title: Great hotel
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. In nice weather, restaurant patio seating is packed with Bostonians and tourists alike soaking up the sunshine and enjoying the food. Commonwealth Ave offers a beautiful stroll down residential tree-lined streets. Keep walking towards the Charles River and enjoy a beautiful view by the water. In warmer months, people run and bike on paths running along the esplanade, and sail and kayak on the Charles River. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Best hotel in Boston
review: I had a great experience on a business trip. Clean, renovated rooms. Mine had a great view. Great location, near shopping and restaurants. Friendly staff. Excellent breakfast. I will certainly stay here next time I am in Boston.

title: Worst Hilton
review: I don’t know where to start. Everything about this hotel is terrific. First off, it is in a great location. Right by tons of bars, restaurants and shopping. Everything you could possibly need is within walking distance. Second, the service is top notch. You are welcomed as soon as you walk in and truly feel the staff wants to make your stay the best ever. The rooms are amazing, super clean and extremely comfortable. I never even consider another hotel when I’m in Boston and neither will you if you stay here.

title: Nice option in downtown Boston
review: Thank you Justin for providing such valuable feedback about your recent stay. Our staff will greatly appreciate this as they work hard everyday to provide this service to all of our guests. Your comments will keep our team motivated to continue to strive for excellent service.

title: Good location, typical "American" service
review: Wouldn’t stay here again. Lack of amenities. Very expensive. Horrible room service. Worse customer service.   Saw a front desk lady sitting and arguing with an elderly couple about not having a reservation (they ended up being at the wrong location), but she could have handled that so much kinder.   My phone never worked, I wish I would have took that as a sign and not ordered the gross room service from the front desk.

Don’t expect anything special. You must park your own car and have to pay $56.00 daily for parking. Overpriced breakfast buffet. $24.95. Stay at the Sheraton right next door. At least they have valet parking and connected to the Prudential Mall.

title: Nice stay in a convenient location
review: Thank you so much for your comments.  We at Hilton Boston Back Bay pride ourselves with superior service and we appreciate the feedback of our valued guests.

title: Great Place to Stay in the Back Bay
review: The rooms were amazing and the service was even better. The staff member who checked me in was very upbeat and pleasant. I unfortunately had to leave a few nights earlier than expected due to family emergency and the staff was so respectful and made the cancellation easy and stress-free.

title: Horrendous customer service

title: Nice Hotel
review: This was truly the noisiest hotel I have ever been in. You can hear the elevator all night and day. It is so loud, it kept me up all night. The tap in the shower was broken and the room had a very strange odor.$50 per day parking!! One of my worst experiences in a long time!

title: Overpriced mediocrity that is customer service challenged.
review: Hotel was beautiful, front desk employees were so great, even though some of the customers weren’t so nice.  Door man was awesome,  sorry I missed him when I went back to tip him.  Garage parking was was easy and convenient.  Fenway in walking distance.

title: Good sleep and health
review: Thank you so much for your comments.  We at Hilton Boston Back Bay pride ourselves with superior service and we appreciate the feedback of our valued guests.  All comments are shared with the departments affected by the responses received.  I am sure the team will be excited to hear how they have succeeded in making your stay a memorable one.

title: Boston visit
review: As a long time Hilton Honors member, I was shocked by this property. We had stayed at other downtown Boston hotels at the same level that were far superior. Our room had 2 plastic cups and no towel bars. There was a notice about re using to save the planet. There was only one bellman per shift and often only one person on the desk. I counted 8 people in line and one check in clerk. A guest told me he had been waiting an hour. Unacceptable! Getting a cab was a challenge as they were all parked at the Sheraton and often no one to call them. They need to take lessons from service from the Hampton Inns. Do not tell me next time will be better you blew your chance to make a good first impression.

title: Nice Hilton, great location, great property
review: Good location for seeing games at Fenway.  Pleasant staff and good, but not great rooms.  Good breakfast included. Substandard TV picture in room and very high priced snacks in lobby.  Will likely go across the street to Sheraton on next visit.

title: Back in the Back Bay
review: I had a conference at the Sheraton Boston, but is was sold out and I somehow found the Hilton Back Bay.  It is literally across the street from the Sheraton.    I loved the hotel, got a great room, nice view, excellent housekeeping who left me bottled water every day.  There are two small food shops in the lobby which was very convenient as well as a very good restaurant in the bar.  I loved that this hotel is in walking distance of a very lovely area for shopping and restaurants.  The Back Bay part of Boston is gorgeous -- I have been to Boston many times, but never in this area.  Other great points about the hotel:  there is a uber / lyft drop off site right in front which is convenient, parking and a nice gym.  The staff is great and very accomodating.  Try this hotel, you…

title: 4th of July visit
review: Staff was very friendly, professional and accommodating. Property was in great shape as always. Perfect location to get to the Prudential shops and Fenway area on foot. We didn’t use the self parking option but they have a conveniently located Uber/Lyft designated pickup area that made grabbing a ride hassle free.

title: Stay elsewhere- this property isn’t worth the price or comfort under its brand name
review: Spent 3 days visiting Boston to see Boston Pops and Fireworks. Hotel was within walking distance to Charles River and Fenway Park. Hotel is very upscale and updated. Very clean, staff are very friendly and helpful. On Old Time Trolley stop. Rooms are updated. Would definitely recommend and will stay again if in area.

title: Very poorly appointed roll for business travel
review: Spent 5 nights here. The location is great, easy access to everything either by foot if you like getting your steps in, or jump on the subway.  The room was spacious,   although the bath was tiny.  Used the gym which was reasonably well equipped and there is a pool too, there is also an outside deck with sun loungers at the gym/ Pool area  Didn't have breakfast here as there are many option near by, so can't comment.   Used the bar in the evening for a night cap, again friendly staff.  So if this hotel is in your budget range them I recommend it

title: Ideal hotel for a Back Bay stay
review: This was a very disappointing and uncomfortable room in which to conduct my business travel.  Will not stay here again. Poor lighting, tv didn’t function properly, no work area/desk, no water pressure in shower, not even a bottle of water.

Because of the angle of the room the bathroom was quite small. I noticed that the carpets were very dirty when I cleaned up a spill and the wash cloth ended up very dirty.

title: Great stay!
review: Stayed for a concert at Fenway. Was about a 15-20min walk to venue. Breakfast buffet was ok and complimentary for status members, but wouldn't be worth the price of purchase. Rooms are basic, nothing fancy. Check in was easy, however I had to personally ask for the complimentary breakfast benefit, as it was not offered originally.

We enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay at this Hilton property again.

review: Last year we stayed at the Hilton Boston Back Bay and accommodations where superb. Close to Many fine food places and only 20 minute walk to Fenway. This year stayed again as we were offered a park and stay package. Very clean and all the saff where friendly and helpful.

title: Great people, service, location, and rooms
review: We stayed here two nights for a college visit. Super nice room, comfy beds, a sofa and desk. The free bottled water was a nice touch. We were on the 17th floor with a nice view. Great area with local restaurants and coffee shops. $50 for parking, but it is in the middle of Boston.

title: Close to the Convention Center
review: My family stayed here for 2 nights for a short vacation and it was our first trip to Boston.  I loved the location relative to Fenway.  It was a quick 10 minute walk to get to the back of the stadium.  We also found it easy to get to subway stations.  With gold status, we got two free continental breakfasts which were good also.  We stayed on the 22nd floor and had great view.  Room was extremely quiet and I never heard any hallway noise.  Work out area and outdoor patio were on 7th floor which were also nice and larger than average for hotels.  Staff was friendly and accommodating - it was great that we were able to check in early at 2.  Everything was well maintained and clean.  Bathroom was smaller than average, but just big enough to move around freely.  We would definitely…

title: Red sox game
review: Thank you so much for your comments.  We at Hilton Boston Back Bay pride ourselves with superior service and we appreciate the feedback of our valued guests. I am sure the team will be excited to hear how they have succeeded in making your stay a memorable one. We are happy to hear you enjoyed both your stay at our property as well as the City of Boston.   Thank you for your feedback and best wishes to you.

title: Great Location!
review: I was in town for a convention, but the hotel attached to the center was booked. The Hilton is literally across the street from the convention center, making it convenient for my work. But it was also close to other nearby attractions. The rooms are tastefully done but could use a little more lighting. They have a great fitness center and Executive Lounge.

title: Disappointing ..................!
review: We chose the Hilton boston back bay for it's proximity to Fenway park. The hotel is  beautiful and our room was very comfortable and quiet. We walked all the way to the aquarium on the harbor and took the train back. It was a great 2 day getaway.

title: Roommate return trip to Boston

title: Great location, average value
review: We graduated in the 80ies, and have been enjoying annual visits back to Boston for about 7 years now.  As a Hilton diamond member I enjoy all Hilton has to offer, and this location is very convenient to Fenway, Kenmore square, and lots of delightful restaurants (try Summer Shack)!

title: Good rooms
review: Thank you so much for taking the time to let us know about your most recent stay at the Hilton Boston Back Bay Hotel.  The hotel is in a great location in Boston for whatever the occasion may be! We look forward to serving you on your future travels here at Hilton!

title: Good sized rooms
review: My 10yo son and I flew up Friday on the 6am flight; we arrived at the hotel about 9:30am.  They were happy to store our bags and advised they'd try for early check-in but no promises.  While exploring the city, my kid started feeling crummy, so I called the hotel and asked again about early check-in, telling them about the kid.  They said they'd put a rush on it and that I could head back that way at 1pm, but would be notified via the app.  About an hour later at noon I got the notification that the room was available.  This likely saved the day and possibly the weekend... doped my kid up on Tylenol and cold meds, he took a 3 hour nap, and was energized and happy for the 7:05pm first pitch at Fenway.  Overall, the hotel was nice.  I paid the government per diem rate of $273 per…

title: Great service and amenities
review: Thank you so much for your comments.  We at Hilton Boston Back Bay pride ourselves with superior service and we are so sorry that we fell short with your visit to Boston.  All comments are looked at seriously and we always present the comments to the departments affected by the responses received from our valued guests.  We are very sorry we did not meet your expectations and would appreciate  the opportunity to redeem ourselves at your next visit to Hilton Boston Back Bay.  We are grateful we were able to accommodate an early check-in for you & your son! The next time you visit Boston, please allow us to welcome you to our property again as well as the city of Boston! Thank you for your feedback and best wishes to you.

title: Great stay for a business trip
review: My husband and I stayed at the Hilton Boston Back from 7/12 to 7/15. Our purpose of our visit was a fun weekend getaway to attend a Red Sox game at Fenway Park and to explore the city of Boston. I booked the Hilton Boston Back Bay based upon research I did on TA for a hotel within walking distance to Fenway Park and of restaurants and shops. In addition as we were driving from NJ, I wanted something easy to get in and out of the city and that also had onsite parking. Hilton Back Bay fit the bill for all of our priorities. Parking was included in our AAA rate. Perfect.   Check in was super easy, the lobby is welcoming and modern and although we did not have a drink there, the lobby bar always looked busy and lively. Our king bed room was on the 11th floor. It looked like it had…

title: Back Bay Hilton
review: Stayed recently for a business trip.  Allowed for early check-in. Room was great, service was great, very friendly, and was conveniently located. Would recommend. Did not explore amenities for travel with family, but saw numerous families come and go.

title: Short walk.....
review: Great location in Copley Square.  Convenient for shopping, dining, Fenway park.  Friendly service, nice rooms and amenities.  On site parking.  Being close to Newbury, Boyleston, and Fenway makes for tons of restaurant, bar and shopping choices, easy in and out of the city yet it is off the main street enough to be quiet.

title: Great location
review: Short walk to the Boston Garden and Common. Short walk to the Freedom Trail. Short walk to Fenway. Short walk to public transportation. Short walk to restaurants fine and casual. There is not much more one can wish for in a hotel in the city. While parking is an added expense, the hotel’s garage is attached and easily accessible. The staff at checkin was great and the room was clean. We had a partial view of Fenway from our room which was an added bonus. The only downside for me is that the ice machines were “taken out during the remodel” I was told. Ice is still offered and free but you have to go the front desk to get it. Will stay here on return trips to Boston.

title: The well known Hilton Experience.

title: Excellent stay at Hilton Back Bay
review: Business trip. Good stay. Room was nicely renovated and the staff was happy to meet every request. The location is perfect, good waking distance to the many restaurants and the lovely waters edge. As always, being a hilton member made the stay that little bit more pleasant.

title: Nice Property - Great Location
review: We were very pleased with all aspects of this Hilton. Staff were polite, super helpful. Breakfast was excellent. Loved everything about this hotel...location, restaurant, easy parking. Our room was quiet and clean.

title: The best staff!
review: Located adjacent to Boston College, right by the bay. Very nice location.  Simple business hotel - neat and clean with large spacious rooms.   Serves a limited buffet breakfast. There is a Starbucks inside which offers a good variety of options for breakfast and meals.  They have a bar too!!!

title: Great stay for our first Boston trip
review: The room was spacious and always clean but what made this hotel excellent was their staff. They were helpful, kind, and friendly. Always ready with a smile. They bar was nice with plenty of seating. They had a well stocked food area with lots of fresh options with decent prices. I was told by a friend the breakfast was pretty good but for $30 I wasn’t going to try it.

title: Great stay, Great Location!
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. In nice weather, restaurant patio seating is packed with Bostonians and tourists alike soaking up the sunshine and enjoying the food. Commonwealth Ave offers a beautiful stroll down residential tree-lined streets. Keep walking towards the Charles River and enjoy a beautiful view by the water. In warmer months, people run and bike on paths running along the esplanade, and sail and kayak on the Charles River. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Amazing hotel
review: We recently stayed here over July 4th week and could not say enough platitudes about this hotel and staff.  First off the location was ideal with short walks to the “T”, Copley Square, Fenway Park and Newbury street areas and short Uber rides to other downtown, North End, Harvard/Cambridge and Boston College areas.  The hotel was clean and lively.  The front desk, bar, diamond lounge staff was friendly and engaging.  I travel a lot and it was nice to see how they treated all guests with a little extra for their regular, HH guests.  The diamond lounge was a nice benefit and was regularly came in handy for a good breakfast to start the day or a late afternoon snack when returning from a day out and about.  Will definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family and will plan to…

title: Convenient Location
review: My daughter and I have stayed at this hotel 4 times recently while visiting Berklee College of Music. The location is PERFECT and the staff is amazing! Shout out to Sam at the front desk for her excellent customer service.

title: Drop off at Berklee
review: Looking to get back to Boston for the 4th with the Pops and Fireworks, I was wanting a property convenient to the Charles River and Esplanade as well as the other sites in the Boston area.   Alexis handled our check-in, recognizing my Diamond status and letting me know the room I had e-checked into was not ready, but she could upgrade me to a King Premium room on the 22nd floor.    Since we were there for two nights, our first morning out we wanted to catch breakfast in the Executive Lounge (for Diamond and Gold HHonors members) so our housekeeper, Winnifred told me she would check back and clean after we had a chance to get cleaned up.    I had checked with Eriko on our second morning to see about a delayed checkout.  He got us taken care of even though we didn’t need all of…

title: Poor service
review: The staff , location and environment was amazing. Highly recommended. The location is central to everything. Great food and shopping needs. Safe and lots to do. The hotel accommodations were wonderful and the people were more than helpful and very friendly.   Look forward to visiting again soon. Nothing but amazing things to say.

title: Nice hotel for a city break
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Great location, friendly staff
review: I enjoyed a stay here for a 4 night city break in May. Arriving mid afternoon, check in was smooth and easy, then straight to the room. Plenty of space to spread out and a big comfy bed - perfect after a long journey. Big, well equipped bathroom with a bath that really wasn't big enough for a proper soak. Location of the hotel is good, not really in the area with all the attractions, but everything is close enough to work or take a cab. Staff were polite and helpful with advice and storing luggage. Definitely recommended.

title: It was OK
review: We stayed here for the Jayson Tatum camp over the weekend. What a great hotel! The location is close to restaurants, shops etc. The hotel is clean, the supreme rooms have a great view across the town and water, and the staff was super friendly from check in to check out. You can even  see Fenway from the room. Parking is a bit expensive $50 per day but it is attached to the hotel and easy in and out. I commented to the desk clerk that our room service was mixed..the fruit fondue was excellent while our nachos were not so good and she immediately gave me a credit for the item. Thank you Tenell (sp. T cooper on our folio)for your excellent customer service. We will return on our next trip to Boston.

title: Worst staff and management ever
review: Location was great. Unfortunately, when arrived around 9:30 pm after a long flight from Los Angeles, we were not given the room we booked. That’s really disappointing,  as we booked directly through Hilton reservations and we had our child with us. So, after staying in that cramped room for 1 night they moved us the next day to the correct room.   The room was fine, but the bathroom was ridiculously small. It was like a broom closet. You could barely move. The ceiling looked as if it was going to buckle with big patches of water damage. The floor was sticky too. One plus was the surprisingly good water pressure in the shower. Also, the couch should be a pull out.   Housekeeping was amenable and brought up everything we needed, but the blanket they sent was embarrassing and not…

title: Experience of 3 night stay
review: Thank you for taking the time to review the Hilton Boston Back Bay during your most recent stay. It is through your feedback that we can only improve. Please know that our Chief Engineer has been in the guest room that you stayed in and is resolving the issue.  We can not have all of our couches as pullouts for the safety of our guests. Certain rooms do not allow this feature because of fire department codes. The room type that you selected had been chosen by multiple guests that checked in prior to your arrival. As we cannot guarantee your selection we always want to provide you with your choice. I am glad  our staff did compensate you for the inconvenience. We hope that you give us another opportunity to provide you and your family with the excellent service that you deserve.  Thank you again for your time.

title: Pleasant 3 Night Stay
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Very happy with the service even after I left the hotel!
review: Very friendly and helpful staff. Good location. Beds are comfortable. Decor is very dark. Only minor issue was no bathroom exhaust fan or it wasn't working. Booked through Hotwire at a reasonable rate for Boston. Would definitely recommend to family or friends.

title: Quiet luxury
review: In general, I really enjoyed staying at this hotel. It's in a good location both for work and leisure. The staff was very helpful. They went out of their way in sending my package back to the deliverer even I left the hotel.

title: Great hotel in Back Bay
review: Enjoyed the spacious room on the 21st floor. Very attractive design. Front desk staff very helpful friendly and efficient. Safe neighborhood. Easy walks to Copley Square. Nice getaway. Would definitely do it again

title: No access to edible food
review: Came into Boston for the weekend for a Red Sox game on Saturday. Chose this particular hotel due to it reputation and proximity to Fenway Park. We were both impressed with the hotel and staff. Everything was just perfect.

title: Prettier than their neighbor
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Over the top service
review: This hotel has its advantages and disadvantages versus their direct competitor across the street.   Comfort - 4 A more compact hotel with a newer interior design of darker wood and coloring gives a warm cozy feel. The advantage over the competitor is that you would not have to fight the Disneyland lines and convention feel.   Service - 4 Very friendly and helpful. Quick and considerate with the check in and check out process. Ask and they were very willing to provide.   Location - 5 In the middle of all the hoopla. Restaurants, bars and shopping within a 5 min walk. Also it is a 15 minute walk to Fenway park.   Will return if I want to go to a Red Sox game. Only downfall is the drip off and pick up location is limited and harder to find.

title: Dangerous shower incident and horrible response
review: Great hotel in great location; upon checkout I thought I would have time to order lunch so I sat at bar counter and ordered salmon salad. But upon ordering I looked at my ticket and realized i had to leave immediately for airport via uber. I apologized to bar manager and cancelled lunch order and then proceeded to get my uber ride in front of hotel. But before uber could pick me up, the bar manager quickly fixed my salmon salad and rushed it out to me in the parking lot  and gave it to me for free! Now that is service, folks!

title: Great location; needs more workers
review: This was one of my worst experiences in a hotel, and I travel 1-2 weeks out of the month. The sliding glass shower door became completely stuck and came off the track while I was taking a shower. It was obvious that the door was already broken before I checked in. My only option was to pull so hard that large pieces of the glass broke off. I could have easily cut myself trying to get out. When I brought it to the hotel's attention they didn't offer to move my room, they said they'd have an engineer try to fix it. When I got back to the room the door looked fixed, but when I moved it a large piece of the mechanism fell off. I practically had to beg to have my room moved. When I complained after the trip I was told that they handled it appropriately. Needless to say I wouldn't…

title: AMAZING HOTEL
review: Dear Jerryfrommaryland,      On behalf of the Hilton team at the Boston Back Bay we are so sorry that you had a terrible experience during your stay with us. We strive to provide great service to all of our guests. The shower door that you had issues with has been completely replaced. We are so sorry that you were inconvenienced during your stay with us. We hope that you will give the Hilton Boston Back Bay another opportunity to provide you with the excellent service that you deserve.

title: Standard Hilton Hotel
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Skip the Brunch!
review: Fair welcome at reception. Has convenience bar which is a good addition. Rooms are comfortable especially with large corner window and electric curtains. Miss mini bar. Bed comfortable but lighting in bathroom is terrible! TV a wonderful size! Well located for Fenway.  Check out a bit early at 11:00AM. Nice touch, can refuse housekeeping and get extra Hilton points.

title: A good hotel for business and leisure - but it needs a lot of maintenance.
review: Skip the breakfast buffet!  The food is prefab and horrible.  The eggs were like eating rubber. The price for the brunch is outrageous!  Valets are especially helpful and nice.Check-in & check-out was smooth. Room was clean.

title: Friendly staff,convenient and enjoyable hotel
review: Dear winniwoman3  I appreciate your review of your recent experience at our hotel and restaurant. I understand that you were disappointed with your meal and shared your comments with our culinary team. We are actively reconsidering our offerings with your recommendations in mind. The next time you are in the area, we would love to have you come back to see the changes we have made and provide feedback. We aim to make it right, and thank you once again for your comments.  Thank you, Miri L.

title: Comfortable and Convenient
review: I stayed there for 6 nights during a conference in May. The hotel itself is in a perfect location since it is within walking distance to the restaurants (i.e. Eataly). The room I had was quite spacious and it was very quiet (good soundproofing!). The hotel gym was also well-equipped and I really enjoyed my time there.  However, I was just slightly let down with the basic facilities that required a lot of maintenance. The elevators were not working most of the time I was there that I had to walk down from my room to the lobby. The hotel also did not have hot water boiler which was a bit disappointing because I liked my tea before going to bed. It would also be great if in the future you could provide our guests with toothbrush and toothpaste. Business travelers do not always have…

title: Fantastic Hotel in a Perfect Spot to Walk and Explore Boston
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: HIlton Back Bay
review: We had a very nice stay at the Hilton Boston Back Bay.  Room had a great panoramic view of the city and it was a nice walk to the Public Gardens, Beacon Street and many o of the wonderful restaurants.  Gym was great as was the internet.  Executive Lounge was nicely stocked as well.  Parking is attached and very easy to load/unload and park.  Overall, given it is in the heart of the city, it is easy to get to, easy to park, easy to navigate the city and just a wonderful staff.

title: Recent stay in Beautiful Boston
review: The hilton Back Bay was very convenient to shopping, eating and made getting around a breeze.  We felt extremely safe in the surrounding area.  The hotel was very clean and staff was top-notch.  I would recommend this hotel to any and rave about it!

title: Fun Trip to Boston
review: Had a pleasant stay at Hilton Back Bay during a work meeting. Very convenient location, well maintained rooms. Attentive and responsive staff.  Access to Hynes Convention center is definitely a bonus. Many restaurants nearby.

title: Disappointing.
review: Even though we had a few issues with the elevator and a fire alarm, we enjoyed our stay. We felt the bed and pillows were too soft for us but that was the only issue. Staff was very nice and professional.

title: Very nice
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Memorial Weekend
review: Very comfortable and nicely remodeled. Great location and view. Clean and nicely designed. The only complain is  I could someone talking from another room through the door which was very annoying. The bathroom shower was funny and I did not like it, and the toilet flushing was extremely loud and reminded me of being in the airplane. Overall great experience.

title: Great Stay!
review: We were going to Boston to spend the weekend with our kids and grandchildren.  We stayed at the Hilton Boston Back Bay so it would be close to their hotel and Fenway Park.  The only negative I would have to say about it was only 2 of the 3 elevators were working when we arrived until Tuesday.  At times it would take a couple of trips to get everyone on.

title: Long wait time for elevators
review: We stayed here for 2 nights over Memorial Day weekend. This was our first trip to Boston, and everyone was courteous, helpful and eager to help us make the most of our short time in the city. The room was very nice, and the hotel was clean and tidy in all the common areas as well. It is a convenient location to Fenway Park, Prudential Center and many of the Boston attractions. We would most definitely stay here again. One of the 3 elevators was down, but it did not cause a significant issue, even though the hotel was almost at capacity.

title: Weekend Getaway
review: I was in Boston for a conference and chose to stay at the Hilton based on positive reviews. However, I regret staying here and wish I had stayed at the Sheraton or Copley. Although rooms are comfortable, all other aspects are weak.  Only two of the three elevators were working, which resulted in long wait times to go up/down. In a hotel with 26 floors, that is absurd. I do not recommend staying here, at least not during holiday weekends or high season.  Also, I was disappointed by the lack of recycling receptacles on site. They leave signs in the room advertising green practices like not replacing towels daily or opting out of housekeeping services, and yet they provide plastic bottles of water with no place to recycle them. It would be more environmentally friendly to have…

title: Terrible Management, Better Options Nearby
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Hilton Hospitality Excellence and a great location!
review: Was here for a conference in May and the management is terrible. They let two elevators sit unfixed for 3 days, all the while claiming that someone was coming to fix it. I live in a high rise in Chicago and be assured when 1 of our elevators is down, people are there the same day to fix it. This kind of response tells me that the management has no clue and does not value guest experience. As a result of having only 2 out of 4 elevators working on a 28 floor hotel, wait times to get up and down were often longer than 20 minutes. Other guests were furious and rightly so since 1 of the 2 down elevators was the service elevator which meant that housekeeping had to use the guest elevators as well making wait times even worse.  I read plenty of reviews and corporate responses and they…

title: Hilton never disappoints
review: Looking for a comfortable place to spend the day and into the night, we popped into the Hilton Boston Back Bay while the teens were attending a music festival in Cambridge. Easy to get too off of the Mass Pike, getting in was easy. Very modern and funky decor makes this Hilton "pop." The staff are super friendly and attend to every guest with enthusiasm. The lobby bar is a nice spot to relax and have a small bite or beverage. Rooms are well appointed as one would expect from Hilton. We had a corner room with a nice city view. We enjoyed access to the executive lounge which is spacious, comfortable, and well furnished. Unless we missed something, we had hoped to find some sort of light food and beverage service. Instead, we only found self-service soft drinks, fruit, and…

title: OK but rather expensive for what you get
review: I stayed in at this place for the weekend and yet another great experience at Hilton. I believe I am starting to like Hilton again after a recent bad experience with one of their other properties. Hilton Boston Back Bay your guys doing a great job with you exceptional service and special mention for amazing Starbucks coffee you guys serve.

title: Very Nice.
review: Selected this hotel because it was close to the Hynes Convention Center. Since all rooms are quite expensive I payed a bit more for a somewhat larger room.   Room was very clean, and well maintained by housekeeping. Bed and bedding of good quality. And airco worked fine. Bathroom quite small with a shower in a rather tiny and thin bathtub. Small people may fit in but not if you are a guy over 6ft4. Had to be very careful. Not what you expect in this price range.   All in all, price/performance (400 USD / night) is too expensive but presume that is because of the location next to the Convention Center.   Tip: if you just cross the street to the Sheraton, you can enter the Hynes Convention Center too and don't have to walk around to the front entry.

title: Perfect in every way
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Boston Marathon
review: The staff goes above and beyond to ensure a great experience for their guests. Breakfast was great, the rooms impeccably clean, and the lobby is beautifully decorated. Very zen and chill atmosphere. Will definitely be back.   Oh, the location is also perfect. Walking distance to the mall, restaurants, evening bars, and lots to see during the day.

title: Great location and hotel
review: Great location for visiting Boston. Close to the Boston marathon finish so great for runners and fans. The hotel is a bit pricey as is the food but that's part of being in Boston. Rooms are nice and beds are comfortable.

title: Great Location, new interior look
review: Great location and hotel. We will definitely stay here on our next trip back to Boston. Walking distance to so many attractions. We stayed here for the Boston marathon and enjoyed having everything so close that we did not have to worry about driving

title: Disappointing
review: This hotel is located just next to the Prudentail center, and within 2 minute walk to 3 subway station. The interior looks brand new, the hotel staff are very helpful, and views from the 25th floor are breathtaking. I highly recommned this hotel, especially for Boston marathoners.

title: Nice stay
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Good Location,
review: Check in was great, arrived late on a Friday night and got an upgrade to a high floor room overlooking the river and part of Fenway Ballpark.  We had 3 in the room and they arranged for a cot in the room at no extra charge.   The view was fantastic, got to see sailboats, rowing teams etc   Nice location, we walked to Fenway and other restaurants in the area.  Shout out to Bauer’s liquor store, a 5 minute walk from hotel, a bit pricier than 7/11 but found out they deliver for free!!  Used this service one evening.   Executive lounge was pretty basic, packaged potato chips and soda/water/juice.  I’ve seen better set ups.  We did eat complimentary breakfast one morning and they had several options.  Served out of the restaurant on the weekends. We did not check it out during the…

title: Fine conference visit in PURE room
review: This Hilton provided the standard Hilton service, good but nothing too fancy.  It was clean and conveniently located to the Back Bay area. The staff was friendly but did not need their services.  I would stay here again.

title: Good location & friendly staff
review: Attended a conference for a couple of days at this Hilton. It’s right across the street from both the new Four Seasons tower being built, and the Sheraton. Around the block from the Berklee College of Music.  The lobby itself was slightly confusing (2 entrances, angular) but check-in was prompt and efficient. I got a 2 bed room (no King available), but it was clean, comfortable, and modern. Roomy with desk area, and a good-sized in-room safe. The room was high up, with good views. The bathroom sink was brightly lit with a circle light around the mirror, but the toilet/tub/shower room was a bit snug.  Perhaps the best thing was that this was a special “Pure” room with special air filter and filtered shower water, and feather free, to minimize allergens. I had no idea that I had…

title: Always stay here
review: Friendly staff. Very nice remodel and convenient location.  Rooms are standard size but corner rooms have spectacular views.  I’ve been staying here for business and pleasure for years and always enjoyed it.

title: Nice and Clean Safe and Comfortable Hotel in a Good Location
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: A great hotel in a great location in a great city
review: The most important thing for me is clean, and this hotel, and especially the room I stayed in was clean and comfortable. The bed and pillows were super comfry, and I slept great. Great view of the city (18th floor). The shower was amazing. Water was hot, and didn't take long to heat up. Great water pressure, and nice toiletries including a shower cap (a must for me). Perfect night lighting on the floor in the bathroom. Very subtle. This was close to the Prudential center, and the Sheraton is across the street, so you can walk in there and get everywhere without going outside (if the weather is bad). Parking was tight, but on-site and while costly ($49), not outrageous for a city hotel, and we could self-park. Some places require valet parking and every time you need your car you…

title: Great place to stay
review: This hotel is across the street from the Hynes Convention Center, which has direct shuttle bus service every 20 minutes from Boston Logan Airport.  My room was well furnished, clean, and had a large flat screen TV.  There was an active bar with food service in the lobby.  I had some excellent clam chowder.  I will definately stay here again.

title: Perfect long weekend
review: Thank you for taking the time to provide our team with feedback about your most recent stay. Everyone will greatly appreciate that all of their hard work paid off and that your stay was a success. The team at the Hilton Boston Back Bay looks forward to your next visit.

title: Great experience
review: The Hilton is located in the Back Bay section of Boston.  It is close to lots of restaurants  The convention center and attractions.  The room are clean and have plenty of space.  I would stay at this Hotel again

title: Excellent Hotel - highly recommended
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. In nice weather, restaurant patio seating is packed with Bostonians and tourists alike soaking up the sunshine and enjoying the food. Commonwealth Ave offers a beautiful stroll down residential tree-lined streets. Keep walking towards the Charles River and enjoy a beautiful view by the water. In warmer months, people run and bike on paths running along the esplanade, and sail and kayak on the Charles River. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Loved everything!
review: Located at an excellent location next to Hayes Conventional Center.  Completed a four day conference and exhibition. Breakfast is $30  Everything that you need to complete your stay. Excellent staff.  They have a business center if you need to print a page.

title: Good hotel for business trip.
review: In town for a conference being held in multiple locations and this was one of the conference hotels.  I arrived really late due to weather and flight cancellations so I was exhausted.   Omar was the front desk person and they were very pleasant and professional.  Check-in was seamless and the room was beautiful and inviting as I expect from this brand. My days started early and I enjoyed ordering my breakfast the night before with the order form that's on your door.  I ordered the morning skillet every morning as it was AMAZING! They bring it in an environment friendly bag with containers that makes clean up super easy. And they don't have a surcharge or additional fees for room service,  that's very impressive! I  enjoyed my stay and sometimes forget I was there for business  …

title: Wel located across from the Hynes Convention Center and upscale shopping
review: Like the bar although they don’t sell still water which I find really strange- I was sent to the shop onsite to get it to take back to the bar. Lobby and bar are nice. Salad was a bit non descript. Breakfast okay, not the largest breakfast offering I have seen and a little costly as I had paid quite a high price for the room yet breakfast cost on top of that. Handy location for walking along and locating restaurants etc without needing taxis - 5 min walk to the Cheesecake Factory which is a must visit if local but leave plenty of room for food. I seem to have got a corner room which was huge with a nice view and I liked the shape. Huge tv and nice coffee machine and decaf so I was delighted, lovely pens and in general clean and warm. Overall comfortable beds and no noise. Good…

title: Hilton Back Bay
review: Interesting hotel in a great location.  The hotel decorations are kind of "edgy" and I did think my room was rather "dark" but comfortable.  Comfortable beds and the location is excellent.  The only slight concern is that the temperature control in the room was a bit erratic.  Overall a good hotel.

title: You won't be dissapointed!
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Boston at the Pops !
review: The Hilton Boston Back Bay is very close to shopping in the gigantic Prudential Center and just an Uber ride to lots of history throughout the city. The atmoshere along with having a wonderful staff was a win win! Enjoyed the buffet breakfast also!

title: Sad
review: My grand daughter and I stayed here while visiting my son in Boston ! We had tickets for John Williams conducting his movie themes with the Boston Pops !  The hotel was wonderful with a great staff ! It's convenient to most everything in Boston near the Prudential Center and Copley Place !  We especially enjoyed The Cheesecake Factory just around the corner !

title: Great stay
review: Place me in a room where someone else was waking them up. No hot water. Wouldn’t give me my points I was promised for all that took place, told me I don’t get them. Food not so good for the cost. Only great thing about this hotel was the location so we could get out and eat somewhere good.

title: Great experience!
review: Thank you for taking the time to respond. I feel terrible that during your stay you had no hot water. There was some maintenance that needed to be done and we did it during the hours of 2am -4am to avoid inconveniencing our guests. I did send out letters to every one of our guests that were already staying with us and guests were handed a letter upon arrival about the situation. If you are ever in the Back Bay Area again our team would like the opportunity to get you the great service that you deserve when you stay at the Hilton Boston Back Bay. Again, our apologies for the inconvenience and thank you for taking the time to respond as it will only make us better.

title: I won’t be back.
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Beautiful, modern hotel with great service
review: Horrible service and I will never stay at this property again. In fact, I have begun to explore switching to other chains, as this experience was enough to push me over the edge. Hilton needs to divert some of its resources to focus on bias assessment and reduction training, as I have increasing noted behaviors that reflect bias and ignorance, both of which could potentially be lessened through education and awareness. As a Diamond member, I spend a lot of my time at hotels, and the customer service provided by the manager, Anna, was the worst I’ve experienced to date. The hot water tank also went out (which was beyond their immediate control), but the lack of sensitivity and callousness of the manager, Anna, is what made an annoying situation 10 times worse. When I asked her…

title: A great stay - super position and nice standard
review: We are sorry we were not able to provide you with the quality of services you deserve. This is not typical of our hotel and staff, and we are always looking for ways to improve our customer experience. Your satisfaction is very important to us and we try hard to make sure all of our guests have a rewarding stay. Thank you again for your feedback and we hope you will consider staying with us again.

title: Delivered Value Beyond Expectations
review: Looking for a modern hotel in the Back Bay Area of Boston?   Check out the Hilton Back Bay.   Recently remodeled, the rooms feature dark, modern wallpaper offset by bright white linens. Get a high floor room for a beautiful view.  The Hynes Convention Center is right across the street and connected to the Prudential Center and great shopping.  It’s an easy walk to all the best of Boston!   Highly recommend it!

title: Comfortable rooms, Friendly Staff, Great location
review: Cathy, your review describes the Hilton Boston Back Bay perfectly.  With so many places to visit in the Back Bay Area I do agree that there is only one place to stay. It is so exciting that our guests are enjoying all of our new renovations.  I hope the next time you stay with us that you have a chance to enjoy our brand new lobby bar.Thank you for taking your time to review the Hilton Boston Back Bay. Best wishes to you and safe travels.

title: Mixed experience
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. In warmer months, people run and bike on paths running along the esplanade, and sail and kayak on the Charles River. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Great location, Great Staff, Great Rooms!
review: Stayed one night on business and it was a fairly mixed affair. The hotel itself is very smart and recently refurbished. I got upgraded to a corner room which was spacious and immaculately clean. However there was no in-room information and I had to phone reception to find out where breakfast was and what time the following morning, check out times etc. My colleagues staying in other rooms had the same situation too, so it was clearly a hotel wide issue. There was also an awful draft off the windows so the room got quite cold and there was no blanket. I can't sleep with the noise of the air con unit going all night and had to switch this off. Like other reviews you can hear the bell on the lift from the rooms going up and down. And it pings as it passes ever floor. Room service…

title: OK hotel with some issues
review: Thank you so much for your comments.  Our engineering department will be taking care of the draft from the window. Our housekeeping department has plenty of extra blankets and would have been happy to bring you one. All of our in room information is currently in the process of being updated and our staff would be happy to help with any information about our property.We are very sorry we did not meet your expectations and would appreciate the opportunity to redeem ourselves at your next visit to Hilton Boston Back Bay.  Thank you for your feedback and best wishes to you.

title: Environmental nightmare; barely 3 stars
review: The hotel staff is very nice and willing to help you in any way.  The hotel is very close to a lot of sites in town, including Fenway Park.  This is my hotel of choice anytime I am in Boston.  The rooms are spacious and nice.

title: Great Service!
review: The hotel was fine, the corner room was bigger than normal hotel rooms. Employees were very friendly and helpful. But there were some issues. One of the reasons we booked this hotel was the pool. When we got there there was a sign stating that due to the cold temperatures the pool area was colder than normal. Really? This is a hotel in Boston. It's winter. Temperatures around 32 are positively tropical for winter in New England. If this is colder than your heater can handle, maybe you need a new one? The pool water was actually warmer than the air temperature at the pool, I was cold watching my kids in the pool. It was VERY uncomfortable getting out of the water once you were ready to leave. Now if this was Florida and it was 32 degrees, fine, but Boston? Also, I had bought a…

title: Luxurious comfort, fantastic value and wonderful welcome.
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Recommended
review: Traveling for business this time, I registered at this hotel since the conference was located in that hotel. The Hilton back bay is convenient to many shopping areas, great restaurants and easily accessible from highways once in Boston. The staff were very professional and courteous no matter what their function. They manage to create a very relaxed atmosphere and have a wonderful welcoming manner. The room was impeccably clean. The bed was heavenly and I wished I didn't need to rise so early for my meeting. Service and food in the restaurant and bar, where food is also served, were perfect. Great quality and experience.

title: Lovely Hotel, Accommodating Staff
review: Nice views, usual very good Hilton staff. I find Hiltons reliable and this one is no exception. We were just in town for one night to see a Celtics game and live not too far away.  But this hotel's location next to the Pru and all its shopping was handy. We walked to TD Garden from the hotel, although that's a long walk for some.

title: Great location and nice stay....
review: I booked my room through priceline and there was some confusion as to which room I had reserved. The staff at Hilton placed me in the correct room, which was very spacious, clean, and comfortable! The hotel is conveniently located and a nice walk from Boston Commons. I plan to stay here again.

title: Nice room. Great location.
review: We enjoyed a very nice stay for my wife's birthday. Rooms are clean, modern, nice sized, with comfortable beds. Location is excellent to everything in the copley square/back bay area. Self parking is a breeze, although pricey at $50 a night. The breakfast buffet was good, but not quite as elaborate as some other Hilton properties, however we found everything we could want and it was well prepared. Service in the restaurant was friendly and efficient.   If we were staying longer I would have lodged a complaint about the wifi, neither the Hilton Honors or ATT networks would stay connected for more than a few minutes. We were only there for one night, and not in the room very much, so was not a big deal.  Perhaps it was our location on the high floor.

title: Great last minute trip!
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Always a great spot!
review: Hilton of Back Bay was conveniently located, so clean and so friendly. We have never been before but we will definitely book there again when we are in area. The room was big and comfortable, bathroom was very roomy and do clean!

title: Perfect weekend at outstanding Hilton Hotel
review: Come to Boston often and the location is great, staff is always friendly and room is always comfortable. The tub in our room however was awful... the lining did not sit right so made the task of showering hard and although the looks of mirror are nice the lightly on it is awful... way too bright!

title: HIlton Back Bay - Excellent Experience
review: Hilton Back Bay made my surprise weekend for my husband’s birthday more than I could have moped for. The hotel, staff, and amenities made the weekend really special. It was extremely clean and comfortable. Parking was easy. Breakfast and dinner at the onsite restaurants exceeded expectations. The room was inviting and comfortable. It was quiet and provided an incredible view. Housekeeping services were very good and responsive to needs. Reception staff were friendly and helpful. Overall it was a wonderful experience. I highly recommend Hilton Back Bay for long stays or even quick get-always. Thank you to Hilton hotels and staff for an incredibly enjoyable and memorable experience.

title: Great location
review: All staff were friendly, accommodating, and responsive. Front desk went out of their way to assist with changes to reservations and general guest needs.  Amenities were well-maintained and easily accessible.  We've stayed at this hotel for an annual conference I attend for the past 2 years and service is always exceptional!  If you need to be near the Hynes Convention Center, this is the place to stay.

title: Excellent Hotel comparable area pricing
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: WONDERFUL
review: Pricing for the Hilton was comparable to the Sheraton's group rate.  The Hilton has nicer accommodations, an excellent fitness room, and very courteous staff.  I would strongly recommend this hotel, especially if one has to visit the prudential center, as it is very close and the cost is excellent for the value.

title: Could have been better.
review: From the day I checked in until the day I checked out for a business trip, I was in awe of the spectacular treatment. They made sure I was taken care of especially in their cleanliness of the rooms, the conceirge, customer service and kindliness has made me want to come back here with my family. I will have recommend this place to all.

title: Won’t be back
review: Could have been better. Sink didn't drain, the noise between room and hallway was excessive. You can hear the elevators "ding" from within the room all night. Not sure if there is a rec room or what near the room I was in, just constant noise through out the night.

title: Great staff - great location
review: Dear Nomad14105788525,  Thank you for your review. We’re sorry we didn’t provide the quality of amenities and service you deserved during your recent stay at our hotel. We apologize for the maintenance and noise issues encountered, and we are working with our team to correct the problems and avoid recurrence going forward. Your feedback is genuinely helpful, as it is the first step in identifying areas where we can better our guest services. If you return to our area, we hope you’ll stay with us again.

title: Good Stay
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: First visit
review: Lovely hotel lobby with a fire place.  The fire place had what appeared to be steam with red/amber lighting to create the flame.  It had an electric heater which provided the warmth.  Very interesting and nice to look at.  There's flavored water to the right of check in. Three elevators to take you to your room.  Never a long wait.  The room was fairly large with a king size bed and a chaise against the window wall.  There's a small office desk and your typical offering in a HIlton room.  Bathroom was a little on the small size.  Difficult time closing the bathroom door, which you had to do to get into the shower.  Room is on the dark side.  The comforter had a comforter cover.  Although it looked fine, when I woke up in the morning, I noticed that the comforter had yellow…

title: Perfect stay
review: Choose this property because I am a Hilton Gold member and it was close to the MFA.  We were going there for a special exhibit. The hotel location was excellent, the staff (especially Omar) was helpful and friendly, breakfast was superb, the room was very comfortable and quiet. Walked across the street through the Sheraton lobby right into the Prudential Blding mall. In January we spent minimal amount of time walking outside which was terrific. Had a casual meal at Eataly, which was really good. Like most cities, parking as a guest was expensive for one night ($50.00). We would return again!

title: Prime Location and Service
review: I enjoy travelling and usually stay in 4-stars (or 5-stars if I can find a good deal!). Hilton Back Bay is up there with the best of them. I stayed in June/July 2018 during the heat wave (and the AC was quiet and effective). I came for a long weekend away with my boyfriend.   First impressions about the public areas of the building: The building is not the most exciting looking, but the lobby is sleek and gorgeous. The pool is nice, but busy, with an adequate gym area for those who are so inclined.   Room: Decorated in very dark tones. Bed was HEAVENLY. One of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept on with premium sheets and pillows. TV was huge (like the biggest I've ever seen in a standard hotel room) with many HD channels. Bathroom was nicely and sleekly renovated, albeit…

title: Perfect place to stay in Boston
review: It's been a few years since I've stayed at the Hilton Back Bay and they've since remodeled the lobby and rooms and they are fantastic.  The service is excellent and the rooms are very modern and soothing, especially after a long day.  The location is perfect with easy access to all the great restaurants and shops in the Back Bay area and the Prudential Center is easily accessed by walking across the street through the Hynes Convention Center.

title: Great hotel
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Nice Hotel in the centre of Bostan
review: Stayed here last month and enjoyed the stay. Room was very spacious and clean. Staff was friendly and attentive. Location was near Berkley School of Music and plenty of places walking distance. I had a small issue upon check out where I was accidentally charged for someone else's room but it was quickly fixed.  I would definitely stay here again when I'm Boston.

title: Loved my stay
review: This hotel is near the shopping area of Bostan and is within walking distance of other tourist attractions. The hotel lobby and bar are pleasant. The room we had was a corner room. It was a nice room except it was very dark. The wall paper and carpet were very dark and the lighting was not good so the room was unpleasantly dark. The bathroom was very small, much smaller than other Hilton we have stayed in. Bed was comfortable, breakfast was good.

title: Disappointing service
review: I showed up to a crowded lobby BUT the atmosphere, speed of check-in and level of service that I received was second to none.  Jessica checked me in and her smile contagious, her attention to my needs was exceptional but also I was so impressed with how she managed the guest waiting in the crowded lobby both while I stood in line to check-in and while I was standing with her checking in.  I should say there were 3 other agents checking guest in.  I can only speak from my observations but everyone seemed to be okay with waiting because these agents spoke to us and thanked us for staying with Hilton and they all at one time or another spoke out and said just a few minutes.  We were offered ice cold flavored water and the whole experience was unlike any other I have had.  Usually…

title: Excellent location , small rooms and bathrooms.
review: The only reason I didn't rate it as 5 starts was the poor service. Accomodating at check in, but ordered room service and instead of the tuna, they bring the tuna croissant. When calling front desk to let them know they had the order wrong, they call back and say they don't have the tuna. So, did they sent the wrong order because they didn't have the tuna in the first place or was it a coincidence. So we obviously get upset because they didn't have anything on the menu we would like and the front desk just hangs up the phone on us. I'm sorry, but you can't work in hospitality and hang the phone on a customer because their attitude (quote) doesn't suit you. No matter how great the stay and location was, the bad taste of this experience will be what I remember.

title: Helpful staff with that extra touch
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: New Year Break
review: We stayed at the Hilton Boston Back Bay when on business. The location is good with close access to the Prudential Centre and walking distance of most major sites. We arrived earlier than expected from Canada and as a Hilton Honors Gold member was pleasantly surprised to get an early check-in. Not only that because of the strike and protests at the Sheraton across the road the receptionist moved our room to a back facing one away from the noise. Very nice touch. The business lounge is for Diamond members only so can not comment on that. The bar is very open and quite expensive for what you get. The swimming pool on the high floor was empty when we went (probably because there is no hot tub) so great to have a proper swim. The breakfast buffet was extensive. Rooms large, clean…

title: Hilton, A Great Stay
review: Lovely hotel, next to the Prudential Centre.  Hotel very clean and quiet.  Staff were very friendly.  Check in was quick and again staff were efficient and helpful.  Room and bathroom were a good size with adequate storage.  Safe provided at no extra cost.  Only issue was with the coffee maker in the room which made warm, very weak coffee and also only paper cups provided. Airport shuttle stops at the Hayes Convention Centre which is near the hotel.  Taxi rank just next to hotel.   Would definitely use this hotel again.

title: Nice hotel
review: This is my first stay on this side of Boston but it’s still close to Logan... I travel on a regular basis and Boston is a favorite so this is not bias but I have to say something about the staff... Paula at the desk and David at the bar have to be the best in the business... They both from the start knew the right questions and had the right answers... Even then the maintenance crew was awesome... My TV wasn’t working correctly but they fixed that, I asked for a refrigerator and that was delivered within a half hour, with a smile and hope your stay is great from both of them... I ordered a sandwich from the cafe in the hotel but wanted it in a wrap, no problem, we can do that... I have read the complaints about the 17 dollar parking fee, really, it’s gated, i have had to pay…

title: Great stay
review: The Hilton Boston Back bay is a nice hotel.  Room was very nice; however bathroom is small and the light they have in there is way too bright!!!  We had the breakfast package and the buffet was very good.  Don't think I would do without having the packages as it was $28 per person.  Wasn't that good.  We didn't go in the pool as very small.  Good for the kids though.  No hot tub which was a bummer.  For exploring Boston it was nice.  I did see in the summer these rooms go for like $400 or $500 a night.  No way would I spend that much.  Other thing was I had put in for a upgrade when I booked.  Was told on web site would be told at check in if we were upgraded.  Never even heard a word about it.  Nice hotel if you can get a decent price.

title: My compliments to Concierge Charles for helping me with my business needs
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline.
