title: Staff is definitely slipping
review: I wish to extend my thanks and a compliment to the Concierge named Charles, who demonstrated outstanding hospitality and helpfulness in immediately responding to my need for a functional desk or office in my room. I needed it in order to complete my work related writing on my laptop during my recent stay at the Hilton Back Bay. Charles deserves to be recognized for setting the standard at the Hilton Back Bay front desk. Thank you.

title: Kathleen from Coventry CT
review: I have a previous review of this hotel and thought it was fine. Our last visit, however, was very disappointing. The check in did not go well. The front desk clerk was basically clueless, unaware of benefits I should have received as Hilton Diamond. I had to walk him through it step by step. He took our parking ticket but did not put it in the system so we ended up paying for parking twice. The restaurant allowed people in with bare feet and didn't seem to care, even when it was pointed out to them. I do realize properties have issues but what really dissapointed me was the response when they were contacted. They sent me a condescending form letter that didn't even have my name in the greeting. I mean  Good afternoon,  I hope this email finds you well?    They gave me back the…

title: Boston great place
review: Had a special rate for Craft Boston and it made the Boston experience more affordable. We could eat in the mall, attend our Craft show and walk around without dealing with the weather. A great place to stay!

title: Great spot
review: While visiting our daughter this past weekend we stayed at the Hilton. I want to thank a man named, Chuck, who was working the desk for making our stay even better. He was fun to talk with and helpful in many ways. I love staying at the Hilton, I love Boston and the Boston people. I look forward to our next visit! Thanks for a great weekend!

title: Arrogant, Obnoxious, Condescending...do not stay here if you are booking a group
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. In nice weather, restaurant patio seating is packed with Bostonians and tourists alike soaking up the sunshine and enjoying the food. Commonwealth Ave offers a beautiful stroll down residential tree-lined streets. Keep walking towards the Charles River and enjoy a beautiful view by the water. In warmer months, people run and bike on paths running along the esplanade, and sail and kayak on the Charles River. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: December in Boston
review: I tried for days to book a group 7 months in advance. I left three messages over 5 days and not one call was returned. On the 4th call I spoke to the actual GM and Doug told me on a Tuesday that rooms were available and someone would call me back on Wed. Again, I was told rooms were available and no need to block any at that time. Shocker, NO ONE CALLED until Thu afternoon. At that point I was actually lectured for a few minutes about how groups work at the Hilton and what I could do to block my 15 rooms for 2 nights. After my lecture was over I went to the e-venue link sent to me and it said the rooms were unavailable. I called the hotel several times and eventually (after 5 more calls) was lectured again and that now the rooms were mysteriously not available. The response from…

title: My home away from home in Boston
review: The Team at the Hilton Boston Back Bay is very sorry about your experience with the sales department. We always strive to provide great customer service to all of our guests and potential guests. Unfortunately, the nights that you were looking to stay were not available at our property. Several people did reach out to you to try to explain this in the most courteous manner possible. We would absolutely love to have you and your company as our guests over different dates. However, your dates are not flexible.  We have a lot of pride in our hotel and its staff. If you are ever in the Back Bay neighborhood in the future we would like a chance to show you what great customer service we offer. On behalf of the staff we are sorry that we could not accommodate you at this time. We thank you for your feedback and we wish you the happiest of holidays.

title: Exception customer service and a great location
review: Very clean hotel , room spacious  , staff very friendly,   The location is great for visiting boston and great for access to tne T stations  Room complete with very large tv  Overall very good hotel well worth a visit,

title: I expected more
review: I travel to Boston frequently and always have a great experience at the Hilton Boston Back Bay.  The location can't be beat - right near the Prudential Center and walking distance to Fenway Park, Newbury Street, South Station, and other popular locations including JP Lick's on Boylston!

title: Great weekend stay, hotel never disappoints
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. In nice weather, restaurant patio seating is packed with Bostonians and tourists alike soaking up the sunshine and enjoying the food. Commonwealth Ave offers a beautiful stroll down residential tree-lined streets. Keep walking towards the Charles River and enjoy a beautiful view by the water. In warmer months, people run and bike on paths running along the esplanade, and sail and kayak on the Charles River. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Really nice hotel, great location
review: I have been staying at the Back Bay Hilton for over 20 years for a combination of business and pleasure.  On this visit, which was a pleasure trip to meet up with friends, I had an outstanding stay from start to finish.  Check in was smooth and I used the digital key (which is GREAT) to access my room.  The staff was friendly.  My room was a corner King.   The bed was comfortable, the TV was VERY large and there was also a nice sofa in the room.  My only observation of this hotel is that (except for in the panoramic rooms) the shower head is a bit low (I am 6'5") so I have to lean quite a bit in the shower to wash my hair, etc.  Otherwise the bathrooms, room layout and cleanliness are perfect.  I enjoyed the breakfast buffet at 40 Dalton.  There was a lot of choice and the food…

title: Back bay Hilton
review: Thank you so much for your comments.  I am sure the team will be excited to hear how they have succeeded in making your stay a memorable one.  The next time you visit Boston, please contact me and I will make sure to welcome you back with the same great service you are accustomed to.    Thank you for your feedback and best wishes to you.

title: Nice hotel in the Back Bay.
review: This is a great hotel in a great location! We stayed here for 5 days while my hubby attended a conference at the Westin Copley Square. This hotel was well within walking distance of his conference and was WAY more affordable! We had a king room with panoramic view. It was very nice, and offered a decent view, but the curtains didn’t open all the way so you really didn’t get a panoramic view.  Our friends stayed in a regular king room and it was much bigger. The rooms had a small fridge and coffee maker. I had read there were microwaves too, but not so.  Very clean hotel! Also, even though there are pictures showing a jacuzzi/hot tub. There isn’t one. Apparently they filled it in a few years ago! The gym was great - good size and lots of machines and weights. Overall, we were…

title: Great for Fenway
review: We stayed at the Hilton Back Bay with my 16 year old son as part of his birthday trip and what can I say!! The most beautiful hotel in the perfect location. Amazing food and gorgeous room. Staff go above and beyond and catered for our every need. Special mention to Ben and Charles on the front desk - legends!! Highly recommend this hotel and plan to come back again

title: Favorite place to stay in Boston
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Great Staff, Hotel was Decent
review: For the past 4 years, our family has traveled to Boston on a regular basis to visit my children who are in college here. The Hilton Back Bay is by far our favorite place to stay. The location of the hotel cannot be beat. It is right around the corner from a T station, and very convenient to Fenway Park, Boylston Street, and Newberry Street. The staff at the hotel is very helpful, and try to make your stay the best it can be. There is an Executive Lounge that offers free beverages and snacks, as well as breakfast each morning and light snacks/meal in the evening. There is a pool, and on-site parking, which is very convenient.   Sometimes the system to enter/leave the parking ramp with the hotel key works great, other times it doesn't. On a recent trip it did not work - and it…

title: Terrific stay in the heart of the city
review: Stayed here last minute with my fiance.  The hotel staff were very helpful and very friendly.  The hotel itself is very much a city hotel but was relatively well appointed.  It was well situated for access to the city.  The room itself was an OK Hilton hotel room.  Bathroom was on the smaller side but it was clean and the linens/bed were comfortable.  The executive lounge and breakfast were very good.

title: Great experience at check in and with lobby staff. A few fixes needed in rooms.
review: Location of hotel was very convenient for visiting the city. Close to many shops and restaurants. Room was comfortable and clean. I ate in the restaurant twice at lunch, and the food was quite good and lots of variety. The accommodations were excellent! The staff was very pleasant and helpful - ready to answer any questions I had.

title: Clean and convenient hotel
review: When I approached the reservation counter, I was greeted very warmly as if the gal behind the counter was anxiously awaiting my arrival.   A few days before my trip I called the hotel to request a room on the lowest floor possible near the stairs (I don’t like to use elevators). My request was fufulilled with a room on the 4th floor. The gal who checked me in offered to walk me to my room via the stairwell. I had a pretty large (and quite heavy) piece of luggage with me. In addition to taking the time to escort me to my room, she carried my heavy bag up four flights of stairs. Wow!   My room was very nice and clean. I was pleasantly surprised by how quiet it was - I am always disturbed by people who are too loud in the hallways (one aspect of staying in a hotel that I really…

title: Great location and efficient
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Convenient location and well run hotel
review: The hotel was recently updated. I like the location and the size of the lobby. It is easy to get in and out of the hotel with efficiency. Benjamin at the front desk goes above and beyond to welcome and assist hotel guests.  The rest of the staff was attentive as well.    Note:  Try the bakery called Flour right out the door.

title: "Awesome Staff & Service"
review: Stayed recently in this hotel for five nights. My room was clean and amply stocked. I asked for an upper level room away from elevators and was granted same. The Sheraton hotel and the Prudential Center/shopping and skywalk observatory is right next-door. Very close to Fenway Park. It is a stop on the hop on-hop off trolley. I did not eat in the restaurant there or use the bar, but there are several close locations for breakfast, lunch, and dinner in the Prudential shopping area.

title: Nothing special but not terrible
review: The Staff treats you like family here, and provides service with a smile! Always my first choice when I stay in the Back Bay Area. Only one complaint, the New Chairs at the Renovated Bar are terribly uncomfortable, make you feel like you are sitting in a grammar school desk.

title: SKIP THIS HOTEL, save yourself the trouble
review: My family and I spent the weekend at this hotel.  It was exactly what you would expect in a Hilton.  Hotel has been updated and rooms were fine.  The rooms could use some more lighting as the dark wallpaper makes it very dark.  The front desk was responsive and housekeeping did a decent job.  The location to Newbury Street was great but not close to the rest of the city.  I probably would not stay here again simply due to its location.

title: Good location and spacious rooms
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Pleasant Stay
review: First of all, the location is great. Very close to Newbury street and to a lot of good restaurants etc. The room is clean and spacious. The decoration is grey, nothing special but newly renovated. I can no doubt stay at this hotel next time in Boston. However, I have 3 points: 1. there is no complimentary coffee at the looby in the morning. Boston is a cold coffee and you need "ready, to go coffee". I know there are coffee machines in the rooms but in the US there are always complimentary coffee served in hotel lobbies.  2. Boston is rainy, I was in Boston for 4 days and I did not want to carry an umbrella in my bag, but the hotel do not borrow umbrellas, really strange. 3. I thing there is a shortage of staff at the hotel, you do not see anybody waiting at the hotel door,…

title: Great property when not under construction
review: Location is very nice. Walking distance to shopping area. Rooms are comfortable and bed is nice to sleep in . Concierge is always accommodating.breakfast is nice. Would definitely recommend to a friend.

title: Berklee Summer Program
review: Stayed here in April. Staff is top-notch, rooms are a little dark for my taste but super clean and well kept. Housekeeping was pleasant and hard working. My only issue with my stay was that I was not told they were under construction (and I booked directly with Hilton). I was working from Boston for a few days while my Son attended PAXEast and had I known that I would be trapped in the room for the trip with no lobby to escape to, I would have stayed elsewhere. When I explained this to the front desk upon check-in, they told me the lobby would be opening up the next day. 4 days later when we left, it still wasn't open.

title: Boston Trip
review: We are very happy to read the comments about your recent stay and glad that you found the location and amenities of our hotel to your satisfaction. Hope to see you return soon....safe travels.

title: The rooms were nice
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Nice hotel, great staff, but price is crazy high!
review: Stayed here after a Red Sox game. Convenient location, but the front desk staff was beyond rude. I am Diamond and requested an early stay. We got there early and when asked about the room was pretty much dismissed. We asked if we could store our bags while we wandered and waited... again, it seemed to be an inconvenience to them. They said they would call when the room was available, but they never did. We returned at the regular check in time and they said the room was ready. No acknowledgement that we were there an hour before and dismissed. WE TALKED TO THE SAME PEOPLE!! Outside of the front desk staff, the people there were wonderful. The porter, the lady in the Diamond lounge, etc. Will I stay there again when I'm back in the area.. not sure. The view is nice and the…

title: Book here to stay in Worcester MA !
review: We had reserved a package of room/parking for $499 for one night as we were visiting our nephew at Northeastern U.  Had requested early checkin, as we knew we would be arriving well before 4 pm from a 4 hour drive to hotel.  Arrived around 11:30, and were told they had blocked out a room for us on the 8th floor, but it was not cleaned yet.   Checked our luggage and walked to NEU.  Spent a few hours there, arriving back at hotel at around 3 pm.  Room still not ready.  I will say that Jessica at the front desk was wonderful, and found another room for us (11th floor)t hat had been serviced.  Location of hotel was good - we walked to the Freedom Trail, then walked the Trail.  Many restaurants to chose from in area. Parking was easy in the attached garage, and hotel lobby and bar…

title: Service was Excellent !!
review: I prepaid 4 nights at Hilton Boston Back Bay for a major convention since the convention center is across the street. Used AMOMA.com from the Trip Advisor web site link. Paid in May for a Sept conference. Called 2 days in advance to confirm prepaid and late arrival. Hilton would NOT take my call since I used AMOMA: had to wait on hold a half hour to a Europe number to leave the late arrival message.  When I arrived despite prepaid stay, I was abruptly put in a taxi and sent 45 miles/ an hour west to Worcester MA: excuse: guests had not checked out as they expected at Hilton. I had to pay for the hotel in Worcester. And pay for my ride back after missing half a day of an expensive convention as I was not asleep til past 0300 AM in Worcester.   After heated confrontation, I did…

title: Better than the Sheraton across the street
review: Thank you so much for your comments.  We at Hilton Boston Back Bay pride ourselves with superior service and we are so sorry that we fell short with your visit to Boston.  All comments are looked at seriously and we always present the comments to the departments affected by the responses received from our valued guests.  AMOMA is not Hilton. When you book through a third party like AMOMA the hotel itself is no longer able to make any changes regarding a reservation. That is why we always recommend booking your reservations directly with Hilton. Booking directly with Hilton not only allows Hilton agents to make modifications to your reservation but it also allows you the  guest to get points in our Hilton Honors Rewards Program. Again we are terribly sorry about what happened to you and we hope that you give Hilton Back Bay another opportunity to provide you with superior service.  Thank you for your feedback and best wishes to you.

title: The view is not as advertised
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: About perfect except in one respect
review: Not so great value for the money.  Manager is unhelpful and unaccommodating.  The panoramic room is not as advertised and the curtain only opens half way.  The upgrade for this type of room is not worth it.  In addition the phone did not work, the curtains were falling of the rail, and an outlet does not work.  On a positive the location is great.

title: Hilton Back Bay-Top notch accmodations
review: Dear Shawn S,  Thank you for your review of your recent stay. It's unfortunate that we didn't exceed your expectations, and we regret that you weren't satisfied with your room assignment and accommodations. We care deeply about the happiness and satisfaction of our guests so we'll address all of your concerns with our team so that we may improve moving forward. Thank you again for your feedback and we hope you will consider staying with us again.

title: Great Location!
review: Location was excellent for me; I could walk to familiar places and some new ones in Back Bay. Hotel very clean. Bed comfortable. Service at front desk and bellman/doorman service were both friendly and helpful. There was a strike next door at the Sheraton, but local cops and Hilton employees navigated that loud and crowded situation with ease. I didn't need the on site breakfast place but would have liked to have been told about it at check in. My only real complaint: rooms are spacious but stark, sterile, ultra modern, all gray and black, too cold for my taste in appearance. Others may not care.

title: Hotel is central to everything
review: The Hilton is mainly for weekly business guests with a few families and or adults mixed in. The front desk staff is friendly and helpful to vacationers. Top notch rooms and friendly guest service makes this a go to destination in Boston.

title: Hilton Boston Back Bay
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Great facility, service and location!
review: The staff was extremely friendly and helpful.  The breakfast buffet was wonderful--best veggie omelet and fruit I've ever had!  Room was nice and comfy.  Bar area is pretty and inviting.  Great location too!

title: Great location
review: Walking distance to the Prudential Center, recently renovated with a stunning lobby and nicely suited rooms.  Staff were approachable and friendly. Room service was a little spendy for what you get....

title: Great Experience
review: Great location!  Even though the lobby was under construction when I was there this past New Years, we still loved the property.  Convenient to everything, and the bar staff was great, as well as the hotel staff!

title: Close to Fenway
review: Beautiful facility.  Wonderful staff.  Rooms were large, great TV and automatic blinds / curtains.  Very clean.  Staff was amazing and the location is excellent for sight seeing, shopping, eating to going to the Red Sox game at Fenway.  Can't wait to go back

title: Great Hotel and Warm Staff
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Check Out Your Room Before You Unpack
review: My wife and I could not have been more pleased with our stay.  We were immediately struck by the exceptionally warm welcome upon our arrival.  We will definitely use this hotel again when visiting Boston.

title: Hilton does not care if I never return.
review: I love the hotel and its location. I have stayed at this hotel many times. This was not one of my better visits. Room assigned was very poor. Difficult to sleep with the street noise. Request a room that avoids the street noise. For the price charged, I know you can find a better atmosphere to relax and sleep.

title: Great conference location
review: Thank you so much for your comments.  We at Hilton Boston Back Bay pride ourselves with superior service and we are so sorry that we fell short with your visit to Boston.  All comments are looked at seriously and we always present the comments to the departments affected by the responses received from our valued guests.  We are very sorry we did not meet your expectations and would appreciate  the opportunity to redeem ourselves at your next visit to Hilton Boston Back Bay. Thank you for your feedback.

title: Second Stay
review: On September 24th From 12 noon until 7pm nobody serviced the room. When I complained Ivan at the desk treated me with utter distain, like I was a passing tramp. As a gold member I did not appreciate it.   I complained to a supervisor on the phone and she did not know what to do and hung up.   Why would I not go elsewhere next time?

title: Nice hotel, great stay
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Nice Stay, but Irritating Construction
review: found the room to be clean and comfortable and the staff were efficient and friendly. Looks like it has had a major refurbishment recently - didn't look at all like I remembered from my last visit in 2004 (not sure if that is a memory issue though LOL). Stayed for 5 nights and thoroughly enjoyed the experience.

title: A really nice Hotel that is located in the center of everything.
review: Overall the stay here was nice. Check-in was easy, elevators were efficient, and the room was comfortable (except for the bed, which wasn't up to normal Hilton standards). The Hilton Honors lounge is nice and spacious. However, they usually remove most of the snack items late in the evening. The hotel does not offer Valet Parking - you must park in a garage located next to the hotel.  My only complaint was the construction noise near the hotel. It was hard to sleep with the sound of the safety beeper on the crane outside going off throughout the night.

title: 👍  Our Hotel In Boston
review: A really nice Hotel that is located in the center of everything. You are a two minute walk away from the Prudential Center, that has all kinds of restaurants and shops.  The staff besides the bartender whom closes is extremely helpful and nice.  The rooms are large and comfortable. I had a room with a double bed, and there was enough room to walk around. I also looked at a room with a king size bed and it was the same size as the room that I stayed in.  The bathroom, is awkward as you almost have to step over the toilet bowl to get into the shower, also there is no towel rakes by the shower so you have to get out of the shower and go under the sink to get a towel or place it on the toilet flush tank, which I found kind of nasty.  If you are looking for a hotel that is in the…

title: Awful value & horrible mattresses
review: We have stayed at this hotel on our last three trips to Boston. The location is great for us a block off Boylston and two blocks from Newberry. Plenty of good restaurants/shopping. Checkin was a snap staff courteous, professional and friendly. Recently renovated so up to date facilities. Room was on the 18th floor clean, comfortable with views of the city. Bed very comfortable, safe in room large TV. Good working free wifi with easy access.  Like the digital key which is easy to program and use. The breakfast buffet was very good with special orders for Omelets. Hotel has a parking garage with easy in and out access. Although they charge fifty dollars per day. Will be back on our next trip and definitely recommend.

title: Great hotel, great stay!
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Wonderful hotel!
review: Hilton Boston Back Bay was a great hotel.  I attended a conference at Marriott Copley place, and Hilton was a short walk (through a mall, so indoor walk!) away.  It was a Hilton, so everything was immaculate.  The rooms were excellent, the complementary wifi worked great, the fitness center is one of the best I've seen.  The view is great.

title: Boston Mets vs Red Sox
review: I travel to the Boston area quite frequently for business, and this is one of my favorite hotels.  The location is very convenient.    But the staff is wonderful.  They really bend over backwards to make you feel welcomed and appreciated.  The rooms are all very comfortable and also very quiet.  And I don't think there is a bad view.  The hotel is shaped like a triangle, and so each side has different views.    Just a nice, enjoyable, easy stay.

title: Excellent customer service, property and location
review: In town with the family for the Mets vs Red Sox weekend. Hotel has done beautiful renovations- room was large and nice. Super attentive staff. Called us when our room was ready. Arranged to have our group of rooms together. We will be back

title: Never Again
review: We like to visit Boston as we are originally from the area. We find this hotel and their staff to be wonderful. The rooms are very nice, very comfortable, and very clean. The food is very good and the people are great. And we love the location. One of the managers on the property on several occasions has been extremely helpful, Semir Talic. We highly recommend the property.

title: Berklee Move-in day
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. In nice weather, restaurant patio seating is packed with Bostonians and tourists alike soaking up the sunshine and enjoying the food. Commonwealth Ave offers a beautiful stroll down residential tree-lined streets. Keep walking towards the Charles River and enjoy a beautiful view by the water. In warmer months, people run and bike on paths running along the esplanade, and sail and kayak on the Charles River. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Like family
review: This hotel is conveniently located and perfect for my stay. It is clean, the staff is friendly and welcoming, and the newly renovated lobby and bar is very nice, although it can be a bit noisy when there's a crowd! I would definitely recommend this hotel, and will be staying there again.

title: Superb hotel, they really take care for their clients.
review: Last week I went to Boston to drop my freshman son at NU. You can imagine the stress and anxiety as this experience was totally new to me. Alas came all the Back Bay Hilton's staff to the rescue, specially Ousama and Amin, who not only helped me with all the moving but made feel at home.

title: Move in Berklee trip to Boston
review: Wonderful hotel, they really take care of their customers. Easy to book, fast, friendly and attentive at check-in as well as at any of its facilities. Bar, pool, restaurant, etc. Spacious, modern and exquisitely maintained rooms. Tremendously recoemndable.

title: Nice location, good service, nice room, limited Diamond perks
review: We stayed here because the hotel is ideally located next to the Berklee campus and dorms.  The rooms were beautiful but we found them to be noisy, and beds uncofortable.  We had long waits also for the elevator.  We felt it was not a good value for the cost.

title: Great hotel/location/staff
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. In nice weather, restaurant patio seating is packed with Bostonians and tourists alike soaking up the sunshine and enjoying the food. Commonwealth Ave offers a beautiful stroll down residential tree-lined streets. Keep walking towards the Charles River and enjoy a beautiful view by the water. In warmer months, people run and bike on paths running along the esplanade, and sail and kayak on the Charles River. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Great location
review: Great location in the heart of Back Bay, rooms are nice and spacious, staff are nice/helpful and they provided a crib for our newborn. Parking can be found on nearby streets if you look a bit, no need to pay 50$ in the hotel or other nearby lots, you can ask the people at check-in for tips. Have stayed at “fancier” and pricier hotels before in Boston and it’s not worth it, would definitely stay here next time in town.

title: Convenient to the Convention Center and great service all around!
review: Perfect location. Next to Prudential Center and some wonderful dining options. Walking distance to Fenway. Standard Hilton quality. Clean and roomy rooms (I like windows open). Good breakfast and bar. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Hilton Boston 18
review: This is one of the "specialty" Hilton properties that you often get near convention centers or in older parts of cities:  an odd shaped building, rooms a bit smaller than the Hilton standard, but still well (maybe even too well) appointed with comfortable beds and furniture.  The real winner here was the staff - they were super-helpful with finding restaurants (I was meeting with Chinese colleagues for their first time in the US, and every place they suggested was great!), and with addressing issues: I had a weird allergic problem with their feather pillows and bedding and they solved that ASAP.    A considerably better than the mean Hilton to my measure - I'll be back when I must be in town again!

title: Absolutely fantastic!
review: Not worth your $$ to stay there even as a Hilton Silver member. The lobby is a bit tight and the receptionist is very crumpy. After my 6 night stay, my request to extend the checkout time until a little after 12 noon was declined.

title: Great hotel and close to Fenway!
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. In nice weather, restaurant patio seating is packed with Bostonians and tourists alike soaking up the sunshine and enjoying the food. Commonwealth Ave offers a beautiful stroll down residential tree-lined streets. Keep walking towards the Charles River and enjoy a beautiful view by the water. In warmer months, people run and bike on paths running along the esplanade, and sail and kayak on the Charles River. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Rude and discourteous management
review: My mom and I just stayed here for three nights. Check in was easy, quick, and staff was super nice. Employees always greeted us upon entering the lobby each day. I was able to walk to Fenway in 20 minutes which was a huge plus. The only downfall was how expensive things were. Self parking is $50 a day and there is no valet! The small food items and sundries are very expensive! I tried to get a luggage cart to take our own luggage to the car, but I was told the cart had to be brought up by a bell hop because “the union rules”. Really? Weird. But the hotel is nice and in a nice area.

title: Rude management
review: Thank you so much for your comments.  We at Hilton Boston Back Bay pride ourselves with superior service and we appreciate the feedback of our valued guests.  All comments are shared with the departments affected by the responses received. We do try to have fair and competitive pricing for the Boston Back bay area. I am sure the front office team will be excited to hear how they have succeeded in making your stay a memorable one.     Thank you for your feedback and best wishes to you.

title: Only stay at this hotel if you are 10,000% sure you will make the reservation - poor cancelation policy
review: We booked the ultimate escape package as it promised late checkout when available.  This would really help our family as we had a night flight with 2 children. We were informed on the morning of leaving that checkout was 11.00am. I asked about late checkout and was told we could have one, but would have to pay extra.  Even after explaining the ultimate escapes promise of late checkout as part of the deal when available they refused to assist.   So much for the Hilton promise to ‘make things right’.   Far from making it right, the manager was rude, discourteous and showed lack of customer skills. On top of this they have not released the hold on the credit card swiped on arrival, but also created an extra hold on my debit card I paid with at checkout (after also taking the…

title: Great location and caring staff
review: We are Hilton rewards members, and regularly book there.  We asked for a waiver in cancellation party 36 hours out, the manager declined through an employee and kept us on hold for 30 minutes before hanging up on us to explain that it was due to a family illness. Hilton has lost our business.  Not waiving the policy is one thing, being rude and discourteous is another.    What’s funny is we were simply going to reschedule for a week later.  But they didn’t hear that, because they wouldn’t talk to us.

title: Ok stay, convenient to Fenway
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Beautiful hotel
review: My wife and I went up on Thursday to see Jimmy Buffett at Fenway.  The hotel is close to Fenway and was very busy.  I can't fault them for being busy, but I did not receive the usual Hilton Honors treatment.  This is a great location for Fenway Park and area attractions.  There is an attached parking garage that is small.  We ended up parking on the roof top level and had to use the stairs, the elevator did not go up.

title: Overnight stay in Boston to see Billy Joel at Fenway Park
review: Gorgeous high end hotel.  Views are amazing.  Rooms are classy.. really modern and tons of room.  Bed was super comfy.  Parking on site. ($50 a night) Easy walking access to Pru // Eataly and surrounding areas.  Cheap Uber to anywhere in town

title: Amazing Room,Friendly Staff,Early Check in
review: The Hilton always exceeds my expectations.  And they absolutely did the night of the Billy Joel concert at Fenway.  Easy parking and quick check in made for plenty of time for dinner before the show started. The room was beautiful, right temperature and very clean.

title: Don't prepay for your stay
review: The Hilton Back Bay was truly amazing.  Our front desk experience was so accommodating, she recognized that we had two families and put us in adjoining rooms.  The room was very nicely decorated and comfortable.  Everything was exactly the way you would expect from the Hilton Hotels..

title: Great location, solid service
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. In nice weather, restaurant patio seating is packed with Bostonians and tourists alike soaking up the sunshine and enjoying the food. Commonwealth Ave offers a beautiful stroll down residential tree-lined streets. Keep walking towards the Charles River and enjoy a beautiful view by the water. In warmer months, people run and bike on paths running along the esplanade, and sail and kayak on the Charles River. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Wait on the street for Uber
review: Chose this hotel due to proximity to Hynes Convention Center. Got great room with view of Fenway and famous Citgo sign. Friendly staff at hotel restaurant , where breakfast buffet was ample and sufficient. Rooms were nice size, bathroom a bit small but all in all this was a terrific place for 4 nights in Boston.

title: Nice rooms, tech gap with lounge
review: If you use Uber or Lyft be prepared for some delay and confusion coming and going, as the hotel has introduced a policy prohibiting these vehicles from coming to the front entrance, rideshare cars need to do pickup and drop offs around the corner on the street. Just wait for the freezing cold and snowbanks...

title: Convenient location, friendly service
review: Stayed in a room on the 20th floor, which was modern and comfortable.  Nice view as well.   Was invited to a reception one evening for I guess Diamond members, which was great and very much appreciated.  There is a bright light around the perimeter of the large, round mirror in the bathroom.  I understand the concept of better bathroom lighting, and have stayed elsewhere with something similar, but it frankly was awkward and too bright.  There should be a dimmer at a minimum.  Finally, I checked in with the mobile app and solely used a digital key.   Never needed to stop by the front desk.   Well, until I was in the Executive Lounge for breakfast, and was sternly challenged that I should NOT be in there without a paper voucher (which I didn't have since I checked in digitally). …

title: No, No and No
review: I missed the deadline to stay in my conference hotel at a reasonably affordable price and needed an alternative.  This place filled the bill well.  They went out of their way to make me comfortable, providing a large room and any assistance I could possibly request.  It was a good choice.

title: Always a pleasure
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Nice, but you can find better for the price
review: We stay here multiple times a year. We visit our child at Boston University. The hotel is very convenient to campus and of course the city in general. The rooms are always clean and the staff is courteous and welcoming. We will continue to stay at the Hilton Back Bay. It’s our home away from home!

title: Boston Dream
review: The room was nice, however the handicapped shower seat was wet when we arrived.  We returned a pillow and requested new sheets due to small yellow stains.  Overall, the room was clean and the hotel staff was outstanding but for the price there are better options available IMO.

title: Excellent location! Excellent staff!!
review: We had a great time in Boston and would highly recommend the Hilton Boston Back Bay.  Very large, comfortable, clean rooms.  Great experience with the front desk at check in and the concierge was great!

title: Nice Hotel
review: This hotel is walking distance to Fenway, shopping and the historical sites. It’s also directly across from the Prudential Center which is full of shops and restaurants. The staff was very accommodating and professional. The rooms were beautiful!

title: Great For Diamond Members
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. In warmer months, people run and bike on paths running along the esplanade, and sail and kayak on the Charles River. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Wasn’t able to check-in until 4:30pm.
review: Was able to check in at 11:00am even though check in time isn’t until 4:00pm. That was a very pleasant surprise. Another surprise was a lounge exclusively for Diamond Members. It has drinks and snacks in it, and some comfy seating. This is a nice but expensive hotel so if you can stay on points you should do that.

title: Really enjoyed our visit
review: I wasn’t able to check-in until 4:30pm. I was told that it’s busy season. Well, I always travel during the same busy season every year, but this was the latest check-in I have ever experienced in my life. C’mon, Hilton!  The room is clean as always. But the problem was the light in the bathroom. I don’t know if this is the same for all the rooms here or it’s just in my room. There was a big circle mirror in the bathroom, and there is light around the mirror(picture attached). This light is too bright to look myself in the mirror, and too bright to look at in the early morning, in the evening and during night. You cannot control the brightness of this light. This mirror light should be taken down and be replaced with descent light. Maybe it’s a good looking design but not…

title: Fantastic Hotel, Great Location
review: This place was great, we used the bar, downstairs, the weight room and pool on the 7th floor, our son was a regular at the snack bar downstairs. The staff was always helpful and polite. The night before we left someone set there sprinklers off on floor 10 at 11:45 pm. It didnt affect us, but it was nice to know that they have a system to notify everyone if there is a real emergency. View from the top floor hall below.

title: 2 night stay - Not worth the 140,000 Hilton Points
review: I have stayed at other hotels in Back Bay in the past. My experience at the Hilton Back Bay was far superior and I look forward to staying at this Hilton in the future. (Great location near Fenway Park and two subway stations.)

title: Wowed by Hilton this trip
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. In nice weather, restaurant patio seating is packed with Bostonians and tourists alike soaking up the sunshine and enjoying the food. Commonwealth Ave offers a beautiful stroll down residential tree-lined streets. Keep walking towards the Charles River and enjoy a beautiful view by the water. In warmer months, people run and bike on paths running along the esplanade, and sail and kayak on the Charles River. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Great stay
review: We were pleasantly surprised to have the Executive Suite (2616) during our stay at Hilton Boston Back Bay. The hotel staff was very helpful and our room attendant did a fab job of ensuring our room was tidy and all supplies were replenished. The views are stunning from this hotel and it is in a great location to either Lyft or walk to many great restaurants, sites and shopping. The restaurant downstairs had wicked awesome chowder as well!

title: Nice Property if Your Room Is Not Cancelled
review: We had a great first stay at the Hilton Back Bay. Lovely modern hotel with excellent gym and pool facilities! Great location very near the Prudential Centre. Helpful staff at reception. Would definitely return!

title: Small adequate
review: First time at this property. Here for a conference.  We arrived late due to flight delays. Called twice to let hotel know I would be late. When arrived, hotel let us know our room had been given away and that of nine other guests. Huge conference across the street, means all local hotels booked.  Very upsetting to say the least especially with early morning conference.   Manager not helpful. We were able to come back the next day, but only because I arrived very early in the morning to re-check in. We were told again the hotel would have to send folks away. It appeared to be a first come first serve basis,  despite having a reservation. Fortunate this time my reservation actually took. Is very convenient to conference center and is a nice looking hotel. However be very cautious…

title: Beautiful view, good location.
review: Dear shannon m,  First of all, thank you for your review of your past stay at our hotel. We apologize that we were unable to accommodate your reserved room type. Our front desk department goes through a lengthy process each day to ensure that our guests receive exactly the room expected, however at times we do not have availability due to guests extending their stays with us. Once again, We apologize for the inconvenience and do hope that the next time you travel to the area you will consider staying with us again.

title: Hilton Back Bay
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Excellent Experience
review: This was our 4th stay at the Back Bay and the hotel location and staff excelled expectations again! Easy walk to Fenway area, Kemore Sq and T ride to Government Center and Wharf. Always a great location

title: Centrally located
review: This hotel was awesome!  The staff were courteous, friendly and very professional.  The room was very clean!  In addition it’s in a great location, just a short walk to many restaurants and shops.  I would definitely stay here again!

title: A good business hotel
review: Nice place, wish service was better. Massive breakfast - but it wasnt complimentary. The WIFI is free, but was terribly slow. Friendly staff at the reception - good knowledge of things around Boston. Pretty much everything is within walking distance - good restaurants, our conference venue, the Tour bus stops, shops.

title: Great stay!
review: I go to Boston for work quite often and it’s the first time I use Hilton Back Bay. I love the Back Bay area as you're close to Newbury St., Prudential Center and Boston Commons - you can easily grab a bite, do your shopping and unwind with a jog.  The hotel's modern with comfortable bed, good bathroom size and decently clean - best thing, they have a mini-fridge (!!! This is a rare gem in US hotel, and doesn't feature in Sheraton across the street).   That said, front desk's service was poor. There's constantly a queue as check-in and -out was v slow. They're also very rude. I'm not sure I'd be coming back for this reason.

title: Upgrade not worth the price.
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Good location
review: We paid $30/night for the upgrade expecting either a larger room or an unimpeded view.  We did not get either.  The regular price is already high at this hotel since location is their main draw.  Don’t bother with any other frills offered since more than likely you will be disappointed.

title: Nice, but a huge problem
review: Good location especially for shopping and restaurants- close to prudential centre. Welcoming, friendly staff. Only downside was the air conditioning blows a gale around the room so couldn’t sleep. Rooms are dark too.

title: Great hotel!
review: We booked the room because it had two double beds. Once we finally got inside the room, I don’t see why it couldn’t be two queens. Instead we had a couch we didn’t need. The bathroom was tiny and no vent. However, our big complaints are with management and wifi.   We arrived around 11:00 and dropped our luggage. We were okay with 4:00 checkin and off we went to sight see. When we came back at 4:30, they acted like we might not have a room. I was ready to blow!  Then they couldn’t find my bag. I had to go on a scavenger hunt with the bell boy to find it. No ice machines. No Starbucks either. The wifi was sketchy at best. We asked for a blanket and got an itchy, scratchy thing that had bald spots on it.  The night it rained we lost the Dish for awhile too!  We went across to the…

title: 5 days in Boston
review: Great Hilton hotel! Great staff, very kind and helpful.  Very comfortable room. Restaurant menu could be more diverse but it’s pretty good in general.  Awesome restaurant and bar staff  Convenient location in back bay.  Go to the top of Prudential Tower it’s amazing from there

title: Pathetic Wifi System
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. In nice weather, restaurant patio seating is packed with Bostonians and tourists alike soaking up the sunshine and enjoying the food. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Hilton Back Bay Boston
review: This property is generally straightforward and fine. The wifi system, however, is an embarrassment in a city renowned for high tech. If you have business to do online, go somewhere else. Computers in the lobby "business center" also second rate.

title: Great location
review: Customer service was very good and the location is good to Fenway and Copley.  Room was small and view was not good for the price.  We stayed in peak summer travel season so the price was high for the level of accommodations.

title: Great rooms, location, and service, but pricey parking
review: The hotel is located near the Prudential Center and walking distances to many restaurants, shops, and train stations. We found it to be very convenient. The lobby was decorated nicely and the staff was helpful. Because the building is triangular, it was easy for me to get a bit disoriented, but eventually got use to it. No complementary coffee or breakfast provided.  Our room was clean and nice, but it was dark, even with all the lights on. The beds were a little small. The room had a refrigerator but no microwave and cost $15/day to rent. The elevators are slow and loud...we could hear them running from our room even though our room was around the corner from them. Overall, the hotel served our purpose and we enjoyed our stay.

title: Excellent base for touring Boston
review: Wonderful hotel for most part. Tastefully decorated / renovated rooms, comfortable bed. Location is very good for exploring Boston.   The service was attentive everywhere and especially from front desk Ms. Chun. She always smiles, always ready to help - the best.   The hotel has nice views onto Charles river when booking rooms with 03-05 numbers.   Diamond lounge was nice - although we would love to have more berries for breakfast.   They do also have a pool.   The only thing, I wish would be better - less expensive - parking at $48 is just too much (and no - it has no valet for such price).   We do still recommend it.

title: Good location
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Good location
review: We stayed here for three nights in June on a city break.  The hotel is in a good location for sightseeing, having a stop for the trolley bus tour across the road.  The exec lounge (or Diamond lounge, as they call it)  isn’t as good as in other Hilton’s we have experienced.  It’s not that large and the breakfast which is served In here, complimentary to diamond members is fairly basic, and you can struggle to get somewhere to sit.  NB - there is no longer a Starbucks in the lobby, although this is still listed on the hotel website.

title: Comfy hotel, near public transportation.
review: I stayed at the Hilton Back Bay for 4 nights. It’s centrally located a block away from Boylston St, the Prudential Center and in between 2 subway stations. You can get from and to the airport on the Logan Express which is a bus that stops outside all the terminals at Logan Airport. It’s $10 pp and you take the one that says “Back Bay”. It stops right outside Haynes Convention Center which is a 3 minutes walk from the Hilton.  The rooms are spacious and clean. The beds are very comfortable and you get 4 pillows per bed. The bathroom has Crabtree & Evelyn toiletries. The big round mirror is a bit too bright but you just have to look to the mirror, not the light.  The front desk staff is friendly and courteous with the exception of one guy that works in the mornings to mid…

title: Hotel for last two nights of our amazing tour of America and was good
review: Had a nice stay here. Super comfy beds and linens. Friendly & helpful staff. Near 2 different T stops and walking distance to many bars and restautants and shops. Starbucks, Dunkin, 7-11 half a block away.

title: Good, but can be better
review: Good Location, Great staff (Very Friendly) and clean room and comfortable bed. Very spacious indeed, and loved chilling out the last few days of this great trip which seen us in 15 different hotel rooms.  The bigger hotels mainly have everything you require, from Parking, to WiFi to Swimming Pool, fitness centre. It was a good location for us and if back in Boston area, would defiantly stay here again

title: Great hotel, excellent staff
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. In nice weather, restaurant patio seating is packed with Bostonians and tourists alike soaking up the sunshine and enjoying the food. Commonwealth Ave offers a beautiful stroll down residential tree-lined streets. Keep walking towards the Charles River and enjoy a beautiful view by the water. In warmer months, people run and bike on paths running along the esplanade, and sail and kayak on the Charles River. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Good Stay at Hilton Boston Back Bay
review: We got a surprisingly good deal on Hotwire and were quite pleased. Everyone on staff worked hard to make our stay lovely.  Our room needed a couple of minor repairs but was otherwise spacious, clean, and comfortable. Tastefully and artfully decorated, the room had an old Hollywood glamour.  Very pleasant stay. Parking was a bit steep, but probably worth the cost. We ended up parking in a SpotHero spot a couple of blocks away. Not a bad walk in better conditions, but not in 100+ heat indices.

title: Pricey Place, not enough elevators
review: Very good location and close to subway stations, also the station for airport shuttle bus to Logan airport is nearby at the convention center. Friendly staff at the front desk and breakfast room. Nice Fenway and MIT views from the North West side of the building.

title: Great Boston location
review: For a place with 25 floors, a bank of 3 elevators isn’t quite enough. Very quiet in a corner king room, but wowsers, $339 a night with a room block through the corporate rate. I guess Boston thinks they are more important than Chicago or San Fran, where I never pay that much.  No water fountains/jugs anywhere to be found on property. I mean the 2 bottles free in the room is nice, but they didnt last all that long.

title: Quiet,Clean, and Ideally Located
review: The location of this hotel is great especially if you are visiting without a car. Fenway is only a few blocks away. Quincy Market is almost a 2-mile walk. There are many nearby subway stops and it's easy to use. The hotel was clean. Room size was about what I expected for the city. The bathroom was smallish. Would stay here again.

title: Great location
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. In nice weather, restaurant patio seating is packed with Bostonians and tourists alike soaking up the sunshine and enjoying the food. Commonwealth Ave offers a beautiful stroll down residential tree-lined streets. Keep walking towards the Charles River and enjoy a beautiful view by the water. In warmer months, people run and bike on paths running along the esplanade, and sail and kayak on the Charles River. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Best location to stay in the city
review: Booked the room thru Priceline and got a good deal. Central location near shops, restaurants, Fenway Park and Public Library. Shops at the Prudential Center within walking distance.  Got to check in early. Room was on the 12th floor. It was clean and quiet and the 2 double beds were comfortable. Had indoor pool and jacuzzi. Did not eat there or go to the bar.  Excellent cafe across the street (Flour) for breakfast. Only complaint was the toilet was loud when flushing. Thought the lid was going to blow up. Other complaint was the bathroom light was too bright (go figure). Had to shade your eyes to look for stuff on the counter top. Enjoyed our stay.

title: Shockingly poor
review: The whole hotel was very modern and clean. I loved the pool/fitness area with the outdoor patio area. It's perfect if you want a good place to relax but also have a good time. Its walking distance to Boylston St and Newbury which is where a ton of stores, restaurants and bars are at. (The best in Boston - my opinion) Not to mention it's basically across the st from the Prudential center and Kings for bowling. You dont need a car staying here but if you must have a car they do have parking for a cost as street parking is only somewhat convenient nights and weekends.

title: Horrendous front desk supervisory staff
review: I’m a Hilton diamond member and normally an ardent Hilton fan. I was put in this crappy little room on the 4th floor with a view of ...ladies of the evening. This building has 20-plus floors and could easily have placed me in a room with a view, but this was the recommended room. Welcome to Boston...

title: Great location, nice room
review: Checked in to the Hilton back bay along with my wife this evening under 2 separate reservations on June 22. Over the years as a business traveler and as a tourist (over 10-15 times or more a year) into hotels that span the boutique to chains including Sofitel, Ritz, Sheraton, Hilton, Kimpton, Marriott. Westin, 4 seasons etc etc. My high expectations generally aren't particularly high. This particular one was the low point. Ivan G (Front desk Supervisor) made no effort to greet, make eye contact, acknowledge, calling my wife by spelling 3 letters of her last name ‘HAL’ in the course of the check in. His demeanor was not only gruff towards us but he was also barking at the bellhop about some errands. He was gruff and appeared to be tired which made me remark at the end of the…

title: Vacation with daughter
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Back Bay Easy Access
review: I was spending 3 days in Boston with my 7 year old and we chose the Hilton.  We arrived way before check in (10 am) and our room wasn't ready.  It wasn't an issue for us as we had things to go and do anyway.  They happily stored our bags for us in the meantime.  We got back around 3 and the room still wasn't ready (check in isn't until 4 so this wasn't anyone's fault).  The very nice lady at the front desk told us if we changed our room selection (I had chosen it through their app a few days prior), we could have a room now.  We were content to wait until she told us that the room that was ready probably had a better view than the one we chose, so we went ahead with the one that was ready.  I thought it was really good of her to think of that for us.  The bellhop got our stored…

title: Good hotel in excellent location
review: Centrally located on the back bay, this Hilton has easy access to Fenway, shopping, and the subway. The staff is efficient and helpful, even upon our midnight arrival. The lobby has a unique smoke fire that is warm and inviting. The bar beckons you with easy access after a long day of sightseeing. Our room on the 24th floor was large, quiet, clean, and beautifully decorated with a magnificent view of Boston, the river, and Cambridge. It was easy to find because it is next to the Prudential skyscraper. Greatest bathroom mirror, EVER!

title: Great location
review: Very nice Hotel. Overall: Good Experience, would stay again Cleanliness: Very clean Service: Good service Rooms: Nice and clean, bit small windows but ok Nice pool area, fitness room and sundeck! Executive lounge has nice snacks from 5-7 PM. Would have appreciated some beer and wine service though.

title: Not a family hotel
review: We stayed for a long weekend and it was a great base for everything that we wanted to do - back bay, Copley, Boston Common, Fenway etc.   We took an Uber to dinner in the Anitra End but walked everywhere else.

title: BS Refund Policy
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. title: Good location at the calm side of Back Bay
review: Never staying at a Hilton again. Won't reimburse me for their hotel room in Back Bay Boston when my flight connection was delayed and had to get re-routed to another city. Totally out of my hands, yet you only cover flights that are cancelled. How about delayed flights that make you miss connections so you have to stay in a different city???? Unbelievable.

title: Boston Back Bay HIlton
review: Thank you for your feedback. We are sorry the cancellation policy did not meet your needs.  We will contact you privately to discuss further how to make this right. We try hard to make sure all of our guests have a rewarding experience at our hotel, and hope that next time you are in the area you will consider staying with us.

title: Good location
review: Excellent location to explore Boston, as a tourist, as a shopper, as a conference participant, as a gastronome. Room was clean and large. Badroom was a little bit small and water was constantly dripping. Service at check-in or check-out very friendly, the concierge was very helpful. Great assistance.

title: Location, location
review: We are sorry we were unable to provide you with the quality of amenities and service you expect from Hilton during your recent stay. We apologize for the issues in your room and will work with our maintenance team to ensure this does not happen again. If you return to our area, we hope you will consider staying with us again.

title: I had a problem but they made it right
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Great time in Boston
review: I reviewed Hilton Back Bay before, and gave it a low rating because I had a significant problem at checkout that could have been fixed easily, but the manager on duty was unhelpful. Besides that problem it was a beautiful property and a nice stay. I am following up because the hotel followed up with me about my problem, and eventually made it right. I appreciate good customer service, even if it comes a bit late.

title: Bad start and things aren't getting any better
review: Back Bay Hilton is a great location with perfect amenities. Second stay here and would definitely return. Within walking distance of fantastic restaurants and an easy train ride to anywhere else. Very safe and comfortable.

title: Lovely Visit
review: When you spend a day traveling to get somewhere, it's always disappointing when the hotel says "oops, sorry, no king size bed for you.  You'll have to change rooms tomorrow."  I don't like to change rooms almost as much as I don't like hotels who don't get the reservation right.  We were too tired to venture out to eat so we stayed in and ate at the hotel.  I know it's tricky to get pasta (from a box) cooked al dente.  But when you're paying top dollar I wish they'd try.  I complained and the waitress smiled and asked if I wanted to order anything else.  No.   Because we hate to move rooms, we're staying in the room they gave us.  My husband (who is attending a medical conference sponsored by Harvard) came up to the room to rest between sessions.  He was quietly dozing when the…

title: Perfect location for business or vacation
review: Dear SaladAlexander,  Thank you for taking the time to review your experience at our property. We’re very sorry you experienced an undesirable stay and level of customer service with us. We addressed the problems you mentioned with our team as we always appreciate feedback that will better our guest experience. Thank you for alerting us to these issues, and we hope you will give us a second chance to make it right in the future.

title: Great family vacation
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: excellent location, nice rooms & impeccable service
review: Location is why we chose this hotel.  Close to “T”.  Easy area to walk to restaurants. Great view of river! Great, great mattresses and housekeeping. Used digital key for first time- easy!  Nice Gym!  Thank you!

title: Perfect for catching a Sox Game or just walking about the Back Bay
review: We have stayed at this Hilton in the past. The staff with whom we have interacted have been polite, friendly and very competent. The rooms are nice & all have a mini-frog & coffee maker. Trader Joe's is a block away, so you can stock the frig with milk & snacks. The pool is nice. The location is excellent.

title: Great Location
review: A great location, near shopping, restaurants, walking down Boylston or Newbury, or to a baseball game. Boston Conservatory families visiting students should stay here! Very nice and comfortable hotel. The staff are very helpful.

title: Good location
review: We enjoyed our stay in Boston.  The hotel was close to Fenway and the Boston Commons.  We were close to many good restaurants.  It was only a $25 Uber ride to the airport.  The hotel was basic but nice.  The pool was growded when we went.

title: New to Boston
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings.
