title: Location is great but....
review: The hotel was nicely setup, clean, beautiful view. The door was ajar and I had a co-worker check my room. Should have called the front desk but had to get ready since we had reservations for dinner. The bed was comfortable.

title: Nice Hotel in BackBay
review: We have stayed at this hotel many times and have had great experiences.  This is the first time our experience was not so good.  For starters we received notice via the digital key that our room was ready so we went to the hotel only to find out "there must be a problem with the app" as the room will not be ready for several more hours.  Ultimately this wasn't a huge issue as we were able to leave our car in the garage and head off to the game.  The staff was very friendly and very apologetic about it.  No issues with getting into the room once we returned later.  Connecting to the Wifi was difficult, so difficult that we, as Hilton rewards members, were unable to use their WiFi at all which was disappointing.  The shower did not work correctly, the water pressure was barely…

title: Great location,  modern rooms
review: Hi Nicole R,   Thank you for taking the time to leave feedback during your recent stay with us. We appreciate your loyalty returning to our property and unfortunately this time we did not exceed your expectations. I apologize for the inconveniences of Wi-Fi issues along with the digital check-in process. We are in the process of enhancing our Wi-Fi.The errors occurring during the digital-check in is something we will bring up to our team to improve the process. We hope you return with us for a more memorable and enjoyable experience.  Best regards,

title: Hilton Back Bay
review: The hotel situation is fine, in BackBay  which is fine for visiting the city. Breakfast is fine, but not so many products. I had a no noise room. Room was huge (2 king beds), TV 47inch. Personal is really friendly and they helped me.

title: great location, decent rooms, very poor service!
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Very average
review: Staying there now. Arrived 3pm, room not available till 4. Ok They stored our bags (me, wife and her 75yr old mom) while we grabbed late lunch Returned and got room at 4. Disaster getting someone to retrieve our bags, which contained essential meds for my mother in law. Called desk twice to complain. So understaffed the operator had to come out to remind them. Eventually got bags delivered almost an hour later! 3 adults in this room but only toiletries for one ( ie single shower cap). Again called and was told housekeeping would deliver while we went out for dinner. Of course when we returned many hours later, Nothing! Called again and still waiting. You should be ashamed to call yourself a Hilton. Even holiday inn has better service. Bring on more staff when you are so busy.…

title: Good hotel - good location - good for business meetings
review: Hello Richard P,   I would like to start by saying thank you for taking the time to review our hotel, The Hilton Boston Back Bay. On that note, we would like to sincerely apologize for failing to exceed your expectations during your stay. It is very out of character for someone on our team to behave like that and I will be sure to address this with the department head. It is very important to us that we continuously uphold our Hilton Values and culture, and we regrettably did not do so. Your loyalty is very important to us and we hope that you will visit us again so that we have the opportunity to make it right for you and create a positive, memorable stay.   Thank You,

title: Nice rooms, convenient
review: The Hilton Boston Back Bay is more expensive than the Hilton in Beverly Hills, but it is nothing special. If you are a Diamond, forget about eating in the Executive Lounge. They are always out of everything. I have been there several times, and this is always the case. You have to beg for an upgrade, which is one of your Diamond perks. One time I could not turn off the water in the bathroom, and I had to stand there, dripping wet, wrapped in a towel, waiting for someone to turn the water off. Worst of all, there are only wrapped plastic drinking glasses in the room instead of proper glassware. If you crave a mediocre experience, this is your place.  P

title: Good location
review: Hello ElektraVelvet,  Thank you for your feedback about your experience as an Honors Diamond member. We are terribly sorry for your experience with being unable to turn off the water in your shower. Also, we are sorry for not having been informed of your desire to have glass cups in your room instead of the plastic cups - we would have gladly had them awaiting for you in your room or brought some to you. We hope to see you again the next time you visit Boston.

title: Good location, room, and sufficient service
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Nice Stay
review: I spent several days here for a work training course in the area.  As a Gold Hilton Honors member, I received a great room on the 25th floor.  The view was nice and the room was great.  I had plenty of space to work comfortably.  Though I did not take advantage of much of their amenities it was a good stay.  There are dozens of dining options very close by.  Every kind of food you could want.  The location was also great for me to run each morning.    It provided everything I could ask for and I would stay here again.

title: Father/son trip to Boston
review: Stayed one night with family for a birthday party near Fenway, which is a 10 minute walk.  Room was nice and modern, although the painted doors revealed their age.  I liked the lobby and executive lounge.  The wifi in my room didnt work apparently because we were so far from the router. They offered to move our room but we declined because of the hassle.

title: Boston Back Bay Bonus
review: My son finished his junior year of college so we took a few days to visit Boston. We wanted to go to Fenway Park (this hotel's location is perfect for walking to Fenway). We wanted to see some sites and we received some excellent help and recommendations from the Hilton staff.

title: Great location
review: I don't usually take time to write reviews, but... I had to post my thoughts about this place. The people who work there have earned it. Yes, it's convenient to everything,  newly remodeled and very fairly priced. But over the course of several visits I found Semir, Charles, Samantha, Jessica, and Amber to be consistently polite, welcoming and accomdating. Can't say enough about their quality of service.  There were others there who were equally nice but I didn't catch their names. Would not stay anywhere else... well done.

title: Nickel-and-Dime
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Exemplar customer service
review: This hotel will nickel-and-dime you. No free breakfast with expensive standard room. No free mineral water bottle everyday. You only get 2 free mineral water bottles upon check-in. The mineral water bottles if you want to buy are available in the front desk. The convenience store is 3 blocks away.

title: Nice stay
review: Hello Ivans_us,  I would like to start by saying thank you for taking the time to review our hotel, The Hilton Boston Back Bay. On that note, we would like to sincerely apologize for failing to exceed your expectations during your stay. I apologize about the water situation and the distance of the store. For future I will let our Front Desk staff know closer locations to suggest to guests. It is very important to us that we continuously uphold our Hilton Values and culture, and we regrettably did not do so. Your loyalty is very important to us and we hope that you will visit us again so that we have the opportunity to make it right for you and create a positive, memorable stay.   Thank You,

title: I love this hotel
review: I arrived in the Back Bay area of Boston late on Thursday night (08 May 2018) and I arrived at my hotel to find out that I had mistakenly booked the wrong day and they had no room for me for the night I required. My flight back to London was early the next morning and I just needed somewhere to lay my head for a few hours. I proceeded to try several hotels nearby but all were booked up - unbeknown to me, there was a Cardiac conference and it was graduation season so everywhere was full! I got to the HIlton and was met by the same "no room at the inn" but instead of being turned away, like I had been at the other hotels, a wonderful member of the front desk team, called Charlie (I think), really went out of his way to help me find somewhere to stay. He was my guardian angel that…

title: Nice rooms but doesn't  meet expectations
review: Beautiful  hotel with the perfect location. Clean and just remodel. Excellent service since the moment you put your feet on the Hotel door. Will go back  for sure next time I travel to Boston. Good breakfast buffet and a la carte.

title: Updated Hilton in the middle of the action
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Boston Trip
review: It looks old hotel from outside but very much updated inside. Spacious fitness center with good size pool.  Not much view from window.   Executive lounge is small but functional. Good sizable space for catching up with people in the lobby

title: Great location, nice stay
review: Location of this hotel is perfect in order to take in the Boston experience. Hotel was clean and well presented, staff was friendly, and the service was great. Boston is a great city to visit and this hotel was an added bonus.

title: Not just the building needs a makeover
review: Hello Triptoboston,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel, The Hilton Back Bay Boston. We appreciate the positive feedback and I will be sure to share your review with our entire team! I am happy you got to enjoy the city of Boston and we hope to see you back again!  Thank You,

title: Good Hotel
review: I was attending a conference in the nearby convention center and found my stay at the Hilton to be very good! My room was quiet, though it could use some updates and a bit more thorough cleaning. Walking to restaurants and the convention center / shopping mall was super easy. I discovered that if you cross the street to the Sheraton, you can get to the convention center and shopping mall from inside the Sheraton. I also recommend cutting through the Sheraton to get to Boylston Street restaurants because at night, Dalton Avenue is not very well lit and you would have to walk on an interstate overpass. I would stay here again for business trips to Boston. For a personal trip, I'd probably find something more updated, especially for the price my company paid.

title: Hilton Back Bay
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. title: Great Hotel
review: This is an excellent hotel.  The hotel accommodations and the customer service were all first rate.  The location is perfect for both business and pleasure.  Great breakfast and evening appetizers.  I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Great location for Hynes Convention Center and downtown
review: The hotel room is clean and the front desk staff are friendly.  It is a great location if you need to attend the convention center.  I feel safer in the close by area of this hotel comparing to other area near downtown.

title: Nice hotel
review: Located 1 block from Convention Center and 2 blocks from Newberry Street! Great location and easy walking to a lot of local sites. View from the 23rd floor was spectacular of the river and downtown area! Great staff!

title: 2 day stay at Boston Back Bay.
review: I don't know whether I paid extra for it or they upgraded me but I got a corner room. Although it is an older property, it has renovated and it now has a modern look, except the elevator. The lobby is under renovation. It is conveniently located and it is across the street from the 1 Dalton, an expensive highrise that it under construction.

title: Wonderful Back Bay hotel
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. title: Very fun cool decor
review: Very friendly staff let me check-in 4 hours early!!  Great location in the Back Bay.... Easy walk to Chinatown for lunch and also easy walk to House of Blues for Joe Perry concert. Will stay there again,no doubt.

title: Reno Gone Wrong
review: I really liked the dark tones and textures of the room. We stayed for 2 nights for a convention then headed to another hotel closer to the city. There was a good restaurant nearby called summer shack. Overall the room was very nice, spacious, and nice coffee maker. Only downside was the lobby was undergoing renovations but no big deal as I’m sure it will be fantastic when completed.

title: Boston Marathon hote
review: We made reservations for this hotel via phone and were not told that we would be arriving at a construction site,  The lobby is a disaster and most of the area inaccessible.   We arrived early and our room was not ready.  This was as expected so we checked our bag and were assured that we would be called when our room was ready.  No call was received but when  we went back to the hotel around 3:30, our room was ready (thanks for nothing).  The staff were not at all welcoming and could not have cared less that we were there.  We had to ask for the complementary water typically given to Diamond members.  We were assured that the rooms had been fully renovated and they had been but what a renovation.  The entire color scheme is black and dark grey with an industrial garage look…

title: Decent hotel with good proximity to Fenway
review: Dear Jack T,  Thank you for having taken the time to write such a detailed review of your experience as a frequent guest and Honors Diamond member. We are very sorry you felt the lobby was in a condition which resembled a disaster since we built temporary walls to hide any changes which were going on behind the scenes. Although it wasn't as early as you would have liked, we are glad we were able to accommodate your request to check-in 30 minutes early. We greatly value your opinion and will be sure to share your distaste for the decor changes with the interior designers in hopes they make different choices next time. Overall, we are incredibly sorry for your atypical experience and we would greatly appreciate the opportunity to make it up to you.  Warm Regards.

title: Quite Disappointed...Too Many Other Service Oriented Hotels in Boston
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. title: Great Location
review: I used Hilton Diamond member points to reserve a room the night before the Boston Marathon, in order to see my nephew run his first Boston Marathon for Boston Children's Hospital, in honor of his 2 year old daughter, Kalin, who has a very unique brain disorder - leaving her blind and deaf.  The hotel provided me a room with one king bed, when I specifically asked for two double beds. They "suggested" I go out of my way to keep calling them to see if I could get two double beds. If not, I could pay $25 for a roll-a-way bed. I decided best to try and cancel this room and just used twice as many points for a different room with two beds. This was supposed to be a special occasion. While the room with two double beds was nice, I later discovered the hotel still charged me for the…

title: Great bed, great location, bad service
review: Dear daksterinwaltham,   We would first like to thank you for taking the time to review your stay at the Hilton Boston Back Bay.  We always appreciate guest feedback and continuously take comments into consideration as we strive to improve our guest service experience. Secondly, we would like to apologize for the issues you encountered during your stay.  This review has been brought to the attention of our Director of Front Office, and he has addressed these issues with his team.  We hope that you will reconsider your decision on staying with another hotel in Boston because we would love to have the opportunity to make it right for you. It is important that we accommodate all your needs and welcome you to stay with us again.  Warm Regards, Dominique Marty General Manager

title: Feels 5 Star
review: Newly renovated and close to everything Boston!  Could not have asked for a better spot.  The renovations a beautiful too.  The staff was so friendly. And, the fitness center is AWESOME as well as the executive lounge.  Can you say complimentary Starbucks!  Will definitely be back to this hotel.

title: Construction but Nice views
review: The type of room we reserved and called to confirm was not available at check in. Then the staff was absolutely rude as if this was not their fault and it was our problem. Three different employees over two days acted this way. But... the hotel is newly remodeled and very pretty. The bed was really comfortable. And the location was good for my needs.

title: Great Stay
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Great Service
review: Hotel was under renovation, but that didn’t hinder the amazing service all around.  Doormen, front desk staff, maid service and bar staff ALL friendly, professional and made you feel welcomed. Everyone greeted me with a smile. It really just makes the stay that much better when the service is top notch. You can tell the staff are happy and that shows through.   Room was awesome, we were on the 20th floor room 2012 and had a pretty cool view.  Beds were comfy, room was clean, bathroom toiletries plentiful and smelled great. Coffee pot and mini fridge are a def. bonus. My only suggestion would be a small microwave. There are so many restaurants in the area and taking leftovers back to the room it would be nice to warm up later on.  I got to check out the pool and fitness center…

title: A work in progress
review: The room I stayed in was very cold  and the heater didn’t work. The phone was dirty.I didn’t report it because I was just there for one night. The view was gorgeous just made you fall in love with Boston at night. The fixtures in the room were nice.The hair dryer didn’t work.I feel like the bathroom could have been clean better. The tub,bathroom walls &door going in out of bathroom .The front desk staff was great  (very nice) and the hotel house keeping was very nice and the bellmen were very nice. The bar manager kinda needs to be a little nicer and have better demeanor .His demeanor is not welcoming at all in my opinion.If the hotel renovations were completed  I think I would have had a better stay and if there were shuttle service to the hospital and airport. I would stay…

title: Nice quiet stay.
review: Dear 24davisj,   Thank you for reviewing your most recent stay at the Hilton Boston Back Bay. First of all, I want to apologize for the issues you encountered during your stay with us. Your comments have been passed along to the appropriate departments so that they can review these issues with their team members. We aim to create memorable experiences for all our guests and I am glad the front desk was able to provide such great service to you. We hope that you will stay with us again and address any issues, concerns, or requests so that we can fully accommodate your needs and exceed your expectations.  Warm Regards, Dominique Marty General Manager

title: Nice location and view from room
review: The hotel is being renovated and I won't comment on the lobby. The room is in the current trend of mostly black and thus feels dark no matter how many lights are turned on. The AC was quiet, but it did nothing and the room was stiflingly hot. Bathrooms in hotel are also notoriously poorly lit but this one had a huge round mirror with a built-in light. It provided great light and it did not fog up. When I checked out I asked repeatedly if the bill was updated for all charges. Even the emailed bill sent to me was incorrect and did not include breakfast, though that charge would have been billed to me on my credit card. Tell me why a hotel charges $30+ for breakfast. Worst of the rip-offs that hotels charge. A diner would charge $10 or less for the same meal.

title: They charge extra for everything- way overpriced
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Good location, poor quality
review: Recently stayed in the hilton hotel in boston and was extremely disappointed. The location is good and the room was clean however the hotel was extremely overpriced. The advertised price did not include taxes- which came to almost 150 dollars for a two night stay- breakfast which was 25 extra per person per night or parking which was 41 extra per night! Charging over 250 a night already i felt this was extremely overpriced especially considering the whole lobby was under construction there was constant noise in the room and the downstairs area was generally untidy- stay somewhere else- other boston hotels are much cheaper and of superior quality

title: Great Back Bay Hotel
review: Dear michelle120798,   Thank you for taking the time to review your most recent stay at the Hilton Boston Back Bay. We are thrilled that you were able to enjoy the great location that our hotel provides. It is unfortunate that your stay with us was not exemplary as reflected in the rating. Our priority is to create positive, memorable, guest service experiences and strive to continue to do so through feedback provided by our guests. We hope that you will stay with us again and address any issues, concerns, or requests so that we can fully accommodate your needs and exceed your expectations. Your business and loyalty is important to us.  Warm Regards, Dominique Marty General Manager

title: Not the Hilton I thought I knew
review: I frequently stay at Hilton properties during business trips, and this one was a disappointment.  Yes, the location is good, but the overall quality of the hotel was poor and there are much nicer Hilton properties.  The hotel atrium was under construction and noisy during my stay.  I have chosen other properties for an upcoming Boston visit because of the poor quality experience at this one.

title: Close too Fenway!!
review: Dear ccmitchellusa,  We appreciate your review of your stay at our hotel in January and are very sorry you had a disappointing experience with us. We’ve addressed these issues with our staff. Exceptional guest service is the foundation of our brand promise. Your feedback helps us improve. Thank you once again for your comments.

title: Don’t stay here in Spring or Fall
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: good hotel
review: Our family stayed here in March for a pre-op visit for our son. It was way too hot in the room. We were told that it was an old building and only had one set of pipes. They were still running the heat and hadn’t switched over to air-conditioning.  We had to turn the thermostat as low as it would go and run the fan.   It was still too hot.  We did not sleep well at all and were miserable the next day. The desk would not change our rate, just offered to give us points, which have never helped me as I do not travel frequently enough (Hilton Honors).  I have to call back to talk to the manager to try to get a rate change as he is not in for 2 more days.  My advice is to only stay here in high Winter or high Summer.

title: Best with a deal
review: Dear MaineGrazer,  First of all, I want to sincerely apologize for the issues you encountered during your stay. We appreciate the feedback you have provided and would like to apologize for the temperature of your room that arose during your stay. It is most unfortunate that it disrupted your stay, and your stay was not positively memorable. Guest comments such as yours are important to us and have been reviewed by the Director of Engineering. We hope that you choose to stay at the Hilton Boston Back Bay on your next stay so that we could have the opportunity to exceed your expectations.  Warm Regards, Dominique Marty General Manager

title: Right location, comfy room
review: Good hotel for standard accommodation.  I attended a conference nearby.  This hotel is not connected internally to the conference center but it is just across the street - so the only 'outside in the winter' transit needed is to cross the street and enter then building on the other side.  None of the rooms are very far from the elevator but I heard NO elevator noise.  The room was a good size, bed very comfortable, linens really nice,view over the Charles was fine.  Bathroom and shower facilities were find.  No problem with getting prompt hot water.  It is not a 'luxury' place but was quite comfortable.  And Benjamin, at the front desk, and our hispanic bartender whose name we cannot recall (surely due to the great drinks we had!) are 'keepers' - definite assets to the staff. I…

title: Great place to stay for business or pleasure
review: Super central location for walking, great for travelers  looking to check out the symphony, museums, top of the hub, Newbury street. Walking distance to great Thai food, pizza, and other comfort foods.

title: Great Hotel, Great Location
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Beyond the call of duty
review: We stayed here a while ago now but I remember it being in a really good location, we walked all over Boston from this hotel and it was a breeze.  The staff were very friendly and the rooms were comfortable, clean and we slept really well.  Would definitely consider staying here again for future visits.

title: Great Hotel!
review: Dear Melissa,  Thank you for taking the time to review your most recent stay at the Hilton Boston Back Bay. Providing positive and memorable experiences for our guests is the reason for our success along with our excellent location. Thank you for taking the time and effort to share your experience at our property with you. We hope you will stay with us on your next visit to our beautiful city and take full advantage of our prime location.  It would be our pleasure to welcome you back.  Warm Regards, Dominique Marty General Manager

title: Home away from Home
review: I was in Boston for business. The front desk was most pleasant. After the first day of walking over 13 miles, the front desk saw how exhausted my room mate and I were and they gave us each a drink voucher. The next day I had a very bad fall down a flight of stairs in the T. The front desk let me back in my room even though I had already checked out and Vernon, the very sweet doorman, gave me a big bag of ice to put on my hurt leg.  The hotel was going through construction but is was unnoticed because of the staffs attention to the guests.

title: Memorable
review: I have stayed here several times in the past few months. The rooms are newly renovated (except for the bathtub which has older off white tile that does not go at all with the rest of the modern, dark, sleek room and is my only complaint). Everything is very clean, beds are comfortable, and the rooms are extremely quiet.  Every staff member we have interacted with has been fantastic and helpful. I left a shoe in my room and when I went back for it the man at the front desk searched for it himself until it was found, which I appreciated! We are gold HHonors members and have had access to the lounge with snacks and drinks and that's also very nice. As of late February, the lobby is still being renovated so there isn't anywhere to really sit or hang out but I'm looking forward to…

title: Friendly staff, great location
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Easy Access to Music Schools.
review: We really enjoyed our stay here. We were in Boston for a long weekend. From the minute we called to request early check in staff was wonderful and accommodating. We stayed during January when it was pretty cold, but this location is so convenient, within walking distance from many of our destinations.

title: City Centre Hotel with warm staff
review: Spent the weekend in Boston and loved the location of Back Bay Hilton.  The rooms were decent size and beds were very comfortable.  The rooms have a refrigerator but no microwave and the refrigerators have no freezer for ice packs and frozen foods which is difficult if you are packing food for food allergies.  We toured Berklee and New England Conservatory and both schools were within walking distance.  Very close to Train stations etc.  Will be visiting again and Back Bay will be on our list.

title: brand new after renovations
review: Great location for a hotel in Boston as we were able to walk about quite easily and take in the street charm. Now finishing a renovation at the Hilton, our room was rather nice. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet, the club lounge next door to the main dining room, and the bar. The check in was excellent experience by the reception staff and bellman/doorman. The breakfast staff was most friendly and helpful, warmer than many. The bar staff are really good, so friendly and welcoming. A well managed hotel with good people, in a good location and now renovated. If you enjoy food experiences you must visit Eataly, a short walk through the mall. Also the tourist site seeing bus stop is opposite at the Sheraton just steps away.

title: Avoid if you are Business traveller, Go for it if a tourist
review: the rooms are brand new and modern looking. it has a dark/black/moody theme which is very modern. Everything is brand new (except the phone lol).  the service was excellent.  as of now, the lobby is still being renovated so there is no lobby to relax in.  highly recommend this hotel.

title: Wife’s Birthday Weekend in Boston
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Director
review: Came down to the big city for the weekend to take my wife out for some retail therapy and dinner. Picked this hotel for the location. It’s right in the middle of everything and easy access to Copley, Prudential Center, Fenway, and all kinds of restaurants and shops. Our room was on the 26th floor and had a great view!

title: Great location and friendly staff
review: Robin,  Thank you for taking the time to review your most recent stay with us. Providing positive and memorable experiences for our guests is the reason for our success along with our excellent location. Thank you for taking the time and effort to share your experience at our property with you. We hope you will stay with us on your next visit to our beautiful city and take full advantage of our prime location.  It would be our pleasure to welcome you back.  Warm Regards, Dominique Marty General Manager

title: Great Location. Great Rate.
review: Hotel room was very nice...  Lobby had a ton of renovations going on that made for a less than awe inspiring impression, but I can understand this.  What I can't understand is their parking garage elevator being broken for all 3 days I stayed. I could understand one day, but three days waking up and done flights and flights of stairs for three days is entirely  unacceptable for a hotel brand like Hilton.  I can't wait to wake up tomorrow morning at 5 00am to walk up yet another dozen flights of stairs to get to the airport for an early flight- ugh!  Again, the superior corner room 2305 is great, but the overall experience has been miserable!

title: Great place to stay in Boston
review: William K,   Thank you for your review of the Hilton Boston Back Bay.  We always appreciate guest feedback and continuously take comments into consideration as we strive to improve our guest service experience. Secondly, we would like to apologize for the issues you encountered in regards to the elevator in the parking garage.  This review has been brought to the attention of our Director of Engineering, and he has addressed this with the entire team. We would love to have the opportunity to make it right for you. It is important that we accommodate all your needs and welcome you to stay with us again.  Warm Regards, Dominique Marty General Manager

title: Meh.  Room for improvement.
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: You Want to Stay Here!
review: Took my son and a friend to Boston for a weekend early last month.  I stayed at the Hilton Back Bay because the price was right and it was a convenient location for what we wanted to do. The room itself was very dark as the carpet and furnishings are all dark grey so it made for a dismal spot on what turned out to be a bitter cold, sunless weekend. I didn’t care for the decor as it felt cold. (Oddly enoug it was very warm in the room and no amount of fiddling with the thermostat helped.  I called the front desk and was told to open a window.). There are also excellent blackout curtains in the room.   We had dinner at the hotel restaurant on Friday.  The food was less than memorable, overpriced and the service was lacking. There are plenty of other places in the area to eat. One…

title: Best overnight stay!!!
review: Dear Christine D,   Thank you for taking the time to review your most recent stay at the Hilton Boston Back Bay. We understand your dining experience at our restaurant did not exceed your expectations and would like to apologize for the poor service. Our Director of Food & Beverage is reviewing your comments with the chef to ensure that our culinary and restaurant team are aware and strive to avoid such issues from arising. We would love to welcome you back and hope you will visit our restaurant again so that we have the opportunity to exceed your expectations.  Warm Regards, Dominique Marty General Manager

title: Service Excellence
review: I was in Boston for a weekend to attend an event, and found a great rate on a room at the Hilton in Back Bay. I was not disappointed in the hotel!   The staff were extremely helpful, from check-in, to recommendations on local restaurants and answering questions, to check-out. The hotel overall was very clean, even with renovation taking place in the lobby and on certain floors. I had a "king superior" room, which was clean, roomy, and had a great view of Boston on the 21st floor. The bed was comfortable. The housekeeping was excellent.   It is located very close to Prudential Center, so you will find no shortage of restaurants, shops, and tourist attractions within walking distance. There is convenient access to the "T" within a couple of blocks, making it easily accessible …

title: Poor housekeeping/Maintenance
review: Dear Drew F,   Thank you for taking the time to review your most recent stay at the Hilton Boston Back Bay here on Tripadvisor. It is always our goal to create memorable experiences for our guests. We greatly appreciate such high praise as well as your choice to stay at our hotel.  We are looking forward to your next visit when we will have the opportunity to build on the trust and loyalty that we have with you.  Warm Regards, Dominique Marty General Manager

title: Good location, average stay
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: honor thy mistake
review: This hotel is in a good location close to Symphony Hall, Christian Science Reading Room, Mary Baker Eddy library (which features a cool mapparium), and only a short 10-15 minutes walk to Fenway Park.   The hotel seems to be undergoing some serious construction right now, so be aware that things may not look as you would expect when you walk in.   I had an average stay at this hotel. Front desk staff was cordial, got upgraded to a room with a view for being a diamond member, and enjoyed a few complimentary snacks in the executive lounge. I did find the gym to be exceptional as it was much larger than other hotel gyms I have stayed at. Multiple cardio machines (~6 treadmills, 2 ellipticals) so there was no waiting to get my workout in. Additionally, there was a large weight…

title: Almost a 10
review: Dear Emily I,   We are thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your stay here at the Hilton Boston Back Bay and the convenience our location afforded you.  Providing positive and memorable experiences for our guests is the reason for our success along with our excellent location. Thank you for taking the time and effort to share your experience at our property with you. We are glad to hear that you enjoyed using our fitness center. We hope your travels will bring you back to the Hilton Boston Back Bay soon.   Warm Regards, Dominique Marty General Manager

title: Great location
review: without admitting the manager sent me a check for items i left for pick up that got lost.  It took several emails and phone calls but at the end of the day the manager sent me a check for the items i left at the front desk for pick up.  that is great customer service. i was there for the boston marathon.  i forgot my ipod and asked that they check and they were abrupt that nothing was left in the room.  I tried to explain giving exactly where the ipod would be that it fell on the side of the bed but culdnt make them take a second look. so the check was a consolation. :( disappointed, frustrated, and annoyed.

title: I am worried about the substance I found on my nightstand! see pics
review: Dear Marissa D,   Thank you for taking the time to review your experience at the Hilton Boston Back Bay. We always appreciate guest feedback and continuously take comments into consideration as we strive to improve our guest service experience.  It is important that we accommodate all your needs and would love for you to stay with us again so we can make it right and your next review on us will be 5 stars.  Warm Regards, Dominique Marty General Manager

title: Great place to stay
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. In nice weather, restaurant patio seating is packed with Bostonians and tourists alike soaking up the sunshine and enjoying the food. Commonwealth Ave offers a beautiful stroll down residential tree-lined streets. Keep walking towards the Charles River and enjoy a beautiful view by the water. In warmer months, people run and bike on paths running along the esplanade, and sail and kayak on the Charles River. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Clean and Modern, with a Few Weird Quirks
review: The Hilton Back Bay in Boston’s is a great place to stay. It is located very close to Fenway Park as well as several historic locations. Everyone was very friendly! We will definitely be back. The restaurant inside the hotel was very good and the service was great!

title: Two Excellent Stays!
review: The hotel is still undergoing renovations as of January 20, 2018, but that only a minor drawback.  The staff here is very helpful, friendly and knowledgable.  The newly renovated rooms are very modern and well-designed.  Strong WiFi in the rooms, and very nice amenities overall.  It's a very comfortable hotel.  The fitness center also has very up-to-date and varied equipment, although it was a shame that the WiFi didn't work there.  My biggest complaint were some of the random quirks that annoyed me - specifically in the bathroom.  The water pressure was outrageous.  Most hotels, I'm lucky to get something above a trickle in the shower, but this was the exact opposite problem.  I felt like I was being power-washed, and the water almost felt like sharp knives sometimes.  And the…

title: Modern and Welcoming
review: I can't say enough great things about this hotel!  From stepping onto the property (great location!) with the bellhops, the front desk, the lovely maids, the breakfast crew, and the appetizer afternoon crew.  Everyone was respectful and awesome, who treated me and my son so well, we felt special.  I haven't had that experience in a long, long, time.  Had a great view of the BSO and CSM buildings.  WiFi was perfect on the 18th floor.  Construction work going on at the front desk area, but, this was never an inconveniece.  Never heard a thing in the Diamond Lounge or upstairs. Prudential Center is literally across the narrow street. What a bonus in the cold weather!!  Went to the BSO two nights, since it's only two blocks away, took the Green Line to the MFA and Isabella…

title: Clean and Comfortable
review: Dear MRS62,   Thank you for taking the time to review your most recent stay at the Hilton Boston Back Bay. Our staff will be pleased to know that you enjoyed the service they provided. We greatly appreciate such high praise as well as your choice to stay at our hotel.  We are thrilled to hear how much you loved our location! We are looking forward to your next visit when we will have the opportunity to build on the trust and loyalty that we have with you.   Warm Regards, Dominique Marty  General Manager

title: Decent hotel in prime location
review: I was here as part of a package trip the hotel itself is being renovated so in the lobby there is a section boarded off with the sounds of drills and hammering all day long but when its finished it should look great. My room 1405 was located on the 14th floor with city view the room is very spacious with an on suite bathroom the wifi is alright the staff were all polite and friendly

title: So Grateful!!!
review: Dear Eddie020173,  Thank you for taking the time to review your stay at the Hilton Boston Back Bay. We always appreciate guest feedback and continuously take comments into consideration as we strive to improve our guest service experience.  It is important that we accommodate all your needs and would love for you to stay with us again so we can make it right and your next review on us will be 5 stars.  Warm Regards, Dominique Marty General Manager

title: One disappointment after another at Hilton Boston Back Bay
review: This hotel had a great location, walking distance to many tourist attractions as well as close to numerous bars and restaurants.  The hotel had a nice fitness center with updated equipment, the rooms were upgraded as well.  My one complaint and I know this is a general complaint most people have with Boston hotels, the rooms were literally the smallest rooms I've ever stayed in, and I've stayed in rooms in Europe which are known for small rooms.  The room was at the end of the hall and had the weirdest set up, you had no place for your luggage and you had to crawl over your stuff to get to the bed, and this was actually one of their larger rooms.  I should have been tipped off when I heard a couple come down at check in and complain about how their room was far too small and…

title: Satisfied Guests
review: Dear U6544CQjenniferg,   Thank you for taking the time to review your stay at the Hilton Boston Back Bay.  We always appreciate guest feedback and continuously take comments into consideration as we strive to improve our guest service experience.  It is important that we accommodate all your needs and would love for you to stay with us again so we can make it right and your next review on us will be 5 stars. title: Exceptional staff and views
review: Great panoramic view room. The staff was extremely helpful. The steak in the restaurant was amazing and my waiter was very kind. My Only complaint would be the renovation in the lobby. It’s inevitable I know , as every property does it to improve. I just wish I wasn’t there for it .

title: Great value for money
review: Dear E2504NOmichaelm,   Thank you for taking the time to review your stay at the Hilton Boston Back Bay.  We always appreciate guest feedback and continuously take comments into consideration as we strive to improve our guest service experience.  It is important that we accommodate all your needs and would love for you to stay with us again so we can make it right and your next review on us will be 5 stars.   Warm Regards, Dominique Marty General Manager

title: Affordable luxury stay in the heart of Boston
review: The property is undergoing renovations in the lobby currently but the noise is kept very minimal.  The rooms have been renovated and look very nice, dark interiors that are modern and clean.  The views of the Charles are really nice and from the higher floors you can see out to BU, NU, South End and such.  The Exec Lounge is located on the first floor and is small but well stocked.  Warm evening snacks are a nice touch and the staff in the lounge are friendly and keep it very clean (even with lots of children in for breakfast I noticed).  40 Dalton has a good restaurant vibe and nice bar with fresh made chips to snack on with your drinks.     The front desk is helpful (Amber is the best she is super nice and friendly!) and they ensure your stay is peaceful and friendly.  I…

title: Outstanding service
review: The check in and out procedure we was seamless and staff were quick to react our feedback. For example, they instantly gave us the water when the housekeeping missed it. Overall experience was awesome. Great bed and great TV entertainment.   Just two points to improve. The WiFi connection can be better and a boiler should be provided for warm water.

title: Room with a view, recent renovation

title: Great stay!
review: My room had a huge window with a 20th floor view on the downtown buildings. Recently renovated, offers a nice bathroom (and a robe), huge TV screen, coffee maker and complementary WiFi. Lacks a work desk or USB ports, so it is not perfect for the business traveler. Air conditioning / heating is a bit noisy. But no noises from the street.

title: Hotel is under renovation and noise levels are high
review: Dear pieroinusa,   Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay at the Hilton Boston Back Bay. We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed the view from the 20th floor. Thank you for your feedback regarding noise and lack of USB ports. We strive to improve your experience at the property. It is important that we accommodate all your needs and would love for you to stay with us again so we can make it right and your next review on us will be 5 stars.  Warm Regards, Dominique Marty General Manager

title: The feeling of luxury
review: This was not my first time staying here. I come back for a reason. This is without a doubt one of my favorite hotels! Service is great, check in is great. They are all so willing to help and make you feel comfortable during your stay!

title: Close to Metro
review: Dear kathrynsZ6353GC,  Thank you for taking the time to review your stay at the Hilton Boston Back Bay. We were thrilled to welcome you back to our property. The team will be delighted to hear that you appreciated the service they provided. We hope to welcome you back to the hotel in the near future! We appreciate your loyalty to the hotel and the brand.   Warm Regards, Dominique Marty General Manager

title: Avoid: Very Poor WiFi. Disappointing stay.
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Never Again.
review: Just finished a two nights stay with family. Had two rooms; one on the 21st and the other on the 23rd floor. Rooms were nice with great views.  Lobby is extremely noisy because of major construction.  Hotel staff were friendly.  Most importantly, the WiFi coverage was just terrible; slower than dial up if it was there. Complained to front desk but nothing happened. Verizon LTE coverage was also weak. Boston had record low temperatures during our stay. So being forced to spend time indoors without WiFi made our stay less than enjoyable.  As a HHonors Gold, this was a deeply disappointing stay at this Hilton property.

title: Poor followthrough
review: Dear Budhendra B,  I would like to start by saying we appreciate the time you took to rate your stay at the Hilton Boston Back Bay. I would also like to thank you for your loyalty to the Hilton Brand as a Hilton Honors Gold Member. I am sorry to hear that the WiFi coverage was not working as it normally should and for the noise during the construction hours. Our priority is to create positive, memorable, guest service experiences and strive to continue to do so through feedback provided by our guests. We hope that you will stay with us again and address any issues, concerns, or requests so that we can fully accommodate your needs and exceed your expectations.

title: Quick overnight
review: This Hilton was/is pretty much the worst Hilton I’ve ever stayed in - I’ve stayed in Holiday Inn’s nicer than this place.   Room/bathroom was nothing like what was advertised - quite aged in fact. There are renovations occurring, but that doesn’t excuse the mess.   Shower left a lot to be desired: water not so hot, and shower head was broken and would not stay in position (just pointed straight down).  So far, hotel staff has not addressed the issue.   Just book at the Sheraton across the street.    *The bed was comfortable, though.

title: Amazing Staff
review: Hello Jason G,  I would like to start by saying thank for taking the time to rate us here at the Hilton Boston Back Bay. I am sorry to read that you had issues during your stay with us back in December. I am hoping the issues were resolved when addressed with the Front Desk Staff. Our priority is to create positive, memorable, guest service experiences and strive to continue to do so through feedback provided by our guests. We hope that you will stay with us again and address any issues, concerns, or requests so that we can fully accommodate your needs and exceed your expectations. Your business and loyalty is important to us.  Thank You

title: Stayed for our Anniversary
review: Even with the renovation of their lobby ongoing, the Hilton was the perfect hotel for us. Easy to walk to great shopping either on Boylston/Newbury or Prudential Center and Copley Place. The hotel gym is very large and has a great assortment of machines. The staff was always available for assistance too.

title: No hot water
review: Dear 71susannahp,   Thank you for taking the time to rate your stay at the Hilton Boston Back Bay. Our team members are thrilled that your stay with us warranted a 5 star review from you. We look forward to the next time you stay with us in order to have the opportunity to continuing building your loyalty and trust.  Warm Regards, Dominique Marty General Manager

title: Great place to stay .. with nice rooms friendly staff and close to everything
review: We had another five-star stay at the Back Bay Hilton, this time as we celebrated our 45th anniversary on 16 December. We stay one two three times almost every year, and it just gets better. The rooms, which were already terrific, have been refurbished, and the updates are comfortable and fashionable. We had a large room with a terrific view of the Charles River and the Back Bay. The staff were friendly and welcoming, and went our of their way to make sure we were happy with our accommodations. Thanks especially to Mr. Talic, and to the front desk clerk whose name, I think, was Geisa. They helped make our stay a memorable one. We have stayed in almost every major hotel in Boston, and this is the one we always return to.

title: Boston Overnight
review: Dear ENDeav0r,   Thank you for taking the time to commend our team members for providing you with excellent guest service.  We are delighted that your recent stay at the Back Bay Hilton was one that exceeded your expectations and will be sure to commend Semir and Geisa for their efforts. They will be happy to hear that they lived our Hilton Values and culture.  We greatly appreciate your business and loyalty, and hope to welcome you again.  Warm Regards, Dominique Marty General Manager

title: Our Favorite Hotel
review: ... heat not controllable and internet service was horrible. Room was way too hot and didn’t cool off until several hours after turning off heater. Internet service was inaccessible during most of our stay after engineering tried and failed to fix it. Hotel employees were pleasant.

title: Troubled hotel in good location for convention center.
review: T9917Ytimc,   Thank you for taking the time to review your stay with us.  We appreciate the feedback you have provided and would like to apologize for the temperature of the room as well as the internet service that arose during your stay. It is most unfortunate that those issues disrupted your stay, and your stay was not positively memorable. Guest comments such as yours are important to us and have been reviewed by the Director of Engineering. Please reconsider your decision to stay at another hotel in Boston on your next stay so that we could have the opportunity to exceed your expectations.  Warm Regards, Dominique Marty General Manager

title: Pleasant Stay
review: One of the best hotels we have stayed. Best location in Boston. Close to shopping and museums -walking distance. It is lie a home away from home with very friendly Hilton staff. Thank you for being there

title: Very Disappointing
review: I’m not going to go into specific details about my stay, however this hotel is nowhere near the quality of urban Hilton’s.   As long as you get a great rate and you need to be near the convention center, that’s the only reason to stay.

title: Great Location for Visiting Boston
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Home Away From Home
review: Good location just off Boylston St. in the Back Bay.  Blocks to the T and Logan Express.  Surprisingly quiet spot, comfortable bed and a walk-in shower (I wish more hotels would have walk-in showers rather than tubs!).  The restaurant, 40 Dalton, offered a lobster frittata which was excellent.  Summer Shack and Bukowski's are both on the next block.   Right across from the Sheraton and the entrance to the Prudential Center Mall with its wide array of restaurants and shops including Eataly.  This is the perfect spot for a getaway weekend or a small conference.

title: Great location
review: This hotel and its staff are friendly, courteous, efficient, proficient in their craft of customer service and the employees we interacted with really seemed to love their jobs; it showed in their thoughtful answers to our out-of-town questions, their smiles, recommendations and professional but always warm interactions with me and our family.      We will be in Boston often as our son is now in college there. I will choose this hotel every time. And booking a bit in advance helps with the costs because Boston is a besutiful and exciting destination for every age!

title: Hilton Back Bay Poor Customer Experience
review: Great location. Rooms are clean and very nicely decorated. Executive lounge is fine - quite small, strange seating arrangements. Best to find a quiet time for breakfast - food options are adequate.    In room wifi was not very good - kept dropping out which was annoying. Staff were generally helpful.

title: Great Place in Back Bay
review: The hotel is clean and comfortable in an excellent location. However we experienced poor customer service  and therefore I would not recommend this hotel. We spent most of the time out of the hotel and minimum inside however this was my experience.  1. On arrival (I agree we did arrive 2pm and check in is not until 4pm) we were requested to return in about 45 mins and a room would be available. Returned to be told we would have to wait an hour but a room was reserved for us 9th floor (stated previously the room was not held). Returned again to be told we had a room available on the 16th floor.  2. Impolite staff  3. Requested a taxi booked for Logan airport by hotel staff . We were not advised of the extortionate fee we would have to pay. (Taxi at Logan airport to hotel was…

title: Excellent location--fairly average in other aspects
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: A pleasant haven in Boston
review: We stayed here for a convention at the beginning of December. Excellent location. Because of the convention activities we did not get to use most of the hotel's amenities so I cannot comment on them. We did not try the hotel restaurant as there are over 100 restaurants of all types within a 15-minute walk. Refreshment of our convention facilities was done well. I was quite pleased with how housekeeping refreshed our room.  Basically, an average stay in a rather nice hotel. Wi-fi was adequate as was the in-room tv. A few minuses--the hotel has no recycling wastebaskets in the room nor in the convention area. The room has the new high-pressure toilets I have come across in other hotels. Their problem is that the water level in the bowl is too high and wets body parts when you sit…

title: Delighted patron
review: Hello Scanner_Lewis,  Thank you for taking the time to rate your stay here at the Hilton Boston Back Bay. I am happy to see that you enjoyed your stay with us and that you were able to enjoy the beautiful surrounding city of Boston! I will mention the recycling to my team as we are always looking for great ideas to be more environmentally friendly. As for the toilets, I sincerely apologize and will address the problem with my engineering team so other guests do not run into this issue. We hope to see you again soon. We thank you for your loyalty and your feedback to help us improve experiences overall!   Thank You

title: Great Location
review: I had a very comfortable and enjoyable stay at the Hilton. Great location in Boston, near the Hynes, Prudential, and at walking distance to the Public Garden. I was so fortunate to get a corner room at a decent price, which was a plus. It has plenty of space and even a desk. The fridge was actually cold (not like 99.9% of minibars). Bed and tv were huge. The bed was very comfortable as well. The only downside to the room was the cardboard walls. I had a neighbor with a very dry cough that I could clearly hear a number of times, so I don't want to ponder the situation if a couple of newly-weds are staying in the next room. And my room was not even a connecting room. I had a different room first, with this (closed) double door to the next one. Good thing I asked to change it.…

title: Great business hotel....
review: Nice hotel with a super staff.  Checking in was seamless, even though it was 12:30 am. The extra items that we requested with the reservation awaited us in the room, just as requested. The king room was spacious and clean, nicely appointed & complete with a mini fridge.  We would DEFINITELY stay here again.

title: Pluses and minuses. Could improve.
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: not really for me....
review: Location is ideal for The Pru, Copley, Newbury st, etc.  Nice view of the Charles river. Front desk staff are nice and helpful.  However... for a diamond member - no bottled water offered, I had to ask about my breakfast privileges.  - no room upgrade, the city was pretty empty for night before thanksgiving. Maybe it was full, but highly doubt all suites were full. - lounge is small with minimal seating at breakfast.   Worst was the internet. It was horrendous. I had to do a speed test because I couldn’t even get my email. It was less than 1mbps. I ended using my cel as hotspot and spent 3gb during the stay.   The room was ok, did not feel old or run down.   But the room was extremely hot, even when we set temp to 60,or turn off the unit. We had to open the window to cool down. …

title: Excellent Choice In the Back Bay Area
review: The rooms are a bit tired, the staff is eager, but the front desk is severely understaffed. The room was acceptable, but just so- the smell was borderline. The fitness center is ok, and the pool a bit small. The location is great for Back Bay business, but there are much better options!

title: Bad experience at checkout
review: I spent four nights here a couple weeks ago while attending a conference at the Boston Convention Center.  The overall experience was excellent.  Price was a little high, even with conference pricing, but Boston is expensive and this is a nice part of town.  The hotel itself is kind of different in that it is shaped sort of like a triangle which creates some interesting room layouts.  I had a room on the 22nd floor with great views of Fenway park and the Charles River.  Looks like the type of room I had used to have a little walk-out balcony, but that has since been converted to a sealed glass window.  Amenities in the room were nice, a couple bottles of water were complimentary, toiletries were good quality, coffee maker included the typical set-up, and a mini-fridge was also…

title: Gorgeous
review: We booked a room for four for a convention rate, but two people had an emergency health problem and could not come.  The hotel weekend manager refused to reduce the price to the two person rate, which was $40 less.  He insisted that it was impossible to reduce the rate, that it was out of his hands.  That's a first!

title: Nice

Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Best
review: Nice views in well furnished large rooms. Diamond lounge is off the lobby which makes it a bit inconvenient but it does have freshly brewed Starbucks coffee. Helpful staff. Across from convention center.

title: Convenient and Comfortable
review: Best place in Boston. Very convenient and the staff is great.   Great place for groups!  Located next to several restaurants and a short walk to may tourist locations.  I would strongly recommend for large groups!

title: Recommended for the poll and hot tub
review: I've stayed in a number of hotels when visiting the Boston / Cambridge but this one has some nice advantages and will be my new go-to. Not sure if all the rooms have been renovated but I was on a higher floor and it was completely redone. Note, photos make the rooms look very bright but I found the decor to make the room look dark; not a big problem as it makes it easier to sleep so it was clean and comfortable. Beds were very comfortable (and I usually don't sleep great in hotels but it was as noted, a great bed.) Plenty of space, good amenities.   Service was quite good with a friendly front desk. Rooms with 000 are next to the elevator as was my room but it was actually very quiet. Starbucks in the lobby area is not a "real" Starbucks so not the full service you might expect…

title: 2nd time staying - Good but room looks old
review: Every year we stay 3 November nights in Boston on business.  At the start of the heating season, an indoor pool and hot tub are a big help with dryness!  The pool is small but attractive and comfortably warm; the hot tub was a little too hot during our stay but still we used it every day and appreciated it very much.  Room renovations are underway; we stayed in an un-renovated room which was perfectly acceptable.  Staff terrific.  Location great.  Expensive; and expensive to park a vehicle ... but so are they all in that area.

title: Conference
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. title: Great place
review: Very nice receptionists, very welcoming and knowledgeable about the area, happy to help with directions and recommendations, close to too many attractions and restaurants as well as shopping center and other shops. Room was small not what I️ expected not too many plugs to charge my stuff, I️ had to pick between my computer and phone. View from windows was disappointing ( at least my side). Starbucks closes at 2 pm !!!! So annoying I️ mean why do you even have it. All in all was good it is just not as good as The Hilton I️ know.

title: Great hotel
review: Lansi G,   We would first like to thank you for taking the time to review your stay at the Hilton Boston Back Bay. Our front desk team members will appreciate the wonderful compliments regarding the service they provided you. We also would like to apologize the disappointment you faced regarding the hours of Starbucks in our lobby. It is most unfortunate that the issue disrupted your stay, and your stay was not positively memorable. Guest comments such as yours are important to us and have been reviewed by the Director of Food and Beverage. We hope that you will stay with us again and address any issues, concerns, or requests so that we can fully accommodate your needs and exceed your expectations.  Warm Regards, Dominique Marty General Manager

title: Decent hotel, friendly staff, bit overpriced
review: Outstanding service great location. We come to Boston three times a year and we always choose HILTON. The staff is very friendly and very accommodating. The prices have gone up in the past year but concedering you are in the center of everything I think it’s a bargain

title: Location Clean & Friendly Service
review: Everything was great and it made our visit easy and stress free. The location made everything walkable. Good food nearby, Quiet and great view of sailboats on the river at dusk! Staff were very friendly and helpful, the gym and pool were great.

title: Cold shower and TV non-functioning. Terrible experience
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Very good experience
review: This was an overall terrible in-room experience.   The water in the shower was cold and warm at best in teh evening when I checked in and then again when in the am. Additionally, the TV wouldn't turn on.   Two small things that made my stay miserable. Given that all I wanted to do was shower, watch TV and go to bed I was very frustrated and it was too late to start calling for help.

title: Vacation stay
review: Stayed for a conference at Hynes convention center. Cindy helped me at the front desk. She was professional, courteous and accommodating. She gave me exactly what I was looking for and I was very happy with the room. One of the nights, I was staying, I had a severe migraine in the middle of the night. Someone from the front desk had Motrin and Tylenol at my room in minutes from the gift shop. Talk about excellent service! Would definitely stay here again on return to Boston. Very nice room, beautiful view, excellent service, what more can I ask for. I am Hilton Honors and wifi was included.

title: Caring Staff - Feels like you are home
review: All Hilton properties are extremely nice to stay at and the Boston Back Bay Hilton was no exception. Our room was large and spacious. I wish it would have had a chair in our room but that is the only complaint i have. Due to the time of year of our stay the price was a little more than i would have liked but i would definitely stay here again

title: Tiny room, Poor view, hot executive lounge,
review: The staff was very helpful and informative.  They were both very helpful, friendly, and thoughtful when dealing with my wife and children who accompanied me on my business trip.  Simple things like giving my children coloring books brings smiles to their face and was an above the expectation mark in my opinion.  After my son had to unfortunately go to the ER and we all spent one of our nights in the hospital, the staff asked about our son to ensure he was ok.  They also did everything they could to clean up our room after the accident. The concierge was also very helpful in recommending things for my wife to do and how to get around the town.  Great job!  Keep it up!

title: Nice stay and a good area of Boston
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Spacious Stay
review: We recently stayed at the Hilton Boston Back Bay and had a great experience.  The staff was welcoming and always helpful.  The pool was good, nothing special but the kids enjoyed it.  Our room was nice, modern, and clean.  The only downside was our room was a little noisy due to elevator noise but otherwise we really enjoyed our stay.

title: Comfortable and clean after renovation
review: We really enjoyed our stay at the Hilton even though it was a short stay. Check in was speedy and our room was fantastic. The room and bathroom were very spacious and housekeeping was very efficient. The fitness centre was very well equipped and the little shop at the reception was very helpful for some last minute toiletry purchases.

title: Clean, spacious, great location. Decor: 1980's mausoleum.
review: We planned a quick trip to visit family in and around Boston for two days, and this had some of the best pricing for the weekend. Close to the T, this hotel is in an eclectic community ... a block or two away from a major mall, eclectic shopping near the music college and a few blocks from the hip shopping of Newbury Street .. all within walking distance and only 5 or 6 stops on the T to the Government Center and the North End.

title: Great stay
review: On the standard criteria, this is a very nice hotel. Clean, spacious rooms. Generally pleasant staff. A perfectly adequate Diamond lounge. Great location, near to the Prudential Center and lots of shops and restaurants. There is just one problem; the recent renovation.   You will be on anti-depressant meds after staying here. The color scheme varies all the way from light gray to dark gray, with some black and white highlights. Not a hint from Roy G. Biv to break it up. I feel gloomy in this room. In addition, the furniture and fixtures are oh-so-cool to look at, but badly designed for actual use. For example, good luck finding the on-off switch on the floor lamp. It's hidden to make it more sleek and attractive. The desk chair is too low for the desk, and is not adjustable. The…

title: Nice room
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Wanted a base to see Boston
review: We stayed here for 3 nights on our first visit to Boston. Our first impressions were very good with a quick check in and the doorman was very helpful as he let us park the car at the side of the car park whilst we checked in as we had to return it to the airport that day. Our room was a fair size - we had a corner room on the 15th floor - with comfy beds and a large bathroom. Pillows were a bit strange though - quite long so when put next to each other in the bed half of them were hanging over the side! Think they must have been pillows for a king size bed and we just had a standard double so that was quite uncomfortable. The staff at the front desk were friendly enough although every time I asked a question about the area and tube trains etc I was just directed to the concierge…

title: Excellent stay
review: This hotel fit the bill. Very convenient and a nice comfortable place to stay. A bakery across the street Flour was great for breakfast etc. Beds comfortable and every thing clean. But most importantly: We met the kindest most helpful man ever. VERNON is a true gem. Made us feel welcomed and valued. He is the Bell Captain  and deserves accolades for service above and beyond

title: Really enjoyed my stay!
review: Very clean, quiet, and comfortable room. Not a lot of outside noise from the street or hallway. Lunch at 50 Dalton was delicious, had the clam chowder and a chicken sandwich. Very convenient to get to Hynes convention center.

title: Stayed with Mom and Sis for a concert at Fenway
review: EXCELLENT  location, and very comfortable hotel.   Has been redone recently.   The beds are some of the best I've experienced recently - the pillows are huge but perfectly soft.  Also a great view and my limited interaction with the concierge gets a thumbs up as well.   Pricey, like all Boston hotels!!

title: Good Location
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline.
