title: Great Location, Good Hotel
review: All staff were very friendly and helpful and it was easy to get into  the centre of Boston. The room was larger than we were expecting and was clean and well maintained.We would definitely recommend this hotel for a stay in Boston.

title: Excellent Location For Work or Play
review: My wife and I recently had a lovely 6 day stay at this hotel.  This was our 3 time to Boston but our first stay in Back Bay.  We chose this hotel based on its location and we were not disappointed by it or the hotel. We were made welcome by the lovely Cindy who decided that given our length of stay she would change our room.  We had booked a King Room with a panoramic view and ended up on the 20th floor overlooking the Sheraton and Prudential Center. The room was a good size, comfortable and very clean.  There was a sofa as well as a desk area and the requisite flat screen TV.  There are facilities to make tea and Coffee and we had 2 free bottles of water most days we were there as well. I used the pool and the gym a couple of times, both of which is adequate but having to walk…

title: Great Location
review: Stayed here for 6 nights. It's right across street from Hynes Convention Center. Lots of restaurants, shopping & a couple of grocery stores nearby within a few blocks. Area seemed very safe & walkable. We walked to Fenway, Boston Common, Berkley School of Music & more. Staff was very accomodating.  Our room was clean & bed & pillows were nice.

title: Worst Hilton I’ve Stayed In
review: Walking distance to Fenway Park, Boston Commons and all the restaurants on Boylston Street. Great staff. Wonderful Executive Lounge. Nice hot tub/pool and fitness center. Was a wonderful location for us.

title: quality hotel
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Nice hotel, good location
review: our group booked 6 rooms at Hilton Back Bay. Our rooms were very clean and comfortable, location was great, but price was high staff was friendly and accommodating, concierge was helpful within walking distance to many local attractions, and easy access to public transportation

title: Nice hotel, convenient to downtown
review: Nice hotel in a great location near the Prudential center mall and many restaurants in the Back Bay area. We used Honors points, which were a significant number of points saved over the past 15 years of which I spent thousands of dollars at Hiltons. Seems that the points were inflated compared to other hotel programs.  Otherwise, the stay was good - front desk attendee AMBER was the best - an outstanding example of a great employee.  She was full of suggestions for visiting the sites and eating at restaurants. She gave us metro "T" hints and other ideas of things to do, in fact, better and more in depth than the concierge. Room was nice, but bathroom very small.  Recommend you get on the side facing the Charles River for goof view, but expect furniture is in front of the window…

title: A Great Convention Hotel
review: Clean & comfortable. Convenient hotel to downtown. Friendly staff. Our rooms were spacious, we ended up staying an extra night due to flight delays & they were happy to accommodate in another room. Both were very nice.

title: Great location and hotel
review: We were there for a small group convention last week end and were very pleasantly surprised. It is an older property but has been recently renovated. Be sure to ask for a newly renovated room since some have not been done yet. Get higher than the 14th floor. The staff was very friendly and we were upgraded to a king room on the 24th floor with a harbor and with city view. The room was large with a good sitting area, desk, sofa,and storage space. Housekeeping was well done. The room also had nice linens and towels with many little amenities in the bathroom. Our group meeting was very well done with nice meeting spaces and very good hotel food. Would go back without hesitation.

title: Nice Staff
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Location, clean
review: Everyone I encountered was very nice and seemed intent on going above and beyond. The room was fine, and the location for a Red Sox game was perfect. My only gripe is the room service menu. I like to have breakfast in my room and there was nothing I was remotely interested in. Simple bacon and eggs would have been fine. The restaurant downstairs offered a great variety  and was very good.

title: Worst experience ever - Rude staff, rowdy guests
review: We enjoyed staying here.  The location is great.  The room was a nice size.  The bathroom was a great size and had enough counter space for storage.  I loved the walk-in shower and sliding glass doors. It was very clean.  I liked the fact that the garage was park yourself and not valet.

title: Hilton Back bay
review: I was awoken in the middle of the night by a rowdy and lewd group of men who were slamming doors and loudly bragging oustide my door (in a racist way) about how much money they had spent on prostitutes.  Prostitute arrived and "activities" ensued.  I called the front desk to investigate, then called again to change my room in the middle of the night.  I missed half of my business meeting the next day. Hotel manager says "we can't control what our guests do in their rooms" and claimed the other guests were "good customers" and "denied it happened" and then asked me "are you expecting some sort of compensation?".... well, it should have just been offered in my opinion.  I am and will continue to be traumatized by this event, and I am shocked by how little sympathy was shown on the…

title: Excellent central location
review: Overall a very nice and well put together hotel. We stayed in one of the renovated rooms so I cant speak to any other room. For gold and diamond members you get access to a special lounge that has soft drinks ,water,  and chips.

title: Friendly atmosphere and good accomodation
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Great location!
review: Room was roomy and clean, curtains ensured a dark room, breakfast was good and the service excellent.  Accessibility to Convention Center is excellent, and other areas in Boston very accessible.  Bar staff is friendly and service is quick.

title: Good choice in Back Bay
review: Stayed here while visiting my daughter. Great location, very close to Newbury St. the hotel is  clean with really nice, helpful staff. The rooms were a great size and very comfortable! We will definitely stay here again!

title: Staffing, lighting, design problems
review: All of the staff was pleasant and professional and our corner room had been recently renovated. Our room on the 22nd floor was very quiet which even on upper floors isn't always true in large cities. Since parking in Boston can be expensive, it was nice that there was metered parking which becomes free parking on Sunday's.

title: convenient hotel to most of the interesting sites in boston
review: I stayed here for 5 nights while going to a conference at the Hynes Convention Center across the street. Certainly, this hotel's location is convenient for Hynes & Fenway Park. When I checked in, I showed by Diamond HHonors card (and it was on my reservation), but the person checking me in didn't acknowledge it or even give me my breakfast vouchers. When I realized it and came down later, the person who gave me the vouchers suggested that I would best upgrade since the breakfasts in the lounge "has only cold stuff like bagels." This was factually incorrect. Actually, the breakfasts in the lounge were warm and quite nice. Also, I'm supposed to get upgraded rooms as a Diamond member but was given a room on the 17th floor out of 26, and had to pay extra just for a peek-a-boo…

title: Close to Hynes Convention
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Modern and clean
review: Across the street from the Hynes Convention Center and a short walk to Fenway Park. Courteous staff and good breakfast. A little pricy for what you get. The Sharaton across the street was much nicer in the lobby area and much cheaper.

title: Leisure Stay
review: I like the modern rooms and huge TV! Very clean, great service. When I first flushed the toilet water gushed out of the tank. I called and it wasn't 5 minutes when a repairman responded and swiftly fixed it.

title: Fantastic view from freshly updated room
review: A great value for price of the room.  Our room had been recently renovated and was beautiful. The only comment is the light around the bathroom mirror was too bright.  I think the breakfast buffet was a little over priced.  The entire hotel staff was friendly, courteous and professional.  They went above and beyond!!!

title: Over night stay for Red Sox game.
review: Loved the hotel. Hidden on Dalton Street but so close to everything. Staff was fantastic. Friendly and helpful. We were on 20th floor and had a beautiful view of south Boston. Our room was spotless. Chocolates on our pillows. Easy checkin. Nice lobby with comfy seats to hang out and talk.

title: Another great stay
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Nice and convenient to Back Bay/Copley Square
review: The Hilton Back Bay has become my home away from home while in Boston.   The he staff goes above and beyond to make sure I am happy and comfortable.  The rooms are spacious and modern. The location is perfect for a walk to Fenway or a trip to Newberry to shop.  The bar and resturant are fun and everyone is so nice. I love this hotel and wouldn't stay anywhere else whilenin Boston!

title: Labor Day vacation
review: Very convenient, quiet hotel with up to date adequately furnished rooms.  Large TVs. Not all channels HD however.  Cover the toilet or you may get a wet air blast.  Those don't work well.  Reasonable restaurant and great complimentary breakfast for some.

title: Great location, nice hotel, great service
review: Great experience overall. Will come back every year and will recommend Hilton to others .During Hurricane Irma Sameer was very helpful in finding us a hotel for that night since they were fully booked. Then he had a room ready for us to stay till we were ready to leave for Florida. The whole staff is amazing . The only thing I will suggest is to have the Starbucks stay open till late.

title: Location, Location, Location
review: Great location for attending a Red Sox game at Fenway.  It is a short walk to the ball park.  Avoiding parking and traffic was a huge plus.  There are a lot of things to see nearby, plus it is a short ride or walk to the freedom trail and many historical sites in Boston.  The rooms were comfortable and clean.  The staff was friendly.

title: Boston Center City First Class Hotel
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Hilton Back Bay - BOSTON
review: One of best Hiltons that I have ever stayed in. Very centrally located and excellent friendly and courteous staff. In particular, Samir and other front desk staff were knowledgeable, courteous and always helpful. Samir is a gem. In Diamond Lounge, Maria and Claudia were outstanding examples of attentive service.

title: Few days in Boston
review: The Hotel is very nice and located in a good location close to all attractions. It is walking distance to Fenway Park, which was one of the reasons we stayed hear. There is also a stop for the ON/OFF Tourist Bus across the street. It is in close proximity to the Prudential BLDG and we enjoyed the Top Of the Hub for panoramic views and drinks.

title: Vernon Wonderful
review: I've got to say this Hilton is above average,its excellent as you would expect it's ideally located for a few days brake in this lovely city. You are located in the middle of the new part of Boston. ..

title: Boston stay
review: The bellman, Vernon, was awesome. He answered numerous questions for us over our weekend stay. Such a nice professional man. His suggestions of the area were "spot on". We would definitely visit this area again.

title: Good location, nice room!
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Great location
review: The room was a really nice size, very clean! Good location with great restaurants and shops within walking distance! Staff was helpful and courteous. I had no issues or problems with or during my stay!

title: Lovely
review: The Hilton Back Bay is within easy walking distance of Newbery Street offering a great value.  I would recommend asking for one of the upper floors (10 and above) because they have been recently renovated and updated.

title: Always a welcomed stay.
review: Great room size, nice amenities, wonderful housekeeping staff. Definitely will return back soon. Loved the city and nightlife. Very close to everything. Breakfast was amazing as well. Usually don’t witness review but I enjoyed his one.

title: Hilton Back Bay Rocks!
review: Quality and attentiveness are always A++ when we stay at this Hilton Boston Back-Bay.  Location is ideal for Berklee College of Music or Boston Conservatory families.  Clean rooms, Good value great location.  Will definitely stay there again.

title: Comfortable Hotel in Back Back Close to Colleges
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. In nice weather, restaurant patio seating is packed with Bostonians and tourists alike soaking up the sunshine and enjoying the food. Commonwealth Ave offers a beautiful stroll down residential tree-lined streets. Keep walking towards the Charles River and enjoy a beautiful view by the water. In warmer months, people run and bike on paths running along the esplanade, and sail and kayak on the Charles River. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Great Visit!
review: My wife, daughter and I stayed at this hotel for several nights over Labor Day weekend while moving my son into Northeastern University.  It is a relatively short walk or very short cab ride from the Hilton Back Back to the dorms at Northeastern.   The rooms are upgraded and modern with comfortable beds and a large, flat screen TV.    The bathroom is very nice with luxury features, plush towels and good water pressure.  The only downsides to the bathroom were a toilet that splashes onto the seat when you flush it and, a blinding light on the mirror above the sink (see photo).  You would need eclipse glasses to look straight at it! My wife saw rings for a long time after looking at it and had to shut the light while in the bathroom!  The hotel staff was very accommodating and…

title: Hilton Back Bay
review: I stayed at this hotel for the first time (I tend to stay closer to the North End) and was really pleased with my experience. We arrived early and they held our bags and offered to call or text me when the rooms were ready. I asked them to text me but never received a text; I stopped back at the hotel around 3:40 to inquire if the rooms were ready and they were.   I had done the e-check in for both of my rooms and found 1 room was located on a higher floor with an upgraded view although they never told me they had upgraded the room, I kind of just figured it out for myself. I wish they had mentioned it so I could have properly thanked the desk for their kind gesture.  The rooms were spacious, modern and overall very clean. 2 of my pillowcases were a little dirty so I didn't use…

title: GREAT HOTEL & STAFF IS VERY HELPFUL
review: Hotel was great and very convenient to Berklee where my son was attending for the first time.  Would definitely stay there again when I visit him in the future.  Close to college, trains, buses and restaurants.  Easy to get downtown for shopping etc.

title: Great location
review: As, many you have a lot of Options for Boston. If you plan to attend a Red-Sox game this is certainly the place to stay. If you like night life, I would suggest closer to the Harbor or North End however, Uber was very fast and convenient and $8-$12 ride to North End. Room was Spectacular over looking Fenway and the River. First time to Boston and the Hotel and Staff made it well worth it. We could not ask for a better experience!

title: Fenway Trip
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Convenient
review: Hotel was very nice and in a good location.  Only issue was that bar closed early so barely had time to get something to eat or enjoy a drink after the games.  Staff were friendly and room was comfortable.

title: Fenway friendly
review: Stayed here recently for a conference at the Hynes,  The hotel is convenient for visiting the Back Bay / Copley Section of Boston and is within walking distance to Fenway to the West, and the downtown area to the East.  Our room was small and awkwardly shaped with very little space in the bedroom but a huge bathroom.  It was an accessible room (we weren't told that in advance) so the closet hanger bar went across the middle of the closet and not the top, and the tub/shower only had a handheld sprayer.  Free Wifi was ok.  There's a Starbucks in the lobby but it's poorly stocked and closes after breakfast.  A block away there are lots of restaurants.  I'd stay here for business, but I'd probably look elsewhere if visiting as a tourist.

title: Very good
review: Booked this hotel because it was near Fenway and it was a great location The staff was great and the hotel room was fine. I wish they had a USB port as I need to charge to things and only had 1 plug. I know many hotels have that now so just don't expect it. The only issue was the parking. I am not sure if this is common since I didn't see any reviews stating it but the hotel lot is a public lit that gets filled if there is anything going on in the area so when we arrived to check in the lot was full. We were told to see if we could find a spot on the street which of could there was none. Fortunately another guest was leaving and gave us her spot. The front desk was very apologetic and waived the fee but it was not a good start. This is the one thing that really needs improvement…

title: Nice Hotel 10 Minutes from Green Line Metro and Fenway Park
review: Location was great, room was spotless, and all the staff were exceptional. Easy 5 min walk to Prudential Tower for drinks at The Top of The Hub, shopping on Newbury and 10 min to Fenway. I couldnt give 5 stars because the bath was small. I'll definitely stay there again and I recommend to family and friends!

title: Good location
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Great stay
review: Wonderful location. Easy access to convention centre, numerous restaurants nearby, happening area. Overall good. I liked the fitness cantre. It has nice and good gym equipment with fresh towels, headphones and Toilet. Moreover it has a pool.

title: Diamond Executive Lounge Was a Nice Surprise
review: I had a fantastic stay at this property. This great hotel with amazing friendly and engaging staff! If you are trying to be located walking distance to downtown and back bay this is a perfect Location!

title: Boston vacation
review: We are thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your stay here at the Hilton Boston Back Bay and the convenience our location afforded you.  Providing positive and memorable experiences for our guests is the reason for our success along with our excellent location. Thank you for taking the time and effort to share your experience at our property with you. We hope you will stay with us on your next visit to our beautiful city and take full advantage of our prime location.  It would be our pleasure to welcome you back.  Warm Regards, Dominique Marty General Manager

title: Good size room expensive
review: My spouse and I stayed at the Hilton Boston Back Bay for three nights in late May 2017. We booked our stay online months prior using the Hilton website. As our stay approached, we received an email promotion for a reduced rate on one of the nights of our stay, so we edited our reservation online; however, when we checked out, our booking had not been updated to reflect that promotion, so the manager refunded the difference with a manual credit.  As its name implies, the Hilton is located in the Back Bay neighborhood of Boston, near Boylston and Newbury Streets, and close to Hynes Convention Center, Prudential Center, Coplay Place Mall, Berklee College of Music, and the Boston Public Library. We chose to stay at this hotel because we planned to walk from the Hilton to the…

title: Not impressed for families... and here's why...
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Great Hotel!!
review: Hilton Back Bay is a great location, only a half mile from Fenway and in a safe, good neighborhood.  It's across the street from a great mall with great food options, and within walking distance to many quintessential Boston neighborhoods and spots.  In addition, it seems to have recently had a re-model, which made it look trendy and cool.  Our floor had a black & silver theme (each seemed to be different), and was very modern.  Service was very good and there's even lime- and orange- flavored water in the lobby to enjoy.  So here's why it's 3 stars and not 5-- our $330/night room came with 2 double beds instead of 2 queens-- seriously?  They just did a giant remodel, and didn't think to put 2 queen beds in??  There was plenty of room to do so.  Even one queen, one double is…

title: We loved the Hilton Boston Back Bay
review: We would first like to thank you for taking the time and effort to write a review about your stay with us. Your comments provide us with valuable feedback that we take into consideration in order to provide an exceptional guest service experience. On that note, we would like to sincerely apologize for failing to exceed your expectations during your stay. It is very important to us that we continuously uphold our Hilton Values and culture, and we regrettably did not do so. We hope that you will visit us again so that we have the opportunity to make it right for you and create a positive, memorable stay.  Warm Regards, Dominique Marty General Manager

title: Great back bay hotel!
review: I stayed here with a friend whose son was completing a 5 week summer program at Berkley.  It is a wonderful hotel!  Not only is it clean and modern, the staff is exceptionally nice and helpful.  The location is wonderful also.  I will definitely stay here again when traveling to Boston and highly recommend it!  The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful in answering all of the questions we had.

title: Pricey but great location and room
review: Simply, we had the most wonderful time in Boston, due in no small part to our stay at the Hilton Boston Back Bay.  Every interaction we had with their staff was a complete pleasure.  My initial experience with their staff was a call I placed prior to our arrival to assure that we would not have any trouble with an extremely late arrival on Friday, Aug. 4 (we didn't arrive to the hotel until close to 3 a.m.).    I spoke with Samir Talic (I will probably mispell names here, so I hope you know to whom I'm referrring) that day and he was great!  Kind, professional and he assured me we would have a terrific room.  We were given a corner room on the 23rd floor and it was terrific - such a marvelous view and so spacious. It truly helped to make our visit a happy and memorable one.   I…

title: Comfortable and great location!
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: For those with good eyesight
review: Hilton as expected, rich, good quality, and comfortable. Great location, near the prudential center (commercial center) and accommodating staff. Great fitness center with a pleasant sun deck. A pool for kids as well!

title: Good location for Fenway
review: The room we had was spacious, but the dark (ie, black) wall coverings and paint and the lack of adequate lighting made the room a little cave-like after sundown and before sun-up. Maybe this is romantic? Or good for looking at your cell phone non-stop? Not sure. Anyway, there is good task lighting at the nightstand and desk but lacked good overhead light (eg, for packing). Otherwise, a great, well-located hotel. Skip the car-- just walk, Uber/Lyft, or take the T to where you'd like to go. We walked down to the Esplanade and ran along the Charles at sunset, which was lovely and invigorating after a day of travel.

title: comfort and good service
review: We chose this hotel for its walking distance to Fenway. We walked to and from the game with no issue. It is also close to the T that quickly takes you into downtown. In a standard double room, the room is spacious and comfortable but the bathroom is small.

title: Comfortable!! Convenient!! Clean!!
review: was 2 days in this hotel for  conventio0n and we had a good service. my room was large clean and quite. the multilingual staff was friendly and the restaurant offer a reach menu. i enjoyed my stay and would return here also for leisure

title: A pleasant return stay
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Back Bay Vaca fun
review: This was the second time that we stayed for a conference in the Boston area. We made a point of returning due to the last stay and were not disappointed with our decision. We were disappointed with the original rate that we had secured and kept an eye on rates and were able to lock in a rate close to $80 less expensive than originally booked. The staff was excellent in accommodating several requests. The room was clean and comfortable and the housekeeping staff went above and beyond To have the room in top shape when we returned daily. Commendations to the staff from management to the doormen.

title: Good location next to the Hynes Center
review: We stayed at the Hilton Back Bay due to its location to several of the colleges we scheduled visits at for our son. Best decision we could have made. The staff was great. Attentive, friendly, helpful. We will be back.

title: Central, nice pool, decent rooms, close to the T
review: Was in town for a conference and the conference hotel was booked up. I was able to get a room at the Hilton for a very reasonable price. Although not attached to the Hynes Center, it is directly across the street and you can walk out and within fifty paces be inside the Sheraton and up the escalator going towards the convention hall. The room was very good, up to Hilton standards. The hotel itself has a good bar and restaurant downstairs.  TIP: just across the restaurant is a bakery and breakfast joint called Flour. Check it out. Very good.

title: Awesome hotel
review: I stayed here with my niece (9 years old) for 2 nights.  She loved the pool and hot tub.  I liked it because it was central and really close to multiple T stops so you can take any of the green line trains and get within a few blocks.  It wasn't really anything special as far as the room, pretty basic.  In fact, we stayed at a Hilton Garden the night before and I think our room there was actually nicer.  If you can get a good rate on this hotel I think its worth it.

title: Okay, but just average
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: City Centre
review: Too expensive for what you get.  The room was okay, but double beds aren't the same as queens.  Location is good for Fenway Park, but not much else.  Taxi ride to downtown is $15.00 each way.  Restaurant seemed to never be open when we were ready to eat.  What happened to hotel restaurants being open all day for their guest who are travelling on different schedules?

title: Disappointed with this Hilton
review: Great location.  Lovely spacious room, coffee, fridge, safe, good en suite.  Breakfast was good at the hotel - worth the $26 each.  At first you think the hotel is quite far from Boston Common and the centre but it is very walkable up through the Public Gardens and Boylston.  Super desk staff - Jess was so friendly and helpful and 'S.....'  I've forgotten his  name, the front desk manager was super and got us some Red Sox tickets.  Thanks.  Places to eat and drink very close as well.  Great shopping centre - Prudential.

title: Superb hotel in a great area
review: The good news:  it was a perfect location for me, close to the Prudential center and Newbury street shopping. The front desk staff are very friendly; the doorman who has been there for 33 years is THE BEST!  I called in advance to get a complimentary upgrade to my room and they put me on the top floor which was allegedly recently renovated.  The issues:  the renovated floors need work.  there were issues with paint on doors, and they are VERY DARK in decor.  weird.  The hotel has the executive hilton concierge room, on the lobby level; but they don't serve any beer/wine/liquor.. I was told this was due to Massachusetts law?  Never heard that before.  So you have to goto the bar across the hall and get drinks and bring them back to the concierge room. But that is a challenge…

title: Kind and Accomodating
review: The Hilton Boston Back Bay was perfect in almost every area.  The location is incredible, close to transit and is walking distance from many attractions.  Clean, exception service.  Concierge, Charles, was incredible!  He was so helpful and knowledgeable of the area including attractions, transit advice, and the restaurants he recommended were amazing.  He totally made our trip beyond our expectations!  The staff at the front desk were also helpful and friendly.  The only downfall were the quality of the mattresses; way too soft but everything else was perfect!

title: Fenway and Downtown Boston District Convenience
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Great location and helpful staff
review: Great location with full services, friendly staff, upscale facility includes bar , restaurants and Starbucks, on site easy parking. The property is roughly 0.3 Mile from Fenway Park, Newbury Street shopping ,restaurants and bars. Most rooms offer an excellent view of the Boston city skyline. Whether walking to city parks, attractions , cab or the T line it is easy centrally located. Breakfast was terrific, rooms well appointed and clean. The facility met or exceeded our requirements so I would recommend staying there as I have recommended to friends already. The staff aimed to please and helpful too.

title: No Working Wifi
review: My family and I stayed in this hotel for two nights and we were not disappointed.  I am giving an average rating due to the cramp bathroom, lacked of working electrical outlets, and damp feeling carpet. Perhaps the carpet had been cleaned? It was just strange.  The bathroom was so tight - with minimal space between the toilet and tub. I don't need a ton of room, but this was excessively small.  And, there were working outlets on the lamp at the desk; however, the outlets on the beside lamp were useless.  The plug just fell out when inserted (on both sides).  Otherwise, this hotel was on par with other Hilton properties - helpful and friendly staff, comfortable bed, nice lobby.  I do wish microwaves were provided, but the in-room amenities are very nice. I love the fruit-infused…

title: Not your money's worth
review: The hotel advertises that they have Wifi but our room did not have Wifi -- at least wifi that stayed on unless you stood at the door to the hallway all the time. We asked for help repeatedly and the problem was not solved. I asked for a manager the next day and I was told the manager is unavailable, but someone else agreed to move us to a new room. If you need Wifi this is not the hotel for you; otherwise it is good. The staff the next told me they know that some rooms do not have Wifi, yet the management continues to advertise that they do have Wifi - implying that all rooms have it, which is not the case.

title: Home away from Home
review: There are too many things that were less than satisfactory with this hotel and the room. To begin with, I had stayed at this hotel previously and knew that the rooms do not have microwave. Upon arrival I requested one and I was told that while a microwave is complementary, it was not available. I again called the reception desk the next day and requested for microwave and I was again told that it was still unavailable. For the price I was paying for the room ($379 per night), it is unbelievable that the hotel cannot afford having enough number of microwaves available for the guests who request it (or maybe even provide one for each room and those who don't want will not use it!). Second, the chair in the room for the desk was EXTREMELY uncomfortable. I use the table and chair…

title: July 4th Get Away
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: loved the hotel staff
review: This is the third or fourth time we have stayed at the Back Bay Hilton and continue to have positive experiences. It is perfectly located off the T so we have easy access to Fanuiel Hall and walking distance to Boylston, Newbury Street, Boston Common and the Fenway. Great accommodations and staff

title: Comfortable, beautiful room, in a great location.
review: We were visiting from California and the hotel staff was so helpful in telling us how to get around and where to go.  They were all so helpful and friendly,  all of their suggestions were spot on.  I truly appreciated all of their help.  I will stay at this hotel next time I am in Boston.

title: good place
review: The room was comfortable and beautifully designed. The view of the Charles River was a plus. The location was conviently located and walkable to Boston Common and other destinations. Some service opportunities existed regarding checkin, room keys, and water cooler stocking.

title: Parking is terrible
review: back bay is kind of away from the mobs of tourists.  quiet street.  there are two subway/underground stations nearby, giving you access to the commons and haymarket. Wish we had a better view of Charles River for the fireworks.  but we made do. all was expected of a Hilton chain, nothing extraordinary but zero complaints.  Being a Diamond member we had access to executive lounge for breakfast.  loved that I could grab a bag of chips and a coke when we got back from being tourists.  happy hour, we made once, at 6:00pm, and all the veggies were gone, they do not replenish.   The room had refrigerator, and a large tv. both were used.  it was spacious and bed was comfortable.  loved the large pillows.

title: Great location to see more of Back Bay
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: They gave our room away
review: We chose this  hotel for a trip where we wanted to visit Boston University as well as get a taste of life in the city, not just the tourist attractions.  It was great on all counts!  Located close to mall-shopping as well as chic Newberry street, we could access the T on Mass Ave readily.  Some surprises we found nearby were the Mapparium at the Christian Science Library and some great restaurants with music acts from the Berklee College of Music.  We couldn't have been happier with the location.  The hotel itself featured friendly service.  It was small for a Hilton and just a level below full-service in my opinion.  There was a bellman available, but the garage was self-park.  The restaurant is pretty small, and although they would deliver "to-go" to your room, it wasn't…

title: Great location to walk to Fenway
review: Just checked into the hotel and was told the room I had checked into yesterday was not available.  I had specifically called the hootel yesterday and asked what room would have the best view and reserved based on their suggestion.  Huge disappointment to check in today and find out that we are a number of floors below where we had requested and do not have the view we had requested.  And I am a Diamond member.  Huge disappointment in our first hour here.

title: graduation visit
review: I stayed here on a business trip.  We had our meetings in the hotel.   Only a $20 and change Uber trip from airport.    I liked the location.   There was a ballgame in town when I was there.  Easy to get tickets and an easy walk from the hotel.

title: Texas Traveler
review: The room was nice  and clean.  Everyone that I met from the front desk to the maid,  bartender,  and bellman were friendly and/or professional. There was some kind of confusion with our reservation bit it was straightened out.

title: Great property and staff
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Downtown Boston at your doorstep
review: You won't get better value or treatment from the staff anywhere.  The room was great, the staff could not have been more helpful. It seems the property has been refurbished somewhat recently and is convenient to everything downtown.

title: Great service, clean and friendly!
review: Very welcoming and inviting personnel. The hotel is very centrally located, close to business center and relaxation of nice restaurants. The room, spic and span, was very convenient, spacious and enjoyed a excellent view. The gym is a treat, spacious, well equipped, allowing for ground exercises. It would benefit from adding a couple of real spinning bicycles, as the current ones are of very limited use to experienced cyclists, and only fit oversized behinds (that probably could benefit from some exercise). Breakfast is very good, and actually contains some food for more health-oriented individuals. I certainly recommend this hotel both for business travels or a family- outing.

title: Great location & hotel
review: This hotel is centered in the Back Bay area of Boston and is within walking distance of the wonderful Prudential Center mall, a T-station and many lots of great little restaurants. The staff is friendly, our concierge, Shakeira, and the doorman, Vernon, were especially helpful. They have a 24/7 self-service food stand behind the desk stocked with sandwiches, salads and snacks, that was nice to find when arriving after midnight. There is a Starbuck's in the lobby for morning fare and, though we didn't try the restaurant, it looked appealing. Our double room was very clean as was the lobby and hallways. We would not hesitate to stay there again!

title: Business and pleasure
review: I have stayed at this hotel a few times and absolutely love it. The staff goes above & beyond. The location is great. Close to Fenway which was our reason for visiting. Will stay again when travels take me to Boston.

title: Service was Great but the Bed.. HORRIBLE!!
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. In nice weather, restaurant patio seating is packed with Bostonians and tourists alike soaking up the sunshine and enjoying the food. Commonwealth Ave offers a beautiful stroll down residential tree-lined streets. Keep walking towards the Charles River and enjoy a beautiful view by the water. In warmer months, people run and bike on paths running along the esplanade, and sail and kayak on the Charles River. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: One night stand
review: We checked in for 4 nights, and although the amenities and service were great, the bed.. well that was horrible. First I am a big guy, and the bed, seemed like a Full to me, although the staff kept saying it was a queen. (NOT) It was very uncomfortable too, every morning I woke up with aches all over my body. The staff also said that was the only size beds they had available in the whole hotel.

title: for business or for vacation OK
review: One Saturday night stay for Red Sox game.  Perfect for the purpose.   We've stayed at a few hotels for this purpose and this may be our favorite.   Shout out to Charles, the concierge.  He Was filling in at the desk during busy check in.  Very professional and made us feel like valued guests.

title: Great stay in Boston
review: we had good stay in this modern hotel with all modern comfort. We were there for a conference and all was well organized. the location is good and the staff is friendly. the rates are a little bit high. but they offer a good service

title: Caring team
review: Facilities were clean and comfortable, staff was friendly, courteous, and helpful. Close to everything you want to see and do. Great experience. Would recommend to anyone traveling to Boston for work or vacation

title: Very nice stay
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Nice Hotel, Great Staff!
review: The decision to stay at this hotel was made on two items: proximity to Fenway Park and room availability. I was surprised by some of the negative/low ratings on Trip Advisor, but didn't find any of them true. Our room was perfect, staff most attentive and helpful, and the extra of being close to Copley Square was an added bonus. Good place to stay in my opinion.

title: Great Hotel
review: Very nice hotel with a helpful and friendly staff. Everyone we came in contact with was so helpful.  Location is great, especially if you are visiting Fenway. We walked to the stadium in less than 15 minutes.  The room was pricey but probably on par for the area.  We had a great stay!

title: Excellent service, location, and perks!
review: This was a great hotel for the price paid.  Great location, only a 10 minute walk to Fenway Park with a Hop-On/Hop-Off bus stop right outside the door.  The staff were very professional and always pleasant and helpful.  The room itself was Awesome as well!

title: The best Concierge I've every met.
review: My wife and I were in Boston for a quick 48 hour getaway and didn't get to the hotel until around 10. We're Diamond members, and Jessica (I think!) greeted us and said how excited she was to check us in.   We'd been upgraded after my wife mentioned the surprise getaway, and our room looked recently renovated and had a great view of the river and Cambridge. The bed, as the room, was very comfortable.  The hotel was very convenient to Fenway, Newbury St., and the Public Gardens / Commons. We really enjoyed the Diamond lounge and the complimentary drinks and snacks.  Only negative we experienced was in the restaurant on Friday night. It was close to the kitchen closing and there were many parties looking to eat and drink but the only employee serving was the bartender. He was…

title: Great Boston location, close to everything, very nice pool and hot tub area parking is a little high but do convienent
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Great location but tired property
review: Great location,  close to everything, pool and hot tub area are very nice , restaurants so close , parking is expensive but very convenient great hotel to be in the center of Boston Rooms are nice and we slept very well

title: Solid, No Frills Hotel
review: The staff and hotel location for exploring Boston was excellent but the hotel itself is in need of refurbishment. The gym is also one of the better hotel gyms you'll find with a nice selection of Precor cardio machines, treadmills, weight machines and dumbbells up to 50lb. Lots of potential if management invests in an overall upgrade.

title: Hmmmmm
review: Thank you for taking the time to review your stay at the Hilton Boston Back Bay.  We always appreciate guest feedback and continuously take comments into consideration as we strive to improve our guest service experience. We are thrilled to hear that the convenience of our location at the Hilton Boston Back Bay afforded you. We hope you will stay with us on your next visit to our beautiful city and take full advantage of our prime location.  It would be our pleasure to welcome you back.  Warm regards,  Dominique Marty

title: Nice facility; very friendly and capable service
review: Well located near Copley/Prudential.  Free wifi.  Bathroom a bit small but functional.  Large desk for work.  Convenience items available in lobby but food, shopping, etc. just steps away, including Back Bay's signature thoroughfares and the Copley Mall, as well as a supermarket, Trader Joe's, Starbucks/Dunkin Donuts, and CVS.  Excellent blackout curtains that will let you sleep till noon if you're not careful.  Courteous and efficient staff.

title: Very nice accommodations
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Great experience
review: Would stay here again.  Much improved over 5-7 years ago.  Centrally located to the T, the Pru Center, Boylston Street, and a few very fine restaurants.  Breakfast option very convenient.  Rooms very clean and kept that way between consecutive days stay.

title: Toilets kept us awake
review: Very nice stay at the Hilton Back Bay.  Room was recently renovated.  Small refrigerator was appreciated.  Bartender was friendly with local suggestions.  Although parking was $43.00 we got to keep our car up to 5:00 pm after check out.  We walked over to the Prudential Center and checked out Eatly.  Soundproofing was good.  We slept late and barely heard any noise in hallway

title: Great experience at Hilton Boston Back Bay
review: We stayed on the 4th floor.  The flushing of neighbors' toilets woke us throughout the night and was our alarm in the morning.  The toilets flush at high pressure and the sound was audible enough to make me jump.  Would not stay here again.  This problem seems to be a design flaw in the hotel and has been reported previously.

title: Lovely hotel
review: We stayed at the Hilton Boston Back Bay on the occasion of our daughter's graduation from the Harvard Graduate School of Education. We found the quality of the hotel and the staff to be superb.  All of the staff were very courteous.  Our room was clean and well appointed.  One of the things we liked about our room is that we could open the window and enjoy fresh air.  I know that this is a small feature and we appreciated it!

title: Pleasant Weekend
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. title: Decent but will not plan a return trip
review: We had a free weekend recently and decided to try out the Hilton Boston Back Bay. What a delight to find such a great hotel,  convenient shops and restaurants. Parking was a little steep, but to be expected in Boston. Great little indoor pool and one of the best continental breakfasts I've had in sometime.

title: Wonderful Stay!!
review: While on a business trip to Boston I stayed at the Hilton Boston Back Bay.  While the room was nice and the bed comfortable I was disappointed with a few things and will not plan on returning.  There are several other nice hotels in the same area. •	The hotel had a concierge desk but there was never anyone there to ask about local restaurants or sight-seeing opportunities.  Luckily the Prudential Center Mall was close by and had a welcome center desk where I was able to obtain information.   •	As a Hilton Honor member I should have free WiFi.  There was not even enough signal to get connected to the Hilton WiFi.  When I tried calling for help I never received an answer.  Stopping at the front desk didn’t help either.  I was told to select the pay plan and they would deduct it…

title: Hilton Back Bay
review: We stayed at the Hilton Boston Back Bay for two nights for my daughter's graduation weekend.  It was wonderful and far exceeded my expectations.  The location was great as we were just steps away from Boylston St., Newbury St. and Symphony Hall.  The service was great and it was very quiet.  I am looking forward to returning!

title: Nice, comfortable hotel
review: With the exception of room labeled as handicapped was certainly NOT. Staff was great food was good and location was terrific. Many good restaurants are nearby. The breakfast buffet was very good if you are a Hilton Honors the club room was a relaxing place to sit and unwind.

title: Great hotel in a great location!!
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Nice
review: My husband's company chose this hotel for a conference. I stayed for an evening and it was truly a great place! It had convenient parking and was in a perfect location - within walking distance to nice restaurants and beautiful sites around Boston. The staff was very accommodating and the hotel itself was wonderful. I have to mention that I left my purse in the restaurant and the staff contacted our room to let us know. Needless to say, we were extremely grateful. I would highly recommend the Hilton in the Back Bay for anyone vacationing or visiting for business.

title: Great location and wonderful staff
review: Was here for a conference.  The room was nicely updated.   But I had ups and downs.  The plug in the bathroom was out of commission.  No mirror near a plug that worked.  Hard time accessing wifi.  And I'm a HHonors member.  Sent a tech to the room 👍🏻.  I knew more about computers than he did 👎🏻.  I used points for one night and cc for other days.  No one mentioned I had to exchanged keys.  So just little things like this added up to 4 stars.  The view was very nice. And the bell hops were wonderful!

title: Perfect stay
review: Great location near Newbury and Boylston St with many restaurants nearby. Near convention center and Prudential Center mall.  Front desk staff are exceptional in their friendliness. Executive Lounge privileges for those that qualify. Easy 15-20 minute ride to the airport. It was a bit pricey and geared towards business travelers/convention goers. Rooms were nice size and well-maintained. Quiet!

title: Way too expensive...
review: We stayed at the Hilton Boston Back Bay for 3 nights in early May and were very pleased with every aspect of our stay, the rooms were large, bright and cleaned regularly the Hotel staff were the nicest people to deal with they were always polite and welcoming, we will certainly recommend this hotel

title: Dependable and Convenient
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Perfect for NEU family/graduatea
review: Visited the Boston area for the weekend and chose the Hilton due to its convenient location. Easy walk to Prudential center, shops and restaurants. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Room was clean and beds comfortable. A bit pricey overall but a good representation of the Hilton brand.

title: good stay
review: Perfect location for anyone in the Professional Studies program at NEU as the center for CPS is a block away.  Great rooms and the staff is super professional and helpful.  All the fun stuff on Newbury street is 5 minutes away. Plenty of Iber and Lyft drivers around to get you anywhere you need to go.  Airport was just a $20 fare!

title: Great location; errs on eclecticism over pragmatism
review: Hotel was in an excellent location. Clean comfortable rooms Some rooms have great views of the city Restaurant was good though not well promoted in the hotel. lots of shopping and restaurants close by

title: Just all around very good
review: Having spent the first week of May at the Hilton Downtown-Faneuil Hall for Boston tradeshow #1, I was already in the right mindset to stay at Hilton Back Bay Boston for Boston tradeshow #2. I was met cordially as usual and provided the option of additional points or free breakfast which, to me, always seems like the better value. Once again, my room lacked the highly coveted foam pillows despite the special reservation request, but it took less time for Hilton Back Bay to deliver them to my room.   As Hilton Gold, I was upgraded to a nice room on the 24th floor, but the true deluxe rooms with panoramic view were exclusively for rooms with king beds, something that wasn’t clear when I made my reservation. The style was more hip than the Hilton Downtown, with dark textured…

title: Average for the price
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Memorable visit
review: I stayed here for a week while at a conference in an upgraded room:  - bed very comfortable and nice large TV. - bathroom dated - hotel in general is dated - nice to have Starbucks in the lobby  Next time I would probably try the Sheraton across the street and directly connected to the conference center. It looked more like a 4 star hotel.

title: Best Hilton-Brand Hotel in Boston
review: Hotel has excellent service, quality food in both executive lounge and restaurant.  Everyone was helpful and friendly. Rooms are clean & ours happen to be recently renovated. We really enjoyed our stay and will be back!

title: Average hotel, poor value
review: As a diamond member, I have stayed at virtually every Hilton-brand hotel in Boston.  This hotel is definitely the best in the area.  My wife and I stayed here for one night.  The room was big, modern, clean, comfortable, and, most importantly quiet.  We had a nice view of the Charles and Cambridge.  The breakfast provided for diamond members had a really nice selection and very helpful staff.  The desk staff was very friendly; check-in and check-out was efficient and quick.   My only complaint is that the parking garage has a separate elevator.  I definitely will stay here again.

title: Beautiful, immaculate, friendly
review: Very good location, roomed were above average and the place was clean. Fitness center was very large and nice. Slowest elevators in the world!!  Noise from TV next door was unacceptable, should have better insulation

title: One of the best!
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Beautiful room and great location
review: So, I am an Intercontinental Hotels person, I have Spire-Elite membership, their branded credit card, and an Ambassador membership. But, I gave the Hilton a shot because one of my credits cards was offering cash back. I had stayed here a couple of times before, and it was fine. First, you can't beat the location, Boylston and Newbury streets right outside. You have Copley, a multitude of restaurants, and a transit stop within a three-minute walk. I arrived a little early, and my room wasn't ready. No big deal, the gentleman that checked me in said he would get the status and in the meantime, I could help myself to the executive lounge. Here is one point of departure from the Intercontinental, there is no comparison. The Intercontinental lounge has large windows, is much bigger,…

title: Great location for the convention center
review: My husband and I celebrated my birthday weekend at this hotel. The rooms were very stylish (think boutique hotel) and the executive lounge access was a nice perk. The staff were all fabulous during our stay. You can not beat this location- easy access to Newbury street and Prudential Center or a quick walk to Fenway or Public Gardens.

title: Great stay
review: Subway noise was a bit disturbing and went on all day & late into the night. Other than that  a great location for my professional meeting at the convention center. Not around the corner but close enough to walk to the historic parts of town & very close to Fenway park

title: Terrible service ruined a lovely weekend
review: Spent 3 nights. Outstanding staff, accommodations, and location. Front desk/lobby staff were very helpful and customer centric. Walking distance to Fenway and great restaurants on Boylston.  Excellent breakfast and restaurant staff. Best Hilton experience I've had.

title: Amazing stay!
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Great Location
review: A very well put together hotel. Customer service was exceptional. Made it very easy to feel at home in a new place. From the moment we checked in everyone greeted us and made our stay a breeze. No problem helping us with any accommodations.

title: Awesome
review: Great location and hotel was very nice, clean and comfortable. Enjoyed the bar downstairs. The Diamond Members Club was disappointing as far as food served and drinks provided. Nothing extra special about the hotel.

title: Love the location
review: Great location, friendly staff, really nice dining options. I went for a conference but I would go back for fun. Close to tons of shopping and dining in Back Bay. It's pricy but it's worth the extra money.

title: Good location reasonable rates
review: Great location.  Hotel rooms are very nice. Staff is friendly and very helpful.  HHonors Lounge, Bar and restaurant are all very good.  Close to convention center, great restaurants and shopping.  Elevator service is annoying.   Makes stops on almost every floor in morning rush, despite a full elevator (all elevators need to work together and to be programmed with modern intelligence decision algorithms).

title: ok to stay for business
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Mixed bag
review: Stayed 1 night in April. Received early check in which was nice. I was given a newly renovated room on the 15th floor. The room was a good size, and the bed was comfortable. Gym was not huge but ok size and good to work out.   Location was also good. There are restaurants in front of Berklee school, short walk from the hotel. For business purpose, I think I can stay next time too.

title: Wonderful location for Newbury St. and the Convention Center!
review: My family recently stayed at the Hilton for five days.This hotel had a number of nice elements, but they were sadly overshadowed by some serious shortcomings. The front desk was able to accommodate an early check-in day-of, which we greatly appreciated. We were given a newly renovated room on the 15th floor. With regard to the hotel itself, Hilton did a really nice job with the decor; it was polished and modern without looking too new-agey. They had clearly retrofitted the room, leaving the bathroom much smaller than at more recently built hotels. That said, there was plenty of storage for toiletries both and underneath on the large granite sink, which I often find lacking in hotels. The room was a good size, and the bed was comfortable. In addition, the lounge available for…

title: Remodel the Cleaning
review: Thank you for taking the time to review your stay at the Hilton Boston Back Bay. We appreciate you taking the time to compliment the team and our Diamond Lounge Attendants for their dedication to our guests and making sure you had everything you needed in the lounge. On another note please accept our deepest apologies for failing to exceed your expectations during your stay with us. We always strive to uphold our Hilton Values and culture and regrettably did not do so during your stay with us. We would like to apologize for the air conditioning issues that arose during your stay as well as the shower & water pressure issues. Your comments are important to us and have been reviewed by the Director of Engineering. He has met with his team of engineers and all maintenance issues have been resolved. We also deeply regret that your stay with us fell very short of your expectations concerning cleanliness. Our Director of Housekeeping has been notified of this review and is working with the Housekeeping Department to ensure that our Hilton Values and culture are being upheld and exercised properly. We hope that you will reconsider your decision on staying with another hotel in Boston because we would love to have the opportunity to make it right for you. It is important that we accommodate all your needs and welcome you to stay with us again.  Warm regards,  Dominique Marty

title: Love this Hotel!!!!
review: The rooms are a decent size, although my colleague and I were somewhat surprised when they didn't have any rooms with two beds left when we arrived. Good thing we're friends as well as colleagues. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean. The best part if the location. It's very close to the Convention Center, Newbury Street, and the Prudential Center, which basically means it's close to fun things to do once the work day ends.

title: Great location for Boston Marathon
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Nice Hotel, Ridiculous Price
review: Our family stayed this past weekend as my husband was running his first Boston marathon.  The room was clean and quiet and the kids loved the pool.  It was pricey, but everything in the area was for that weekend.  Being there over Easter, we were pleasantly surprised to find a great church that meets there as well!  However, what we enjoyed the most was the convenient location.  The Runner's Expo was in the convention center across the street; we were able to walk to Fenway to catch a Red Sox game; there was a metro stop nearby which we used several times; the ending stretch of the marathon was just steps away on Boylston; and there were plenty of restaurants in the area to choose from.

title: Brilliant hotel great location
review: This is a nice hotel with a great location. The staff are wonderful, so friendly, hospitable, and professional! The room was, but the price is out of this world. Staying for the Boston Marathon I expected higher prices, but many of the usual Hilton amenities were not up to par. The breakfast was not what any Honors member would expect and the lounge was weak. Again the staff were great, but management should really take a look at what hey provide for the guest and what kind of impression this leaves with their guests.

title: Value for money is poor
review: We chose hotel for location to Fenway park . The facilities are excellent and staff are very helpful and friendly could not do enough for us  . It is in a central location very convenient for shops and restaurants and also the Boston trolley and duck tours

title: Boston weekend
review: The quality of hotel, the food and the executive launge is very poor compared to the value paid. In Europe Hilton chain provides much better quality for this value (service, food, hotel outlook, etc.)

title: Super-Hot, but not in a good way
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. In nice weather, restaurant patio seating is packed with Bostonians and tourists alike soaking up the sunshine and enjoying the food. Commonwealth Ave offers a beautiful stroll down residential tree-lined streets. Keep walking towards the Charles River and enjoy a beautiful view by the water. In warmer months, people run and bike on paths running along the esplanade, and sail and kayak on the Charles River. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Mediocre hotel
review: We stayed for five nights, 4/8-4/12. The weather forecast showed that it would be 80 degrees for two of the days. But, it's a Hilton, so we will be fine. Air conditioning exists, right? Wrong. For two nights of the stay there was no air conditioning in the entire hotel. The front desk could not fix the problem, and Hilton's corporate "800" number was of no help. I was less than impressed. Rather, I was outraged.   And, lest the hotel respond that it takes time to turn over from heating to cooling, keep in mind that this was not an unexpected weather event. The 80 degree weather had been in the forecast for over a week.  For shame, Hilton Boston Back Bay.  For shame.

title: Great Location and Hotel
review: We would first like to thank you for taking the time to review your stay at the Hilton Boston Back Bay.  We always appreciate guest feedback and continuously take comments into consideration as we strive to improve our guest service experience. Secondly, we would like to apologize for the air conditioning issues you experienced during your stay. This review has been brought to the attention of the Director of Engineering and he has addressed the maintenance team.  We hope that you will reconsider your decision on staying with another hotel in Boston because we would love to have the opportunity to make it right for you. It is important that we accommodate all your needs and welcome you to stay with us again.  Warm regards,  Dominique Marty

title: Excellent!
review: We stayed at the Hilton as part of our Boston marathon expedition. As a HHonors gold member we stayed at many Hilton related hotels but the price/value experience here in Boston is not up to par. We checked in the day before but on arrival were welcomed by an employee who had more attention for the people passing by than us.  And I guess we are not the only ones who concluded that the hotel is not up to par as the hotel is not full on one of the busiest weeks of the year.  The gym is really nice. The complementry breakfast in the Diamond lounge is OK but missing a few things. There is for instance no cheese/samon or cut meet to put on your bread.  For a place that charges close to $500 a night that should be in order.   The bathroom is really small. Water pressure is low but…

title: Great Stay
review: This hotel is in a great location and central to shopping and restaurants.  You can cross the street and enter the Sheraton, take the escalators upstairs to the Prudential building to the shopping center.  If you keep walking, you go up the walkway headed to Marriott Copley where there is upscale shopping...all without going outside in the snow or heat.  I had a corner room and it was very spacious and decorated nicely.  I felt right at home with the bed and very large LG TV.  The shower water flow was great and the amenities in the bathroom are superior.  The bar was a great place to meet colleagues and have appetizers and drinks.

title: Left in the middle of the night
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: No air conditioning
review: No AC and no one seems to know why or how to get it working. After 7 hours at 60 degrees my room is still a sweltering mess. No one mentions it at check in, had to hear it from another guest in the elevator.  It's the entire hotel not just my room. #Fail   Update  I finally gave up and packed my bags and left at 130am.  Front desk told me they couldn't refund my room charge and that I would have to call the next day and speak to a Director. When I said "I'm the customer, why not take care of the refund and have him call me tomorrow?" He said "He may be busy so you should call him."   Update  So using the Hilton app I lodged a complaint and now they replied saying the hotel needs 3 business days to DECIDE if I will get a refund. How is this service? How do you treat a Gold…

title: Great Stay!
review: Thank you for your feedback in regards to the air conditioning not working. It takes about three days to switch from the heating to cooling system, however I apologize that this was not resolved sooner. Thank you again for your review and I invite you to stay with us the next time you return to Boston!    Dominique Marty  General Manager

title: Above average hotel, though the price is ridiculous
review: This has to be the worst experience I have ever had. My room was unable to cool, I was told the building was built in the 80's and staff was not able to to anything. For this horrendously hot room, I was offered a measly BOX FAN. It was about 80 degrees in my room because there was a vent that always had heat on in my room that I could not shut off. I felt as if I was staying in a motel. I honestly feel bad for comparing this place to that because I'm sure a motel would have air conditioning. This is not the first time it has happened. After this experience I checked yelp. Reviews for this hotel are barely at 3 stars. Others have complained about this issue and yet this hotel has done nothing to address it.

title: Clean and comfortable
review: Great location! So many restaurants pubs you can walk too! The first day my boyfriend and I checked out a few places that were highly rated. Took uber to a few and at only a few bucks! Next day we went to places near our hotel. Great yummy places! The hotel itself was very clean, a little pricey but then again you are downtown. I'm looking forward to visiting Boston again I've been about 4times. This hotels location was a first and I definitely will be staying here again. Great gym equipment with the pool been located right next to it. I didn't try out the pool but the gym was great!

title: Rooms are comfortable and view was great
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Weekend Comfort in the Back Bay area
review: We held a work meeting in a Conference room and stayed in the hotel.  The. Room on the 25th floor has great views but is a bit dark -grey walls, black carpet etc.   No spring colors here.  The staff was warm and friendly.

title: My favorite Boston hotel!
review: Stayed here while working a convention and chose a room on the 25th floor so we could have a beautiful view of the city. Unfortunately, the direction that our floor to ceiling windows faced looked directly at a new, even taller building that is newly built. It took up the majority of what was sure to have been a great view a couple of years ago. The room was a little on the small side and felt tight. The bed was great! Very comfortable and clean with fantastic pillows. There were also plenty of places to charge our phones and computers. I loved the shower...it easily accommodated two adults. The complimentary shampoo/conditioner/soap were very nice and felt higher end. The hotel staff were very professional, courteous and friendly. Two minor issues...the garage could not…

title: Fantastic
review: My son went to school in Boston, so I've traveled there a lot for business and family reasons over the years.  I've stayed at a variety of hotels, but I always come back to this one - it's my favorite for lots of reasons.  Primarily, the location is great - it's close enough to anywhere you want to go, including subway stops, but it's also quiet and peaceful.  The service is always good, and they've recently remodeled, so that's a bonus.

title: Great rooms for a group
review: My room was so clean and comfortable, The staff was friendly and helpful, the snacks in the lounge were nice, and filled in the gaps during my stay. Special recognition to Jessica at the front desk, and Jonathan, in the Lounge, for their added personal touch to their service, and the sweet young lady who works so diligently at the snack bar in the lobby. Each of you, as well as the other staff made me feel more comfortable while in an unfamiliar city.

title: I'll definitely return
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings.
