title: Great place to stay
review: Nice hotel. Staff is very friendly and will go out of the way to help out. They provide an in-room dining menu. There is no service charge. The only thing that gets added to the listed price is the sales tax. They also have a bar and restaurant on site. 40 Dalton has good food. Paul, the bartender, is fantastic! Very friendly and personable and pours a great drink.

title: Good location, Good hotel
review: We stayed at the Hilton the weekend of Anime Boston. We were extremely satisfied with the service we received especially with how busy it was. The staff was friendly, helpful, and very reliable. Would definitely recommend staying here.

title: Good quality business hotel
review: I attended a conference that was held at the hotel. The hotel is in a good location across the street from Prudential Center. My room was nice, appeared to be recently updated and had a large desk. Ideal for a business trip. The staff was friendly and helpful.

title: Anime Boston 2017 Stay
review: I stay at this hotel regularly. It is consistently good - service is great, and the bar staff are the sort that provide good conversation as well as a nice bottle of Sam Adams.  The rooms are clean and pretty standard Hilton layout. The Wifi has good coverage which makes it a good base for meetings.  There is a great seafood bar literally 50 yards outside the door  If you are a Hilton person, then I recommend this one in Boston

title: Could have been nice, but questionable business practices and customer service
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Stay at the Sheraton or Marriot nearby instead
review: My daughter, wife, and I had to travel to Boston for a club sporting event on March 3-5 for which the club had already made hotel arrangements near the Boston Convention Center.  We decided to use the opportunity to do some college visits on March 2 and made plans to stay at the Hilton Boston Back Bay for March 1-3 using Hilton Honors points.  Prior to arrival, we selected our room and checked in using the Hilton Honors app.  During this check-in, I selected the "after 10pm" arrival option.  Upon arriving at the hotel slightly after midnight, we were informed by staff that our room had been given away, that they had reserved a room for us at a nearby hotel, and that they would cover the cost at the other hotel.  They also stated that we would have a room at the Hilton the next…

title: Great location
review: We appreciate the feedback you have provided the Hilton Boston Back Bay with your review. Please accept our deepest apologies for failing to exceed your expectations during your stay with us. Secondly, we would like to apologize for the issues that arose concerning your room reservation. We always strive to uphold our Hilton Values and culture and regrettably did not do so during your stay with us. We constantly take guest comments into consideration and would like to thank you for providing us with excellent feedback to help improve our guest service experience. It is our priority to uphold Hilton Values and culture to ultimately exceed your expectations. For that reason, we would like to sincerely apologize for failing to do so during your stay. We hope you will reconsider your decision to stay at another property on your next visit to Boston so that our team members will have the opportunity to make it right for you.

title: Great if attending a Convention Next Door
review: This building is smallish in footprint, with 26 floors.  It is fairly old, and no doubt has been remodeled numerous times.  Because of the age and shape (triangle), they can't do much but use the existing room footprints.  This means very small bathrooms!  They have small fridges in each room, and coffee makers.  No microwave, no mini-bar.  The linens and beds are very good.  55" televisions are a nice touch.  The climate system can be controlled to include constant fan, which is necessary for me.  My room was way too dark, even with all the lights on (of which there weren't enough, and they werene't bright).  There is a safe, but it's in a drawer.  Remove the drawer and the safe is gone with it.  The lobby bar is nice, with a good selection of spirits, including scotch and…

title: Location is the best part
review: Close to convention hall and great restaurants rooms are very clean and new decor  Staff very helpful and friendly Starbucks in lobby internet comes and goes but I find that in most hotels if you have a car it has parking at hotel just off the elevators

title: Beautiful Hotel
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Another great stay
review: My room had recently been remodeled, it was so clean & spacious! The city view room was so cool from the 18th floor! Thank you for excellent service! Starbucks in lobby. Close by restaurants & mall. Great experience.

title: nothing works
review: The staff is so welcoming. Everyone made me feel right at home.  I was in a great superior corner room. It wes clean and modern. It was cold while I was there so the restaurant came in handy.  I loved my bartender!! I also like the proximity to great shopping.  This is the only place I would stay while in Boston. Thank you to everyone, even the door man who hugged me goodbye!

title: Excellent accomodations
review: Internet doesn't work. Lamp doesn't work. Electrical outlet doesn't work. Safe doesn't work. Four strikes and you are out. I haven't tried the very large TV but maybe it doesn't work either? Room is cramped but clean. Internet is unstable...on and off. Grrrr.....Wastes so much time.

title: Business Trip - Great Service - Average Accomodation
review: Check in was very fast and easy.  Staff was well informed.  The bar personnel were great and always greeted you and served right away.  The room was clean and no issues.  The location is great, within walking distance of shopping, food, sights.

title: College Visit!
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Miserable experience - would give fewer stars, but employees were pleasant and helpful
review: Perfect location for visiting MIT! Short walk across the river and no worries about parking. Close to much shopping and dining. Hop on and off tour bus is picked up directly out the doors of hotel. Loved everything about our stay!

title: Great location for the convention center
review: The previous week we had a fabulous stay in Boston at a rival chain. We were looking forward to another two days in the beautiful Back Bay area. Instead we were extremely uncomfortable in a minuscule room,which had a very awkward configuration. There was ONE low easy chair practically on top of the television. There were two beds, and from one you could not see the left side of the TV screen. There was NO work desk or table. Strangest of all, there were no ice machines on the floors. To get ice you had to traipse down to the lobby, request it from front desk, and have it dispensed sparingly in small plastic bags. The other choice was to call for ice delivery and feel compelled to offer a tip. The coffee/tea maker was hidden in a cabinet below the TV - in a dark corner - and…

title: Service excellent as always
review: We appreciate the feedback you have provided the Hilton Boston Back Bay with your review. Please accept our deepest apologies for failing to exceed your expectations during your stay with us. We always strive to uphold our Hilton Values and culture and regrettably did not do so during your stay with us. Your comment concerning the restaurant being closed has been addressed to the Director of Food & Beverage and we apologize again that these services were not available to you. On another note we also would like to apologize for the service of our Wi-Fi.  Thank you for taking the time to commend our team members for providing you with excellent guest service.   We hope you will reconsider your decision to stay at a different property on your next visit to Boston because our team is dedicated to make it right for our guests and would love to have the opportunity to do so.  Warm regards,  Dominique Marty

title: Great Location and comfortable facility
review: I stayed here for a convention and it was in a great area. Even though it is not connected to the convention center, it is just across the street.  There are so many places to eat and shop within the area.  The room we had was a corner room and very spacious.  The room is on the older side but it was clean and comfortable.  What I really liked is that you couldn't hear doors slam in the middle of the night or people in the hallway.  Perfect for St. Patrick's evening.  I do think you could hear the T but it was very muted. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful.  If there for another conference, I would stay there again.

title: Nice Hotel
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Was expecting a little more
review: Hotel was clean, staff was friendly. My room had a great view and was very clean. Fitness center needs to be updated a bit. Close to a number of decent restaurants and a mall. My overall stay was good and I would come back. Ride to/from the airport didn't take too long. Be mindful of your cab drives taking longer routes.

title: Good location but inexperienced staff
review: It's a nice hotel, very clean but the devil's in the details.  First we arrived and after 10-15 minutes of the clerk telling me he was checking for an upgrade, he found a room.  I explained that as a HH member, I had checked in and picked my room the night before.  He came up with a room on the 5th floor with 2 double beds.  I explained I had reserved a corner room on the 11th floor with 2 beds.  He went back to checking and, after another 10-15 minutes, gave me the room he was "able to line up" for me.  It was the room I booked the night before.  3-4 other parties checked in with 2 other clerks while I was waiting.  When we got to the room, it was clean and nice, the corner rooms are a little bigger.  Nice basic amenities.  Room is a bit noisy from the street and hall ways. …

title: Worst Hilton ever
review: Thank you for taking the time and effort to send us your feedback. We always appreciate guest feedback and continuously take comments into consideration as we strive to improve our guest service experience. Secondly, we would like to apologize for the issues that arose concerning your room reservation. This review has been brought to the attention of our Revenue Analyst and will be reviewed with the Hilton reservation center. On another note we would like to sincerely apologize for the pool issues that arose during your stay. It is most unfortunate that those issues disrupted your stay, and your stay was not positively memorable. Guest comments such as yours are important to us and have been reviewed by the Director of Engineering. He has met with his team of engineers and all maintenance issues have been resolved. We hope that you will stay with us again and address any issues, concerns, or requests so that we can fully accommodate your needs and exceed your expectations. Your business and loyalty is important to us.  Warm regards,  Dominque Marty

title: Great location and fun stay!
review: Newbury Street is great, walking distance. Sadly the staff at the reception is inexperienced. They struggle with very simple operations (giving you your keys, using their computer...) and also lie if you don't talk to their manager (pretending that the hotel is fully booked, even if it's not). Also ignore the fact that you'rte Hilton Honors Member... The Sheraton facing this one is probably a safer bet.

title: Back in the 70's
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Business/weekend visit
review: Upon entering the room I was met by a complex array of odors. Someone had clearly smoked in this room and them someone used tons of air freshener trying to mask it. Furniture like back in the 70's (brown furniture, brown carpeting and teal wall coloring) and a bathroom that is in urgent need of an upgrade. If this would be the standard for all Hilton properties, I would not be a Diamond member. Staff was great, especially Paul (I think that was his name) the bartender.

title: loo paper....
review: The Hilton Boston Back Bay would like to first thank you for taking the time and effort to write us such an informative review about our hotel. We deeply regret that your stay with us fell very short of your expectations, and you were disappointed by the cleanliness. Our Director of Housekeeping has been notified of this review and is working with the Housekeeping Department to ensure that our Hilton Values and culture are being upheld and exercised properly. We encourage that you stay with us again so that we can prove this recent stay otherwise and you can reconsider this review and rating.  Warm regards,  Dominique Marty

title: Need some operational help
review: Room was small, but it's Boston. Would certainly stay again. Diamond lounge was great. Location was premier. Across from mall. Lots of walking. Taxi in from Logan airport and never taxi again until we left for airport. Walked everywhere, Copley square across the street, Quincy market - great walk. Go to leagle seafood for lunch and walk back. 25000 steps. We even hoped on the train 4 blocks away and went down to providence and back. Awesome city, awesome hotel location.

title: Generally expect more from Hilton properties
review: ....is very cheap  Otherwise good location, bar and reception areas were pleasant enough, large rooms but a tiny bathroom did not permit cat swinging and was so small I kept accidentally dropping my towel in the toilet water after getting out of the bath

title: Two nights in Back Bay
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Great location for Berklee performances
review: 25th floor room, great view, though the wind turbines on top of the tower at 888 Boylston St. kept catching my eye (not expecting movement out the 25th floor window). Room well kept, bed made very neatly (chocolates were a nice touch). Took me a minute to find where the complimentary waters were placed.  Decor: 5 of 5 : Very modern, dark, and shimmery. My coworker noted that her lower floor room was "nowhere near as cool as mine" Bathroom: 4 of 5 : Toilet was very close to the door, but the vanity mirror was nice, very useful for my tall height. Shower: 3 of 5 : Height was good, water pressure was not so good. Power: 5 of 5 : Accessible outlets mounted next to the bed. Didn't even have to use a power strip or unplug a lamp. Wireless: 5 of 5 : Streamed video content without…

title: Great Time
review: This is nice Hilton that is in the perfect location for performances at Berklee. Our room on the 22nd floor had just been renovated with brand new carpet and beds. While there is nothing boutique about this hotel, it is clean, friendly, and you know exactly what you're going to get.

title: Great hotel.....staff extremely helpful
review: Spent 2 nights at Boston Hilton Back Bay. Looking forward to returning. Upscale room in a great location. Front desk was attentive and accommodating.  As a Hilton Honors gold member we arrived early and were able to check in. The  ftness center was very clean, fully equipped and we also enjoyed the whirlpool and swimmimg pool.

title: It's average
review: Great hotel....staff were extremely helpful and assisted us with our every request. Very central location and close to pubs and restaurants.  Large shopping mall across the road so all areas catered for .

title: A little dated
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. In warmer months, people run and bike on paths running along the esplanade, and sail and kayak on the Charles River. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Very disappointed
review: I stayed here with my family and fortunately, my visit was for just one night..  Although a Hilton, it is in need of a major renovation  They are apparently doing work on the higher floors, but the rooms we had are stuck in the 1980's. Old decore and noisy toilets. Tried to take a shower in the evening and the water was either cold or luke warm.... Could not get any hot water. The staff, although friendly were not Hilton standard in my opinion and I have travelled extensively.  From check in to check out, I was very underwhelmed and would look elsewhere next time.

title: Great staff, nicely updated rooms
review: We would first like to thank you for taking the time to review your stay at the Hilton Boston Back Bay.  We always appreciate guest feedback and continuously take comments into consideration as we strive to improve our guest service experience. Secondly, we would like to apologize for shower issues.  This review has been brought to the attention of the Director of Engineering and he has addressed the maintenance team.  We hope that you will reconsider your decision on staying with another hotel in Boston because we would love to have the opportunity to make it right for you. It is important that we accommodate all your needs and welcome you to stay with us again.  Warm regards, Dominique Marty

title: Central Location-Comfortable Accommodations
review: I stayed here as a surprise Valentine's visit with my fiancé, but this Hilton was not like what I have come to expect from Hilton hotels.  As a Hilton Honors member, I routinely visit Hilton hotels while I travel. However, this hotel just seemed to lack the service and basic amenities of other Hilton hotels.    First, I went to two different floors to obtain ice (ice not on every floor) and the machines did not work on either floor nor was there appropriate signage. When I contacted the front desk to ask where else I could find ice, they told me it would be delivered to my room. I thought this was really nice, however it was not delivered for over an hour.   The wifi which was included as a honors member barely worked and continuously shut off.  I have traveled to small hotels…

title: Too hot too stuffy too loud
review: We appreciate the feedback you have provided the Hilton Boston Back Bay with your review. Please accept our deepest apologies for failing to exceed your expectations during your stay with us. We always strive to uphold our Hilton Values and culture and regrettably did not do so during your stay with us. Your comment concerning reservation & check in experience has been addressed to the Director of Guest Services, and he has reviewed the matter with his guest service department team to avoid this issue from ever occurring again. Your comments concerning the wifi issues have been addressed to the Director of Engineering and he is reviewing this issue with his maintenance team.  We hope you will reconsider your decision to stay at a different property on your next visit to Boston because our team is dedicated to make it right for our guests and would love to have the opportunity to do so.  Warm regards,  Dominique Marty

title: Great hotel and location
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. In nice weather, restaurant patio seating is packed with Bostonians and tourists alike soaking up the sunshine and enjoying the food. Commonwealth Ave offers a beautiful stroll down residential tree-lined streets. Keep walking towards the Charles River and enjoy a beautiful view by the water. In warmer months, people run and bike on paths running along the esplanade, and sail and kayak on the Charles River. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Great location
review: The hotel has a very friendly and helpful staff. It's modern and clean, and is in a great location.  They also have a complementary van to and from the train station and airport.  Highly recommended.  The rooms are fairly large and the shower is hot and strong.

title: OK business hotel in good location
review: After a long drive we were happy to find the hotel. We were tired and probably looked a little worn out when we went to check in but Sam immediately changed our attitudes.  She's wonderful!  She was patient while I searched for my information to check in, gave us a complimentary upgrade to a little larger room.  She is a real asset at the front desk.  The room was very nice.  The price of beverages and snacks are a bit pricey and there was noise from the elevator but that was the only downfall.

title: Always a pleasure
review: I work in Boston and travel here regularly on business.  It is competent as business hotels go but the lobby is lacking and the location, while very central, is kind of tucked away and takes longer to get to than it should given the way the streets go.  Unless you have Hilton loyalty there are better choices in Back Bay.

title: Back Bay
review: We would first like to thank you for taking the time and effort to write a review about your stay with us. Your comments provide us with valuable feedback that we take into consideration in order to provide an exceptional guest service experience. On that note, we would like to sincerely apologize for failing to exceed your expectations during your stay. It is very important to us that we continuously uphold our Hilton Values and culture, and we regrettably did not do so. We hope that you will visit us again so that we have the opportunity to make it right for you and create a positive, memorable stay.  Warm regards,  Dominique Marty

title: Floors 20 and above
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. title: Last minute stay
review: I stayed here last week on floor 17. The room was nice the hotel staff was accommodating. In room 1707 you are close to the ice machine which for periods of time you can hear water running in your room constantly as if a shower is running in the bathroom. I came here for business but also was with my family who love swimming and being in hotels. I have stayed at the Sheraton across the street numerous times but I am a loyalist to the Hilton as well.  The pool was perfect for the boys however it is a quarter of the size of the Sheraton's next-door. They have a great gym plenty of exercise equipment. The location is excellent, shopping, restaurants the T and all around stores nearby make this a great hotel to stay at.  They have remodeled the top six floors which is 20 through 26…

title: Excellent Stay
review: It is a very nice hotel. It's a little out of the way from things, but it's near Newbury Street if you like shopping. The staff was nice and helpful. The view from the room was nice and clean. The price was great for a last minute stay.

title: Great location
review: I was really impressed with this hotel. We stayed 3 nights. The staff made us feel like we have been coming there for years. This was our first visit. We got an upgraded room at the top of the hotel with the perfect panoramic view of the river and surrounding sites. My son was auditioning at the New England Conservatory so we were given complimentary breakfast buffet the morning of his audition so he could have a good start. The room and housekeeping was great as was everyone else we interacted with. We will be staying here again... especially if he gets accepted into NEC!

title: Great Spot for Conventions
review: Location was great. Short walk to shopping centre train station. Cheesecake factory just around the corner too. Hotel is a little on the older side but didnt bother us at all. Would recommend based on price and location.

title: a hotel targeted at the low price business
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: I won't be staying there again
review: This place is a Hilton-branded hotel that strangely feels like a Days Inn or Motel Six. The room price was, to be fair, quite low, around $175, while luxury rooms in Boston go for well over $400. We had bought one of the possible upgrades, well worth it - our floor, the 24th,  was brand newly rehabbed and everything glistened. The view was superb out over the city and Symphony Hall. The bedding and linens are excellent.   But there were little touches of economy which might be disappointing if you are expecting a high level of luxury: there are no robes or slippers; the coffee maker is pretty cheesy, not a nice Keurig; the hangers are the kind that fit only the hotel, to keep, I guess, guests from taking them home; the hotel REMOVED the ice machines from the new floors, and…

title: Would definitely recommend
review: Thank you for taking the time to review your stay at the Hilton Boston Back Bay.  We always appreciate guest feedback and continuously take comments into consideration as we strive to improve our guest service experience. It is unfortunate that your stay with us was not exemplary as reflected in the rating. Our priority is to create positive, memorable, guest service experiences and strive to continue to do so through feedback provided by our guests. We hope that you will stay with us again and address any issues, concerns, or requests so that we can fully accommodate your needs and exceed your expectations. Your business and loyalty is important to us.  Warm regards,  Dominique Marty

title: Good base to explore Boston
review: The location is good, beds are comfortable but there are a few problems.  The mirror in the bathroom will blind you.  It is a round mirror, very large, with the light bulb around the outer edge.  You cannot turn it off or down. You can't look at it without hurting your eyes and if you do and then leave the bathroom you can't see because the reverse image is in your eyeball.  It is horrible.   We asked to change rooms and were told that all the rooms were like that.  Which turned out not to be true.  We asked for the electrician to come up and unplug it.  He did and couldn't.  He did say that he would bring up a lamp to use in the bathroom. He didn't.   Then there were the ups packages that were sent to the hotel and signed for by security.  We were able to retrieve one but the…

title: Nice hotel, great location
review: We would first like to thank you for taking the time to review your stay at the Hilton Boston Back Bay.  We always appreciate guest feedback and continuously take comments into consideration as we strive to improve our guest service experience. Secondly, we would like to sincerely apologize for failing to exceed your expectations during your stay. It is very important to us that we continuously uphold our Hilton Values and culture, and we regrettably did not do so. We hope that you will reconsider your decision on staying with another hotel in Boston because we would love to have the opportunity to make it right for you. It is important that we accommodate all your needs and welcome you to stay with us again.  Warm regards,  Dominique Marty

title: Enjoyable stay
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Nice hotel in a good location
review: Stayed for 2 nights over Christmas. We had a newly renovated room on the top floor. The location is superb-about 5 min walk to Prudential Center and a short drive to MIT. The room was well furnished and quite spacious and the beds were comfortable. The staff was very welcoming. A minor negative was the noise made by the bathroom blower.

title: Well located for the Prudential Centre and Back Bay area.
review: The Hilton Back Bay is located close to main shopping districts in Boston. The lounge is excellent at this hotel and the rooms are very comfortable. The gym is pretty good as well. Only one downside, no complimentary water in the room even though they told me it would be there.

title: Great location and friendly people
review: This is a nice hotel but there are very few onsite facilities. The Starbucks was always closed when you needed it most (at the end of long day site-seeing). The room we had was newly refurbished (to a high standard) and the view over Cambridge was superb. In room service was a bit strange (please Hilton, do not let this be the new standard for room service). It did not come as a room service tray --- it was more like a take-away (not my idea of a nice way to serve food and it wasn't cheap either). Other aspects of the hotel that were worthy of note (sorry to be negative) were the elevator service. If you are at a conference in the Hynes Centre, DO NOT leave it to the last minute to get to your venue --- the elevators are astonishingly slow (especially if you are on the top…

title: Excellent place and employees
review: This hotel is close to Boylston Street ad the Prudential Center (as well as Copley).  It was perfect for a fun weekend in Boston. The staff was great, and the room was very nice.  I expected a lot of "city noise," but it was actually very quiet at night.

title: ABIGAIL / EVERYONE ELSE AMAZING
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Wonderful Weekend Workshop
review: So cannot describe how good my stay was I informed Abigail that I was proposing to my fiance my room was then transformed and looked incredible she decorated my room with rose petals and champaign and chocolate covered strawberries it was absoultely above and beyond.  Again I cannot tell you how pleased I was with my stay.  the room was perfect.  I will absolutely be staying at this hotel anytime I am in the city

title: Good stay
review: I signed up for a weekend workshop with Paul Selig, I live in the Boston area but didn't want to drive into Boston each day on the weekend so and I am a Hilton Member so I decided to stay at the Hilton to save travel time.  I got a great deal on the price of the hotel, had a wonderful workshop and a great weekend.

title: Weekend stay
review: Best part of experience was the staff, very helpful and friendly. Happy to suggest restaurants etc. Rooms very nice (as expected) no issues arose during stay. Location was great for convention centre and 5 min walk from subway.

title: Really good value for money
review: Wonderful hotel, great location and amazing views from the upper floors, especially on the north side of the building. Parking is a bit pricey per night ($43) and the breakfast was also very expensive. Staff was very nice and helpful. Rooms were clean and in good condition.

title: Great location, recent renovations and service
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Excellent location and service
review: Property is centrally located within Back Bay and walking distance to everything!   I was placed in renovated unit, which was really nice and brand new!   View is great and staff is friendly.   Will definitely stay here again.

title: Very nice hotel
review: The location was close to Fenway park and Prudential Mall. Excellent staff and very clean rooms. It was easy to check in and they were helpful with any questions. I would recommend to my family and friends.

title: Great Hotel
review: Despite the complimentary connection wasn´t good (sometimes it didn´t work at all), the overall experience in the hotel was awesome. Great location, professional staff and a clean room made our stay to be a very affortable experience.

title: Great Location but hotel is average at best
review: Overall excellence, fantastic location, great staff. We had the king corner superior room which was very spacious and had a magnificent view of the river and the city. For the moment the only negative I could give is the noisy nearby construction which apparently runs 6 days a week.

title: Good Location
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Back Bay's Best!
review: Stayed there for the weekend January 6-8.  Hotel is a great location to shopping sand restaurants. A very easy walk to Boylston and Newbury Streets as well as the T stop of the Prudential Center.  Did not have much interaction with the staff other than at check-in. WI-FI was not working on the room on the 17th Floor at all.  Signal wasn't strong enough for some reason to allow connection.  Had a great view from the room of the river, Fenway and downtown areas.  Would definitely stay there again.

title: Good location, in walking distance to lots of great dining.
review: This hotel is in a prime location for anywhere you want to go in Boston. Outstanding value for a first class hotel! Very clean, spacious rooms! Quiet and comfortable! Excellent fitness center! I've stayed here 3 different times and never been disappointed! Can't wait to return!

title: 21st Birthday
review: Friendly and helpful staff at the front desk and in the coffee shop.  Good location to walk to many fine eateries in the area.  Not too far from Fenway Field. Clean, quiet rooms. Had a great time in the area.

title: The Staff Makes It!
review: Had a wonderful time spending my 21st Birthday here! Went with my boyfriend for the night with the MFA, Aquarium and Royale all on our list as well. With such close proximity to the T we were able to hop around the city with ease! When we first arrived (early) they took our bags and lets us enjoy the city. A few hours later and our room still wasn't available, and based on the holiday, we were upgraded from a panoramic view where construction was occurring to a 20th floor room with a view of the Charles River Basin. We were also told a bottle of wine would come as well but it just never arrived. By far one of my favorite stays in Boston. Would easily stay with them again!

title: Jan 2017
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. title: Hilton Back Bay - The Place to Stay
review: Clean efficient warm and comfortable. Bar was nice and friendly , service was great! Room clean and quiet slept both nights comfortable and cool, usually a problem to find a restful night sleep night 1, but fell  asleep and overslept night 1 and rested night 2 just as nice! Thank you!

title: Great location but delay in getting room
review: From our arrival to our departure the staff were helpful, polite and professional.  Our accommodation was comfortable, clean and the decor excellent. We would highly recommend staying at the Hilton was visiting Boston Back Bay.

title: Super clean and great team
review: We arrived before 3pm check in and as our Superior Corner room was not ready was offered another of a lower standard. However, the room on offer was not to our requirements, therefore we opted to leave our bags, book a room on the 20th floor for the view, and return after 3pm.  Upon our return our room was still not ready but was informed that it would be within 15 mins, 30mins passed and it was still not ready, another 30mins and still not.  It was now 4.15pm and the room I had pre-booked earlier (as an HHonors Member) was still not available.  I was offered another room of the same standard but on a lower 16th floor and offered a late book out time of 1pm.  I accepted this as time was getting on.  Whilst waiting other couples who’s rooms were not ready were getting abusive…

title: Can't expect more
review: This is the first hotel I was totally impressed with when it comes to cleanliness. My room was immaculate. Bathroom clean.  Bedding nice.  High dusting done. And even dusting on mirrors and pictures and all the vents.  The room attendant must take a lot of pride in what she does because it shows. I ran into her as I was departing and gave her that feedback too.  Even the front desk staff were great. Super friendly, quick, and helpful.  The gym was a nice departure from the ones I was in when I stayed at other Hampton Inn locations.  Thank you for an awesome stay and a super clean room. That should be expected but this is certainly the first time I've actually seen/experienced it.

title: Great location to explore
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Great hotel, perfect location
review: We were only here for about 36 hours but had a great stay. We got in around 9pm with two sleepy young children in tow. Checkout was quick and we were upgraded to a nicer room despite having booked via Hotwire. We managed to get to the bar/restaurant just before closing and the bartender couldn't have been more welcoming. We got a quick bite to eat before heading up to bed. Our room was clean and comfortable and had great blackout shades that kept our kids asleep just a bit longer than usual. Checkout was quick.  This location is great because it's directly across the street from the Sheraton, which offers access to the Pru for shopping and food. We visited during winter so wanted to spend as little time as possible outside and the location was perfect for that.

title: Very Satisfied
review: This hotel is situated in the perfect place. We were there for four days for the First Night First Day festivities to bring in 2017 and everything was within walking distance. The Logan Back Bay Express dropped us off at the Hynes Convention Center about 2 blocks away from the entrance, and if it's cold or raining outside you can cut through either the Hynes Convention Center or the Prudential Center to get to the hotel through the Sheraton lobby across the street. Copley Square, Copley Center, Boston Public Library, Boston Public Garden, Boston Common, Historic District (all picture signs, no neon or modern advertising), Downtown, Prudential Center, Fenway Park, and MIT are just a few of the places within walking distance from this hotel. Also, the hop on-hop off Boston Trolley…

title: Fabulous accomodations, location, and attentive staff
review: Spacious, clean rooms.  Very friendly staff.  Excellent location to Prudential Center mall with tons of shopping and restaurants.  Hilton Honors Wi-fi in rooms was not great, but did not want to pay $14.99 for premium service.  Parking in garage was $43 dollars.  Seems to be the going rate around town, even in other parking garages.

title: HAPPY DAYS
review: My boyfriend and I stayed here for New Years Eve, checking in on the 30th and staying until the 2nd.    First, this is a GREAT location.  The Prudential Center is a quick walk through the Sheraton across the street and up the escalator in the Prudential Center Mall.    Since it was New Years Eve, there was a bit of a line to check in, but it moved very quickly and the front desk clerk was very polite and helpful.  The bellman who assisted with our luggage was also very friendly and helpful.    As an HHonors Diamond member I suspect my room was an upgrade, but we had a panoramic view from our room with drapes that were electronically controlled to open to see the view - or close.  Great view, especially at night!  Room was spit-spot clean, with a king bed, sleeper sofa and a…

title: Great Location
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Great service but a bit dated
review: Great hotel with perfect location in Back Bay and right next door to the Prudential Center. Room was very pleasant and clean . Staff was great and very accommodating. Would definitely recommend. Will stay again.

title: Great stay
review: Small double beds in one room, very dated bathroom and good location.  The hotel staff are amazingly helpful and friendly and there is a Starbucks in the foyer which is convenient. The hotel is set just across the road from the Prudential shopping Centre and it takes about 30 mins to walk to the Common or a quick subway ride.  We didn't eat in the hotel, but we used the pool facilities which are also okay. Small pool but usable for a dip.  The beds are small so if you are used to a Queen or King you may struggle. Good coffee Machine in the room and ice machines on each floor are great.  It's a basic, good solution to a family holiday on a budget I would say, but don't have high expectations.

title: Great stay and price
review: We would first like to thank you for taking the time and effort to write a review about your stay with us. Your comments provide us with valuable feedback that we take into consideration in order to provide an exceptional guest service experience. On that note, we would like to sincerely apologize for failing to exceed your expectations during your stay. It is very important to us that we continuously uphold our Hilton Values and culture, and we regrettably did not do so. We hope that you will visit us again so that we have the opportunity to make it right for you and create a positive, memorable stay.  Warm regards,  Dominique Marty

title: Great location, everything else is average.
review: Hotel was a great experience. Location is fabulous and new remodeled rooms are wonderful.  Semir the front desk manager is super and very warm and friendly, very professional and so helpful. Mariah is excellent with fabulous customer service and very helpful.  Great stay !

title: Vacations in Boston

Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Price gouging food
review: Me and my family went to Boston on vacation and stay at the Hilton Bay Back. Excellent location and accommodations. Friendly staff, good fitness room with every think you need. But the best is the location, very close to the Prudencial Center, in winter you can walk at least 6 blocks indoors to downtown. If you don't want to expend a lot of money in breakfast you can go to the mall and eat. The mall have PF Chang, Eataly and others and in the corner summer shack for new England food.

title: Great location and amazing staff
review: Our room was average and clean, except for the sink, which had coffee grounds in it and there was a used q-tip on the floor.  Room service staff did deliver our meal as promised, but simply showed up at the door and handed me the bag of food at the door and walked away. She did not unpack the food or make sure our order was correct. I asked about a signature, she said it's all on your bill as she walked down the hall facing away from me. On top of that she expected a gratuity?  We later found out that were grossly overcharged for our room service. A total of $90 for two hamburgers and a child's meal! For the quality of this "fast food" packed in paper and plastic with no plates, this meal charge was an simple example of extreme price gouging. After questioning the charge at the…

title: A welcoming place in a great location
review: First and foremost, thank you for taking the time and effort to write us a thorough review on your stay with us at the Hilton Boston Back Bay. We understand your room service experience at our hotel did not exceed your expectations and would like to apologize. Our Director of Food & Beverage is reviewing your comments with the chef to ensure that our culinary and room service team are aware and strive to avoid such issues from arising. We would love to welcome you back and hope you will visit our restaurant again so that we have the opportunity to exceed your expectations.  Warm regards,  Dominique Marty

title: Above and beyond!
review: The location of the hotel is great if you want to experience and stay in the Back Bay area. The staff here went above and beyond every time, especially when I had to go to hospital. They checked in on me during my stay. Their advice for restaurants was great as well.

title: Well located for dining, shopping
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. In nice weather, restaurant patio seating is packed with Bostonians and tourists alike soaking up the sunshine and enjoying the food. Commonwealth Ave offers a beautiful stroll down residential tree-lined streets. Keep walking towards the Charles River and enjoy a beautiful view by the water. In warmer months, people run and bike on paths running along the esplanade, and sail and kayak on the Charles River. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Excellent Family Stay
review: We were very pleased with our stay at the Hilton Back Bay. The location is excellent with a multitude of restaurants a short walk away. The room was pretty standard for a business hotel and very quiet. The staff was helpful. We will stay at the Hilton Back Bay next time we visit Boston.

title: Great location!
review: Newly refurbished 26th floor (interconnecting) rooms were finished to a very good standard. Our stay was made special by the brilliant staff, who were always prepared to go out of their way. Gym is fantastic with a very large range of equipment.

title: Great staff from doorman to restaurant ...
review: Stayed here for a girls weekend.  Location was great.  Close to shopping and restaurants. Quick Uber ride or nice walk to most parts of Boston. Has a Starbucks which is great for grabbing coffee in the morning.  Staff was very helpful and friendly.

title: Nice location and room
review: We stay here a few visits a year for Red Sox and Bruin games, weekend get-a-ways and such - consistently helpful front desk, check-in staff, doormen and concierge.  Property well managed and comparatively quiet.  Easy to recommend.

title: Room was clean  - staff was polite - great location nearby shopping and restaurants (walking distance)
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Nicest hotel staff
review: Would stay here again - easy to drive to - parking near by - cleanliness of hotel - staff was knowledgeable of location and places to go - walking distance to restaurants and shopping - only minutes to down town Boston

title: Enjoy Stay before heading to the football game but disappointed with Wifi Issue. :(
review: Thank you Hilton Back Bay for the most wonderful two days.  My room was amazing. The bed was so comfortable. The view of Fenway was fabulous. The room was just redone and is so classy. I love the artwork and the use of textures and color. The hotel restaurant was fabulous and I was able to stay warm and eat right there. All the staff went above and beyond. But a special thank you to Mr. Semir Talic, who treated me like a princess and not only met all my expectations, but exceeded them. I have never experienced such a friendly staff. The hotel is in a great location. I will be back in March and the only thing I would change, is the weather. It was so cold outside, but the hotel and staff were so warm and friendly.  Thank you Semir. You are one of a kind and I am so thankful for…

title: Better than expected
review: I did enjoy staying here at this hotel on the top higher floor with nice newly undergo renovation and met some of the managers are nice and take care of my requests and other issues that I am concern during my stay.  However, I am disappointed with the Wifi issue have some kinds of technical issues on the higher top floors during my stay and it makes me feel frustrated.  I am highly recommend to this hotel need to be improve adding upgrade better network connection speeds for the Wifi on the higher top floors.  This location is a great closer to the Prudential Center.

title: Hilton - great as always
review: Thank you for taking the time and effort to write a review on your recent stay with us.  We are thrilled that your recent stay with us exceeded your expectations and would like to apologize for the service of our Wi-Fi.  For your next stay with us, please enjoy the excellent coverage of our complimentary Wi-Fi located throughout our lobby, Starbucks, and restaurant, Forty Dalton.  We would also love to sign you up as a member of our Hilton HHonors rewards programs, which offers amazing perks such complimentary Wi-Fi.  Your business and loyalty is appreciated, and we look forward to the next time you stay with us.  Warm regards,  Dominique Marty

title: Needs up-dating!
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. title: great location; great hotel!
review: I recently stayed at the Hilton Back Bay. I had stayed there about 7years ago and I found the hotel had not updated at all. The room was clean however, there was mold  on the tiles in the bathroom, and the pillows were over sized and very hard! A bottle of water was $8.00 ! The staff was extremely nice and courteous but the hotel lacked. We will be retuning in September but will be staying at a different hotel, for the money spent I would expect a finer experience.

title: Bostons economical answer to luxury
review: The Hilton Boston Back Bay would like to first thank you for taking the time and effort to write us such an informative review about our hotel. We deeply regret that your stay with us fell very short of your expectations, and you were disappointed by the cleanliness. Our Director of Housekeeping has been notified of this review and is working with the Housekeeping Department to ensure that our Hilton Values and culture are being upheld and exercised properly. We encourage that you stay with us again so that we can prove this recent stay otherwise and you can reconsider this review and rating.  Warm regards,  Dominique Marty

title: Great place to stay
review: This ia a very well located property. It has a good fitness center and indoor pool. We have a Gold Hilton Honors card and as a result were given free breakfast plus free evening hot appitizers starting at 5pm in the Honors Lounge. Our room was very clean and well appointed., and the staff was very accomodating. There is a parking  garage attatched to the hotel with its own elevator within the lobby. It a short dash across the street to the indoor shopping malls.

title: Excellent value for money
review: Off the beaten path, this hotel is smallish but very comfortable and near most everything you would need as long as your willing to walk.  Excellent for a business traveler or someone visiting this fair city.

title: Great Hotel
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: central and welcome
review: We stayed at the Hilton for one night this past weekend.  Our room wasn't ready when we arrived at 11:30 am (check in is at 3pm, but we requested early check-in if possible), so we dropped our bags and headed out.  The hotel called us when our room was ready.  We had a room with double beds on the 25th floor.  It was very nice and clean.  No complaints.  Another review mentioned the double beds being small.  They were not small, they were simply standard double bed sized.  They were very comfortable in our opinion.  We stayed here so we would be close to Symphony Hall, which was just a couple of blocks away.  It was also close to the Hynes Convention Center T station.  We liked that there is a Starbucks in the lobby.  It is a bit small with a limited selection of food.  When I…

title: Mediocre Stay
review: We felt really welcome at this Hilton Staff were great, rooms lovely.  Centrally located and really easy to find what you needed from this location. GREAT salad restaurant behind the Sheraton, for a healthy alternative.  Starbucks inside hotel is a bit more expensive than others

title: Excellent hotel
review: When we checked in to the hotel, our room was extremely hot. When we called down to the front desk to address the heat, they said that the temperature was controlled by the building and there was nothing we could do to adjust it. None of us slept Friday night because it was so hot. Also, if you're staying more than two people to a room, get two different rooms, because these "double" beds are not large enough for two people. These are double beds in Hilton's world only. The only good thing about this place is that the staff was friendly and it's in a good location. $26 for breakfast buffet? You can spend that on breakfast at a restaurant and it will be ten times better.

title: Another Terrific Stay   3 - 4 December 2016
review: Thank you for taking the time to commend our team members for providing you with excellent guest service. We are also thrilled to hear that the location of the Hilton Boston Back Bay afforded you. We appreciate the feedback you have provided and would like to apologize for the heating issue that arose during your stay. It is most unfortunate that those issues disrupted your stay, and your stay was not positively memorable. Guest comments such as yours are important to us and have been reviewed by the Director of Engineering. He has met with his team of engineers and all maintenance issues have been resolved. Please reconsider your decision to stay at another hotel in Boston on your next stay so that we could have the opportunity to exceed your expectations.  Warm regards, Dominique Marty

title: Great location; hotel needs some updating
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Good choice for a short visit
review: The rooms could use some TLC and updating to raise to the level of a Hilton.  Room service was excellent and fast.  The location is fantastic for shopping, walking to the Library and much more.  Valet staff were very helpful and enabled a feeling of safety.

title: Great hotel
review: We are thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your stay here at the Hilton Boston Back Bay and the convenience our location afforded you. Thank you for taking the time to commend our team members for providing you with excellent guest service. Providing positive and memorable experiences for our guests is the reason for our success along with our excellent location. Thank you for taking the time and effort to share your experience at our property with you. We hope you will stay with us on your next visit to our beautiful city and take full advantage of our prime location.  It would be our pleasure to welcome you back.  Warm regards,  Dominique Marty

title: Not worth the money
review: I staied at Hilton for two nights for business conference. A great choice for that kind of visit and for a short visit in Boston. The location is great, in a walking distance of central Boston. The room was lean and at good size with a big and comfortable bed.   Great location for a business confrenses and group meetings.

title: Below hilton usual standard
review: We are thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your stay here at the Hilton Boston Back Bay and the convenience our location afforded you.  Providing positive and memorable experiences for our guests is the reason for our success along with our excellent location. Thank you for taking the time and effort to share your experience at our property with you. We hope you will stay with us on your next visit to our beautiful city and take full advantage of our prime location.  It would be our pleasure to welcome you back.  Warm regards,  Dominque Marty

title: Excellent hotel

title: Poor Service at Hilton Back Bay
review: Family trip to Boston. We had 4 rooms. Terrific service and hotel . Great location so close to many Biston attractions like the Chrustuan Science main headquarters, very helpful staff. Great stay. Great hotel pool.

title: Very central
review: I had called the Hilton Back Bay at 9:00am the morning of our arrival to ask for a 1:00pm check-in time, the women I spoke to ensured me that our early arrival would not be a problem and to head down to the hotel. We took the early train & subway to Prudential Station and arrived at 1:30pm, our room was not ready so we checked our bag at the front desk and went for a late lunch and some shopping. The front desk staff took down my cell and said that they would give me a call when the room was ready in about 40 minutes. After not receiving a call from the hotel, we returned to the Hilton Back Bay at 3:30pm (Hotel Check-In Time is at 3:00pm) and were informed that our room was STILL not ready and would not be ready for another 40 minutes. The front desk staff, remembering us from…

title: GREAT LOCATION / COMFY BEDS
review: We would first like to thank you for taking the time and effort to review the Hilton Boston Back Bay on your most recent stay. As we continually strive to uphold the Hilton Values and culture, it is important for us to take guest comments into consideration in order to improve our guest service experience. We appreciate your feedback and would like to thank you for your patience with us during the check-in process. On that note, we would also like to sincerely apologize for failing to exceed your expectations and ultimately, create a positive, memorable experience for you. We would also like to apologize for the issues that arose concerning your room reservation.  We would like to accommodate all your needs and hope that you will stay with us again so you can reevaluate our efforts and review your next stay with us 5 stars.   Warm regards,  Dominique Marty

title: Wonderful City
review: Great spot if you want central location. Waking distance to lots of hot spots! Staff were very helpful, booking a bus to Wrentham for us to get all the bargains.!!! We were in a very small room, for 4 people,  the staff kindly moved us to a bigger room. We didn't dine here but the menu looked good. We had all our meals out at many of the fab restaurants near by.

title: Excellent Stay at the Hilton Back Bay
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: This hotel is our home away from home when we are in Boston
review: Great staff, great room, Boston is a great city. I could not have asked for a more satisfying experience.  From the check in to the check out, everything was perfect.  Thank you very much for a very, very positive experience!  I would definitely return to the Hilton Boston Back Bay!

title: Great service, awesome location
review: Great location. Great rates ( AAA, parent of college student discount etc), best sheets and pillows.. Good night sleep guaranteed. Small fridge and coffee maker in room.. A must! Great staff, and breakfast.

title: Frequent Business Traveler
review: I was here for a conference and I was very impressed with the service and professionalism of the staff. The rooms were immaculate and the beds were really comfortable. The staff at Forty Dalton and the Hilton Honors lounge were very professional and accommodating?

title: Review of Hilton Bay Back Hotel in Boston
review: Always a good experience - from Front Desk to Executive Breakfast Lounge, Housekeeping and Bar/Restaurant - always friendly and accommodating - for frequent travelers makes a difference to be greeted by friendly faces every week!

title: view from 25th floor
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: So so
review: This hotel has a very good team and is always willing to help. Always has a smile on their face. The view from the 25th floor is awesome-you are looking directly over the river and can see Fenway Park. Lots of lights in the evening.  Lots of windows to see all you would like to see. Thank you all for being very kind and friendly Definitely would stay here again as we love the back bay area.

title: Good location
review: I booked this hotel cuz of location. It's near from Hynes convention center. But the price was very expensive during conference (about 320$). The hotel restaurant was not delicious. But room clean was good.

title: Great place to stay in Boston
review: Thank you for taking the time to post a positive review about your stay at the Hilton Boston Back Bay.  We are thrilled to hear that the Hilton Boston Back Bay and the convenience our location afforded you.   We understand your dining experience at our restaurant did not exceed your expectations and would like to apologize. Our Director of Food & Beverage is reviewing your comments with the chef to ensure that our culinary and restaurant team are aware and strive to avoid such issues from arising. We would love to welcome you back and hope you will visit our restaurant again so that we have the opportunity to exceed your expectations.  Warm regards,  Dominique Marty

title: Great location
review: Very convenient location, close to convention center, shops, restaurants, transit.  but room not ideal for business travel - be sure to specify you need a desk if on business trip.  Updated bathroom but too dark for putting on makeup. Lots of hangers.

title: Executive Lounge Breakfast is a WOW
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Good value and location
review: Enjoyed this business trip with nice clean room, excellent quiet bar for evening business and a nice surprise with the Executive lounge breakfast- it had something for everyone. Staff is friendly and everyone smiles. Well done.

title: Pleasant, Clean, and Quiet
review: We chose this hotel in the Back Bay for a girls' getaway weekend and were very pleased with our room ( top floor,view of the Charles River) and our access within walking distance to shopping and restaurants . The staff are friendly and helpful and of course Boston is a great city to visit!

title: Great location
review: This hotel is located next to the Prudential Center Shops and restaurants. There is also easy access to Newbury Street. The staff was very friendly upon check-in, the room was nicely decorated and clean, and the room quiet. I really enjoyed my stay here and would certainly return.

title: Great Location!!
review: Was in town for a conference at the Hynes Convention Center. Great location to the meeting and easy access from the Sheraton which is across the street. lots of walkable areas (including Newberry Street) and restaurants to sample. Room was as you'd expect clean, good wifi  and coffee in room.

title: Great Location
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. title: Nice meeting rooms, but a bit behind in technology
review: I travel weekly to Boston on business and can say this Hilton is top notch. The rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable.  Close to many great restaurants and shopping.  The Executive lounge has a great breakfast but lacks a good happy hour.  The restaurant is small with a limited menu of choice, but walk just one block and you'll have plenty of choices.

title: OK stay with no AC as it was off for winter
review: The meeting rooms are nice, big and comfortable, with very nice food and lovely service. On the negative side the projector and the screen were a bit outdated what should be improved for an excellent experience.

title: Great Hotel
review: Arrived at hotel via the T. A short walk from the Hynes convention Center Station. On arriving at front desk, had a short wait. Agent was not particularly friendly and didn't thank me for Diamond status. Had already checked in on mobile app. Got my key and access to executive lounge with coupons for continental breakfast. Room on 18th floor. Sun bearing down on window. Room temp was very hot. Turned temp down and opened window. Finally by bedtime temp had gotten down to somewhat comfortable. Front desk said only heat was available as cold water for AC was turned off. Had same problem each afternoon as sun heated room to very uncomfortable level. Decor of hotel and room was excellent. Only 3 elevators for a hotel with over 20 floors means some longer than desired waits. Meeting…

title: Good hotel better location
review: This was our fist time at this Hilton and we weren't disappointed! As HHonors members I was able to choose a room ahead of our visit, so I called to get some information on the different rooms that were available. I spoke to Gesa who was very helpful and very pleasant to talk with. She helped me choose the best room for us and provided additional information about the hotel, some of the perks for a HHonors member and other little helpful tidbits. I was traveling into the city alone and meeting my husband there and wasn't sure how the check in and parking process went so when I pulled up to the front, Vern the Bellman immediately came over and explained the process, offered to take our luggage out of the trunk while I parked in the garage and kept it safe until I returned to the…

title: Comfortable and convenient, helpful staff
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Good hotel located in good location
review: I stayed at this Hilton because it was across the street from the Hynes Convention Center.  My room was perfectly comfortable, quiet and convenient, nothing obtrusive.  Food services in bar and restaurant were fine, staff friendly and very helpful. The fitness center was very nice, and there is a pool. I left my phone behind in my room, and it was located and sent to me quickly.  Thanks, Jason, and to others who helped!  Much appreciated!

title: Nice Hotel just outside the density of Downtown Boston
review: Nice size hotel with well appointed rooms and clearly well managed. Staff all very pleasant and helpful. Rooms are quiet despite being  in the Backbay area. The restaurant/bar is fine...does classic US bar food.....fries come as standard although the staff are very very chatty. Hotel has a business lounge that serves a good buffet breakfast and drinks throughout the day  There is a Starbucks also located in the lobby although it closes at 3pm. Good for business...not romance

title: Great location, but not well managed
review: It's a nice hotel and the staff were helpful. Clean and comfortable i had no issues.The Trolleys and T (subway) stations are about a 8-15 minute walk away so it's not super convenient if you want to use public transport to go deeper in to the city. Still it's doable considering the value.

title: Ideal Location
review: Visiting for college weekend, I had made reservations for a King Superior Corner Room 6 weeks before our trip. We arrived late (which I told them by email) and we were offered the last king bed on the 4th floor outside the elevator. No thanks. They then put us in a superior (upper floor) double for the night until a better room became available. The next morning we were assured they'd put a rush on a better room (upper floors, king bed), it took until 3:30 to get an upgrade. Ended up with a beautiful view of the Charles, but never got the corner room reserved 6 weeks prior.   Minor details: the coffee shop is never open, so go across the street to the Sheraton which has a full sized Starbucks.  We wanted a quick meal before going to the airport - The bar serves food but we…

title: Great hotel
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. In nice weather, restaurant patio seating is packed with Bostonians and tourists alike soaking up the sunshine and enjoying the food. Commonwealth Ave offers a beautiful stroll down residential tree-lined streets. Keep walking towards the Charles River and enjoy a beautiful view by the water. In warmer months, people run and bike on paths running along the esplanade, and sail and kayak on the Charles River. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Again it did it!
review: Great location, front desk staff is super nice. Our room was beautiful and clean, had a gorgeous view, and the bed was super comfy. On the con side the curtains weren’t blackout as we expected, and they didn’t open all the way. We did have a bad experience on our last day: in the morning before checking out the next people were allowed to check in and walked right in on us getting dressed. Needless to say it was incredibly awkward and from now on I will always be sure to use ALL the locks on a hotel room door! Overall we did have a good experience and would be likely to return.

title: Amazing View, Great Food, Perfect Service
review: I have been here many times and though the room we got this time was not the best, it did it quite well. Housekeeping at this hotel is better than average many Hiltons show these days.  Location is  good because you are near  the  tube and near Prudential Center. I love being near it because if time gets rainy, windy or cold -as it did this time- you can walk through Sheraton to the shopping and get many places to eat. It is very comfortable when travelling with kids. Complimentary Wi-fi (Silver HH)  was improved this time. Fitness Center has many walking machines and the swimming pool, though not big, is a place to relax when it is no "rush pool hour". Breakfast is good without  being luxurious. Breakfast room is nice and plenty of day light. This time we were not charged for…

title: Pre Cruise
review: Hilton Back Bay is in a great location near old Boston, shopping and convention center.    They also have a Diamond Lounge for frequent Hilton travelers.   The hotel is shaped like a triangle with rooms facing any direction. I like the view across the bay toward Harvard.

title: Good location, good people
review: We stayed here for 4 nights pre cruise.  The hotel is average, nothing special.  We had a room on the 5th floor so we didn't have a view of anything but a building next door.  Our room was clean which is always important.  We didn't find the location all that great I think if we were to every come to Boston again we would stay in the Downtown area, it seems closer to a lot more things.  This hotel is close to Newbury Street, Copley Square and the Prudential Centre.  I found it a little strange that when we checked in with 5 bags we weren't even asked if we needed help up with our bags.  As we were struggling off the elevator with our bags there was the Porter!  Even when he saw us with our luggage he never asked if we needed some help, he actually seemed a little annoyed he had…

title: Gorgeous Panoramic View
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings.
