Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Excellent place to stay while on business.
review: Loved staying here. Everyone was very helpful.  Room: we had a king room with panoramic view. It was lovely. A good size with comfy bed.  Great gym (we didn't use the pool).  I loved the location of this hotel. Back Bay is fantastic. Great shopping, great restaurants. Hop on Hop off bus stops right outside.  About $20 + tip in taxi from airport or $7.50 via Logan bus, which literally stops around the corner.  Would definitely stay here again.

title: Fantastic View, Fabulous Location, Great Staff - needs a little updating
review: This was my first trip to Boston and the staff at the Back Bay took care of your needs and the accommodations are nice, neat, and comfortable.  The staff answered any questions that I had about the location of different restaurants in the area and they assisted in making my trip memorable. Even after I left the hotel, I realized that I had left some items in my room and they were accommodating enough to get my items back to me. I am very appreciative of the staff for going above and beyond to meet my needs.

title: Conference Stay
review: I was very fortunate to get upgraded to a high floor with a view looking out towards Fenway Park and the Charles River.  That made all the difference as there was a building being constructed on the opposite side.   Check-in was a bit slow though as the lobby area was packed with people.  In fact the check-in and lobby area is quite small, likely due to the small footprint of the hotel.   Loved the location!  Easy walk to the subway on Huntington, easy walk to Copley Square and the indoor mall, as well as a little longer walk to Fenway Park. Enjoyed my experience here as the room was quite nice and I could sit and look out a the sailboats on the Charles River and watch the glow of the sunset.    The staff - especially on the 22nd floor - was great!   The elevators were quick and…

title: Great location for convention center
review: The bed was was extremely comfortable awesome.  My Bath tub needed to be cleaned. Never received additional bath linens. Infact I don't believe that room service ever came into my room. The internet kept going out but it worked well when it was on.  Location is great, close to a lot of attractions.

title: Great location
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Friendly staff- Rooms in need of an update
review: The hotel is what you'd expect from a Hilton. Nice clean rooms and really good service. The location is great. You are just a short walk from all the local bars and restaurants. It isn't cheap but then it's location and the time of year makes nowhere really cheap.

title: Fabulous view;great walking location
review: I read reviews of this hotel before I stayed here however was pleasantly surprised with the friendly staff. The lady who checked me in was friendly and very personable. I had to check out at 4am and again, the gentleman who checked me out was    friendly and efficient at 4am! The woman at the 'Starbucks' off the lobby was sweet and accommodating.   During my stay I walked to Fenway one morning and it was about a .8 mile 15 min scenic walk. Newbury St  and Prudential shopping was very close as well.    For a Hilton, I found my room to be out of date and resembling more of a Hampton quality with the fixtures, finishings, decor and style. I would have expected something a bit of a step up for this brand. The lobby area was nice and upscale and what I would expect.

title: Excellent
review: Very happy with my stay here. Had a room on the 20th floor over looking Boston, the Charles river and MIT. I have stayed in this part of Boston beef so I knew it was a bit farther to the historic area but walkable about one mile to Boston commons for the start of the Freedom trail. About one half a mile to walk to fenway and only a couple of blocks to Newbury street. Also the old town trolley stops right in front. There is a Starbucks in lobby for a quick breakfast.

title: Just another...Hilton
review: Whenever possible, I keep coming back to this Hilton. Reasons are simple, the staff is extremely nice, courteous,and helpful. Another extremely valuable bonus is the Diamond Lounge, accessible using your room key card if you are lucky to be either Gold or Diamond elite. It is not stocked like the ones in Asia or Europe with beer or wine, but the aluminum-bottled (Yes, bottles, not cans) soft drinks are classy. The lounge itself is an oasis for getting away from the crowd and noise.  Location-wise, it's middle of the city, shopping, museums, restaurants, are plentiful and you won't be disappointed.

title: Great hotel, my go-to place for visits to Boston Back Bay
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. In warmer months, people run and bike on paths running along the esplanade, and sail and kayak on the Charles River. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: A good place to stay
review: Stayed at the Hilton Back Bay several times over the past 9 months. The rooms are clean, modern, and well maintained. The location is convenient to the Green Line Hynes T stop. And the hotel is just steps away to the Prudential Shopping Center and Convention Center (you can cut through the Sheraton across the street if you're avoiding bad weather). Newbury Street and Boylston St restaurants are just blocks away.  The staff is polite and friendly. I appreciated the lobby bar for a late snack or beverage. There is a tiny shop by the check in desk to purchase snacks and sundries. Elevators were quick.  We had a corner room the first time which was cozy. We've also stayed in higher floor view rooms with gorgeous views of the Charles River.   Will definitely stay here again.

title: $420/night with Service Seriously Lacking
review: I chose to stay at this hotel because it was within walking distance to many thing; work, food, transportation, and friends who live in the city.  I would stay in this location again if I were in the area for business.

title: Pretty Good Stay
review: This hotel takes advantage of the fact that there are insufficient hotel rooms in the area to accommodate the size conventions that Boston is able to land.  I was attending a meeting at another hotel and decided to stay here, due to Hilton Diamond status. The physical plant is okay...a little dated...across from Prudential Center restaurants but a hike from Boston Common (requires taxi/uber). Rooms are decent size, upholstery on chaise lounge is threadbare, tiny bathroom with bathtub and insufficient ventilation. There is an indoor pool and hot tub but it closes at 10:00pm so unable after business dinners to use it (most Hilton's keep it open until 11 or 12).  Where this hotel leaves little to be desired is the service (or lack thereof).  Starbucks in the lobby is supposed to…

title: Great Location and Nice Team
review: We would first like to thank you for taking the time and effort to write a review about your stay with us. Your comments provide us with valuable feedback that we take into consideration in order to provide an exceptional guest service experience. On that note, we would like to sincerely apologize for failing to exceed your expectations during your stay. It is very important to us that we continuously uphold our Hilton Values and culture, and we regrettably did not do so. We hope that you will visit us again so that we have the opportunity to make it right for you and create a positive, memorable stay.  Warm regards,  Dominique Marty

title: Back bay Hilton
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Great location,would stay again.Started off with a problem. Which did get sorted.
review: While SUPER expensive, very nice hotel. Centrally located. I wish they didn't charge so much for overnight parking.  Rooms are nice bough. Quiet. Great view. Overall assuming you can afford this hotel, it's very nice.

title: Boston
review: Had a bit of a problem to start with. We had tried booking online the night before going,when it got to stage 4 of 5 in the booking,it came up saying, couldn't guarantee a non smoking room? Couldn't get any further,so we rang reservation and a very helpful lady sorted it for us,she was surprised it had come up saying this, as it is a non smoking hotel! As we had booked a ' stay and park' package,she said we would receive an email and to print of the parking package. Waited and waited and it never came. A bit later I logged into my hhonors and it was all booked. I just went with the room that came up. As it was now quite late, I didn't go into all the details. Next morning I went on again, as still hadn't received an email. When I opened the whole set of details, it had been…

title: Disappointing Business Stay
review: Great hotel and great staff. I would encourage travelers to consider this Hilton. Great location that allows you to walk to so many places in Boston. The Diamond/Gold lounge is great and has a great staff.

title: you get what you pay for
review: I attended for business purposes, I was disappointed - please see below (the Bad).  At this price, go somewhere else and get a better experience.  There is solid competition in the same area and no reason you should deal with the multiple small disruptions that I had to.  The Good: - Well decorated and spacious room - Courteous Staff - Great location  The Medium: - Expensive, in line for the area - noisy plumbing, not an issue for myself but if you expected a very quiet room, this would trouble you  The Poor: - the first room smelled of moist cigarettes; it was changed without issue - night desk staff spoke with friends throughout half of my stay when I was working late in the lobby; simply not professional and disruptive - poor wifi, disconnections frequently disrupted work; no…

title: Beautiful hotel
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: In the heart of it all
review: Good hotel made great with the lovely staff. Good location for touring, nice comfortable beds in quiet surroundings  with no disturbances, plenty to eat in the morning, overall everything really good- I Will recommend.

title: Well placed hotel
review: Hilton Back Bay may not be the fanciest of all in Boston, but the location and service have the Taj beat for sure! We spent 4 days at this location while friends stayed at the Taj. The difference in service was crazy - Bell service was fantastic we never had to wait for a cab - 10 seconds and we were gone - one night we actually past our friends in the cab who were still waiting for cab service in front of the Taj as the bell man was not around - crazy!   The room manager Semir Talic was wonderful as well as the rest of the house keeping staff - extra towels without asking.  Front desk check in was a breeze - as well as check out.  Location was great easy walking to everything. We will be back for sure. Ask for high floor - windows open and you get a nice breeze of fresh air…

title: Nice Facility and convenient
review: We stayed at the Back Bay Hilton for 2 nights at the start of a New England leaf peeping tour. It is well situated for walking to south end attractions & shopping in the Prudential Centre as well as browsing on Newbury St/ Boylston St as well as a wander down Commonwealth Avenue. The common is also walkable. The staff were very friendly & helpful. There was a good choice of options at breakfast too.

title: Best Hilton in Boston!
review: I was roomed on the 14th floor.  My room was quiet and very comfortable.  Great housekeeping staff.  Front desk personnel very accommodating.  There is a Snack bar off the lobby with Starbucks coffee. I only at breakfast while there, but they put out a very nice buffet.  My only beef is that, like most other hotels I stay at, they offer PCs and printers for guest use, but they never seem to work properly.  1 of the 4 units PPCs and 1 of the three printers were not working.  The PCs are in serious need of updating and debugging.

title: Pricey run of the mill hotel
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Nice hotel
review: There is nothing to write home about here..  very small lobby, strange drive-way on a side street, and weird shaped building.  Rooms were fine.  Do request a high floor  though - I was on the 11th floor with a wonderful view of the nearby buildings roof a/c, vents, etc (kept the drapes closed...).  On the positive side: I got lots of Hilton Hhonors points thanks to the high rate.......  For the money, there are better choices nearby.

title: Excellent lodging
review: We appreciate the time you took to rate your stay at the Hilton Boston Back Bay. It is unfortunate that your stay with us was not exemplary as reflected in the rating. Our priority is to create positive, memorable, guest service experiences and strive to continue to do so through feedback provided by our guests. We hope that you will stay with us again so that we can fully accommodate your needs and exceed your expectations. Your business and loyalty is important to us.  Warm regards,  Dominique Marty

title: Boston IAMFA trip
review: The staff was great and it was located in a great area plenty of things to do and see enjoyed the indoor pool even though it was cool outside! Hotel was clean and nice beds would go again and stay there

title: Great stay
review: When I stay at a Hilton, I have high expectations. This location did not disappoint. It was an excellent stay in almost every respect. The room was clean and quiet and I was upgraded to a room with a nice view. The breakfast buffet was very good, though a bit pricey. The complementary internet was awkward to use and I experienced a bit of trouble printing from a USB thumb drive through their business center computers. These are relatively minor issues and all in all, my stay was fine.

title: Comfortable Stay but Expensive
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Safe bet
review: Stayed at this hotel for business. It is located close to the Hynes Convention Center and that makes it appealing. Access to the parking garage was super easy. My room was quite and in general clean and the bed was comfortable. It appears that some decor changes are needed maybe to brighten the rooms up. Staff was pleasant and helpful. There was wine and cheese one of the nights in the lobby. The place however is expensive and besides the state and city tax, there is also a convention center tax. I am sure that is the case for other hotels near by.

title: Anniversary visit as part of a group
review: Stayed here for 2 nights over a weekend whilst between business trips. Its exactly what you would expect, a simple standard Hilton. Quite good, but not brilliant location - if you could you would spend the extra few bucks and stay in The Lennox which is just down the road and has much more character and much more central location, but you cant really fault this place.  Its what i would call an essential safe bet - got all the bits that hilton hotels have, its quite comfortable without having the luxurious beds of the Westins, its quite well appointed without having the toiletries of a more boutique hotel, its quite central without being in the center of the action, its not hip and its certainly not cool, but as the old IT saying goes 'nobody ever got sacked for buying IBM' so i…

title: Hilton Back Bay Boston
review: We would first like to thank you for taking the time and effort to write a review about your stay with us. Your comments provide us with valuable feedback that we take into consideration in order to provide an exceptional guest service experience. On that note, we would like to sincerely apologize for failing to exceed your expectations during your stay. It is very important to us that we continuously uphold our Hilton Values and culture, and we regrettably did not do so. We hope that you will visit us again so that we have the opportunity to make it right for you and create a positive, memorable stay.  Warm regards,  Dominique Marty

title: Great hotel and location
review: Visited this hotel as part of a travel group. Staff on hearing our anniversary showed their kindness in strawberries and fizz🍾🍾 lovely touch. Aside from this room large and clean, comfy bed, full facilities - tried out pool on 7th floor and hot tub- careful it is hot. Note no poolside shower and lockers a little tricky to use if limited eyesight. Breakfast plentiful. Easy walking access to the common, down Boylston street into town. Prudential centre nearby with great cocktail lounge on 52nd floor.

title: Disappointed
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Fabulous
review: My new husband and I stayed here for two nights of our honeymoon, when we arrived after being up for 22 hours the desk staffed seemed to be more bothered about getting my credit card than welcoming us to the hotel, we weren't told anything about the hotel -breakfast times check out etc!  Our travel company later informed us that paperwork for the reminder of our road trip was supposed to be handed to us on our arrival this was not done. The room was just OK we've had better rooms and treatment at the cheaper hotels we stayed at after this one. We were really disappointed since we upgraded to this hotel. We would not stay here again.

title: The first of six hotels on an East Coast tour taking in Boston, Newport, New York, Philladelphia, Lancaster  Washington
review: We appreciate your feedback and would like to thank you for your patience with us during the check-in process. On that note, we would also like to sincerely apologize for failing to exceed your expectations and ultimately, create a positive, memorable experience for you. This review has been brought to the attention of our Director of Front Office and he has addressed the guest services team.  We hope that you will reconsider your decision on staying with another hotel in Boston because we would love to have the opportunity to make it right for you. It is important that we accommodate all your needs and welcome you to stay with us again  Warm regards,  Dominique Marty

title: Disappointing, could have been great. Let down by poor communication and lack of commitment to customers
review: My newly finance and I really have fun traveling and the Hilton really made us feel comfortable with the luxury of there Corner room overlooking the prudential building and Newbury street. A Valentine's Day extravaganza the hotel provided champagne and glasses and with my secret spy tactics I was able to have the sprinkle rose peddles. They were so accommodating. The restaurant in the Hotel was  Delish I recommend eating there . ... would love to stay again if the prices were a little cheaper. Thank you again Hilton

title: First time visit to Boston , MA
review: The Hotel is 15 minutes away from the airport, so to the inexperienced driver to the US, is not a great distance away, remember to get easy pass and no refuel on gas added to your car package, oh and a satnav, we added breakdown, but didn't need it. the hotel does a no fee parking package, remember to get this before you travel, as your travel agent will not help you save $43 a day parking. the staff are friendly and helpful, the bar has charm and does bar meals, the room was a double and had ample space to move around, free wifi and were cleaned and serviced to a high standard. the hotel is within walking distance of Fenway Park, try and enjoy a baseball game if you have time, the shopping district is 10 mins walk and its 1/2 hour to Harvard on the T Boston's underground…

title: Terrific hotel
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: All's well.  I will stay here in future.
review: Large room, heated indoor swimming pool with whirlpool, and located near two upscale malls and great restaurants. Staff was very friendly and checked on us right after we checked in.  Terrific location about a 10 minute walk from Amtrak and T station.  The Fitness center is awesome with the latest equipment.

title: Typical Hilton Quality
review: Loved the mid week stay, albeit too short, on all accounts.  Wonderful service, wonderful room with amazing views over the Charles River towards Cambridge and wonderful location.  The hotel is situated next to the hop on, hop off trolley bus stand that takes you around on various tours to see the main sights of Boston (Boston Common, Freedom Trail, Cheers bar and so,so much more).  We took this bus tour on our full day in Boston which has live and informative commentary onboard, the vehicle is purpose built to accommodate weather and it is really worth doing if you only have a short time to spend to become somewhat acquainted with the city.  Take the harbour cruise package that comes with one of the deals.  After the cruise we went to the fabulous nearby Quincy markets housed in…

title: Excellent Service, Clean Hotel
review: Big room, comfy bed (hate the down pillows though, we always call and request a more firm pillow), and impeccable service from the doorman right through to every employee we encountered.  The downside of most Hiltons is cost-Back Bay set us back about $400/night, and $15 wifi that was slower than what I could get for free at a Motel 6-trust me on that.  Of all hotels I stay at, the Hilton consistently has the worst wifi.  Location is great and we always felt safe.  About a 12 minute walk to Fenway or 30 minutes to Boston Common which appears to be the tourist hub.  There is a subway station nearby if walking isn't your thing, but I'd recommend the walk to Boston Common via Commonwealth Street which is a gorgeous street with a green space right down the middle and upper end row…

title: Nice
review: I stayed at this hotel for business in September. I am extremely picky regarding cleanliness, and this hotel was immaculate. Fitness center was open 24 hours, and provisions were excellent. The Executive Business Center had decent accommodations. I had to adjust my dates outside of the "free cancellation" window, and though rates had increased, staff was able to offer the same rate I had initially booked. Excellent bell service and friendly staff. Housekeeping immediately brought extra towels to my room late in the evening upon request. Thoroughly satisfied with this property.

title: Inconsistent Customer Service
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. In nice weather, restaurant patio seating is packed with Bostonians and tourists alike soaking up the sunshine and enjoying the food. In warmer months, people run and bike on paths running along the esplanade, and sail and kayak on the Charles River. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Just right!
review: We chose this Hilton for the convenience to our work assignments in the area.  We also liked that it was near Newberry Street and restaurants and had a great workout gym, large indoor pool and hot tub.  They also have an executive lounge for Diamond members with free breakfast, afternoon snacks, and Starbucks coffee available 24 hrs.  We truly enjoyed and appreciated all of the above.     Front desk customer service was very inconsistent.  There was one lady at the front desk who had a nonchalant air about her. We had a particular request but she denied it, telling us she had to "follow protocol".   When we poised the request to someone else on the next shift, it was granted with a smile!  As Diamond Honors members, we like to be shown a little appreciation for spending three…

title: Great stay, good location.
review: Thank you for taking the time and effort to write a review about your recent stay at the Hilton Boston Back Bay. It is important that we constantly take guest comments into consideration so we appreciate the feedback you have provided. On another note, please accept our deepest apologies for failing to exceed your expectations. This review has been brought to the attention of our Director of Front Office and will be addressed in their upcoming department meeting. Please reconsider us the next time you visit Boston so that you can reevaluate our performance. We would love to welcome and provide you with a 5 star experience.  Warm regards, Dominque Marty

title: Red Sox vs Yankees
review: I attended a conference across the street at the Sheraton and the location was perfect for exploring the city. The staff was friendly and helpful. Our room was well appointed and fairly quiet considering their is a fire station just up the street. I would recommend staying on a higher floor.

title: Great trip for conference
review: The hotel was clean and had a fantastic gym a hotel. The hotel was full and there was hardly any noise. Beds were comfortable but the bathroom was small and had no fan. I hate that.   Bars, restaurants, clubs and shopping surrounded the area and it was close to the T. Overall it was a nice stay.

title: Hilton Boston Back Bay
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. title: Great hotel located across the street from Sheraton and convention center. Enjoyed being centrally located.
review: The hotel was very clean and staff were very helpful and friendly.  They are in a great location with lots of options for dining and shopping nearby.  The only issue I had was that my room was my room was really warm even with the thermostat turned way down.

title: Hilton Boston Back Bay
review: Great stay and service at the Hilton.  Enjoyed the very comfortable bed and amenities. Would suggest having soft drink vending machines.  Centrally located so could walk to lots of different sights.  The city has much to offer.

title: Quick trip to boston
review: Hotel is nice, clean, breakfast was super yummy (a little on the expensive side for a buffet though), staff is very friendly and the view from our room was beautiful!! The fitness center is really nice and it is close to Newbury St shopping and some good restaurants.  The bell hop at the front door was so nice,  he helped us get a cab and with information on the area.

title: great place to stay
review: Overall the hotel was very nice. The only reason I didn't give a 5 is bc nothing wowed me except the bartender at the restaurant. I don't remember his name but he said he was from Cuba. He was awesome and recommended some restaurants to us. The only disappointments I had was the view from the room and the over priced room service. I booked the panoramic Window room. When I looked at a map(using my iPhone) there was nothing blocking the view and of course when we got there there was a newly built condominium across the street! Ugh! I wouldn't really pay the extra to get those rooms.But overall the staff was very friendly and the rooms nice. Good location in back bay too to all of the restaurants, shops and subway.

title: Comfortable & clean
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Nice Hotel
review: Everyone here is so nice! Starting out with the bellman who assured me my, then enroute luggage, would be delivered to our room as soon as it arrived at the hotel, thank you! Check in was a breeze as the front desk staff was very accommodating. Our room was blah, but the cleanliness made up for that. Bed & pillows were very comfortable. The bar area was a good size and serves food as well. A nice place to sit back, relax and having a cocktail and munchies. The bartenders were awesome! It's an ideal location for a short walk to Fenway.

title: Overpriced, Tiny Lobby and Average Service
review: Had a really comfortable 4 night stay here. Everything was clean and easily accessible. Good location, close to shopping/dining, and a short walk to Boston Common, Cambridge, Museums, etc. The room itself was fairly standard (nothing "wowed" me) but I didn't spend a whole lot of time in it to care. Would definitely stay here again!

title: Great
review: I arrived at the hotel around 9PM, there were two associates at the counter talking. As I approached them, none of them seemed to care, I had to start asking I want to check in please, one associate told me wait a sec and then he just disappeared and went back to the office. The other associate who checked me in literally did not look at me, and only said three phrases to me: last name, first name and elevator something (his voice is so low I couldn't hear him clearly.) The upside is the room is very clean and the AC was already on when I walked into the room.

title: Perfectly adequate convention hotel
review: We would first like to thank you for taking the time and effort to review the Hilton Boston Back Bay on your most recent stay. As we continually strive to uphold the Hilton Values and culture, it is important for us to take guest comments into consideration in order to improve our guest service experience. We appreciate your feedback and would like to thank you for your patience with us during the check-in process. On that note, we would also like to sincerely apologize for failing to exceed your expectations and ultimately, create a positive, memorable experience for you. We would like to accommodate all your needs and hope that you will stay with us again so you can reevaluate our efforts and review your next stay with us 5 stars.   Warm regards,  Dominique Marty

title: Two-day City Break
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: view is fantastic and rooms are comfy
review: Great Location, walked to Fenway Park, Cheers Bar and the Market area. The Staff were extremely helpful and the bar tender was excellent, entertaining and informative. The management could not do enough for us. Room very comfortable. If returning to Boston would certainly stay here again.

title: Friendly staff and close to Fenway
review: Was there for a weekend with a friend and we each had a room on the 24th floor. The views were great, could watch it for hours. The bed was very comfortable and our rooms were quiet, so we slept great. I also used the pool which was a good size and temperature. It was walking distance to Newbury street, and when we did need a cab, there was someone there to hail one for us.

title: Great Location!
review: The hotel is conveniently located and a short walk to Fenway Park. Parking is expensive $43/night but very convenient and safe. The rooms were clean and updated. My only complaint was a faint smoke smell that was either the hidden remains of a former smoking room or someone not abiding by the "no smoking" policy.

title: Great Hotel
review: Friendly staff and great location make this Hilton a very good choice when visiting Boston. Very close to Fenway, shopping and restaurants. About a 30 minute walk into the historic district. Stayed on the Hilton Honors floor in a corner room which was very clean and spacious. Beds were comfortable. My only complaint was the lighting in the bathroom. The brightest lighting is over the shower with very dim lighting over the vanity. So strange. It made it impossible to apply makeup because you couldn't see. My husband also found it difficult to shave.

title: Perfect stay in the heart of the Hub
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. In warmer months, people run and bike on paths running along the esplanade, and sail and kayak on the Charles River. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Great Location, Good Rates
review: We stayed on a Friday night, coupling it with a Sox game and fun activities the next morning. We stayed in an upper floor "Superior" King room. The view was spectacular - we could even see the harbor in the distance! Other rooms have great views of Cambridge or look west towards Fenway, etc.  Our room was clean and spacious with everything in perfect condition. Check in was a breeze - the garage is very convenient. I felt a little weird giving my bags to one of the front desk staff at the front door though since he wasn't wearing a uniform or name tag. It worked out, although he did leave the bags in the lobby by the front desk. It just didn't seem like a smart thing to do in the city. But it worked out.  It is not that far of a walk to Fenway. Less than a mile if I remember…

title: Business Trip
review: I stay here often, as it's convenient and comfortable.  I especially like the Diamond Lounge, which Hilton Honors people have access to, as it has a full breakfast, as well as coffee, water and soft drinks during the day.  The fitness center is big.  Beds are comfortable and the pillows are down, a big plus from my standpoint.  Free internet for Hilton Honors guests as well.

title: Friendly staff and great location
review: Great location close to convention center. Rooms are nice. Sometimes with fridge and micro. Staff was great especially house keeping. Breakfast was not included, but there are many choices with in walking distance. Dining in the hotel is pricey. Dinner spots and bars are also close by.

title: Very nice hotel in perfect location
review: Easy access to the T, shopping, restaurants and Logan Express airport shuttle. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. They greeted us each time we arrived back at the hotel Breakfast was great and wait staff was always welcoming and helpful. Hot tub was very good. Hotel was clean. Definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Met our expectations
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Will be back to back bay again!
review: Arrived here an hour early after our stay in NYC, it wasn't ready but we were early and we were offered another room but not the room type we had booked.  We had booked a superior King room which was high above the city and away from any noise. Our room was spacious, well equipped, clean and kept clean during our stay.  The staff were professional, friendly and helpful. Just a short walk away there are lots of restaurants and bars to choose from.  Overall this is a very good hotel.

title: Jackson Browne & James Taylor Fenway Show
review: A comfy mid range hotel. Staff are fabulous and friendly! Clean rooms with amazing pillows, had great nights sleep. Hotel is very close to the Mapparium and I would definitely recommend a visit. Another bonus is the trolley bus stops just outside (you must purchase ticket first from hotel)

title: Reasonable rate but shocking experience
review: We stayed at the Hilton Back Bay in 2015 after attending the James Taylor show at Fenway. The hotel is located a short walk from Fenway so it was an easy decision to go back again this year! Staff is very helpful and the rooms are clean. If you are in Boston for an event or game at Fenway don't hesitate to book this hotel.  Tip: I got a better rate through Trip Advisor than on Hiltons site.

title: Make sure your door is LOCKED
review: I stayed at the hotel the first week of August for a family trip. Hotel prices are very expensive in Boston. I considered the Hilton Back Bay for prime location, reasonable rate and there is a swimming pool. The overall stay was fine. When we checked in, the front desk lady was not too friendly, but the room she assigned was fine: clean and comfortable. The pool was disappointing as it is very dated. It does not look like the hotel picture at all. Anyway, we considered we spent most time out and the time at the hotel was minimal. It was fine until the night before we checked out. It was around 11pm. I was in bed half asleep where my husband and my kid were watching TV. Someone was trying to open our room door with a key several times! My husband went opened the door and found 2…

title: Good Location to the Convention Center
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Berklee Move-In
review: This hotel is conveniently located to the Conventions Center and surrounding sights within walking distance. The room was nicely set up and quiet, just some construction that was going on across the street which started surprisingly early in the morning.

title: Good stay but not perfect
review: Great location, and relatively good value for the area. The bar/lounge is quiet and a nice place to unwind after sight-seeing. Excellent parking due to in-out privileges. The staff is friendly and accommodating

title: Reasonable hotel
review: Like staying here because of its great location in the heart of Boston as well as usually good service.  This time the visit was not without minor glitches but still an overall good stay.  The front desk agent worked and got me in a room two hours before check in which I greatly appreciated. The free Diamond breakfast the next day was also good and plentiful. The room was exceptionally clean too. My complaints, no internet connection- never got it to work butt as I told the manager didn't troubleshoot too hard either as I wasn't in room much. My bigger complaint was their bar doesn't open till 3pm and you can't find a drop of alcohol anywhere in the hotel prior.  Given I started traveling at 4am that day, a relaxing drink at 2pm would have been great. It's Boston, the big city…

title: Stayed here on Red Sox trips, always enjoyable
review: Hotel with average service level. The main advantage of the hotel is its location and proximity to colleges and Fenway park and shopping centers.   The staff is usually cooperative especially the concierge. The dining facilities are average however there are plenty of choices available in the vicinity. I will suggest the place as a business accommodation where one is away for work for most part of the day.

title: BEST HOTEL STAFF EVER
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Fabulous Club Lounge
review: I just had to write and give a very special shout out to a Mr. Calvin Napoleon Cherry who works the front dest at the Hilton Back Bay !!!  He made my entire trip!  If you stay at the Hilton, you need to make sure to meet him.  He knows EVERYTHING about all the restaurants around town and makes the VERY BEST recommendations.  We had such a great time. I always ended my night with laughs, stopping by the front desk to chat with Calvin, before going up to my room.  I will stay at the Hilton Back Bay for all of my trips to Boston.  Thank you so much Calvin!!!!!!  Oh and the rooms were great too!!!

title: Great location, superb service, good value
review: I wanted to not only praise the hotel itself for its courteous and helpful employees overall but to make a special mention about the Club Lounge which is always welcoming and comfortable. Most especially the wonderful Memsura by whom we are always welcomed back like family and who goes the extra mile to make our time there as pleasant as possible. Many thanks for yet another memorable stay.

title: Red Sox weekend
review: Hotel was located across the street from my conference. When not working, I found shopping and restaurants very convenient. Staff service was impeccable. I was made to feel welcome and important. The room was clean and relatively spacious. Only problem that I had was with an excess of air conditioning in the lobby.

title: Comfortable stay
review: Went to Boston for Red Sox game. Location of the Hilton Back Bay was great. About a 10 minute walk to Fenway. Room was nice - stayed on the top floor, thanks to Jon and Benjamine! Breakfast Buffet was great! Benjamine at the front desk went above and beyond!

title: Decent facilities
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Where I stay for Conventions
review: Decent hotel in a good location, gym is relatively well equipped for a hotel of this type. Pool ok. Good access to plenty of great restaurants and no more than a kliometre to the start of the freedom trail.

title: Good location
review: Yes, this Hilton is were I generally stay for events at the Convention Center.  While not my favorite place in town.  It will have to do because I'm a loyal Hilton Honors members.  If I wasn't... I would be staying elsewhere.  Which I have on many occasions by using the subway to and from the convention center. The hotel has an older feel throughout and a very tight lobby and eating areas.  Rooms are average but clean.

title: Brilliant people
review: Thank you for staying at the Hilton Boston Back Bay. I appreciate your honesty. We look for reviews to provide insight into our hotel and are very sorry you were unhappy with our hotel. I welcome any additional comments or suggestions you would like to share.

title: Weekend in Boston
review: Hotel is located right next to the Prudential Center in back bay, opposite to Sheraton Boston hotel. Walking distance to shopping street, restaurants and top attractions (Skywalk in Prudential, and duck tour Prudential Center, and Copley). Room is normal size, facilities include an indoor pool and a small heated jacuzzi pool where we spent some time in the evening. The lounge on ground floor provides breakfast buffet and evening snack food, which are modest but adequate. Interestingly a breakfast voucher is needed for the breakfast in the lounge and you need to pay 10 dollars to upgrade it to the full buffet in the restaurant next to it. Hotel is generally clean and functions well, but shows age and feels worn in some places. Not much other Diamond benefit offered during our…

title: Nice get away
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. title: Back bay
review: Loved the Hilton we really had a wonderful time. Easy to get around. Boston is amazing. Everyone there is so helpful. They wanted to make sure your time there was perfect and enjoyable. And they were absolutely professional

title: Whatever Happened to Hilton Quality
review: Hotel in a great location. Walking distance to restaurants and Fenway. would return to the back bay area if visiting boson again in future. Hilton property was clean, staff was helpful to give directions, and price was a good value.

title: Good location, good room, good service.
review: I made a reservation for this site several months in advance.  I requested a room close to family members who were also staying.  We even followed up 3 days before check-in to be sure the rooms were close to each other.  On check-in, one room was ready for my family.  My room, which was on the same floor, but not close, was not ready.  This was at 3:30 in the afternoon; thirty minutes before the formal check-in time.  I waited almost an hour before the room was prepared.    It would have been nice to be comped with a breakfast voucher or something.  And breakfast being approximately $26 each for the buffet was pretty sad.  I helped myself to the Eggs Benedict.  The english muffin could not be cut into because it obviously sat in the hot pan for too long.  If you cannot…

title: No More True Room Service Ugh
review: First of all, thank you so much for your review of your past stay at The Hilton Boston Back Bay. I apologize that we were unable to accommodate your room request. Our Front Office department goes through a lengthy process each day to ensure that our Guests receive exactly the room expected, however at times we do not have the same availability due to guests extending their stays with us. Once again, I apologize for the inconvenience and do hope that the next time you travel to Boston you will consider staying with us again.

title: Nice stay
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Great stay!
review: The hotel is a great location for Fenway and some of the restaurants. First time to Boston in a long time so wasn't sure where to stay. Very close to average but I rated a very good. Room was not great and price was $300 plus. Everything is expensive in Boston but price/quality didn't seem to match up here. Some mold in the shower didn't help my rating either. But if I'm coming to a Red Sox game this is a great location and I'd stay again. Otherwise, I think I'm hunting something closer to the waterfront if possible.

title: Great location for any Fenway event.
review: I recently stayed at this hotel during a weekend get away. The hotel is located in an awesome location, and is within a short walking distance to many restaurants, bars, shops, Fenway, the Boston Public Library, and the Boston Public Garden. I arrived at the hotel around 10 am, and was able to go ahead and checkin to my room (checkin time isn't until 3). As a Hilton Honors member I was given access to the lounge, which was a nice touch. With lounge access we had access to unlimited bottled soft drinks, water, milk, juice, candies, fruits, chips, and other snacks. We also received complimentary breakfast in the lounge each morning. The workout room is nicer than most hotels gyms - rowing machines, ellipticals, treadmills, free weights, various machines, medicine balls, and more.…

title: Good business hotel
review: Stayed here for the Billy Joel concert at Fenway.  Several folks going to the concert were there.  Self park was pretty easy.  The fee was $45 for the overnight which allowed you to stay till 6:00 the next day so we did some shopping and came back to get the car.   FYI-The access to the hotel garage is actually around the corner from where the GPS brings you.   Check in was easy and front desk staff was pleasant.  The room was comfortable.  We had asked for a microwave in the room to warm up therapeutic wraps.  It was there when we got to the room.  Free wi if for Hilton rewards members.  We did not eat at the hotel.  Very short walk to the Prudential Center (you can cut through the Sheraton) with lots of choices for food. We will stay here again

title: Didn't realise Hilton had took to taken on liars
review: This location is has good shopping and is next to a great restaurant called Summer Shack.  The hotel itself is clean and comfortable best suited for a business hotel. They need to add to their breakfast options   Easy access to shopping and various nightlife

title: Great Location, Great Stay
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Unexplained $400 Charge Months Later, Otherwise Good
review: The Hilton Back bay is right near  the Prudential Center, metro, restaurants, Amtrak and is located in a central part of Boston that enables easy access to every area. The room was well appointed and extremely clean. The staff was friendly, welcoming and responsive. We asked for the feather pillows to be replaced and it happened immediately. The host was extra friendly. Every time we saw him he stopped to greet us, ask how we were doing, and inquired if there was anything he could do to make our stay even more pleasant. Last of all the price was right. It was an extremely good value. I just recommended it to friends and we will certainly return, as we are frequently in Boston for business.

title: Great location, average hotel
review: I stayed at the Hilton Boston Back Bay towards the end of March, had a fine stay. I booked and prepaid through a third party website and got a great rate. As is standard, I gave them a credit card in case of incidentals, of which there were none.   Unfortunately, I was entirely shocked when reviewing my July credit card statement to see that the Hilton had charged my card $408 on 7/20, without any notice or communication, four months later.   On my first call to the hotel, customer service had no record of any charges. On the second call, I was informed that their Accounting department had charged me $408 because the third party company had gone bankrupt. They advised that I contact the booking company and that was that.   For the Hilton to charge me $400 four months later…

title: Wonderful Stay
review: I appreciate your review of your recent stay at the Hilton Boston Back Bay. I understand that you were unhappy with some of the charges. I apologize if the charges were of concern and am sharing your feedback with the appropriate members of oour team. Guest feedback is incredibly important to us. Thank you for your review.

title: Wonderful stay in Boston
review: Back bay area is a posh historic area of this heritage city. If you have a conference at Hynes convention centre this is certainly the second best option to stay, the best being the Sheraton.  Check in was very swift and smooth, my room was on the 12th floor(1202).  The location was just great. The convention centre is just a few minutes walk. If it rains take the route through the Sheraton.  Breakfast spread was nothing great to talk about.  Just what you expect in a business hotel.  The wifi was free in the room and that certainly was a plus.  The rooms need to have a few more power points, especially near the beds.  The bathroom fittings are ok, nothing special.  Check out was smooth snd fast.  I liked my stay in this hotel.

title: Boston My Favorable Walkable City
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. In nice weather, restaurant patio seating is packed with Bostonians and tourists alike soaking up the sunshine and enjoying the food. Commonwealth Ave offers a beautiful stroll down residential tree-lined streets. Keep walking towards the Charles River and enjoy a beautiful view by the water. In warmer months, people run and bike on paths running along the esplanade, and sail and kayak on the Charles River. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Friendly, welcoming, service with a great view of Boston
review: Returned to Boston for a three night summer New England vacation stay. Last stay was five years ago. Each time I'm reminded why Boston is one of my favorite walkable cities. Checked into the Hilton Back Bay with a Diamond reservation. From the initial front desk greeting to check out, the attentive staff went out of their way to accommodate our needs. Highlights included the spotless room, ample daily breakfast in the Executive lounge, evening hors d' oeurves, and the refreshing indoor pool and whirlpool. Love the location close to shopping, public transportation and public parks and historical sights. Visited the hotel bar which I and another customer remarked about the somewhat lacking offerings of scotches and whiskeys.

title: Very frequent guest of this hotel
review: I came for a conference in Boston and was treated with some of the best hotel service. The concierges were very friendly and welcoming. When I got to my room, I was greeted with a great view of the city with mechanically assisted drapes. Upon my departure, they were very accommodating with my bags and even gave me a temporary key (after checkout) to change into travel clothes in the gym. Excellent hotel.

title: Beware of room with lingering cigarette smoke
review: Thank you for choosing to stay with us at the Hilton Boston Back Bay. I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay and that our team was helpful. I will be sure to share your comments and hope you will return soon. Warm regards, Dominique Marty

title: Execllent hotel and staff!
review: I stay at this hotel very often for business. It's a really good hotel; extremely clean, rooms a huge for a major city, Starbucks in the lobby, excellent doorman in the morning for taxis, wonderful location close to shops bars and restaurants to walk to. Fitness center is comprehensive and bigger than many hotel gyms. They have also recently stepped up service; not sure if this is new management or just a renewed focus but it's visible. Solidly, consistently good.

title: Best stay ever!
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. In nice weather, restaurant patio seating is packed with Bostonians and tourists alike soaking up the sunshine and enjoying the food. Commonwealth Ave offers a beautiful stroll down residential tree-lined streets. Keep walking towards the Charles River and enjoy a beautiful view by the water. In warmer months, people run and bike on paths running along the esplanade, and sail and kayak on the Charles River. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Excellent hotel
review: We are overjoyed with the service and kindness the staff showed us. Calvin Cherry at the front desk is the BEST!! He saw we were there for the weekend to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. He took the time to really get to know us and made us feel at home and special. He upgraded our room so we had an excellent view. When we returned that evening there was a special gift (champagne and chocolate covered strawberries) waiting for us. Soooo nice!!  Calvin also included breakfast for us during our stay. The staff in the restaurant were excellent. When we returned the 2nd day they remembered our coffee and juice preferences - amazing! Buffet was great! Loved the French toast (thanks for the recommendation Calvin!) Our room was very clean, perfect size, and beautiful view. Very…

title: Enjoyed our stay
review: I have had many other hotels stays in Boston, and this was definitely the nicest.  The room was enormous.  I have never been in a bigger hotel room in any major city.  I addition, it was very quiet.  Cleanliness was excellent.  They had a nice exercise facility, indoor pool and sun deck.  My room had a good view of the city and the iconic Citgo sign.  The only cons: the check in took a little longer than it should (10 minutes) and there is no free wifi.  Overall, I can overlook the negatives and I would stay here again.

title: Concert Weekend
review: Dear Jay, Thank you for your recent stay here at the Hilton Boston Back Bay. I am very happy to read your comments about your stay and glad that you found the location and service levels of our hotel to your satisfaction. We look forward to seeing you soon, Jay!  Warm regards, Dominique Marty

title: Back Bay Hilton, Boston, MA
review: Spent three night here with our two children. Room spacious enough for four but beds need to be replaced as rolled together. Paul at the bar is a great asset to the hotel, such a friendly guy, remembered our order from the previous night, great service, thanks Paul. The pool is ok but could do with a bit more 'looking after'. Great location for Fenway & Newbury Street. Cheese & wine tasting in the lobby was a nice touch. Would happily visit again but would request a better view.

title: A week of fun
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. In nice weather, restaurant patio seating is packed with Bostonians and tourists alike soaking up the sunshine and enjoying the food. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Hotel is Close to Fenway, Terrible Staff
review: Spent a week in Boston attending my doctoral residency at NEU.  My husband came with me and we chose the Hilton Back Bay for it's location to NEU and because we are both HHonors members.  Location was perfect.  We reserved a high floor, king room with panoramic views.  The room as a bit smaller than I expected but it was good.  Interestingly, even though we were on the 25th floor, we still heard some street noise.  not much but every so often..so choose a high floor!  The service was excellent; we did not eat at the restaurant but used the bar; the Diamond club was a bit lacking; no wine or drinks in the club, had to get them from the bar.  But snack offerings were fine.  The biggest disappointment was that the food network was spotty...not the hotel's fault but it's my goto…

title: Mediocre for the cost
review: I would recommend staying else where if you are a young professional. I guess the manager thought he could take advantage of my group since we are and appear in a younger age bracket (24-30). We received complaints from front desk at 8AM on a Saturday about our previous nights noise complaint from a near by room. We were not even in the hotel that night. Then day when checking out the manager told us we cost him money because of how loud we were all day long and proceeded to berate us in front of other guests. (Mind you we were out of the hotel at 9AM for brunch and didn't come back until 12:30 after the Redsox game and went to sleep. Then the manager had the audacity to ask me for a 5 star review. Nope. Never going back. Not to mention the left over spoiled Chinese food that…

title: Red Sox game
review: The Hilton Boston Back Bay appreciates the time and effort you took to review your recent stay with us. We constantly take guest comments into consideration and would like to thank you for providing us with excellent feedback to help improve our guest service experience. It is our priority to uphold Hilton Values and culture to ultimately exceed your expectations. For that reason, we would like to sincerely apologize for failing to do so during your stay. This review has been brought to the attention of our Director of Front Office and will be addressed in their upcoming department meeting. Please reconsider us the next time your travels bring you to Boston so that you can reevaluate our performance. We would love to welcome and provide you with a 5-star experience. Warm regards, Dominique Marty

title: Awesome!
review: This was a decent hotel as far as rooms but I paid over $400.00 dollars a night and still had to pay for everything else including breakfast.  I think this hotel is overpriced and overrated. At least at the crappiest Embassy Suites the breakfast is included.

title: Back Bay for your stay!
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. In nice weather, restaurant patio seating is packed with Bostonians and tourists alike soaking up the sunshine and enjoying the food. Commonwealth Ave offers a beautiful stroll down residential tree-lined streets. Keep walking towards the Charles River and enjoy a beautiful view by the water. In warmer months, people run and bike on paths running along the esplanade, and sail and kayak on the Charles River. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Very nice location
review: Many good things.....several not so good things.  My "issues", although, probably minor to most....., were just that....minor.  This hotel is in a wonderful location.  Walking distance to Fenway, the freedom trail, the train system and the Back Bay area in general.  This is a huge facility and has a lot to offer.  I would most likely stay here over and over again.  First off, this hotel is not cheap. I had a panoramic superior room on the 26th floor.....the top floor.  Getting to my room was slow and took some time.  A hotel that has 26 floors.....offers 3 elevators to service the entire hotel.  Often, we waited for multiple elevators before entering.  And, coming down...it would stop almost on every floor.  Again....minor.  My room...for the price...was small.  I think it…

title: The worst experience in Hilton
review: We appreciate the time you took to rate your stay at the Hilton Boston Back Bay. It is most unfortunate that those issues disrupted your stay, and your stay was not positively memorable. Our priority is to create positive, memorable, guest service experiences and strive to continue to do so through feedback provided by our guests. We hope you will reconsider your decision to stay at a different property on your next visit to Boston because our team is dedicated to make it right for our guests and would love to have the opportunity to do so. Warm Regards,  Dominique Marty

title: Boston visit
review: My first time staying at this particular hotel, but I picked it for it's location and close proximity to the Fenway Park and Newbury Street.  We did a lot of walking the 24 hours we were in Boston and this hotel was centrally located to the things we came into town to do.  Rooms were very clean and staff was very helpful and friendly.

title: Great Location
review: My stay in Hilton Boston Back Bay from July 16 to 22, 2016 was a very unique experience. I was there for IEEE PES GM 2016 which was across the street on Sheraton Hotel. I did arrive one day earlier to Boston to enjoy the panoramic view of Boston on 26th floor and have a breakfast in bed, but it did not end up the way I had planned. I did experience something negative every single day, I contacted with Semir the manager on duty on my very first morning in Boston on July 17 2016 expressing how disappointed I am with the panoramic view of Boston on 26th floor as the view was 90% blocked with a building and a large TV in the room. I could tell that while I was on the phone he was not even listening to my complains and was taking the phone away from his ear and that was when I asked…

title: Great stay and great location
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. In nice weather, restaurant patio seating is packed with Bostonians and tourists alike soaking up the sunshine and enjoying the food. In warmer months, people run and bike on paths running along the esplanade, and sail and kayak on the Charles River. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Great Location
review: We had a great stay at the Hilton Back Bay Hotel. Great staff and Great room. The hotel is close to restaurants shopping and Fenway Park. The main reason for our visit was to see the Red Socks and the Giants play at Fenway Park. It was great being so close. I hope we can return one day.

title: Needs a facelift
review: Very close to Fenway Park, very nice hotel.  Towels are very nice and there's a Starbucks in the lobby.  My only reason for giving it only 4 stars is that if you are taller than 5 feet 8 inches you may find the shower head not quite tall enough, at least in the room I stayed in and even though I hung up my towel to use again, they still took it and gave me a clean one, nice but not necessary.  Otherwise, nice amenities, coffee maker, hair dryer, etc.  Cannot say much about the price, I didn't pay for the room.

title: Fenway
review: The location is nice- close to the T, Fenway, and Prudential Center- but the hotel needs a face lift. The rooms are old and the beds and pillows are very uncomfortable due to age. The bathrooms are quite small for a family of four as well. The staff is very nice- just expected a bit more from a Hilton.

title: AWSOME !
review: We appreciate the time you took to rate your stay at the Hilton Boston Back Bay. It is unfortunate that your stay with us was not exemplary as reflected in the rating. Our priority is to create positive, memorable, guest service experiences and strive to continue to do so through feedback provided by our guests. We hope that you will stay with us again and address any issues, concerns, or requests so that we can fully accommodate your needs and exceed your expectations. Your business and loyalty is important to us.

title: Nice stay for a summer week in Boston
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. In nice weather, restaurant patio seating is packed with Bostonians and tourists alike soaking up the sunshine and enjoying the food. Commonwealth Ave offers a beautiful stroll down residential tree-lined streets. Keep walking towards the Charles River and enjoy a beautiful view by the water. In warmer months, people run and bike on paths running along the esplanade, and sail and kayak on the Charles River. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Great stay and convenient to Fenway
review: We were fortunate to stay on the 26th (top) floor of this hotel which has outstanding views of the city and gives a birds-eye view of the lay of the land.  Fenway is within 15 minutes on foot and there are a LOT of restaurants/bars/shops even closer.  If you like upscale shopping, check out Newbury St and for the regular "joes" there's Coppley Square 3 blocks East.  The Prudential building, Maporium and Cambridge (Harvard) are a stone's throw away.  We enjoyed a quiet, comfortable room with no interruptions of rest by any tennant and/or staff member.  The gym is on the 7th floor and is next to a very nice pool/jaccuzzi and sun deck should you want to grab some rays.  The weight room is quiet and clean as was the entire workout facility.  Our room was comfortable, cool -- and the…

title: BEST hotel staff!!
review: I've already recommended the Hilton Back Bay within this past week to friends who go to Boston for either a Red Sox game, to go shopping, or to just get away for a bit.  I chose this hotel because of its location to Fenway Park where I attended the Paul McCartney concert.  Please share my "Thank you!" with the Front Desk team (1st, 2nd as well as the 3rd shift since the concert was over late), and with the housekeeper for the 9th floor.  (My room was 931.)  The housekeeper was always pleasant and welcoming, even stopping what she was doing to greet me if she saw me at the elevator or at my door.  Many thanks also to the Doorman/Security who always greeted me with a smile whether I was entering or leaving.  Also, the Eggs Benedict in the restaurant was delicious for this tired…

title: No hot showers!
review: My partner and I stayed here in February and it was amazing. - On arrival, the door man came out and grabbed our bags, which was extremely helpful. - At the front desk when checking in we spoke with a lovely young man, Eduardo. We mentioned that were were in the states to get married, and he immediately upgraded our room for us, free of charge without question. - Whilst settling in to our room, Eduardo called up to see if we would be going out any time soon, as he would like our permission to go in to our room and leave a little gift. We agreed that this would be fine. After returning, he had sent up a bottle of champagne, along with a bowl of strawberries and cream. - We went to the bar for a few drinks and some dinner. The bar men (Paul and Dimitri) were so friendly and…

title: Holiday stay
review: Traveled 3k miles to go to Fenway with my son- Giants vs. Red Sox. Stayed one night. Location is convenient to Fenway- about a 15 minute walk. Got woken up at 8:30 (which=5:30 California time) by some one knocking on our door and opening it. After I yelled at the person, they went away. Must have been housekeeping. At 8:30 am? Don't they have the capability to know when a guest has checked out? The Main issue was the one time we used the shower at 9:30am. We both had lukewarm water. Almost $400/night and you can't even get a hot shower? I've stayed at hotels that charge roughly the same per night, such as in the wine country, and that would never happen. Hell, motel 6 will give you hot showers. Mentioned the lack of hot showers upon checkout. The girl at the front desk said they…

title: Hilton Back Bay
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Perfect location for Boston marathoners
review: This is a VERY nice Hilton hotel. The staff was wonderful and always very helpful. The hotel is clean and pretty perfect. It is located very close to great entertainment, food, and two different transit locations.   The only things that I would say that I didn't expect that could be improved are:  1. The Starbucks in the hotel was closing at 3 pm daily when it was published to close at 7 pm daily. that was a bummer when I needed a latte fix.   2. Although the rooms have mini-fridges, they don't have microwaves.   Other than that, this was top notch. I recommend booking early, if possible, to get the best rate. It fills up regularly and very quickly.

title: Pretty city scape view but unfortunate construction noise
review: My husband and I stayed here for three nights during the Boston marathon. Great central location for all the events, expo and finish line. Lots of restaurants close by. We didn't have  car so having everything within walking distance was great.

title: Red Sox Game
review: The hotel itself was beautiful.  My room was clean and spacious.  My favorite feature of the room was the panoramic window.  Even though I was on the 5th floor I had a nice view of the city.  The downside was the early morning construction across the street that I could hear perfectly well in my room.  The location of the hotel is so convenient to Prudential Center and loads of culture.

title: Convenient and comfortable
review: If you are going to a Red Sox game this is the only way to go!  Great location within walking to the game and you don't have to worry about where to park.  Our room had a great view of the city and was spacious. Everyone at check in was friendly and accommodating.  If you have children with you and everyone is hungry after the game there is a little pizza place and Thai place just around the corner.  That makes everyone happy, late night pizza for the children and yummy pad thai for parents!

title: Summer side trip
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings.
