title: Beautiful view!
review: The hotel looks very tired...  the breakfast lounge (for Diamond members) was packed to the gills each morning but the staff coped admirably, smiling cheerful ensuring there was an unending supply of eggs and bacon. The rooms were standard size, clean and those on the back of the hotel hada views over Charles River. The reception staff were helpful and came fairly promptly ( 2 calls to fix the TV) but for a top of the line hotel... I expected more e.g. a call to say when someone would be there, etc., I would stay here again if the rates were good but otherwise many similar hotels in Boston.

title: Nice location but uncomfortable bed
review: Hello J&J,  Thank you for your feedback about your stay. I'm glad you enjoyed our Diamond Lounge and staff, but I'm terribly sorry you didn't feel we went far enough to deliver exceptional guest service. You'll be glad to know we are currently offering some of the best rates of the year. We hope to see you again the next time you visit Boston. Sincerely, Theo

title: Boys Weekend
review: The room we had showed a beautiful view of the Boston skyline. The bed was extremely comfortable, as all Hilton's are. The bar was nice but it lacked any nightlife. That was the only downfall. Capitol Grille is around the corner which makes for a convenient location.

title: Inconsistent quality, RUDE check-in staff
review: Thank you for leaving us such an approving review of your experience at the Hilton Boston Back Bay.  We are glad that you enjoyed your stay as well as our staff and enjoyed the view provided at our hotel. We are sorry to hear about your experience at our bar and we are continuously striving to improve this amenity. We appreciate your business and loyalty and look forward to the next time you stay with us.  Warm Regards, Dominique Marty

title: Ok
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Excellent hotel. Best hotel experience in Boston
review: OK Hotel. It is nicely located and has good amenities. They dont have shuttle to airport which is not great. Rooms are ok, Hilton honors must have been better overall. Go there if you just want to sleep. Small and cab be noisy.

title: Mediocre
review: Hello Prince. Thank you for your feedback about your stay. You are correct in that we are a bit too far to be able to reliably pick guests up from the airport, however we are a short Uber/Lyft ride away. Sincerely, Theo

title: Recommended
review: After having been in different hotels in Boston I decided to try the Hilton Back Bay. It did not only have a great location as its near the shops at Prudential center and the metro station but the staff was very friendly and always willing to help the guests. The housekeeper was very kind and our room was always clean and tidy. They also provide their guests with free wifi which is something ALL hotels should do. I had bad experiences with hotels nearby such as the Sheraton and the Westin which charge for wifi and charge even higher hotel rate. I have no complains at all with this hotel. If I have to go back to Boston I wouldnt doubt staying here. Fantastic!

title: Could be better, could be worse.
review: We are thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your stay here at the Hilton Boston Back Bay and the convenience our location afforded you.  Providing positive and memorable experiences for our guests is the reason for our success along with our excellent location. We are absolutely thrilled that our housekeeping staff was able to meet your expectation of the room and that you enjoyed our free Wi-Fi amenity. We hope you will stay with us on your next visit to our beautiful city and take full advantage of our prime location.  It would be our pleasure to welcome you back.  Warm Regards, Dominique Marty

title: Terrible Stay - for the second time
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Great Hilton Experience
review: This is the second time in three months that we have stayed at this hotel, and both times have been terrible. Each time we have had issues with the HVAC that the front desk and engineering were unable to repair. The room is sweltering and we were told that there was no air conditioning and no way to make the room cooler other than to open the window - not a great option when trying to get a good night's sleep in downtown Boston. The front desk seems to have very poor English skills and parking is $43/day. Combine this with the uncomfortable accommodations and you have the makings of a miserable stay.

title: Clean, and excellent location
review: Hello JGB999. I'm so sorry about the temperature issues you experienced during your stay. Unfortunately, the building wasn't designed with the ability to have cold air blowing during the winter, and hot air during the summer. Also, might we suggest booking our parking package the next time you visit Boston? I'm sorry we didn't tell you about it after your first stay since you could have saved that expense. Sincerely, Theo

title: Served the purpose of this trip well, easy cab ride to Mass General Hospital
review: Overall, the entire family had a great experience.  The staff were all great and the location of the hotel is wonderful.  The facilities at the hotel are also great.  We all are looking forward to staying at the Hilton Back Bay again very soon.

title: Great location, great service
review: We appreciate the time you took to rate your stay at the Hilton Boston Back Bay and are thrilled to see you enjoyed your stay as reflected in the rating. Our priority is to create positive, memorable, guest service experiences and strive to continue to do so through feedback provided by our guests. We greatly appreciate your business and loyalty, and hope to welcome you again.  Warm Regards, Dominique Marty

title: Good location, helpful staff, but don't stay in rooms ending in 16, 15, 17 - noisy pipes that keep you awake
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. In nice weather, restaurant patio seating is packed with Bostonians and tourists alike soaking up the sunshine and enjoying the food. Commonwealth Ave offers a beautiful stroll down residential tree-lined streets. Keep walking towards the Charles River and enjoy a beautiful view by the water. In warmer months, people run and bike on paths running along the esplanade, and sail and kayak on the Charles River. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Great customer service at check in
review: Stayed for one night...supposed to stay for two, but checked out early. I thought the noise was a jack hammer, but I was told it was pipes - intermittently making loud noises from 10pm to 1am - therefore no sleep which is what we business travelers value amongst everything. If you can get a room away from the pipe noise, you may want to give it a go. Could hear the noise by the elevators as well.  I have had great experience with other Hiltons and was rather disappointed by my stay in this one, driven by the noise issues

title: Anniversary
review: Hello Gillian. I'm am terribly sorry you had to checkout because of a noise issue. We would very much like to talk to you to see how we can convince you to stay with us again the next time you're in Boston. Please contact our General Manager, Dominique Marty, at your earliest convenience. Sincerely, Theo

title: Attentive staff, beautiful rooms
review: I do a lot of traveling and I have to say this hotel has the best check in staff that I have seen.  Calvin checked us in on a Sunday night around 930 pm and he was outstanding!!  The rooms are very clean and larger then you would think for a hotel located downtown.  This hotel is in a great location within steps of tons of restaurants.  Some things I would recommend the management to look into would be the Diamond lounge having the proper staffing.  I felt it was very dirty with the garbage overflowing and just things were all over the place.  Also beware the parking here is 43 dollars a night!!!

title: Excellent Hotel Experience
review: Thank you for taking the time to review your stay at the Hilton Boston Back Bay.  We always appreciate guest feedback and continuously take comments into consideration as we strive to improve our guest service experience.  We would like to apologize for our Diamond lounge as this could have been maintained much thoroughly and has been addressed to our Diamond lounge attendants. It is important that we accommodate all your needs and would love for you to stay with us again so we can make it right and your next review on us will be 5 stars. Warm Regards, Dominique Marty

title: Nice Hotel Big Rooms, Good locaiton
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: 40th birthday trip
review: Nice place, great Diamond Lounge for good feeling about being a High end Customer.  They do a nice job.  Seemed a little short on staff but that could just be when I happened to be there.  Staff is very nice and does a good job.

title: Excellent Location and Rooms
review: Our Diamond Lounge Attendants will be thrilled to read such an amazing review about their service.  Thank you very much for taking the time to post such great compliments about our teams. We appreciate you taking the time to compliment the team and, in particular, our Diamond Lounge Attendants for their dedication to our guests and making sure you had everything you needed in the lounge. Thank you again for taking note of their hard work and dedication.  We enjoy your business and look forward to continue building on the trust and loyalty we have with you. Warm Regards, Dominique Marty

title: Acceptable but nothing to entice me to return
review: was a pleasure to stay in the hilton situated great for shopping during the day as the main shopping area is all in walking distance hotel itself was very clean and room was very spacious as there was 3 of us sharing and staff were all very helpful this was my 3rd time staying and wont be my last.

title: Old can really be Gold when service comes first with comfort a & Good food.
review: It was our pleasure to read such an exciting review about your stay at the Hilton Boston Back Bay.  We are delighted that you enjoyed celebrating your birthday with us and will be sure to inform our staff for surpassing your expectations. Our team members continuously strive to create memorable experiences and will love to hear that they went above and beyond.  Thank you for taking the time and effort to write this review.  We appreciate your business and loyalty and hope to have another opportunity to welcome you again. Warm Regards, Dominique Marty

title: Conveninet to shopping and restuarants
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Nicely updated
review: I have often stayed in this hotel and like much about it, including the gym and pool, which are spacious, well-equipped and light-filled.  The worst aspect of the hotel is that guests are not able to adjust the temperature in the room.  To reduce stifling heat during a recent stay I had to call the front desk every day and ask that they lower the temp!  This is totally ridiculous, and I will not return until this problem is fixed.

title: Back Bay
review: Hello Qao01. Thank you for your review. I'm glad to hear you enjoy our gym and pool, however, unfortunately, due to the age of the building there is nothing we can do about the air conditioning during the winter and heat during the summer. Sincerely, Theo

title: Manager Calvin was very rude, surprised this is a Hilton
review: A nicely updated property. Close to everything in Back Bay, including T stops (subway). Friendly and helpful staff. Avoid the Starbucks within the hotel as it is more expensive and doesn't have all the selection of a normal Starbucks (2 are close by). Lines were lovely. Beds comfortable.

title: Had a great time
review: We are thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your stay here at the Hilton Boston Back Bay and the convenience our location afforded you.  Providing positive and memorable experiences for our guests is the reason for our success along with our excellent location. We are absolutely thrilled you took the time and effort to share your experience at our property. We hope you will stay with us on your next visit to our beautiful city and take full advantage of our prime location.  It would be our pleasure to welcome you back. Warm Regards, Dominique Marty

title: Hilton Back Bay, Boston
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: A great stay
review: Good rooms, reasonable rates.  Don't expect front desk staff to move quickly when checking in or out, even when there is a long queque. Front desk under manned for the number of guests waiting for service.

title: Lack of Follow-Up
review: Thank you for your constructive feedback. I am sorry to hear that we did not meet your expectations at check in. I encourage you to try our e-check in tool, which conveniently allows you to choose your room and check in ahead of time. We hope to welcome you back in the near future! Sincerely, Dominique Marty

title: Great location, good staff
review: I had a great stay at Hilton Back Bay. The room was nice, comfortable and very well equipped. The bathroom was spotless, wi-fi signal strong and reliable, the bed was huge and cosy and the view was amazing. If I ever come to Boston, I surely will stay at this hotel.

title: Balance of good service and great location
review: Thank you for your review! I am pleased to read that your stay was comfortable and exceeded your expectations. We look forward to welcoming you back! Sincerely, Dominique Marty

title: Worse than I expected..
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Good spot, centrally located.
review: I lived in Boston 15 years and never stayed in a hotel here.. After moving to Florida stayed 3 days for business.. I was expecting much better for the price and was very disappointed.. I cant complain on the services.. Excellent reception and nice and warm people on the reception, but here my disappointing.. Being Diamond member I can go to executive lounge.. In this hotel was one if the worst lounge I have seen.. Come first day for night snacks.. There was no plates and terrible pieces if meat.. Hated. Also small space. The decoration is horrible what a bad taste!  There was only 2 elevators working.. The hotel was full.. Had to wait a bit few times..  Parking is not much space.. What is ok, but over 40 for this space is a bit much as well..  Will try other one next time.. …

title: DONT ORDER ROOM SERVICE!!!!
review: Thank you for your feedback. I am so pleased to read that our service exceeded your expectations. I have brought your comments regarding our Diamond Lounge to our Food and Beverage Director. We are always looking for ways to improve and will certainly take your comments into consideration. I apologize that one of our elevators was under renovation during your stay with us. We hope to welcome you back in the future to give you the stay you deserve. Please contact me directly so that we can make this right for you: 617-867-6100. Thank you again for your review! Sincerely, Dominique Marty

title: Great July 4th trip
review: My family and I stayed here on a quick trip to the greater Boston area and were very happy with it's location and amenities. Beds were comfortable (although I have slept in much more comfortable ones in other Hilton properties),  great shower, coffee in the room   and the personnel were wonderful.  Fenway park is walk-able from here as is the T and Kenmore Sq. There is a restaurant/bar on site and a private lounge if you are a "gold member", and parking. Also a Starbucks in the lobby for those who just have to have their latte.... A little pricier than the Hiltons elsewhere in the area but its worth the convenience.

title: Nice people, good price for downtown
review: Thank you for your review! I am pleased to read that your stay with us was a comfortable and convenient one. We look forward to welcoming you back in the future! Warm Regards, Dominique Marty

title: Buffet Breakfast
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Luxurious Hotel in the Back Bay area
review: I always come here best buffet breakfast.  Lots to choose from.  The staff are very friendly and always remember me when I go in.  Jose in particular is excellent very attentive and welcoming.  Well worth a visit.

title: Nice hotel but nothing special
review: Thank you for your review! I am pleased that you enjoy our breakfast buffet and will be sure to share your comments with Jose and our Chef. It is always a pleasure to welcome you back! Sincerely, Dominique Marty

title: Good Location. Great Room
review: Beautiful hotel with tons of luxury accommodations and great service.  They also have a "diamond" lounge available to Hilton Honors members that is open 24 hrs a day and provides access to coffee, soft drinks, and snacks.  The location is very convenient to great restaurants and bars and it is only a 15 min drive to the airport.  The only downside is the parking as it cost a whopping $43/night!!!!

title: Good location, but few amenities
review: Thank you for your review! I am so glad to read that our hotel exceeded your expectations in accommodations and service. I see that the parking fees were of concern to you. Our Guest Agents would love to reserve you a room with our Parking Package for your next trip to Boston so that you may take advantage of the parking discounts we offer. We hope to see again you soon! Warm Regards, Dominique Marty

title: Great stay
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. title: Old hotel but convenient
review: I chose the Hilton back Bay as a cheaper alternate to the Sheraton.  It's literally across the street.  It has a parking lot that you access and no valet parking which I love. Some may want that but it helped in costs. Room was comfortable and the restaurant was good. Only had breakfast.  The best part was the simple access to Rte 90. Zero driving through boston to get the hotel.  Overall great stay.

title: Best night's sleep I've had in a hotel
review: Thank you for your review! I appreciate your feedback and I am pleased that you enjoyed the value in our prices. We hope to welcome you back on your next trip to Boston! Sincerely, Dominique Marty

title: A little Underwhemed
review: First stay at Hilton Boston Back Bay.  Walking in, I noticed that the lobby area was pretty small.  Kind of unexpected / disappointing for a Hilton.  I had pre-selected my floor and room prior to check-in via the Hilton app (this was a very nice feature!).  Check-in was quick and painless but there was a little surprise.  Apparently, I got upgraded by Hilton.  The upgrade was just a higher floor upgrade not an actual room upgrade.  Can't really complain since I was only a Hilton Silver member so wasn't really expecting anything.  I did request for a late check-out which the staff happily accommodated.    After check-in I brought my luggage up to the room.  Room was a decent size with the two beds that I requested.  There were plenty of space for my luggage without me tripping…

title: Great views, helpful staff, high level of excellence
review: Thank you for such a detailed review! I am pleased to hear that we were able to upgrade your room and accommodate a late check out – it is the small details that make a difference. I am also glad that you found our App to be useful and that our location was to your liking. We appreciate all of your wonderful feedback and hope to welcome you back in the near future! Sincerely, Dominique Marty

title: Good location and well maintained but...
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Excellent business hotel in Boston
review: This is hotel is conveniently located but outside of the core area.  I had a clean, spacious corner room.  Just be aware that the hotel does not provide restaurant service at mid-day and the bar does not open 4:00 pm.  And, there is no make-up mirror in the bathroom.  And, interestingly enough, the only glass (yes, just one) was a plastic glass found in the refrigerator area.  No glasses in the bathroom.  But, there is a small refrigerator.  So has some nice features but lacking some basics, I think.

title: Great!
review: Thank you for your feedback. We appreciate you taking the time to share your experience with us. Your comments and suggestions have been reviewed with my team. We hope to welcome you back in the future!  Sincerely,  Dominique Marty

title: The Staff is Stellar
review: Clean and quiet business hotel in the middle of Boston City. Close to everything and upscale restaurants. Will stay next time I make a trip to Boston. Easy to get a cab. When you have time, its the best place to walk or jog around.

title: A little bit more attention to detail needed.
review: Thank you for your review! I am so happy to read that you enjoyed your stay with us and our excellent location. It would be our pleasure to welcome you back on your next trip to Boston. Sincerely, Dominique Marty

title: Good business hotel centrally located
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Annual get together
review: Staple for the Boston back Bay Area and easily reached and accessible. The views have been a little spoilt by the surrounding buildings which is a shame given the circular design offering 360 views Service is good and the upgrade to the executive lounge is great with wonderful service and items to choose from - little noisy and distracting with all the media there tho'

title: Worst Hotel Stay Ever!!
review: Thank you for your review! I am pleased that you enjoyed your room, despite the unfortunate construction across the street. I appreciate your feedback regarding our Executive Lounge and the noise in that room. I will bring your comments to my Team to come up with a solution. We hope to welcome you back soon! Sincerely, Dominique Marty

title: Perfect location
review: This is our 4th year in a row staying at the Backbay Hilton. The rooms are clean, beds extremely comfortable and linens soft and fresh! I have made a habit of using the pool and spa early in the morning. This year, we had gotten engaged and our favorite waitress at 40 Dalton, Gloria, made sure to tell her supervisor and they sent a bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries to our room. I have friends who began staying last year and they love it here as well. I love the king panoramic suites but have found it unfortunate that a building has been built right outside them taking away from the view but the rooms are still superb!

title: Location, Location, Location
review: Thank you very much for your very gracious review. I consider myself very fortunate to work with a bunch of true professionals, such as Gloria. We look forward to welcoming you back on your next trip to Boston and on behalf of my team – congratulations again on your engagement! Sincerely, Dominique Marty

title: great location, spacious rooms, nice pool, average food
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: The furnace is not working properly throughout hotel
review: very well positioned for tourists in Boston, neatly between Copley Square and fenway park. Efficient checkin, clean large room, lovely pool and gym. Large tv, large desk, chairs and sofa. Room service was quick but food only average, and quite expensive ( delivery charge, service charge and then tax on top of menu prices )

title: Upgraded Hotel
review: Thank you for your review. I am happy to read that you enjoyed your stay with us and the convenience of our location. I will be sure to bring your comment regarding our menu prices to the attention of our Food and Beverage director. We appreciate your feedback and hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back on your next trip to Boston! Sincerely, Dominique Marty

title: Very nice stay after New Years
review: Please be aware before coming here as there is nothing on the hotel website about it. It is all or nothing with the heating right now as they have old time boiler pipes in this historical building & are replacing the heating system in the hotel. The coolest I have gotten my room to is 87 all week long. I had to get up at 5 am 2 nights ago to shower when it was at 94 after just being up to go outside to cool down at 2 am.even shutting the thermostat off continues to blow hot air out the vent because the building is quite old and runs off steam pipes. Words cannot describe how completely exhausted I am this week. After no sleep and no help from  Maintenance man ,I was told to open the windows to cool off the room. Until this is corrected it is quite miserable here. Just fair…

title: Great service and location
review: Thank you for your detailed review. It is through such feedback that we are able to continually improve our property to meet and exceed the needs of our guests. I understand that you were not satisfied with the heating system in your room. I sincerely apologize for this and assure you that this area is of great importance to us as we ensure the comfort and satisfaction for our guests. I have reviewed your comments with the Director of Engineering to ensure that this problem is addressed immediately. Thank you again for your review and I hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back on your next trip to Boston.  Sincerely, Dominique Marty

title: Perfect hotel for our overnight in Boston
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Great location.
review: We have a Christmas tradition where we attend the Boston Pops Christmas show.  Then we stay overnight and attend the children's pageant at Trinity Church on Christmas.  This year I searched for hotels within walking distance to Symphony Hall and found the Hilton Boston Bay Bay Hotel.  Our choice was perfect.  We were eligible for an upgrade and ended up in a fabulous high floor corner room with beautiful views of the City.  When it came time for the Pops it was only a 5 minute walk so we didn't have to use any cabs.  Our bed was so comfortable I woke up full of energy for our day in Boston.  We fully intend to stay at this hotel next year, and maybe a few other times in between!  We highly recommend this hotel for anytime you find yourself in Boston!

title: Location Excellent...Need to do Little Things a Bit Better
review: Thank you for the great review. I'm so glad that you and your family had a great time here at the Back Bay Hilton and that we were able to play a positive role in your Christmas tradition! It would be our pleasure to welcome you back, year after year!  Warm Regards, Dominique Marty

title: Close to shopping in back bay
review: Great service. The rooms are modern and sleek. The hotel has a great location for restaurants and sight seeing. We were there for my husband to attend a meeting and it was ideal for me to run around town and sight see and then meet him for dinner. The staff was helpful and our overall experience was great.

title: Great staff, very convenient!
review: Thank you for your review! I am delighted to read that we exceeded your expectations. We hope to welcome you back soon. Sincerely, Dominique Marty

title: Like home in the heart of Boston
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Great Location. Great Staff.
review: The staff has been one of the most kind staff I have met recently. When arriving, early in the afternoon the woman at front desk had no problem to give us the room immediately. There was an issue with the key system but she asked  someone to accompany us. She gave us a complimentary up-grade, which was nice. Room quite well appointed, with coffee facilities, work place and a sofa by the window. Bathroom, not luxurious one but it was OK. We had breakfast the four mornings and we must say staff there was very kind. Many choices. The breakfast is convenient if you pay it in a "Bed and breakfast" Room  Promotion but though it was OK I believe it  does not worth the $53( for two ) you have to pay if you do not have it included. There are many possibilities (A Starbucks inside the…

title: Convenient, good service will stay again
review: Thank you for such a detailed account of your stay with us! I enjoyed reading your feedback and will take your comments regarding our Christmas decorations into account for next year. Your many wonderful compliments for our hotel staff are sincerely appreciated and we are thrilled that your experience with our Front Desk staff was so helpful. We hope to welcome you back on your next trip to Boston. Warm Regards, Dominique Marty

title: Comfortable and clean hotel
review: we stayed here for 5 nights for a visit to Boston as we were recommended to stay in the Back Bay area. We were not disappointed, the location is just right. Close to the Prudential T station (green line) & the hop on hop off trolleys stop right outside the Hotel which is ideal if you are tourist like we were. There are some great bars & restaurants very close by along Dalton St & the short walk onto Boylston (by the Fire Station)  The biggest plus sign for us was the staff, this is always important to us as tourists, we like to feel appreciated & valued & the staff make you feel that here, especially if you show some manners & are polite, you always receive that in return.  Special mention MUST go to 2 guys on the front desk (David & Hassan) who always went over & above to help…

title: Not what you'd expect from a Hilton
review: On behalf of my team, thank you very much for your very gracious review. We will print and post on our Team Member bulletin board so all can read your kind comments. I consider myself very fortunate to work with a bunch of true professionals. We look forward to welcoming you back!  Sincerely, Dominique Marty

title: Peaceful Stay
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. In nice weather, restaurant patio seating is packed with Bostonians and tourists alike soaking up the sunshine and enjoying the food. Commonwealth Ave offers a beautiful stroll down residential tree-lined streets. Keep walking towards the Charles River and enjoy a beautiful view by the water. In warmer months, people run and bike on paths running along the esplanade, and sail and kayak on the Charles River. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Hilton Stay
review: I stayed at the Hilton Boston Back Bay for the ASE Convention in June, it was typical Hilton.  I picked the location since it was right across the street from Hynes.  I wish I knew that the Marriott was connected to the shopping center in Hynes.  It is a walk but it is covered and they have a huge bar area and it seemed like the happening place to be. At the Hilton we had to walk across the street.  Overall, it is your typical stay at a Hilton hotel.

title: Good location
review: Thank you for taking the time to review your stay at the Hilton Boston Back Bay this past summer. We would love to hear any suggestions you may have so that we can make sure your next stay with us exceeds your expectations.  Kind Regards, Dominique Marty

title: Convenient location at a reasonable price
review: Conveniently located to Mass General Hospital.  Hilton staff courteous, professional and accomadating.  Chef and staff extremely helpful - my daughter has multiple food allergies and were able to prepare delicious meals.

title: Bummed about the view.
review: Thank you for your review! I am glad to hear that you and your daughter enjoyed your stay with us. We look forward to welcoming you back!  Sincerely, Dominique Marty

title: Weekend stay
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Old hotel with awful rooms
review: Room was very clean (no bedbugs).  Good size.  Convenient parking at the hotel and surrounding area.  Easy walk to Massachusetts Ave and Boylston St.  Our check in guy was a bit aloof but I think that was his nature as the rest of the check in people were extremely welcoming.

title: Visited twice now
review: Thank you for your review of your past stay with us. I am thrilled to hear that you found your accommodations comfortable and our location convenient.  We hope you will consider staying with us on your next weekend trip to Boston! Sincerely, Dominique Marty

title: Great choice
review: The hotel is like a youth hostel that has not been refurbished. The interiors are old, the bathrooms are the size of a matchbox and the whole place is brown, tired and claustrophobic. It is clean and the staff are nice. Nothing extra for diamond card members. Avoid!!

title: Great location and friendly staff
review: Thank you for your feedback. I apologize that we were unable to meet your needs during your stay. Since we are continually working to improve our on property experience, I would like to hear more regarding your stay so I can ensure all challenges are addressed with the appropriate department. Please contact me at your earliest convenience should you be willing to discuss these with me.  Best Regards, Dominique Marty – General Manager

title: Was So So - Not exactly as advertised
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Solid hotel in prime location in Boston
review: I was sold a "panoramic view" room - there is no view. There is however a LARGE building across the street that blocks any kind of view. The first room provided was dirty.  The second room the door didn't work.  Basically it was one of the worst Hilton hotels I have stayed at. Thanks for the upsell.

title: Weekend Getaway
review: Thank you for your feedback. I understand that you were not satisfied with the cleanliness of your guest room. I sincerely apologize for this and assure you that this area is of great importance to us as we ensure the comfort and satisfaction for our guests. We appreciate you bringing this to our attention. Should you have any questions or concerns, please do not hesitate to contact me directly.   Sincerely, Dominique Marty

title: Great location
review: We stay here very frequently and it's always a solid choice. The location is great whether you are seeing a Red Sox game, going to the MFA, theater etc. You can walk to most places. There are many nearby restaurants and the Prudential Center is right across the street. It's 2 blocks from Newbury St.  The hotel has an odd layout, as the floor are triangles. The corner rooms are larger, so try to select one of those.  The fitness center is large with both free weights and machines and the pool is nice.   We've eaten a few times at 40 Dalton and the food is always solid. The service has always been friendly, especially to the kids.  There's a nice Hilton Gold/Diamond lounge that was remodeled in the last few years that's also worth getting to for breakfast.  All in all, great…

title: Great staff,  that really aim to please
review: Thank you for your detailed account of your stay with us! I am thrilled that you enjoyed our location and amenities. We hope to welcome you back in the near future. Sincerely, Dominique Marty

title: Decent hotel in a good location
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Perfect property with outstanding service!
review: My wife and I stayed here for a quick overnight before a very early medical appointment the next morning, so we didn't get to experience a lot of the hotel amenities.  The room was nice enough with a good view overlooking my old college neighborhood by Symphony Hall.  Everything was clean and tidy.  For us the primary downsides were the noise from the elevators and the dead air due to a seemingly non-functional climate system.  The hotel is built on a tight triangular footprint, so the elevators are in the center all three corridors.  I probably made a bad decision in picking a room on the backside of the elevators figuring the noise from the doors  would be less of a problem.  We never heard the doors, but the drone from the cars going up and down sounded kind of like a…

title: Nice Hotel-Great location
review: Thank you for your detailed account of your recent experience with us. We appreciate your feedback, as it will help us improve. I apologize that the elevators and A/C units interrupted the comfort of your stay. We appreciate you bringing these issues to our attention and would love the chance to welcome you back to give you the say you deserve. Sincerely, Dominique Marty

title: Decent All Around
review: I was on a 4 city in 2 weeks marathon so my patience was short. I had a rude cabbie who talked loudly, in a foreign language, on his cell phone the entire trip. Then, I arrived at the Hilton Boston Back Bay and was greeted by Calvin Cherry. What a quick turn of events in my travel day! He was efficient, pleasant and very professional. He also recommended The Summer Shack for my unwinding cocktails and meal.  The room was perfect---high floor, clean as a whistle and well-appointed. Every staff person I met had a smile at this property! It was just a great experience!

title: Very disappointed !!!
review: Thank you very much for taking the time to post a review of your experience at the Back Bay Hilton. I appreciate you taking the time to compliment the team and, in particular, Calvin for his dedication to our guests and making sure you had everything you needed at check in. I am fortunate to have a great team that focuses on taking care of our guests, and I thank you for noting it. I look forward to welcoming you back to Boston soon!  Warm Regards, Dominique Marty

title: Hilton Back Bay Boston
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Excellent option for meetings in Hynes Convention Center
review: This is a very good hotel, with a nice view at high floor. The convience of transport is another advantage of this hotel. And it locals in a commercial center of Boston, the conwenience of touring around and shopping would attract you.

title: All about back bay
review: Thank you for the great review. I am glad you found our location to your liking. We hope to welcome you back to Boston soon! Sincerely Dominique Marty

title: Great Location - Great Price!
review: This is the 1st time I had stayed in Hilton, after some visits to Boston to attend scientific meetings in Hynes Convention Center. Hotel localization is fantastic, just in front of Sheraton Lobby (which is connected to Hynes). That's very important in cold days of fall or winter. Rooms are excellent - my only complain is that's a little bit difficult to control the heating system. In the 1st day we put this in a very hot level and we couldn't down this after, it is hard to understand how to manage this.  But this wasn't a big problem, I suggest a better explanation of how to control this system on the rooms. Prices are expensive, but compared to other hotels in Back Bay (including some very poor in terms of service quality) they are on the expected. Generally, a good option for…

title: Very good
review: Thank you for taking the time to review your stay with us! I am happy to hear that you enjoyed your room and our convenient location. On another note, I am sorry to hear that your experience with our heating system was unsatisfactory. I have brought your comments to the attention of our Director of Engineering so that we can prevent this problem from happening in the future. We hope to welcome you back again soon! Warm Regards, Dominique Marty

title: Excellent, reasonable price - but watch out for construction and parking fees
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: perfectly acceptable
review: We wanted a downtown Boston hotel over Thanksgiving week. Price was very reasonable for an excellent hotel! New, clean rooms, excellent service. BUT, parking is $43 a day - that's 1/3 of what we paid for a deluxe room. And there's major construction nearby, including piledrivers which start at 7:30 a.m. every day including Saturdays. Free wifi with Hilton Honors membership.

title: The Good, The Bad, and a lot more ugly..
review: Thank you very much for taking the time to post a review of your experience at the Back Bay Hilton.  I appreciate your very kind comments about the staff – they will be thrilled to hear your feedback! I would like to apologize for the construction across the street from our property. It is most unfortunate that those issues disrupted your stay. Let us know upon your next visit so that we can make sure you get the stay you deserve! Warm Regards, Dominique Marty

title: great experience, really good location
review: It's a great location, and the staff were quite friendly and helpful.  As many have already noted, it's getting a little old, but it was still perfectly comfortable.  Housekeeping seemed to have a few off days during my stay -- some hair on the bathroom tile stayed from the time I checked in until the time I left (3 days), but all in all everything was fine.

title: Bellman left part of my belongings in the taxi trunk
review: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel! I understand that you were not satisfied with the cleanliness of your guest room and am deeply disappointed by that. I sincerely apologize for this and assure you that this area is of great importance to us as we ensure the comfort and satisfaction for our guests. Thank you again, I appreciate your honest feedback.  Sincerely, Dominique Marty

title: Getting old
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: A Great Hotel!
review: Positives (1) great location for Fenway, shopping & restaurants (2) great executive lounge (3) workers are very friendly Negatives (1) property can only run either heat or air conditioning which is a major problem when you get a warm day in early winter. The only way to cool your room is by opening the window (2) the property is starting to show its age.

title: good hotel, great location
review: Thank you for your honest feedback. I am pleased to hear that you enjoyed our location, staff and Diamond Lounge. I have brought your comments regarding our heating units to the attention of my Director of Engineering. He is looking into this issue with our Maintenance team to ensure that this does not continue to occur. Again, thank you for bringing this to our attention as we are always looking for ways to improve. We hope to welcome you back soon! Warm Regards, Dominique Marty

title: Beautiful Corner Suite
review: My colleagues and I stay at the Back Bay Hilton almost every week.  The hotel is close to our work, is in a great location, has great rooms, and HAS A GREAT staff.   As Diamond members, we also enjoy the Diamond Lounge, where we have breakfast each morning and snacks in the evenings.   We are please to be frequent guests.

title: Good but not great
review: Thank you for your glowing review of our Hotel! It is our pleasure to have you and your colleagues as our guests. We look forward to welcoming you back. Sincerely, Dominique Marty

title: best hotel in boston area unless you hit the suburbs
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: First rate service
review: This hotel is worth the price the area an views are Boston's finest at its best clean comfortable an I was on the pool floor so that was a plus if you can afford it I highly recommend this place right next to the Sheraton but I always choose this one great hotel.

title: Do not stay here unless you have to
review: I am delighted that your recent stay at the Back Bay Hilton was one that exceeded your expectations. Your many wonderful compliments of the hotel are sincerely appreciated and I am thrilled that you enjoyed our amenities! We look forward to welcoming you back to Boston soon.  Sincerely,  Dominique Marty

title: Quiet and Clean
review: After a 14 hour flight and arriving at 6am, the Front Desk found me a complimentary upgraded room immediately and, because of my Hilton Honors status,  provided access to the Executive Lounge which was serving a substantial breakfast at the time. Enjoyable evening appetizers in the Exec Lounge were served from 5-9. No beer or wine, but soft drinks and juices. Bar was adjacent.  Facility well maintained, clean, comfortable and a 3-minute walk to the Convention Center and The Summer Shack - a great lobster & seafood place.

title: Worst check in experience ever!
review: Thank you very much for taking the time to post a review of your experience at the Back Bay Hilton. I appreciate you taking the time to compliment our staff. I am fortunate to have a great team that focuses on taking care of our guests, and I thank you for noting it! I look forward to welcoming you back to Boston soon!  Sincerely, Dominique Marty

title: Comfortable stay, great staff
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: A little tired
review: The hotel staff was wonderful from pre-arrival arrangements (one of us arrived a day early) and accommodated several requests. I was able to check in prior to arrival and selected a room that would more comfortably meet our needs. Able to stay on a high floor and use the pool, gym and on-site cafe (Starbucks but limited hours in the late afternoon). Construction was ongoing next door which does block what was once a much better view but the work didn't seem to start until after 7 which was not an issue for us as we are early risers. Close to the mall, Boylston, Newbury Streets.

title: Nice hotel with great staff, a little noisy
review: Thank you for taking the time to post a detailed account of your experience. I am happy that you enjoyed your stay and took advantage of our convenient location. Our Team Members will be thrilled to hear of your compliments! We look forward to welcoming you back to Boston again soon. Sincerely, Dominique Marty

title: Boston family trip
review: This Hilton is feeling a little tired and dated, especially given the cost and the other options there are in the City. We didn't really use any of the facilities other than our own room. Everything was clean well daily, just the furniture and carpets showing wear

title: Unsavory Hotel Front Desk Staff
review: Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent stay at our hotel. We sincerely appreciate your feedback and we’re very sorry you were unhappy with our amenities and the condition of the hotel. We will take your comments under consideration as we continually work to improve our guest experience. We hope you will consider staying with us in the future. Warm Regards, Dominique Marty

title: Awesome!

title: Lovely hotel, good location
review: We stayed one night this weekend and had a great time. My toddler was being a bit difficult when we first arrived and the bellman engaged in conversation with him and totally made our arrival so much more enjoyable! Calvin at the front desk was also super friendly and patient with us. You have really wonderful staff members at this location!   The room was very clean and the beds were very comfortable. Our room was close to the elevator and I don't think I heard it once. Will absolutely return.

title: Fantastic Hotel With An Amazing Staff
review: Thank you very much for taking the time to post a review of your experience at the Back Bay Hilton. I appreciate you taking the time to compliment our staff for their dedication to our guests. I am fortunate to have a great team that focuses on taking care of our guests, and I thank you for noting it! I look forward to welcoming you back to Boston. Sincerely, Dominique Marty

title: Very Disappointed
review: This hotel was in a great location. Right next door to the prudential centre, great for shopping. The room was lovely and the bathroom was very spacious. A lot of bench space for toiletries and make up. The staff were amazing on the front desk, and the doorman greater me cheerfully each morning I left the hotel to do things.

title: Nice view, that's where it ends.
review: I am delighted that your recent stay at the Back Bay Hilton was one that exceeded your expectations. Your many wonderful compliments of the hotel are sincerely appreciated and I am thrilled that you experienced true Hilton Hospitality with our Staff! We look forward to welcoming you back to Boston soon.  Warm regards, Dominique Marty

title: Great location

title: Good place
review: Was put in this hotel by a relative and had a great experience. Warm welcome from Calvin Cherry the receptionist and the room was very spacious and comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful. Yes there was construction going on nearby but it's the same all over town. Might be considered a bit pricey but I thought it was good value.

title: Good location for exploring Boston
review: We are delighted that your recent stay at the Back Bay Hilton was one that exceeded your expectations. Your many wonderful compliments for our hotel staff are sincerely appreciated and we are thrilled that your experience with Calvin Cherry and the rest of our staff was so helpful. We look forward to welcoming you back to Boston soon. Sincerely, Dominique Marty

title: Dissapointing hotel in Boston
review: We stayed here for 3 nights. The room was nice and the beds were comfortable. In addition, the pool and the gym are great. Location is pretty good, about 10 minutes away from the public park and 15 minutes away from downtown

title: This Hilton has bad feng shui; not a welcoming lobby and public space
review: We are thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us during your three nights in Boston. Should travel bring you to the area again, it would be a pleasure to welcome you back. Warm Regards, Dominique Marty

title: Not the best Hilton
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Comfortable hotel
review: We stayed for a week. Unfortunately there is a hotel being built across the street from the room we booked and so they transferred us to one as close as possible which still had a view and a fine view it was. The room was clean, the room service excellent and the bathroom fine even though they lost hot water to the upper floors one day! The staff were courteous although the restaurant service was variable. I wouldn't put anyone off staying here but there are equally good if not better hotels nearby.

title: Good Stay
review: Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent stay at our hotel. We appreciate your feedback and we’re very sorry you were unhappy with the quality of our hotel. Guest feedback is incredibly important to us and we are taking your comments into consideration as we improve our on-property experience. We hope to have another opportunity to serve you, if your travels bring you back to our area. Warm Regards, Dominique Marty

title: Lots of issues with this Hilton
review: The location could have been more convenient for the Boston attractions, but so saying, this didn't spoil the 2 visits we had. The hotel is what it is and try, if you can, to get a room overlooking the river. The view is very good. There is a trolley stop outside the hotel, which is very convenient and within a 5 minute walk there is are 2 subway stations, very handy for getting to the harbour area of Boston. We ate once in the hotel and the poor man on duty - the only one - was run ragged, hence the very poor service. The hotel must get its act together regarding the number of staff required to be on duty. The steak tips were not very good either. Bit on the tough side. This was pointed out to the management who were apologetic and adjusted the bill accordingly. Good PR. We ate…

title: "Better service than amenities"
review: Thank you for taking the time to review your stay with us here at the Hilton Boston Back Bay. Our team members will greatly appreciate your wonderful feedback as they continue to proudly uphold our Hilton Values. We understand your dining experience at our restaurant did not exceed your expectations and would like to apologize that your steak was not cooked to your liking. Our Director of Food & Beverage is reviewing your comments with the chef to ensure that our culinary and restaurant team are aware and strive to avoid such issues from arising in the future. If you find yourself in the Boston area in the future, it would be our pleasure to welcome you back.  Warm Regards,  Dominique Marty

In warmer months, people run and bike on paths running along the esplanade, and sail and kayak on the Charles River. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Big mistake
review: I spent $450 a night here for four nights and was disappointed.  My room key did not work on check-in, the room service was a joke, the bar closed early, the room was the same as when I stayed several years ago for far less, and I spent more money across the street at the Sheraton as a result.

title: Boston Back Bay doesn't act like a Hilton
review: We appreciate the feedback you have provided the Hilton Boston Back Bay with your review. Please accept our deepest apologies for failing to exceed your expectations during your stay with us. We always strive to uphold the Hilton Values and culture and regrettably did not do so during your stay with us. Your comment concerning room service and bar hours has been addressed to the Director of Food and Beverage and he has reviewed the matter with his team. We hope you will reconsider your decision to stay at a different property on your next visit to Boston because our team is dedicated to make it right for our guests and would love to have the opportunity to do so. Warm Regards, Dominique Marty

title: Good City Location
review: Beware of what you get when booking. We have just checked in and had paid for a king room and have received a old outdated room with 2 double springy creeky beds.  When calling the front desk to correct this error we are told they are fully committed and cannot do anything. We also ordered room service as we have had a long day of travelling so too tired to go out and they completely stuffed up our order and then when my husband called them to advise they had given us the wrong order they insisted that is how it comes and were rude about it.  I will not recommended this hotel to anyone as they clearly don't have any care factor for keeping their guests happy. If i could i would change hotels right now. Not impressed at all.

title: Excellent Location For Sightseeing
review: First and foremost, thank you for taking the time and effort to write us a thorough review on your stay with us.  We understand your experience with our CP Express room service did not exceed your expectations and would like to apologize for the errors in your order. Our Director of Food & Beverage is reviewing your comments with the chef to ensure that our culinary and restaurant team are aware and strive to avoid such issues from arising. We would also like to apologize for the booking error and have brought this issue to the attention of our Front Office Director. We would love to welcome you back to have the opportunity to exceed your expectations. Sincerely, Dominique Marty General Manager

Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Beware of on line check in unless you want a handicap room
review: Everything is within walking distances. I didn't have to drive around Boston to search for places to eat or shop. The hotel was clean, staff was friendly. The price was average compared to other hotels in the area.

title: Weekend Getaway
review: Thank you for taking the time to commend our team members for providing you with excellent guest service.  We are delighted that your recent stay at the Back Bay Hilton was one that exceeded your expectations and the convenience of our location afforded you.  Providing positive and memorable experiences for our guests is the reason for our success along with our excellent location. We hope you will stay with us on your next visit to our beautiful city and take full advantage of our prime location.  It would be our pleasure to welcome you back. Warm Regards, Dominique Marty

title: not really on par with the brand
review: My wife stayed here 6 weeks ago before our entire family stayed here last weekend.   My Wife liked the hotel and it's location.  It's one flaw was that she checked in on line and was given a "handicap room".  She asked for a new one and was told by the receptionist "this was the room you reserved on line" (it was not).  She took the room as the receptionist said that the hotel was "fully committed".    I also checked in line having had requested a high floor with a view.  When I checked on line, I saw that we had a room on the 23rd floor.  When I checked in - we were once again given a handicap room.  Was this a coincidence?  I asked for a different room and was offered a room on the 7th floor with a view of a building(the room, I was told was an upgrade as it was a corner…

title: Fantastic, easy stay.  Great location
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience at the Hilton Boston Back Bay. We would first like to apologize for all issues with your check in and room allocation. We are sorry we had placed you in the room that you had not originally selected.   We are thrilled to hear Troy was able to make it right and provide you with the correct room.   We hope you will stay with us again so we can have a fresh start and check you in to the right room originally and surpass your expectations. Warm Regards, Dominique Marty

title: Boston Back Bay
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Celebratory Birthday Weekend!
review: I found a pubic hair on my sheets when I pulled back the covers... which made for a very itchy night. The toliet keep gurgling and when I went  to the bathroom and lifted the lid, shredded toliet paper and colored water backflowed into the toliet.  The gurgling noises made for a pretty gross nights sleep.   There didnt appear to be a dining service, but rather a company that delivered and this wasnt mentioned on the menu.  I ordered a cheeseburger and fries.  The cheeseburger arrived with a hard bun, wrapped in foil, as if it had been sitting under a hot plate for hours.  The fries looked like they were removed from a left over plate and stuck under a hot plate until someone ordered them.  They arrives looking like they had a coating of hardened oil on them.  Pretty miserable…

title: Good Boston Hotel
review: First and Foremost thank you for taking the time to share your review at the Hilton Boston Back Bay. Please accept our deepest apologies for failing to exceed your expectations during your stay with us. We always strive to uphold the Hilton Values and culture and regrettably did not do so during your stay with us. We are sorry your room was not found at it cleanest potential in a result of a not so quiet night's sleep. We would also like to apologize for CP Express, our in-house Room Service, not meeting your standards. We have forwarded your comments to our Culinary Chef, so he can speak with his staff to ensure our food is always served at his highest quality.  We hope you will consider staying with us again, so we have the opportunity to provide you with a quiet, clean stay that will surpass your expectations. You are important to us, so we hope to welcome you again. Warm Regards, Dominique Marty

title: Great Location & Friendly Staff
review: Favorite Boston Hotel, location is fantastic for teenagers to go shopping.  We were celebrating my son's 17th birthday with his 2 best friends.  Need to get adjoining rooms, they even gave us the same exact rooms we had to celebrate his 16th birthday.  The Front Office Manager, Troy, handled our reservation expertly and the whole team was aware of our birthday celebration and went above and beyond to make it a special occasion.  Josh, the Concierge delighted us by making dinner reservation at a very busy restaurant, getting a great table!  We will be back next October!

title: One Night Stay
review: It was our pleasure to read such an exciting review about your stay at the Hilton Boston Back Bay.  We are delighted that you enjoyed celebrating your son's birthday with us and will be sure to inform, Josh along with the rest of the staff, for surpassing your expectations.  Our team members continuously strive to create memorable experiences and will love to hear that he went above and beyond.  Thank you for continuously choosing to commemorate your son's birthday with us.   We appreciate your business and loyalty and look forward welcoming you all back again next October. Warm Regards, Dominique Marty

title: Complete disappointment and stressful
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Excellent stay and great service
review: As a Hilton Honors Gold member I was thrilled to be able to do mobile check-in prior to my arrival. It's a wondeful feature I had just used the prior evening in Burlington, Vermont.  I had selected a great room on a high floor with a view of the city.Upon our arrival I was detained at the registration desk for an extended period, something that is not supposed to happen with mobile check-in.  After waiting I was told by the attendant, Edgardo, that our room was given away to another guest.  He was very apologetic and offered to make up for it by comping our parking.  We proceeded to our room and noticed the room was uncomfortably cold so we adjusted the thermostat and proceeded downstairs to get something to eat.  Upon returning to the room after a fair absence, I called the…

title: Front Desk Service
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback from your stay with us. We would like to sincerely apologize for your stay. We always strive to provide the best service to our guests and on this occasion we did not exceed your basic expectations. I would first like to apologize for the heater in your room not working properly. I have forwarded this message along to the Director of Engineering to have all issues resolved but more importantly, I would like to apologize for the service we provided you on the phone. We care about our guests at the Hilton Boston Back Bay and I am embarrassed to hear those things were said to you.  I hope you will consider to stay with us again as I would like to have the opportunity to make it right with you and provide you the VIP service you deserve. Please contact me personally upon your next stay. Warm Regards, Dominique Marty

title: Problem Hotel
review: We arrived at the hotel prior to check in and I asked if they could store the luggage so we could take a Duck Tour of Boston.  They said that would be fine and that when we returned the luggage would be in our room.  I had purchased the room on Priceline and it did not specify which side of the hotel it would be on.  The hotel is 3 sided and I wanted to be on the side facing the Charles River.  It took some time but the lady at guest services was able to find us a room on the 22nd floor.  The concierge was very helpful on multiple occasions.  The hotel is very close to the Old Town Trolley, the Boston Duck Tours local restaurants and many historical sites.  The cab ride was $35 dollars from Logan Airport.

title: Great location and service
review: Thank you for taking the time to share about your positive stay at the Hilton Boston Back Bay. Our team members are thrilled to hear we were able to accommodate all of your needs, helping you get the most of your stay in Boston. We can understand why you love the view of the Charles River. We hope we have the opportunity to welcome you back to Boston again and build on your trust and loyalty. Warm Regards, Dominique Marty

title: Good base for Boston
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Comfortable stay
review: Compares well with other Hilton's we have stayed at. Comfortable room with a small seating area and good view of the city from our 24th floor. The addition of a safe for valuables was welcome. Good pool and modern fitness centre. Complementary wifi quite weak. Price for the room was around the level being charged by similar hotels in the area. In the past, at other Hilton hotels, we have often been able to secure a deal that included breakfast, but not on this occasion. Meals taken in the hotel were on the expensive side as per usual, but that was not a problem since there were many good restaurants close by within walking distance. We dined at the Cheesecake Factory in the Prudential Centre for our evening meals. For breakfast we used either Philly's in historic Faneuil Hall,…

title: Good hotel for exploring
review: Thank you for leaving us such an approving review of your experience at the Hilton Boston Back Bay.  We are thrilled to hear you loved the view from your room and the amenities throughout the hotel. We are absolutely thrilled you had the opportunity to visit all the local shops and great restaurants around the back bay area. Providing positive and memorable experiences for our guests is the reason for our success along with our excellent location. We hope that you have the opportunity to stay with us again at your next visit to Boston to build on your trust and loyalty.  Warm Regards, Dominique Marty

title: Great hotel and great staff
review: Although rooms were a little dated they were large, clean and comfortable. We started off in a room on the 12th floor (no view) but the next day we were moved up to the 22nd floor where the view across to the river was amazing. Staff were generally pleasant and helpful and the location was good. We didn't eat at the hotel but had a good breakfast at Thorntons - a 2 minute walk away. Good location for the subway. Good free wifi for Hilton Honours members (just join when you arrive if not a member!)

title: Fabulous hotel
review: Thank you for taking the time to review your stay at the Hilton Boston Back Bay. We are happy you enjoyed your stay and the staff was friendly and helpful. We always appreciate guest feedback and continuously take comments into consideration as we strive to improve our guest service experience.  It is important that we accommodate all your needs and would love for you to stay with us again so we can make it right and your next review on us will be 5 stars. Warm Regards, Dominique Marty

title: Great location
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Disappointing for a Hilton
review: Stayed for two nights as part of  'Grand Tour of New England ' great location close to subway , large clean rooms , good buffet breakfast and efficient courteous staff.Didn't eat here in evening but plenty of great bars and restaurants within walking distance. Would recommend

title: A great hotel and great staff!
review: Thank you for sharing the kind words about your stay at the Hilton Boston Back Bay.  We are thrilled to hear you enjoyed your stay and the location afforded you. Providing positive and memorable experiences for our guests is the reason for our success along with our excellent location. We hope you will stay with us on your next visit to our beautiful city and take full advantage of our prime location.  It would be our pleasure to welcome you back. Warm Regards, Dominique Marty

title: Back bay is at the front
review: The good thing: the hotel is in a very good location within walking distance to restaurants, shopping and public transport. Now the not so good: the hotel - for a Hilton - is pretty dated and tired. The staff at front desk seemed uninterested for the majority of our stay (I am a Diamond member so used to another level of customer service). The lounge was ok to have breakfast and coffee but nothing special. The room was not cleaned properly upon arrival.  Overall it was not the experience I was expecting of a Hilton hotel - during our New England trip we stayed at Garden Inns and Hampton Inns that where much much better.

title: Nice location...good hotel
review: We appreciate the feedback you have provided the Hilton Boston Back Bay with your review. Please accept our deepest apologies for failing to exceed your expectations during your stay with us. We always strive to uphold the Hilton Values and culture and regrettably did not do so during your stay with us. Your comment concerning the cleanliness of your room upon check in has been addressed to the Director of Housekeeping, and he has reviewed the matter with his team to avoid this issue from ever occurring again. We hope you will reconsider your decision to stay at a different property on your next visit to Boston because our team is dedicated to make it right for our guests and would love to have the opportunity to do so. Warm Regards, Dominique Marty

title: Location, Location, Location!
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. title: Great stay
review: The Hilton Back Bay is in a great location.  We were able to walk to nearby restaurants, the shops on Newberry Street, Boston Gardens and even the Museum of Fine Arts.  Unfortunately, there is also construction right next door to the hotel which begins before 7AM in the morning (not a fun wake up call).  We were in a room directly opposite the construction so when booking, request a room on the other side of the hotel. Our room was, however, quite nice.  Very large (a corner room) and nice in room amenities.  We did have a couple of issues, though.  The tub drain was clogged and did not drain well and the tub itself was not cleaned well. The toilet seat was also loose.  I complained and  someone was sent to the room to fix these and we were also comped some fees, which was nice.…

title: Conference trip to Boston
review: Thank you for taking the time to review your stay with us.  We appreciate the feedback you have provided and would like to apologize for the construction across the street from our property. It is most unfortunate that those issues disrupted your stay, and your stay was not positively memorable. We would also like to apologize for your tub being clogged and the toilet seat was loose. Our team is dedicated to great service and is thrilled to hear the issues were immediately resolved and provided with comps.  We hope that you will stay with us again and give us the opportunity to exceed your expectations. Warm Regards, Dominique Marty

title: Less than expected
review: Was always in a hurry this trip was great having a taxi stand right at the corner, always a taxi waiting to whisk me off to my next appointment. Hotel was perfect, everything was as it should be. Great location was able to easily get all over town from there. Walked to most of my appointments. Not far to the airport. not far to downtown. everything seemed to be either a 15 minute walk or 11 minute taxi ride.  One of the most comfortable hotel beds i ever slept in. maids didn't make a ton of noise or wake me up. never heard them once.

title: Comfortable Friendly Stay
review: We are thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your stay here at the Hilton Boston Back Bay and the convenience our location afforded you.  Providing positive and memorable experiences for our guests is the reason for our success along with our excellent location. Our team is thrilled we were able to assist with getting you around the city and guaranteed you a quiet nights sleep. We are thankful you took the time and effort to share your experience at our property. We hope you will stay with us on your next visit to our beautiful city and take full advantage of our prime location.  It would be our pleasure to welcome you back. Warm Regards, Dominique Marty

title: Location's good but feels old and sad!
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Great location and a good overall hotel
review: We liked the location of this Hilton, and yet I find it too old style. The staff were very friendly and attentive though. They hsve a Starbucks in the hotel lobby which is a big plus. Also, the firm and comfortable Kingsize bed and easy Wifi access were the good plus aspects.  Overall,mI feel we paid a large sum for the location.

title: Great location
review: Thank you for taking the time to review your stay at the Hilton Boston Back Bay. We are thrilled you enjoyed the location and our comfortable beds. On another note, we are sorry our hotel had not met your standards. We always appreciate your feedback and continuously take comments into consideration as we strive to improve our guest service experience.  It is important that we accommodate all your needs and would love for you to stay with us again so we can make it right and your next review on us will be 5 stars. Warm Regards, Dominique Marty

title: Affordable in the city - decent location
review: I stayed at this property for four nights for business. As a HHonors Gold, I was offered a high floor room, but not a change from the double room I booked to the king room I desired. I was also denied a late check as the property was full, but this is not abnormal for HHonors properties where late checkout is by availability and not guaranteed unlike some competitor chains.  I was also given two bottles of water daily and access to the Diamond Lounge, the properties executive lounge which is located on the ground floor near their restaurant. The rooms were neither large nor small, but were clean. Clearly some furnishings in the room were showing wear but the common areas (hallways and lobby) were well maintained.   The hotel itself is across the street from the Sheraton, and…

title: Great Place to stay!
review: We thank you for taking the time to review your stay at the Hilton Boston Back Bay. We value your feedback as we are continuously looking for ways to improve our guest's experience. We are thrilled you enjoyed your stay and the Diamond Lounge along with the convenience of our location. On another note, we would like to apologize for having to deny you a late check out this stay.  We try very hard to prevent this from occurring. We thank you for your business and loyalty and hope to welcome you again in the future. Warm Regards, Dominique Marty

title: Great Hotel for Diamond
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline.
