title: Nice place;Great location
review: As the saying goes, first impressions are lasting impressions: our first impressions were of a very ordinary drab hotel which didn't look inviting nor appealing. In fact, it didn't seem to be up to the usual Hilton standard. It is, however, in a good location close to excellent shopping facilities and transport. The bedroom was a good size but the bathroom was old and tiny. The bed was comfortable but not of the high quality provided in most other Hilton hotels throughout the world.The lounge and food were a disappointment. We would not stay there again.

title: Huge rooms, great for families
review: Room and bathroom on the small side but clean. Maid service was a little lacking no towels one night. The hotel is in walking distance of tons of retail stores and great restaurants. The hotel concierge was very helpful in suggesting restaurants and sightseeing tours.

title: Dirty Shabby Room and Terrible Food for Huge Dollars
review: Thank you very much for taking the time to post a review of your experience at the Back Bay Hilton.  Making the most out of our convenient location is easy, with our hotel being in the heart of the Back Bay. We look forward to welcoming you back to Boston

title: Nice hotel,close proximity ,safe!
review: Traveling with my mom and my 3 children - we had 2 connecting rooms one with 2 queens and 1 with a king and chaise that acts as a bed for a small child. The rooms were spacious and very nice. The staff at the hotel was so kind and gracious. "Mr. Vern" managed to wrangle all our luggage with a smile and went out if his way to be helpful to us during our stay. The hotel is pricey but so is everything else in Boston. It is smaller than some of the others in the area and feels less hectic inside. It's location does require some walking to get to Copley or the T but not much. We were very pleased and will definitely return on our next trip to Boston.

title: Great Stay
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. In nice weather, restaurant patio seating is packed with Bostonians and tourists alike soaking up the sunshine and enjoying the food. Commonwealth Ave offers a beautiful stroll down residential tree-lined streets. Keep walking towards the Charles River and enjoy a beautiful view by the water. In warmer months, people run and bike on paths running along the esplanade, and sail and kayak on the Charles River. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Good Location
review: Awesome Facility..Friendly Staff...Great Location.  Restaurant and Bar Affordable and Excellent Quality.  Spacious Meeting Rooms and Attentive Service.  Fitness Center was Relaxing and Accessible.  Bell Desk was Accomodating and Prompt.  Housekeeping was great.  Rooms were clean and comfortable.

title: Winning team(work) in Boston...
review: Thank you very much for taking the time to post a review of your experience at the Back Bay Hilton. I appreciate you taking the time to compliment our staff for their dedication to our guests! I am fortunate to have a great team that focuses on taking care of our guests, and I thank you for noting it! I look forward to welcoming you back to Boston!

title: Our great stay!!
review: Hilton Boston Back Bay is located close to Copley Park, where you can get twofer show tickets, for the limited number of shows in Boston.  The hotel is a short walk to Fenway Park, the finish line for the Boston Marathon.  The hotel itself is a typical Hilton hotel, good service, average continental + breakfast for Hilton Honor members. Rooms are clean, bedding is comfortable. Elevators are slow, Concierge was not very knowledgeable or helpful, the doorman is a better source of info.  There are numerous complimentary PCs off the lobby with printers.  There is a Starbucks in the lobby and a PF Changs, Cheesecake Factory and a small mall within a block or so.

title: Prime spot in Boston Back Bay!
review: Thank you for the great review. I'm so glad that you had a great time here at the Back Bay Hilton! We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you again soon!

title: Best place for Fenway Park - hands down
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Excellent Hotel
review: Never been to Fenway, but a chance to see Sir Paul McCartney in the historical park called.  First, hotel staff is incredible; always helpful and friendly. Decor is modern and very inviting. Room was excellent with comfortable beds, pillows, sheets, view of city. Second - locale could not have been better for us. Right by the trolley pick up for a two day tour; one street from amazing restaurants, shops, bars. Huge shopping center was near yet we just ran through as we were on the go the entire time. Fenway was a short 10 minute walk although would take longer if in a big throng of people. We walked back after concert and MANY fans had parked cars futher than were we were staying - it is that great of a place. My only suggestion for the Hilton would be to have coffee/tea in the…

title: Outstanding Hotel
review: Thank you very much for taking the time to post a review of your experience at the Back Bay Hilton.  Making the most out of our convenient location is easy, with our hotel being in the heart of the Back Bay. We look forward to welcoming you back to Boston soon and hope you enjoyed your concert at Fenway!

title: A Pleasant Stay in Hilton Back Bay Boston
review: My wife and I are just home after a weeks stay at this hotel, from day 1 until our last, the staff were excellent, front desk to chambermaids, they all looked after us so well. I must give special thanks to the guys behind the bar at 40 Dalton, lauren, Matt and Jamie not only kept us going in refreshments, they also gave great advice on places to visit and to dine out, they helped make our stay in Boston all the better, we certainly recommend the Back Bay Hilton and hope to visit again inthe near future.

title: Good choice in Back Bay.
review: Close to Fenway Park, Copley Square and newberry Street Shopping. Tour Bus pick up across the street, with Staff friendly and accommodating. Breakfast offered is Starbucks that does not open to 7.00am. No free WiFi

title: Amazing Stay at Hilton Back Bay
review: Stayed there 3 nights for a first time Boston. We were given a room on the 20th floor with a nice view and free wifi which was nice given that we expected to have to pay for it. The room had an empty fridge which was great for keeping our drinks, the bed was comfortable and we slept very well. Can also mention that the training facilities were great. Breakfast buffet was good but expensive (22$ per person without tip).  The staff was nice, polite and helpful.

title: Average but comfortable
review: I am delighted that your recent stay at the Back Bay Hilton was one that exceeded your expectations. Your many wonderful compliments of the hotel are sincerely appreciated! We look forward to welcoming you back to Boston soon.

title: Great location

title: Perfect location
review: Spent one night for a Red Sox game and fireworks for the 4th. Location was perfect for walking to Fenway, only 15 minute walk. Hotel is located right next to Prudential Center, Copley Place. Several restaurants in the area as well. Hotel room was clean, Bellhop was excellent. Only down side was the elevators, very slow.

title: Over Night in Boston/Red Sox Game
review: Thank you for taking the time to post a detailed response of your experience at the Back Bay Hilton! I appreciate your very kind comments and I will be sure to share your feedback with hotel. We hope you enjoyed the Red Sox game and fireworks and look forward to welcome you again soon!

title: Ok stay with nothing to write home about
review: In a perfect location for sightseeing, Lots for the tourist in the area, Plenty of restaurants for most budgets and only a couple of minutes walk to the T to go out & about.  Lovely view from our room over Boston & the river from an upper floor.

title: Charged my card after cancellation
review: Thank you for the great review. I am glad you found our location to your liking and enjoyed your time here in Boston. We hope to welcome you back soon!

title: Wedding event, plus unusual event!  Excellent organization
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Overpriced for Room/ Inconsistent Service
review: The Hilton Back Bay is in a great location, and the guest rooms are very comfy, clean, and well-appointed.  Everything you'd expect from a Hilton.  We were here for a family wedding.  The wedding and reception were at the hotel and the staff did an great job making sure the event was wonderful.   The unusual event:  at 4 am on Sunday morning, a transformer in the neighborhood blew and for several blocks of Boston, the electricity was gone.  So, no television, no phone charging, no traffic lights, nada, zip, zilch.  At daylight, from our room on the 23rd floor we could see utility trucks at work, digging up the street way below us.   We were checking out that morning, and the hotel's generator was keeping one of the 3 elevators going.  We grabbed our luggage and rode down.  As…

title: Nice one-night stay during the Early Music Festival
review: Thank you very much for taking the time to post a review of your experience at the Back Bay Hilton. I appreciate you taking the time to compliment our staff! I am fortunate to have a great team that focuses on taking care of our guests, and I thank you for noting it! I look forward to welcoming you back to Boston!

title: Great stay!
review: As a Hilton Gold Member I expect a certain quality when I travel for business and pleasure. I stayed three nights at this hotel in late June 2013 while attending a conference at the Harvard Medical School. Upon checking in I was informed that I was upgraded "complementary" which I have learned can mean different things depending on the management (please see my review of the Hilton resort at Myrtle Beach as an example). I was given room 1618 and upon entering the room it was hot and the AC did not work. A maintenance worker did get it going after 2 hours while I was working at the room desk. The exhaust fan for the very small bathroom did not work at all and thus I had to battle the "steam" on the mirror while getting ready each morning for the conference. Moreover, I paid in…

title: Reseved Room given away
review: Thank you for taking the time to share feedback on your recent stay with us. I always appreciate hearing from our guests – including places of improvement. I apologize for the poor service you received at breakfast in our executive lounge and I have taken your comments to our team to ensure that in the future we do a better job of ensuring every guest feels valued and welcomed. The next time you have the opportunity to travel to the area I do hope that you will be our guest again so we may show you the complete quality hospitality you expect and deserve.

title: Great Hotel and Staff
review: We were here for two nights in June 2013. Beautiful hotel with an excellent location (near 2 green line T stops, the convention center, Newberry Street). We wanted a hotel downtown that wasn't TOO close to Quincy Market, etc. so the choice was perfect for us. We had a very nice, clean room on the 22nd floor. Staff (front desk, bellman) all very polite and professional. Starbucks in the lobby was very convenient for that extra "jolt" before heading off. Would have preferred free Wi Fi but that is really my only complaint. Would definitely stay at this hotel again.

title: Good location, great views, and great rooms
review: I am thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your room and that our staff took such great care of you! I am glad you were able to take advantage of our convenient location. We look forward to welcoming you back to Boston in the future!

title: Good service, great location
review: Great experience. Staff was very helpful. Would definitely recommend!!!!!!Very convenient to all attractions and the convention center. This would be the hotel of choice if we visit Boston in the future.

title: Decent
review: Thank you for the great review. I'm so glad that you had a great time here at the Back Bay Hilton and more importantly – enjoyed our local attractions! We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you again soon!

title: Back Bay Hilton rocks!
review: I was in Boston for the Red Hat Summit and picked the nearest hotel, the Hilton.  I had a wonderful experience at the Hilton: with courteous and helpful staff.  In the end I believe the Hotel stay made my conference trip more productive.  I plan to come back next year for the same conference and stay at the Hilton Back Bay

title: Old hotel but renovated and good staff
review: Thank you for taking the time to post a response of your experience at the Back Bay Hilton! I appreciate your very kind comments and I will be sure to share your feedback with the hotel. We look forward to welcoming you back next year!

title: No Power- No manners either!
review: Wonderful room, great service, lovely staff.  Would stay here again in a heartbeat!  It rained during our stay, and if you just hop across the street to the Sheraton Hotel, it leads, INDOORS to a lovely mall to shop or have a snack in.  AND you can go into the Prudential's Top of the Hub for a drink and never get a raindrop on you.

title: Nice Clean, Comfortable Hotel in a Great Location!
review: We are delighted that your recent stay at the Back Bay Hilton was one that exceeded your expectations. Making the most out of our convenient location is easy, with our hotel being in the heart of the Back Bay and we are glad you enjoyed your time in Boston! We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you again soon; hopefully we will have better weather!

title: Good, solid hotel with nice staff

title: Boston in May
review: My wife and I stayed there recently as I was accompanying her on a business trip. We liked the hotel. Largish, comfortable room with a good view of some domed building (sorry, I don't know what it was) and beyond. I think the only "upgrade" we got with me as a Hilton Diamond member was to an upper floor, but that was fine, we'd booked at the last minute (literally the day of arrival) and the hotel seemed pretty full. Nice staff. I'm a light sleeper and I didn't notice whether the walls were thin, but then again we were just there for a couple of days.   Oddly, one respect in which the hotel undersells itself (albeit in a minor way) regards what it calls a continental breakfast in its lounge (which I guess is just for Hilton Gold and Diamond members). Actually, there are both hot…

title: Here for work- nice hotel
review: Thank you very much for taking the time to post a review of your experience at the Back Bay Hilton. I appreciate you taking the time to compliment the team and, in particular, our Diamond Lounge Attendants for their dedication to our guests and making sure you had everything you needed in the lounge. I am fortunate to have a great team that focuses on taking care of our guests, and I thank you for noting it! I look forward to welcoming you and your friends back to Boston soon!

title: One eye crying the other laughing
review: Loved the location of the hotel. The staff were very pleasant and gave us excellent tips about the area. They accommodated us with a late check out and our car was safely parked for the entire day. We were able to catch a cab to a college graduation with ease and did not have to figure out where to park once we got to the graduation, Priceless! They also recommended a great breakfast location, very reasonable. All in all I would stay there again. I would look for a better rate in the future, graduation weekend prices are out of control at all hotels.

title: Well Placed for Fenway Park and Convention centre.
review: Thank you very much for taking the time to post a review of your experience at the Back Bay Hilton. I appreciate you taking the time to compliment our staff! I am fortunate to have a great team that focuses on taking care of our guests, and I thank you for noting it! I look forward to welcoming you back to Boston and Congratulations to your graduate!

title: Great Hotel - Second Time here

title: Very pleasant stay.
review: The Hilton Back Bay is a great, quiet and accessible hotel in a quiet little corner of a busy area. Its convenient to the T and very close to Prudential Center, Fenway and Boyleston Street. Staff is very friendly, rooms are quiet with great views out all sides.

title: Good location, nice hotel gym
review: Thank you very much for taking the time to post a review of your experience at the Back Bay Hilton. I appreciate you taking the time to compliment the team and our property! We look forward to welcoming you back to Boston!!

title: hilton boston back bay/anime boston 2013
review: Check in was quick, location could not have been better,round the corner from Newbury street,could get  the T to main attractions, bought a 7 day ticket 18 dollars worked out cheaper, the room was spacious, bed was a king, very comfortable, air conditioning worked well, only  a few criticisms, waited 3 days for an iron to be sent to the room, the light in the bathroom did not always come on had to hit the wall, but it did not bother me enough to mention it, the staff very welcoming and helpful, again the location was perfect, walking distance to Beacon Hill, Charles river, Fenuel hall, it really is a walking city, everything is central, did not eat in the restaurant in the Hilton as there are so many in the area to choose from, spoilt for choice.  Did a day trip to Salem, ferry…

title: Excellent location
review: Thank you again for taking the time to post a detailed account of your experience and we hope to have the opportunity to welcome you again soon!

title: Great Location!!!

title: Good gym and pool & location
review: We had a fabulous time at the Hilton Back Bay for my 40th birthday trip.  The staff is friendly, the hotel is clean, and you are just steps from the T and Boylston and Newbury St.  The fruit infused water in the lobby is a nice touch.  The beds are VERY comfortable!

title: Comfortable, convenient and clean stay in the Back Bay
review: Thank you for taking the time to post about your experience here at the Back Bay Hilton! I am glad you enjoyed your stay and the fruit infused water in our lobby. I hope you had an amazing Birthday and many more to come! We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you again soon!

title: I wanted to like this hotel
review: Have just spent 5 nights at Hilton Back Bay Boston.  Hotel was fine (i.e. normally expected standard for a city hilton). No complaints about bedroom, staff or hotel (although bathroom was on small side) Gym and pool were really good and often empty, especially the outside sun deck. 5 mins walk from a big Shaws store (which you can actually walk to undercover via the shopping mall opposite).  The exec lounge was busy at breakfast, but they seemed to just put people down to the main restaurant.  Food was OK in exec lounge but I think this is not a proper exec lounge, so fairly limited.  Service from staff was fine and location excellent being near Prudential and Hynes T stops.  Although there is nothing to rave about, there was nothing wrong with this hotel either.

title: Clean modern rooms - Fantastic views!!
review: Thank you for taking the time to post a detailed account of your experience! I am happy that you enjoyed your stay and took advantage of our convenient location! We look forward to welcoming you back to Boston again soon!

title: Nice deluxe room
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Marathon Weekend
review: I had stayed at this hotel over 20 years ago on my first visit to Boston. Fortunately, the hotel has been renovated since then. We received an upgraded room on the 20th floor with views towards Cambridge and the Charles River. The room was very spacious, with a comfortable bed. It would have been nice, in fact, to have a larger TV in the room, given the distance from the bed and lounge chair. The bathroom, as other reviewers have noted, is very small, which makes it almost impossible for 2 people to get ready at the same time. The hotel is in a very convenient location, close to the Prudential Center, Boylston Street and T-stops for the Hynes Convention Center.  My biggest complaint is about the conceirge lounge. It wasn't clear if the location on the third floor was a permanent…

title: Top service and excellent Back Bay location
review: Great location for marathon weekend. Across the road from expo. Only a minute or two to Boylston Street. Fifteen minute walk to Cropley Square and mara bus pickup. Walking distance to heart of restuarant scene. Rooms just OK. A bit dated and small bathroom. No noise issues up on 20th floor, however others on low levels mentioned some issues. Front desk a bit hit and miss. Sometimes great, at other times hopeless. Room servicing a bit inattentive to requests. Unfortunately took a few late night prank calls (scammers posing as front desk night manager requesting credit card confirmation details) on room phone. I wasn't aware that Joe Public could directly dial a room. Would I stay there again? Only if there were no better options.

title: Good value at great location
review: Thank you for taking the time to share feedback on your recent stay with us via TripAdvisor. We appreciate your candid review and we will use your comments as we constantly look for ways to improve our guests' experience. We hope you will return to stay with us again the next time you are in Boston so we may show you the complete quality stay you expect and deserve.

title: nice city nice hotel
review: My husband and I really enjoyed our stay at the Hilton Back Bay for our anniversary night. With tickets to the symphony and reservations at our favorite back bay restaurant, we chose the hotel for its location. What we didn't expect was the incredibly nice service - and I mean completely genuine and warm - everyone from the front desk to waitstaff to housekeepers. Totally made our overnight special!  We also enjoyed the workout area and small pool and jacuzzi, a nice way to relax. Finally, the hotel parking is worthwhile as you can leave your car till 5pm the day of your check out so you can enjoy more of the area.  Overall, it was an excellent choice for us.

title: Great location in the Bsck Bay
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: great
review: My sister and I were visiting Cambridge for a wedding and at the last minute decided to visit Boston a day early to do some sight seeing. We booked a night at the Hilton Back Bay because the price was good. Front desk service was friendly and speedy. The room was clean and comfortable. If you are staying more than one night, I would request a room with a view. We were on the back side of the hotel and our view was that of a small alley and another brick building. Our first day there we walked the entire city, the Freedom Trial. Definitely double from this hotel. Our second day, we checked out early but left our luggage at the hotel while we walked around Boylston and Newbury streets. We were to be picked up by some family members at the hotel, but their flight was delayed. We…

title: Lovely Hotel
review: I am delighted that your recent stay at the Back Bay Hilton was one that exceeded your expectations. Your many wonderful compliments of the hotel are sincerely appreciated and I am thrilled that you experienced true Hilton Hospitality with our Staff while you waited for your family! We look forward to welcoming you back to Boston soon.

title: Graduation Weekend in Boston
review: loved the Hilton Backbay.  The location was perfect, safe , and very clean.  We were down by the Prudential building and Newberry street.  It was an easy subway to the commons, Northend and Fanuel Hall and Quincy Market at the Government center

title: Boston Back Bay Hilton
review: Thank you very much for taking the time to post a review of your experience at the Back Bay Hilton. I appreciate your comments on our location and the cleanliness of the hotel. We look forward to welcoming you back to Boston in the near future!

title: Great location, great service, but wish it were quieter
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. In nice weather, restaurant patio seating is packed with Bostonians and tourists alike soaking up the sunshine and enjoying the food. Commonwealth Ave offers a beautiful stroll down residential tree-lined streets. Keep walking towards the Charles River and enjoy a beautiful view by the water. In warmer months, people run and bike on paths running along the esplanade, and sail and kayak on the Charles River. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Good, not great
review: The Hilton Boston Back Bay is a comfortable hotel in most ways.  I enjoyed the pool in the mornings and found the location very convenient to the Hynes Conference Center (it's through the Sheraton, next door).  The service was excellent in every way.  My complaint is that the rooms have no shielding from the hall noises (the elevators and the ice machine) and the HVAC system creates a really loud bang when it comes on.  Several of my colleagues in different rooms had the same complaint.

title: Ideal for business travel
review: I’m sorry we were not able to provide you with the satisfactory peaceful experience you deserved during your recent stay at our hotel. Your satisfaction is very important to us and we appreciate your feedback about the hallway and neighbor noise. Your comments will help us to correct these issues moving forward and we hope you will consider staying with us the next time you are in the area.

title: Great location and beautiful hotel
review: We visit Boston several times a year visiting our daughter.  First the positives:  comfortable rooms and great beds.  Its nice to have a small refrigerator in the room.  The location is in Back Bay and an easy walk a multitude of schools and attactions in the area. Cons: Staff are friendly, but check in could have been better with no one to help us when we arrived and then they seemed more concernd about moving our car vs. helping us check in.  The Paranamc View rooms have great wide windows, but get a room as high up as possible if you want a view worth looking at.  As a local, I couldn't believe that their channel selection did not include the channel that carries the Red Sox!!! Really, kind of cheap if you ask me.

title: Great location and service
review: I am thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your room and am glad you were able to take advantage of our convenient location. We look forward to welcoming you back to Boston in the future!

title: Not the usual Hilton standard
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Great City Hotel
review: I am a frequent Hilton customer and I need to say I was expecting much more from a category 7. The location is great, staff is helpful, but the hotel looks and feels a bit old. Rooms are ok, but small for the price (executive room at 400$), vs. standards. Breakfast is good but limited choice. Didn't have the time to try the fitness and whirlpool. Net, ok hotel but not for the price, nor for the category standards.

title: Great stay for the Boston Marathon!
review: Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent stay at our hotel. We sincerely appreciate your feedback and we’re very sorry you were unhappy with our guest rooms. We will take your comments under consideration as we continually work to improve our guest experience. We hope you will consider staying with us in the future.

title: OK, but not a leading edge Hilton
review: A good location for Boylston Street and Newbury Street. A 20 min walk to Boston common and downtown. If you don'nt want to walk ( which is a nice walk down Newbury street which takes you to the common, as does Boylston street ) a sudway station is a coulpe of mins away. Comfortable clean rooms, friendly staff.Coffee shop selling Starbucks coffee till 6pm also a hotel bar which also serves breakfast. We had breakfast in the executive lounge as we are gold card holders which serves the same as the bar.There is also a gym which we did not use.

title: Many, many thanks!
review: Thank you very much for taking the time to post a review of your experience at the Back Bay Hilton. I appreciate you taking the time to compliment the team and I am glad you enjoyed our location in the Back Bay! I look forward to welcoming you back to Boston in the future!

title: Perfect Location

title: Great business trip
review: While visiting my niece in college, this was hotel was in the perfect location for us to walk and get around the city of Boston.  Within walking distance of Newbury and Boylston Streets.  Where is plenty of shopping and wonderful places to eat.  Room was very clean and the staff was very accommodating to us checking in early.  Parking garage is attached to the hotel.  Overall experience was Excellent.  Would stay here on our next visit to Boston.

title: First visit to Boston
review: Thank you for the great review. I'm so glad that you and your niece had a great experience at the Hotel!  Making the most out of our convenient location is easy, with our hotel being in the heart of the Back Bay just steps away from some of the best eateries, shopping and transportation in Boston. We look forward to welcoming you back to Boston in the future!

title: Superb Hotel in a great location
review: The room was spacious, comfortable and clean.  The bathroom could have used a little bit more attention but overall very good!  The staff were awesome...especially Vernon!  Very polite and ready and willing to assist.

title: A little dissappointing
review: Thank you for your feedback.  We are glad you chose our hotel during your recent stay in the area and we apologize for the housekeeping problems you encountered. We appreciate you bringing this to our attention and know our Guests deserve better. We will make every effort to ensure our rooms meet the highest housekeeping standards. We hope you will give us a second chance if you visit our area in the future.

title: ABOVE and BEYOND DUTY

title: Hotel & Staff Were Great Before and After the Marathon Tragedy
review: Boston Back Bay staff attended to guests in both a professional and caring manner during a terrible week in Boston following the recent bombing. The hotel was on security lockdown but as guests we were well cared for by dedicated staff

title: A few problems
review: On behalf of my team, thank you very much for your gracious review, in the wake of the Marathon Bombings that occurred in our city.  Our guests are always our main focus and it was our pleasure to take care of you during this horrible tragedy! Thank you again for your kind words and I will be sure to pass them on to the rest of my staff. We look forward to welcoming you back to Boston in the future!

title: Amazing hotel
review: We were here for the Boston Marathon and found the location of the Hilton Back Bay a perfect location for our stay. As most know now, the Marathon finishes on Boylston Street and there are a number of hotels that line the course but the crowds on the street watching the finishers makes it a challenge to come and go. It was a much quieter and better experience being a few blocks away. The "T" is just a few blocks away with Green Line Stations at Hynes Convention Center and at Prudential. The Sheraton is across the street and you can cut through there, directly to the Shops at Prudential, the Prudential Bldg, the "T" Station and access to Boylston Street. The hotel was easy to check into and our room was available even though we got there before official check in time. If you are…

title: A Restful Retreat amid the Marathon Chaos
review: Thank you for taking the time to post a detailed response of your experience at the Back Bay Hilton! I appreciate your very kind comments and I will be sure to share your feedback with hotel. The Marathon Bombings was an extremely difficult time for everyone and I am exceedingly proud of how my staff responded and took care of our guests in a time of need! I look forward to welcoming you back next year for the 2014 Boston Marathon!

title: good location

title: Family Stay
review: Was happy with my stay for the most of time.   Because of bombing in the marathon everyting was very strange in the city of Boston. Very good location to stay for the marathon.  Expo right behind the corner and only few hundred meters til finish line.  2km walk to take bus on the morning run started.

title: Boston Marathon
review: Thank you very much for taking the time to post a review of your experience. Making the most of our convenient location is easy, with the hotel being in the heart of the Back Bay just steps away from some of the best eateries, shopping and transportation in Boston.  We look forward to welcoming you back to Boston in the future!

title: Great service and location, but overpriced
review: Nice, clean and comfortable accomodations, staff were pleasant and helpful! Beautiful and clean pool! Children enjoyed it! Easy parking and location of parking makes nice accessibility to vehicle. Convenient and within walking distance to Fenway and other attractions/restaurants. Price was reasonable for last minute decision and location. We would visit this location again.

title: Hilton Back Bay Boston
review: Thank you for your recent review regarding your stay with us. I am very happy to see you enjoyed your accomodations and location. I am glad you had such a great stay with us and we look forward to welcoming you back to Boston soon!

title: Didn't get what I paid for

title: Excellent Stay at the Hilton Boston Back Bay
review: Overall, very disappointed. Reserved a King room and given a room with two doubles. The room was clean and fine. The front desk would not do anything about the room. They offered to discount the rate but when I checked out there was no discount. Front desk knew nothing about it. Not the service I was expecting. Won't return.

title: Get new keys
review: Thank you for your review. I apologize that you were not happy with your room assignment during your recent trip and for the mismanagement of the situation by our team. We strive to accommodate all reservations but occasionally cannot meet every room request due to guests extending their stays with us. We hope you will consider giving us a second chance to show you the quality service and accommodations you deserve if you return to our area in the future.

title: One Bad Apple Doesn't Spoil the Whole Bunch - But almost
review: I stayed here for a conference that was going on at the convention center across the street. The service at the hotel was top notch. I am a Hilton Gold member and the hotel provided excellent service to its gold members including a private lounge that was well stocked with food. The hotel room was nice with a panoramic view (although the view was a bit crappy), clean and quiet. The staff was friendly and helpful. I will definitely stay at this hotel again.

title: Good experience; great staff
review: Thank you for your recent review regarding your stay with us. I am very happy to see you enjoyed your guestroom along with lounge in Forty Dalton. I am glad you had such a great stay with us and we look forward to welcoming you back to Boston soon!

title: Not up to par
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: OVERBOOKED
review: We hoped for better out of this hotel brand. We asked for a quiet room. What we got was not quiet!  The heater would start up with a loud crack and shut off with another loud crack.  We got through the night with  very mixed rest and sleep interruptions. When asked by the hotel staff I mentioned the noise and they apologized and said that they would see to a solution. I mentioned that it was now morning and my wife was dressing. I asked them to wait until we had checked out.  They didn't.  They insisted with 3 calls and a visit to attend to it ASAP. Even then it continued This was ridiculous and poor service. The room itself was spacious; the bathroom was very small .... strange! The lemon water in the lobby seemed a nice touch but there were no glasses to enjoy it! Strange! We…

title: 1st time in Boston.
review: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your experience with the TripAdvisor community. We are so sorry for the restless night you encountered due to our noisy A/C unit and the seemingly overzealous service you received in the morning. We will use your comments as part of our ongoing training to provide the quality hospitality you deserve and hope you will return to see our improvements first hand.

title: Hilton Back Bay - highly recommended !
review: I book a 2 DOUBLE BED room for 3 adults for April 4th-April 7th. We traveled from California to Boston and arrived at the Hilton well after midnight. I checked in at the front desk and we were given the keys for our room. Upon entering our room we discovered that we had been given a room with no bed. The room appeared to be a Party Suite with a large table and chairs with no bed. They had made the sofa bed. I went down to the front desk and it was then that they mentioned that they had overbooked. They offered to send us to another hotel, but we were tired and weary at that time. We asked them to bring an extra bed to the room and they did. It was a very small bed but at least we all had a place to sleep.   They moved us the next day to a room with 2 DOUBLE BEDS. I don't…

title: Stayed for 6 nights while house hunting in Boston
review: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your review with the TripAdvisor community. I apologize that we were unable to accommodate your reserved room type upon arrival and for any discomfort or inconvenience our overbooked situation caused you. Our front desk department goes through a lengthy process each day to ensure that our guests receive exactly the room expected, however at times we do not have the same availability due to guests extending their stays with us. We are sorry for the misstep in service and for our delay in getting back to you on the matter. Once again, I apologize for the inconvenience and do hope that the next time you travel to the area you will consider staying with us again so we may show you the consistent quality service and accommodations you expect and deserve from our hotel. If we may be of any additional assistance or if you would like to discuss your stay further, please do not hesitate to contact our offices directly.

title: Outstanding
review: This is a great place to stay in Boston with easy access to the Prudential Center, Copley Square. If you have nice weather you have Boyelston Street along with Newberury Street.  The Hotel itself has very informative staff who are very helpful with any question you might ask. Very impressed with our Checking In Gentleman who handled everything named Omar.

title: SOO DISAPPOINTED
review: Thank you very much for taking the time to post a review of your experience at the Back Bay Hilton. I appreciate you taking the time to compliment the team and, in particular, Omar for his dedication to our guests and making sure you had everything you needed at check in. I look forward to welcoming you back to Boston in the future!

title: Great location, Great hotel
review: Very helpful staff.  Answered all of our out of towner questions, gave us tips and directions on where to go and how to get there.  Hotel was very close to where we wanted to go.  Left car in garage and took a train to where we needed to go.

title: Hilton Back Bay fits the bill
review: We stayed here for the past 5 years for the easter holiday. This year's stay was soo disappointing for us. In a nut shell the hotel is under renovation. We have no idea if any of the rooms are ready for occupancy. They need an overhaul. In short, pillows are worn, shower drains smell of must and mold, rugs are dirty and stained, elevator to the garage broken during our stay, curtains falling off the rods, drilling above our heads, heating/air unit broken..suffered two days with a room at 78 degrees with no way to adjust it or fix it before the circuit finally blew. Engineer fixed it remotely. Bellman very nice, he always says "welcome back" knows us and treats us like family. The rest of the staff only know their jobs, got a lot of "I don't knows" and then said,I'll ask just a…

title: Location, Location, Location !
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Not bad....
review: The Hilton Back Bay has it all when it comes to location. You are in the middle of Back Bay, and very close to important venues like the Hynes Convention Center, Prudential Center, Copley Place, Newbury Street, Symphony Hall, and the list goes on.  We found the rooms to be large, and the bathrooms well stocked with basics. The complex is very clean, and the fitness center and pool are a good size, and well trended to.  If I have to make a suggestion, it is that (3) elevators are barely enough for a busy hotel that has 26 floors.  In addition, it is a rare weekend that finds this area not buzzing with activity. if you are looking for a more mellow weekend hotel, I would recommend the Hilton Financial Center.  The hotel offers room service, but at this location you are surrounded…

title: Disappointment.
review: I appreciate your review of your recent experience at our hotel! It is through such feedback that we are able to continually improve our property to meet and exceed the needs of our guests. We look forward to welcoming you back to Boston in the near future!

title: Did not meet expectations
review: Here for Irish dancing which was on nearby and we were glad to be slightly removed. If you can, try to get a corner room which gives you more space for ten dollars a night. Prepare for all the state taxes too when you get your bill. Staff were ok, rooms very clean and well equipped. Look out for the doorman who was the double of "blakey" from "on the buses". When you enter the Sheraton over the street you can travel under glass all the way to Copley square if you wish. Pool was good with lots of free towels. Grab some free headphones and fruit there too.

title: Top notch service and location
review: Thank you for sharing details about your stay with us. It is through such feedback that we are able to continually improve our property to meet and exceed the needs of our guests. I am very happy to see you had such a great stay with us and I hope you were able to enjoy Boston while you were here for the Irish Step World Championships! We look forward to welcoming you back to Boston in the near future!

title: Great Stay and Location in Back Bay!
review: We only stayed one night but it was a nice, clean, convenient, staff was pleasant and helpful to questions we had. I'm sure if you're looking for luxury this would not be it but it's nice!!! Getting a cab was easy because it snowed 5-6 inches through the night and it seemed to not bother the Bostonians!!!!

title: Too many better options in the area...
review: Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent stay at our hotel. We appreciate your feedback and we’re happy to see you enjoyed your stay! We hope you will consider staying with us in the future.

title: Great fitness facility. Clean, quiet & comfortable, friendly staff
review: stayed here over st. patrick's day weekend.  i booked the room through priceline package with united airfare (room was about $240 for 1 night).  we checked in around 3pm, they pulled up my reservation immediately through priceline.com and gave me the key.  the room was clean and tidy.  the bathroom was nice, although a little small.  the room had a flatscreen TV, desk/study, and lounge chair.  there was also   i enjoyed my stay at the hotel.  the staff was friendly, the room was nice and cozy and they have free internet in the lobby.      location was hard to beat.  it is just minutes away from the hynes convention center.  it is walking distance to boylston street and newberry st.    i would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a good hotel to stay in near back bay.

title: Good location, clean, comfortable, pleasant
review: Thank you for your feedback.  We are glad you chose our hotel during your recent stay in the area and appreciate your time and input on our property layout and amenities.We hope to have another opportunity to serve you, if your travels bring you back to our area.

title: Convenient clean quiet hotel

title: clean and good location
review: I stayed one night when visiting on personal business. I stayed on the 24th floor and it was very quiet. The bathroom was very clean and the beds were comfortable. There was no hairdryer in the unit which surprised me but isn't a big deal.  I got a free voucher for breakfast since it was my first stay and they threw in another for my husband. The coffee was good and the breakfast was decent. There is a starbucks in the lobby with wifi.   The location is convenient witha subway 1.5 blocks away. You can cross the street and cut through the Sheraton and get to a large mall and subway. It was freezing when I was there so this was convenient. There are chain restaurants in the mall (e.g. Cheesecake Factory, PF Changs) but you can walk one - two blocks for other options.   Overall a…

title: Good 4stars hotel
review: Thank you for your recent review regarding your stay with us. I am very happy to see you enjoyed your guestroom along with Breakfast in Forty Dalton. I am glad you had such a great stay with us and we look forward to welcoming you back to Boston soon!

title: Week end stay
review: clean, comfortable and in a good, convenient location. No hot water one morning and the front desk apologized for the inconvenience and offered us free breakfast buffet while they worked on correcting the problem. Hot water was back on after breakfast. No complaints, and seemed to be good value for the area. Not fancy but nice.

title: Hilton Back Bay Boston, MA
review: Thank you for taking the time to review your stay with us. I am very happy to see you had such a great stay however I am sincerely sorry for the trouble with the hot water!  We look forward to welcoming you back to Boston in the near future!

title: Very good for the business traveler

title: Very Helpful to accommodate our school group/Conference
review: I've stayed here several times, and each time I was satisfied.  Lobby:  The lobby is nicely decorated, and there are plenty of seats to wait for others.  There is a business center if you need to check something out on the internet or need to print something.  There is also a starbucks inside the hotel in case you want a quick snack.    Rooms: I stayed in the 1 bedroom King and 2 twin bed rooms.  The king bed room includes a  day bed for you to lounge in.  The twin bedroom doesn't have this.  The bathroom in the twin bedroom is larger, but includes an adjustable height showerhead that I don't like because there's less water coming out of the head compared to the traditional shower head found in the regular king bedroom.    There is little in way of adjusting the temperature. …

title: Excellent location
review: Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us. I am very happy to see you had such a great stay with us and I will be sure to pass along your comments to our staff!

title: Not my first choice
review: The Hilton Back Bay was very good at check in. We had 23 high school students and they were Harvard Model Congress that was taking place across the street at the Sheraton. Im glad we were here instead of the Sheraton. The Sheraton is attached to the Prudential Center and being able to keep the kids at the Hilton was a good thing. The rooms were clean and it was nice to have the opportunity to grab a coffee downstairs Starbucks lobby or go into the bar and get a refreshment. The lobby looks small but there are definitely areas that you can sit and socialize. The elevators were adequate as well. I think the Back Bay is a great location if you are doing business in the area and if you need to take the T. I would stay there again and I thought the price was very reasonable for…

title: Friendly, Professional Service
review: Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us. It is through such feedback that we are able to continually improve our property to meet and exceed the needs of our guests. I am very happy to see you had such a great stay with us and I will be sure to pass along your comments to our staff! We look forward to welcoming you back to Boston in the near future!

title: Great Place to Stay
review: Stayed at the Hilton Boston Back Bay whilst on business for 5 nights. Reception staff friendly and averagely helpful - i received 2 shipments whilst staying and it took them some time to find both. Had room service one evening and breakfast in the hotel restaurant one morning, both good service and good food.  Starbucks in the lobby very handy for grabbing a drink to go. Free wi-fi in lobby area but had to be a gold or diamond HHonors member to get free wi-fi in the room which was a bit of a pain. Overall the hotel could do with a refurb, but really your standard chain 3 start hotel.

title: Not welcoming? Go somewhere else. Hospitality, cold/warm depending on who helps you.
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your quick feedback on your recent stay with us via TripAdvisor. We appreciate your time and input on our service and amenities and we hope you will return to stay with us the next time you are in the area.

title: The Staff Made it Special
review: We recently stayed at Hilton Back Bay.  We chose it because we were searching for a hotel close to Capital Grille, Cheese Cake Factory and House of Blues on Landsdowne Street.  HBB turned out to be perfect for all three.  It ended up being a sleety/snowy night but we were able to walk to Capital Grille (great food but very pricey) and then we took a cab from there ($5) to Landsdowne Street.  The next day was beautiful and we walked to Cheese Cake Factory for lunch.  It was perfect for us.  The hotel was very clean and our room was fine (met our needs).  I will definitely stay here again.

title: Great Hotel
review: Thank you for your review of your past stay with us, I always appreciate hearing from our guests! It is through such feedback that we are able to continually improve our property to meet and exceed the needs of our guests. I am very happy to see you had such a great stay with us! The next time you have the opportunity to travel to Boston I do hope that you will be our guest again.

title: Great price for city location but w 1 caution

title: Good middle-of-the-road Hilton
review: My husband aand I decided to stay in the city after seeing a musical. I found a great advancedrate so we decided to try it. For Boston inner city we got a $119/nite rate. We were about 12 blocks from the theatre but an easy walk. Didn't. Want to be near hospitals and dealing w sirens all night (we're quieter country folk). However once we settled down to go to.bed I heard a noise that sounded like a plane taking off or flying overhead. My husband astutely recognized it as the elevator motors working. We were adjacent to 3 elevators that ran all night. We were on the 15th floor. Eventually the constant hum lulled me to sleep. Highly recommend requesting a room away from elevator!  The thermostat was unresponsive so we cracked a window to cool room down. Near lots of shopping or…

title: Great conference hotel
review: Thank you for your review of your past stay at the Hilton Boston Back Bay. We always appreciate hearing from our Guests - including when comments help identify ways we can improve. I understand that the elevator noise and heating were some issue during your stay. I apologize that you're comfort was interrupted and I have shared your review with our team. I do hope the next time you return to Boston you consider staying with us again.

title: Nice Hotel
review: My wife and I stay in Hilton properties all over the world.  The Back Bay Boston Hilton is solidly in the middle of the pack.  It has the kind of first-class service that you expect in a Hilton.  We were very comfortable in our room, and the location is fabulous - not far from Copley Square and many other attractions in Boston.

title: Great location and room
review: Thank you for taking the time to review your stay with us. I am very happy to see our staff took such great care of you and we look forward to welcoming you back to Boson soon!

title: Convenient and Comfortable Stay While Visiting Colleges

title: Red Soxs
review: I spent a night here with my teenage daughter while in the area to tour BU, Northeastern and Brandeis. I got a pretty good deal through AAA which included parking. The Hilton parking lot is connected to the hotel and we were able to leave the car there till 5:00 pm even though the checkout time was noon. This was a great convenience since parking in Boston can be challenging. Our room was spacious, comfortable and very quiet. Overall, a very pleasing stay and Thornton's around the corner was a good bet for breakfast.

title: A solid business hotel, pleasantly low-key
review: Thank you for staying with us at the Hilton Boston Back Bay and for taking the time to write a review about your recent stay at our hotel! We appreciate your feedback and hope to have another opportunity to serve you, if your travels bring you back to our area.

title: great location super nice staff
review: I have stayed here a couple times to go to Red Soxs games or a night out in Boston.  It was an easy walk to Fenway and even closer to many bars and night clubs. It was a clean hotel lobby and rooms.  Parking was also easy, but does come at an expense. I have always had a good night sleep while here.  The views are amazing in the right room too!!

title: Very good impromptu stay thanks to blizzard
review: Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent stay at our hotel. We sincerely appreciate your feedback and we look forward to welcoming you back to Boston in the near future!

title: Great renovated, back bay hotel, with reasonable parking
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Great location, reasonably priced, very helpful staff.
review: This is the second time i've stayed at the Hilton Boston Back Bay - it's a great hotel, having now stayed at the Hilton Downtown Financial District, I can provide a proper comparison. This hotel doesn't have any suites (well just one) but it does have larger corner rooms. Superior rooms are on the 23+ floors. The gym and pool and jacuzzi are significantly better than the Hilton Downtown, the parking is about $40 but it has unlimited in/out, no need for a valet and allows you to leave later in the day and arrive early, the hilton downtown will charge you +$12 on your $45 parking fee if you arrive before 1pm and +$12 if you leave after 1pm! So this hotel is definitely better value for money. The breakfast buffet is open till 11am, and the rooms are fine, albeit small unless you…

title: Blizzard of 2013
review: It is through such feedback that we are able to continually improve our property to meet and exceed the needs of our guests. I am very happy to see you had such a great stay!  We look forward to welcoming you back to Boston in the near future!

title: Motel 8 may just be as good. Stay at the Sheraton or the lenox if you want a proper service
review: Stayed here for a conference.  They allowed me to leave my car there for well over 24 hours for the 24 hour rate since I attended a 2 day conference at the Hynes (right across the street).  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  The room was clean and I had a great view overlooking the Christian Science building.  It's a short walk (less than a block) to Boylston Street where there are plenty of restaurants.  Copley Square is also very close.  There's a subway station near the Hynes which will get you anywhere in the city.  I booked it 2 days ahead of time for a rate of $119.  My colleague booked his the night before and got it for $109.  HHonors gold and diamond members get the breakfast buffet for free.

title: Good stay- bad HVAC system
review: It is through such feedback that we are able to continually improve our property to meet and exceed the needs of our guests. I am very happy to see you had such a great stay! We look forward to welcoming you back to Boston in the near future!

title: Good location, clean rooms
review: This is a great hotel. They Greeted us with Starbucks Hot Chocolate. They have a Pool, and theres easy access to The Prudential Center area across the street! Parking is right there. It's $40 for parking but other hotels are the same price and this Hotel is really nice!

title: Heating/cooling system can not be controlled by guest. No one to assist with luggage or call a cab. Disinterested staff.
review: It is through such feedback that we are able to continually improve our property to meet and exceed the needs of our guests. I am very happy to see you had such a great stay and enjoyed the Starbucks in our Lobby! We look forward to welcoming you back to Boston in the near future!

title: Great location, great rooms
review: It's in a great location, right near the Prudential Centre and a short walk to Newbury Street where most of the nice restaurants and bars are situated.   I never had any complaints, so little reason to talk to the staff. Found them to be quite impersonal, but you grow to expect that with a chain hotel. Staff were not rude or unhelpful in anyway, just impersonal.   The rooms are very clean, spacious and the beds are very comfortable. Great nights sleep! I am only marking the hotel down because I was disappointed that wifi was not provided for all customers. You had the option to pay or if you were in a premium room you were provided with the code. This was the only hotel of the 5 I stayed in on my trip that did this. I think it is a poor effort on behalf of the Hilton. Nothing…

title: Heart warming in a cold city!
review: We appreciate your feedback about our location and regarding the cost of our wireless internet service. While we do charge an additional fee for wireless internet, we strive to be competitive with other hotels and offer quality services and amenities in our guest rooms. We are glad you enjoyed your stay and hope you will consider staying with us again.

title: Exceptional staff and very nice hotel

title: Nice Hotel in Great Location!
review: When my family travels together we enjoy staying at "upscale" hotels to be as comfortable as possible. This Hilton Hotel did not disappoint. It has a great location just outside downtown Boston and most everything is only a short walk or drive. The entire staff was exceptional and the hotel was very clean and well maintained. Every member of the staff was friendly, helpful and courteous. We would definitely stay here again.

title: Surprisingly lovely
review: Thank you for choosing to stay with us at the Hilton Boston Back Bay.  I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay and that our staff was helpful. I will be sure to share your comments and I hope you will return soon.

title: Excellent hotel near Convention Center
review: Let's face it there is no such thing as a cheap hotel in Boston. But, you really can't beat the value of this hotel based on it's location. I stayed here for 4 days while looking for a permanent residence in the city this past May 2012. The room was large, clean, and the staff was efficient and friendly. The small cafe in the lobby was also nice to grab a quick snack to go. I did not eat ate the hotel at there are so many wonderful restaurants to chose from in the city!

title: Safe Option
review: Thanks for taking the time for the great review and hope to see you return to the Hilton Boston Back Bay!

title: Very attentive service, zero faults, Very good exec lounge food.  Great location.  Well above average for brand.

title: Friendly, convenient and comfortable
review: The striking thing about the Hilton Back Bay is the excellence of the staff.  The location is great with plenty of nearby restaurants and shops for almost any budget.  Well above the average for US Hilton's.

title: Location location location
review: I am very happy to read your comments about your recent stay and glad that you found the location and service levels of our hotel to your satisfaction. Hope to see you return soon....safe travels.

title: Convenient but lacking comfort
review: Having stayed at a few Hiltons and looking at the photos I was expecting a modern hotel and decor in rooms. This Hilton had an impressive lobby and a Starbucks too ( defo a plus!) however the room was not as modern as we would have wanted and a lot of the furnishings in the bedroom looked a but tired. We were upgraded to 22nd floor so had a fab view although not panoramic (even though we booked this). The bathroom however was modern, good water pressure and large.   My husband and I satyed for 4 nights so this room actually grew on us a lot! Breakfast buffet was amazing! Good quality hot food and selection of breads and fruits. Service as expected was good too. Gym was quite big and again with a view however Boston do NOT believe in air con so you are hot before you have started…

title: What Christmas?
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Convenient hotel in Boston
review: Having previously stayed at this hotel I knew that the rooms were nice, staff friendly and that it was excellently located for exploring Boston.  It therefore seemed a sensible choice to stay over Christmas.  We should have known something was wrong when the hotel was unable to confirm its Christmas Day dining arrangements and menu until the second week in December.  Nevertheless we booked as a party of six.  Not a Christmas table decoration in sight, no crackers or festive music.  All of which would have been tolerated had the food been to its usual standard.  The food was poor; roast potatoes raw, meat overcooked and other items burned.    In fairness to the one waitress working she tried hard and her customer service was good.  She was let down by the lack of organisation and…

title: Welcoming staff, excellent location !
review: Please accept our sincere apologies for the poor Christmas experience you had with us. We strive to make every guests stay a positive one and we are sorry that our lack of festive atmosphere detracted from your enjoyment. We have shared your comments on the quality of your dining experience with our culinary team who will work to prevent similar issues moving forward. We are glad to hear our wait staff was friendly and courteous and we will be sure to pass your kind words along. Again, we apologize for not meeting your holiday expectations and we hope you will consider giving us another chance to show you the quality service and accommodations you expect the next time you visit Boston.

title: A MUST STAY while you are in Boston!
review: We travel to Boston frequently and have stayed in many hotels and always like staying at the Hilton Back Bay. The staff is always friendly and the hotel is in a good location to tour the city. They also have a self park garage which is attached to the hotel. We also like going to St. Cecilia's Catholic church which is located next to the hotel.

title: Excellent service!
review: Thanks for the comments and hope to see you return soon to the Hilton Boston Back Bay!

title: Great Views and Location Walkable Anywhere!

title: Great View of Fenway Park
review: This hotel is in the perfect location inside Copley Mall and connected to the Prudential Center. 15 minute walk gets you to Boston Common or Fenway in either direction. Great venue for events with amazing views. Hotel rooms are clean. Staff is friendly.

title: Excellent Locations
review: Just wanted to thank you for your recent stay here at the Hilton Boston Back Bay!  So glad you were able to experience our authentic Hilton hospitality. We look forward to seeing you again soon.

title: Beautiful view and service
review: Location is pretty good, although not a ton of high end restaurants in the immediate area. Not a far walk from Fenway or the Prudential Center. I had a room on a very high room, which offered an amazing view of the city and Fenway Park. Rooms are small, but workable. Free internet in the lobby. Elevators were a little slow and had to wait for a few minutes on multiple occasions.

title: A pleasant hotel
review: Thank you for taking a moment to share your experience. I am happy to hear you had a great experience with us at the Hilton Boston Back Bay and enjoyed the views of Fenway Park! We look forward to welcoming you back the next time you visit Boston!

title: Great Customer Service
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Good hotel in central Boston location
review: The hotel is in a very busy location so it may be difficult maneuvering through traffic to get to the hotel.  Self parking will cost you at least $40, but I guess that is to be expected.  The staff was very helpful.  Once we parked the car we did not want to move it so we asked about eateries and transit.  The hotel is very close to Prudential Place and there are plenty of restaurants easily accessible.  I would recommend this location to travelers.

title: Treated like a family member!
review: Thank you for your review of your recent stay, I appreciate your honest feedback about your experience while parking at our hotel. Your review provides feedback that our hotel team needs to re-evaluate Guest needs and meet Guest expectation.  Thank you again and we hope to see you return in the near future!

title: Very good location
review: If you are looking for a centrally located hotel in Boston, Hilton Back Bay is good value for money.  The only exception is the price of parking which is ridiculous; however, I daresay it's not any more expensive than parking anywhere in the Back Bay / Downtown Boston region.  We did not make use of any amenities (restaurant, pool, gym), but the room was comfortable and clean.  The Prudential T station is a couple of minutes' walk from the hotel, as were a few bars on Boylston Street if you want an alternative to the hotel breakfast.

title: Unsatisfactory
review: I appreciate your review of your recent stay at The Hilton Boston Back Bay  I understand that the parking cost was of concern and am sharing your feedback with the appropriate members of our team. Thank you for your review and taking the time to share your experience.

title: Beautiful
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Very Nice Hotel
review: Spent 3 nights here for a holiday before heading to NY. The Staff were absolutely amazing, cannot fault them one bit. The hotel was in a great location. Close to the train station, all the shopping and about a 20 minute walk from the parks (Boston Common & Public Garden) and more shopping. Very big Town but also very homey! I loved Boston. The Hard Rock Cafe was great too!! Definitely visit to the Quincey Market are you are a food lover -- just food stands / restaurants / bars all the way through -- i didnt know where to look first!!  The hotel really was amazing and if you can get a high floor with a view of the Charles River you are in for a treat! What an amazing view! And the rooms were amazing -- stocked with coffee everyday for the coffee machine and new bottles of water. …

title: Short and sweet stay!
review: Just wanted to thank you for your recent stay here at the Hilton Boston Back Bay!  So glad you were able to experience our authentic Hilton hospitality. We look forward to seeing you again soon!

title: Great Location
review: We spent four nights in a standard double-double room at the Back Bay Hilton the week before Thanksgiving and had a great time!  Some "pros":  * Location!  Close to a lot of cool stuff, including the Prudential Center mall (accessible through the lobby of the Sheraton across the street), Newbury Street, Copley Square, and public transportation.  It was only about a fifteen-minute walk to the Museum of Fine Arts! * Price--although in Boston this is all relative * Friendly and attentive staff.  They go out of their way to help.  We didn't hear the word "no" our entire stay.  When we had a tiny bit of trouble checking in, the front desk gave us a coupon for free wireless internet (which is spottty, but at what hotel isn't it spotty?).  Genuinely nice people on the Back Bay Hilton…

title: Love the Shower in the Panoramic Room
review: Thank you for taking a moment to share your experience. I am happy to hear you had a great experience with us at the Hilton Boston Back Bay and that our team members took such great care of you!. We look forward to welcoming you back when you visit Boston.

title: Excellent location and value

title: Just okay, but not worth the price
review: Stayed in November for a conference. Excellent reception staff and a very good room for conference rate of $179. Nice beds and linens. Close to Boylston and Newbury Streets for great walking to restaurants and shops.  I recommend Abe & Louie's for filet mignon and Jasper White's Summer Shack for the pan roasted lobster. Both in easy walking distance.  Hard to beat at the price.

title: Decent enough, but not my favourite place in Boston
review: Thank you for taking a moment to share your experience.  I am very happy to hear our staff took such great care of you while in Boston!  We look forward to seeing you back at The Hilton Boston Back Bay in the near future.

title: Hilton quality & central location
review: I guess you're paying for the location at this hotel, but at $500 a night for the standard room, you could probably find more affordable options in Back Bay. Everything was just okay. The room was standard and the bathroom was quite small. A small plus is the Peter Thomas Roth products in the bathroom.

title: # 1 Concierge
review: Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent stay at our hotel. We appreciate your feedback and we’re very sorry you were unhappy with guest room. Guest feedback is incredibly important to us and we are taking your comments into consideration as we improve our on-property experience. We hope to have another opportunity to serve you, if your travels bring you back to our area.

title: Very convenient
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. In nice weather, restaurant patio seating is packed with Bostonians and tourists alike soaking up the sunshine and enjoying the food. Commonwealth Ave offers a beautiful stroll down residential tree-lined streets. Keep walking towards the Charles River and enjoy a beautiful view by the water. In warmer months, people run and bike on paths running along the esplanade, and sail and kayak on the Charles River. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Great location in Boston
review: Great location that allows you to walk to many places in downtown Boston as well as across the river to the MIT campus. Rooms are spacious and very clean. Only minus is lack of wireless in rooms, one has to go to the lobby area to use Internet. Bed matresses are a bit too soft for our taste.

title: Excellent alternative to conference hotel
review: We spent 3 nights at the Back Bay Hilton and were very pleased.  The upgrade due to the honors status was excellent with a top notch room with a view, a generous breakfast and great service, The hotel staff is very friendly, pleasant and helpful.  The location in the Back Bay is very convenient - easy walking distance to the Prudential Mall, the restaurants on Boylston St and Newberry Street.

title: Great neighborhood
review: Thanks for taking the time for the great review and hope to see you return to the Hilton Boston Back Bay upon your next visit to Boston!

title: very good hotel
review: Stayed here for a conference across the street at the convention center and was pleased.  The management left a small platter of fresh fruit in my room - nice touch!  The service was very accommodating and the room was comfortable.  I was worried at first that my proximity to the elevators would mean constant hallway noise but I heard nothing all night long.  Besidea the convention center, the hotel is also close to great shopping.  I recommend it!

title: Great place to stay in the back bay
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. title: Lots of good, some not so much!
review: I recently stayed here for 4 nights.  Great hotel overall.  Rooms were very spacious, clean, and modern.  Beds were comfortable.  Room service was wonderful and fast.  There is a starbucks open 24 hours in the lobby that is very convenient.  Tons of restauants and bars within walking distance.  Mall is right next door.  I very very impressed with the Hilton and would stay there again.

title: 3 star hotel with a 3 star experience
review: I am very happy to read your comments about your recent stay and glad that you found the location and service levels of our hotel to your satisfaction. Hope to see you return soon....safe travels.

title: Nice hotel, enjoyed the stay
review: Travelled for business and stayed for 6 nights, so got a good feel of facilities and service. The service was excellent by all means, and in particular with reference to managing package acceptances, and I had a few of them.   Food was ok. Breakfast at the lounge was ordinary, and service lacking as compared to the 'paid breakfast' next door which I also tried on a couple of mornings.   The hotel structure is mediocre, in terms of sound proofing etc. the fitness and pool facilities were above par.   To summarize, good value for money, especially if you are a Hiltoner and need to stay in West Boston.

title: Location Location
review: Thank you very much for taking the time to share your experience. I am very happy to hear that our Team Members took such good care of you and you found the amenities of our property to your liking. Hope to see you return soon! Safe travels.

title: Advance Pay Room is Not Clean, Noisy Toilets
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Convenient to Fenway!
review: Just got back from staying at this hotel for 2 nights to attend my child's college Parents Weekend with my husband.  Great location, 2 blocks from the Prudential / Copley shopping and dining.  I prepaid for my stay, selecting to stay in one of their panoramic view rooms for not much more than the traditional room rate.  They put us on the 10th floor (not very high as the hotel is 25 floors), making our panoramic view a bunch of rooftops - nothing to write home about.  Went into the bathroom where there is a double person shower.  This would've been better if the glass door didn't have soap marks from a prior occupant, and a toilet that when flushed was Extremely Noisy.  Shall I mention the yuckey corners in the bathrom as well?  When telling the front desk about it, no…

title: Worst hotel customer service
review: Thank you for staying with us while in town for Parent’s Weekend and for sharing your candid feedback on your stay with us. I apologize that we did not meet expectations and I am actively working with our housekeeping team to ensure our standards of cleanliness and comfort are consistently met. I understand the condition of your restroom was of concern, I am always looking for reviews to provide insight into our guest experience and I will keep your review in mind as we look towards refresh options. Thank you again for your feedback and I invite you back to stay with us and experience an improved level of customer service as well as quality accommodations the next time your travels bring you to the area.

title: Good location, helpful staff
review: The location was the best part of this hotel. This Hilton is about 10-15 minute walk to Fenway. It is also convenient to Newbury Street (3 blocks) with all the nice restaurants and shopping. Tour buses pick up across the street from the hotel. The concierge was very helpful with booking a Cape Cod tour. The room was clean, though small. The continental breakfast buffet was very sufficient.

title: An ok hotel but expected more from a city centre hotel
review: I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us!  Hope to see you return in the near future. Safe Travels!

title: Excellent Customer Service!
