title: Best hotel in Boston
review: I was traveling in Boston for business, I wasn't sure where to make reservations for dinner and went to the considerge desk and there was no one present. So I went back into the bar and asked the bartender for some help with reservations for dinner she took almost 15 minutes and helped me. That is the type of customer service I appreciate.

title: Great hotel but pay wifi and parking
review: Thank you for choosing to stay with us at the Hilton Boston Back Bay.  I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay and our team memebers took excellent care of you!  I will be sure to share your comments and hope you will return soon.

title: Backwater Bay?
review: Recently stayed at the Hilton, Back Bay and the service is five star. The staff cannot do enough to make your stay as comfortable as possible. We stayed on the 25th floor and the views across the Charles River and surrounding Back Bay area are phenom! In my opinion, this is the best hotel in Boston!

title: Fabulous hotel and great location
review: Thank you so much for your kind words!  I am very happy to hear you had such a wonderful experience and I look forward to welcoming you back to Boston in the near future!

title: Fantastic stay
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Good hotel
review: My husband and I stayed at the Hilton Back Bay for my 50th Birthday, we have a fantastic time the Hilton Back Bay was profect , we have a panaramic room, the room was great and the staff very friendly, the service was very good and hotel was in a very good location, this is the 3rd time I have stayed at the Hilton Back Bay and we would recommend it.

title: Average, convenient
review: Thank you for your kind words. We appreciate the opportunity to welcome you and appreciate your business. If there is anything we can do to enhance our services please let us know. We are always listening to our Guests. Thanks again for choosing The Hilton Boston Back Bay.

title: Unnecessary Greed
review: Stayed here for a conference across the street. Nice lobby area. Pleasant staff. Big corner room. The carpet is frayed a little in the room, but overall very good. May be time for a decorating update in the rooms. Very clean. Walls are thin. You could here the person in the next room cough through the walls.

title: Nice hotel
review: Thank you for staying with us at the Hilton Boston Back Bay.  I appreciate your honesty. We look for reviews to provide insight into our hotel and our guest room is an area we are actively examining. I welcome any additional comments or suggestions you would like to share.

title: Really nice hotel, well located to the T.
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: A nice hotel but not a warm welcome
review: We really enjoyed our stay here apart from one niggly thing. We travelled around New England for 10 days and every B&B/hotel we stayed in offered complimentary WiFi unfortunately this hotel doesn't unless you are gold/premium members. It's a really handy tool for planning trips etc. They do offer terminals in the lobby but its not private so if you want to bank online its not ideal.

title: Totally average
review: We appreciate your feedback regarding the speed and cost of our wireless internet service. We apologize that it did not work well during your stay. While we do charge an additional fee for wireless internet, we strive to be competitive with other hotels and offer quality services and amenities in our guest rooms. We hope you will consider staying with us again.

title: Excellent hotel
review: This was our first time in Boston and our first stop on our honeymoon.  When we arrived after a long flight from the UK, we were met by a surly receptionist who wasn't at all friendly.  She asked for our ID and credit card and gave us no information about the hotel, the facilities, the times for breakfast etc.  I am pleased to say that this must have been a one off as everyone else we spoke to during our 4 day trip was extremely warm and friendly. We stayed on the 6th floor.  Our room was extremely spacious, with a big bathroom and twin shower.  However, I think that the room was a little on the tired side, considering that this was a Hilton hotel. Breakfast wasn't included.  We paid $55 for the first day and after that we visited the nearby Prudential Shopping Centre and had…

title: Good but with issues
review: I appreciate your review of your recent experience at our hotel. I'm very sorry that had a disappointing arrival and I have addressed these issues with our staff. Exceptional Guest service is the foundation of our brand promise and your feedback will help us improve. Thank you once again for your comments.

title: Service at the front door
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Good location but noisy room
review: We went to this Hilton as the other hotels we've been to we're full. Compared to the service we received at the doubletree near the airport, the service here was lacking. Granted I arrived at 11p, but it would have been nice if there was a valet service available or someone at the door to assist with bags. I'm surprised that the doubletree/Hilton near the airport offers all that but the Hilton down town does not. You would expect that from a Hilton. I'm told they will also not credit my Hilton rewards card as my boyfriend booked the room thru a travel website, which is annoying. The room was in the typical nice Hilton style and clean. I think wifi costs $ which I object to. We also ordered room service which was good but expensive $85 without tip for app and 2 entrees and 2…

title: Excellent location
review: We chose this hotel specifically, as it was close to the Prudential Centre and the fact that the trolley stop is outside. The Hilton is opposite the Sheraton (where the trolley stop is), and to get to the Prudential Centre, go into the Sheraton, left up the escalator, then straight ahead and right to the shops....easy.  We had booked our hotel via a consolidator, who shall remain nameless, but provided us with weeks of worry after we had booked and then found the reviews online. If booking via someone, always call the hotel a couple of weeks before, to check you do actually have a room..  We came off a cruise ship early Sunday. Room not ready, but staff stored our bags in a locked room, whilst we went on our hoho tour.  When we checked in, we were offered a king or double. We…

title: Decent stay but...
review: I sincerely apologize for the elevator noise you encountered during your stay. Your comfort and safety is my number one concern so I appreciate you bringing this to my attention and your review will assist in correcting issues in the future. I do hope that the next time you are in Boston you will consider staying with us again. Thank you!

title: Excellent value and location
review: A great location for exploring Boston as almost all the Hop On Hop off tours stop just outside the entrance. Room very large (especially as had just come from a Washington DC Hotel! and clean. Bed and pillows very comfortable. Arrived on a Saturday just in time for a RedSox game at Fennway so hotel busy but quiet during the night. Starbucks in lobby great for breakfast but take your own butter!

title: Location... GREAT.  Staff... Very good.  Billing... Not so much.
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Very nice and close to Fenway
review: Can't add much to what others have already said.  Do be forewarned that they will charge your credit card OR place a hold on your debit card up front for the entire stay which, in our case, was over $1,200.  In addition, they will do the same for $50 per night.  In my case, this was over $1,400 hold on my debit card.  Due to an "error", they placed a hold for another $200 (now over $1,600).  I go to investigate the charges.  Told they would reverse the additional $200.  HOWEVER, they placed a hold for yet another $100!  It was not until I checked out that I was finally charged the proper amount.

title: Quality
review: This is a Hilton, so overall it is usually a nice hotel. The hotel is well located, walking distance to Fenway, the Prudential Building, the shopping mall and a lot of placed to eat. It is in front of the Sheraton that has a stop where all the duck tours and sightseeing tours stop and take people. The hotel offered free Wi-Fi on the lobby, and has a business center with computers and TV’s. They charge an additional amount of $15 for WI-FI in the room, that other cheaper hotels offer for free. There is also a Starbucks coffee bar on the lobby. The rooms are comfortable and clean, even though the bathroom is quite small for the room size, but it was clean. Overall, a very nice experience.

title: Room nice, staff accommodating, restaurant awful
review: Hotel was as you'd expect from a Hilton in a large city.  Massive room, spotless, large bathroom, all the modern facilities you'd expect.  Efficient staff, very helpful doorman who was genuinely interested in the guests and what they had planned in Boston.  Ours was a quick stay, just a 1 night stopover to watch the Celtics game.  Great location if you want to go to Fenway Park for the Red Sox.  From the hotel we bought hop on/hop off bus ticket as the bus stops right around the corner, and had a crash course of the city on the way to the game.

title: Nice digs
review: We had to change rooms an hour after check in due to confusion about the number of beds reserved - not entirely the hotel's fault as the first in our party to check in hadn't made the reservation and so wasn't aware of the problem. It was a nice showcase of the on-the-fly skills of the desk and housekeeping staff that they made this painless.  Our eventual room was lovely and the pool and workout area were top-notch. Unfortunately my view of the whole stay is colored by the truly awful experience we had at the restaurant for dinner. I suppose we should have been warned off by the fact that the place was deserted on a Friday night. The waitress seemed harried and didn't even take drink orders. After ordering we waited for over half an hour to learn that they only had two orders…

title: Boston Trip

title: Great location & nice hotel
review: The hotel, Hilton Boston Back Bay was very well located to help us with all of the tours of the city and historic sites that we took.  The hotel was an upper scale accomodation and thus very expensive.  The service was very good and the room was very nice but not for what we had to pay.  Four days = $1,200,  Meals were also on the expensive side.

title: Awful service--stay somewhere else
review: Just back from a 2 night stay here with my wife & our 5 month old. Only negative we had was that the walls are a little thin. Can hear next door, but it was a couple shouting! The rooms are decent & the staff very friendly. Concierge was fantastic with loads of info as well. Best thing for sure is the location. 5 min walk to the T, Newbury St, the Prudential Shops, & Convention centre. Also very close to Fenway Park. I'd recommend it if u can get a good deal!

title: Good hotel, good location
review: The hotel was mediocre, the location in the middle of Back Bay was good, but the service was awful.  I asked for a bottle opener and a plate to be brought to my room and after three calls and an hour and a half, I had nothing.  I finally called to talk with the manager and cancelled it.  It wasn't complicated, and they weren't busy--they just didn't care.  I'm heading back to Boston next month, and I'll find somewhere else.

title: Don't bring your car
review: Have just spent 3 nights at the Hilton Back Bay and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. My wife, teenage daughter and myself had a triple room which was spacious with 2 double beds, well furnished and had good quality beds, linens and towels. The bathroom was a bit small but not an issue. The room was clean and modern as was the hotel reception and public areas. We liked the use of a fridge in the room along with complimentary bottled water. The indoor pool and fitness area was open long hours and easy to use. There is a Starbucks in the hotel lobby area along with 5 computers for guests. Reception staff, Concierge and Porters were all very pleasant and helpful. The hotel location is also very good. The Back Bay area is lively with shops, bars and places to eat in Boylston St, Newbury…

title: nice hotel in back bay
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Grubby, not up to usual Hilton standard
review: We stayed two nights at the HIlton in Back Bay in September both nights there were weddings so the lobby was usually quite busy and the elevators were running very slowly. We booked this hotel through hotwire and we got a good discount compared to the posted price through the hotel. The downside of this hotel was that there was no free wife in the rooms unless you were a gold member... for the cost of the rooms it should be free wifi throughout the hotel not just in the lobby. The room was nice and big with lots of space for all our shopping bags. The room was clean and recently updated. no complaints about the room - all the staff we dealt with very friendly as well.

title: Good Location And Nice Hotel
review: This hotel is in a good location and has all the usual amenities associated with a Hilton - diamond lounge, biz centre, pool, gym - however it was severely let down by the grubbiness of the room. On arrival i was greeted by the reception staff, who are all extremely helpful.  I went straight to my room to find the carpet was filthy with stained sheets that had a strange smell and stained towels.  I was tired so didn't complain to reception, the next morning i met the housekeeper in the hallway and she asked if everything was ok, i asked her to change my sheets as they smelt strange and were stained.  She did change them, but that night they still smelt and had even more stains! Making coffee in the room the following morning, I found the coffee cup to also be dirty. One thing I…

title: Excellent Stay in Boston
review: Hotel was easy to find and just a short walk to great restaurants, shopping, bus stops Fenway and Boston Commons.  Reception was ready for us and provided good service along with nice help from the Concierge.   Our room was as requested, except we were on the 7th floor with the pool and next to the elevator.  This provided for a lot of noise in the hall.  The room was clean and had all the necessary products to make it comfortable.  Internet service was an extra cost of $14.95 per day.  Self-Parking was $41.00 per day extra. The 40 Dalton Restaurant was not very good both for service and food, I do not recommend.  The Coffee Shop has a Starbucks sign and does serve Starbucks coffee but is not a true Starbucks in the rest of products. However, in all because of location, good…

title: Good Stay, Great Location
review: This hotel had great service and was close to public transportation as well as many interesting sites within walking distance.  I also needed to use the business center often on this trip and there was always a computer available.

title: Average room average service average everything
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Boston Trip
review: There is nothing exciting about this Hotel, the rooms needs updating. Bathroom is not very clean it is rather old looking. The bed is not very comfortable. I actually found all the hiltons pillows not very comfortable to sleep on. Don't go for the valet parking, there is a parking lot opposites that charge a lot less. They have closed their members lounge also.

title: no 5th star because of bar staff
review: 5 night stay with a complimentary upgraded room, and Wi-Fi on the house! Very clean, although there was no honor bar in the room, and no bed bugs!! The shower in the bathroom had two shower heads, making for a very nice bath. Breakfast at the hotel is expensive and there are plenty of local eateries with very good food and coffee on Bolyston and Newbury Streets, just a few minuet walk from the hotel. You don't need a car in this town, and parking is very expensive.

title: Very clean room, convenient location
review: We were staying two nights at this Hilton and had a pleasant stay. Good location in Boston with many nice bars and restaurants around the corner. There is a great shopping mall which can easily be accessed via the sheraton on the other side of the street. There are all kind of stores with a big Microsoft store which opened August 23rd this year. The hotel includes a Starbucks, a business center where there are 5 computers with internet access and printers. The concierge and the people at the reception are very friendly and helpful. Breaktfast buffet is good and more than adequate.Room was fine and clean; as you expect from a Hilton room. We were two times at the bar: first evening the bartender was very friendly and efficient. Next evening the lady at the bar gave us the feeling…

title: OK. might be better off at the Marriott.
review: I stayed at the Hilton Boston Back Bay for two nights in early Sept. 2012.  All of the staff I met were very friendly and helpful.  The doormen know the prices of cabs, airport shuttles, etc., if you need those services.   But, the thing I noticed the most was how clean the room was.  I have recently stayed in several hotels traveling on vacation in Hawaii, and now very much appreciate an immaculately clean room and bathroom!  Thank you to the Hilton housekeeping staff.   I also made use of the "business center" in the lobby, because I was traveling without a laptop.  They have several computers for guest use, and they came in handy for me on this trip - never had to wait to use one, either.   I stayed in room 1618, which was almost a corner room - very spacious.  I guess if you…

title: Average hotel compared to normal hilton standard
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. In nice weather, restaurant patio seating is packed with Bostonians and tourists alike soaking up the sunshine and enjoying the food. Commonwealth Ave offers a beautiful stroll down residential tree-lined streets. Keep walking towards the Charles River and enjoy a beautiful view by the water. In warmer months, people run and bike on paths running along the esplanade, and sail and kayak on the Charles River. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Great for location, okay for property
review: Stayed here 4 nights. The staff is very welcoming, and the location is good both for food&drinks in the evening, Fenway park and transport links to other areas. However the room rate is expensive compared to other comparable cities, there is no executive lounge of sort, the only restaurant and pub are one room, which makes in-hotel dining loud. The price of food in the restaurant is also quite high, with most mains well ober $25. The gum is good, but the pool is very very small, despite pictures on the website would suggest otherwise. Overall a comfortable stay but not good value for money.

title: Great location, great staff, so so room
review: The Back Bay neighborhood is very convenient - almost all the sights are within walking distance.  Great shopping and great restaurants are all nearby.  The staff are all polite and helpful.  The rooms were just okay.  They were clean, so I'd stay again, but the room itself was not at the "Hilton" level I've come to expect.

title: Lots to recommend it
review: We stayed at the Hilton after winning a bid on a certain discount site, which we were very happy about.  The back bay area is very convenient to great shopping and eating, as well as being snug between two green T stops, which leaves that city at your beck and call.  We arrived very early for our reservation, as in 8am from a red-eye, and the staff treated us great.  They offered us a room with two doubles but we said we were grab some breakfast and wait for our preferred king bed room.  Staff took our cell number and called later on when a room was ready, you don't always get that type of service, helpful and friendly.  Oh yeah and the concierge will store your bags for you while you wait, even leave them in your room if you ask once its ready, nice touch, nice guy, very…

title: Good location, comfortable and clean.
review: We stay here when taking our son to and from the Berklee College of Music summer programs.  It is in a great location.  Walking distance to the school, great shops, restaurants, Fenway, the Prudential Center and the Convention Center,  Every staff member that we've encountered has been helpful and friendly. The rooms and bathroom are nice and clean and look to be recently updated.  My only complaint is that the mattresses are very soft and uncomfortable.  Both my husband and I have sore backs and necks after two nights.

title: Would've given a 5, if not for a couple of issues
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Location! Location! Location!
review: Apart from the one issues described below, this hotel is really good for the money. Location is excellent for Newbury Street, Boylston St eats, Prudential (just another mall), MIT and the subway.  The only downside was the room and the housekeeping. I got given an accessible room that did have a good view over MIT and the Charles River on the 14th floor. However, on one day the housekeeper just walked in without knocking and just when I got out of the shower. Spoke to the Housekeeping Director and asked that he retrain his staff to knock before entering ANY room. Secondly, the room was a bit dodgy in that the door was jamming at the top right and every time I had to enter the room, it made a really loud scraping noise that resonated along most of the to corridors, it was that…

title: Great location!
review: Strayed there for business, very close to convention center. Staff at Hilton were top notch and went above and beyond my expectations. They were at full compactly but treated each guest like they were the only ones there.  This hotel is so close to many casual and high end bars, pubs, and restaurants, no worry about walking to find food. Shopping possibilities around the hotel are worth bringing a larger sized bag. This hotel is great for the business traveler or couples. Highly recommend.

title: Nice place
review: We have stayed twice and would probably stay again. We love the location; walk to Prudential shops and Newberry Street.  The friendly staff and the corner rooms! We started the day with the breakfast buffet, which we found to be a good value!

title: Sufficient, but not over the top
review: We stayed here after the Boston Marathon... Nice room to rest in, good location to walk to nice neighborhood and great restaurant within walking distant. The underground station is very close and it is very easy to go to the airport.

title: Excellent Stay, Very Accommodating Staff!!
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Good location
review: My wife and two of my three children stayed here for three nights, August 6th-9th, and had a wonderful stay!  I stay in Hilton brand hotels quite often, but normally am traveling for business.  In this case, we were in Boston to go to a Red Sox game, and do a few other touristy things (Duck Tour, Freedom Trail, etc).  After securing the tickets for the game  and buying our plane tickets, I started to look for a place to stay.  There was NOTHING available for the first night without going 10-15 miles out.  To make a long story short, the folks I worked with at the hotel were very understanding, and very helpful in trying to get us a room for the first night if one came available.  In working with Mike O'Connel and Kelly (at the front desk), I was finally able to get confirmed for…

title: Make another choice if possible
review: Stayed here for 3 nights at the end of July 2012.  Check-in was a bit "lacking" - staff seemed to be a bit disinterested - only 2 on duty and no-one else waiting to check-in but felt like we had interrupted their afternoon.  Location is good - short walk to Prudential Centre for shopping/restaurants.  Tour buses stop directly opposite hotel (next to Sheraton) - you can buy your tickets from the Concierge.  Free Wi-Fi in Business Lounge but not in rooms which is disappointing.  Rooms were your standard fare - we were a family of 4 staying and the maid did at least put out sufficient toiletries each day which was good.  Only ate breakfast there - buffet style (not cheap though) - good choice and will make omelettes/pancakes to order.  Overall felt like the hotel lacked a bit of…

title: Adequate all-around & fine value; just nothing special.
review: Staff is very nice, but mostly helpless... Concierge was totally worthless.  I stopped by 2x in am and asked him for help w dinner reservations and called him from the road around 2pm, but nothing. We returned to the hotel at 515p after a day of sightseeing and he was gone.  Thx to front desk mgr who in 10 mins was able to help us and rescue a 1-star rating.  Rooms and bathrooms are in need of a facelift.    Location is good...quick walk to shopping on Newberry Street and convention center.    FYI, I'm being generous w the 2 stars...

title: Good location
review: This hotel is the last big property in the area surrounding Prudential-Hynes-Copley-Fenway, and directly across from the Sheraton. I stayed at this hotel for a major (11,000+ attendees) conference on a rate negotiated by our organization. For roughly the same price, I could have had the Sheraton or the Westin, but I chose the Hilton to leverage my brand loyalty status (and because it is usually the best in the range). I'm disappointed in my choice.  First, my experience with the property was that of an HHonors Gold member, which was only a series of small perks (free in-room Wifi, free bottled water every day, continental breakfast each morning, and access to the Diamond Lounge). Other than the WiFi (which was excellent, but which should be standard!!), the rest was nothing…

title: Good for a conference goer
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Fell down at first, but excellent recovery
review: This is a good, well situated conference hotel. I stress these factors because a) if you are not part of a conference you may want to avoid the hustle and bustle, and b) the facilities for those with a Gold or Diamond card is well below par. There is something called `the Diamond Lounge' which allows access also to Gold Card members. However, the room is rather small, looks and feels like a small conference room and is light on food. I stayed at a Hampton Inn just before reaching Boston and the breakfast fodder was much better. The Boston Hilton had scrambled eggs and porridge as the hot food selections. The lounge is closed in the evening and there is no alcohol of any kind on offer. There is a very small bar in the hotel lobby but it didn't seem to attract too many people. Our…

title: Not worth it
review: We travelers expect a good stay experience each time, but when something goes awry, what is most important is how Management and the staff respond.  In my case, the 1st go-around was not what it should have been for a variety of reasons. I contacted the GM, who responded quickly and decisively. Our next stay was perfect.  All issues that were previously present had been fully addressed and corrected, to my family's complete satisfaction. Upper Management genuinely cared about where and how they fell down, and took the appropriate action, to include COACHING the staff. This is an important point, as such action tends to yield longer lasting results not just for me, but for all Customers.   Dominique, thanks for turning the negative into a positive. You've earned my repeat…

title: Very nice hotel
review: If you are thinking this is going to be a "luxurious" Hilton or a business-oriented hotel, you are going to be disappointed.  The rooms are small.  The elevators don't work very well and the lobby staff (very friendly, though) get overwhelmed when even a moderate-sized group appears to check in or check out.  The lobby is no better than any Hampton Inn, which generally costs half of what Hiltons cost.  The worst is the Internet access.  They charge fourteen ninety-five and the connection is flaky and slow.  If you are going to pay so much for Internet access, you should at least get a reliable, super-fast connection!

title: Close to Fenway
review: I appreciate your review of your recent experience at our hotel. I'm very sorry that had a disappointing experience with us and I have addressed these issues with our staff. Exceptional Guest service is the foundation of our brand promise and your feedback will help us improve. Although we do charge for internet we do strive to make sure our pricing is competitive and in-line with other properties in the area.  Thank you once again for your comments.  Warm Regards,  Dominique Marty, General Manager Hilton Boston Back Bay

title: Solid Hilton Hotel in a Prime Location
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Good hotel in good location
review: The location is everything for this hotel. Although it is not a new property and doesn't have the energy other hotels in the area seem to have, the Hilton is a nice property that is easily accessible from the airport by the "T" (Prudential stop is marginally closer than the Hynes stop). There are many restaurants in the area, at all price ranges, including a good food court at the Prudential Centre, PF Changs, Legal Seafoods. This is not to mention more upscale restaurants on Newbury St. Also nearby are a Trader Joe's, a Wholefood Market and Shaws.   But back to the hotel....we had a corner room ...14, which seems a bit more spacious than others. Also, it has a small but inaccessible balcony, allowing for extra light. The room was spotless and nicely decorated. Only two small…

title: Best of the US Hiltons
review: I am very happy to read your comments about your recent stay and glad that you found the location and service levels of our hotel to your satisfaction. Although we do charge for parking we do strive to be competitive in price and in-line with other nearby properties.  Hope to see you return soon....safe travels.  Dominique Marty, General Manager Hilton Boston Back Bay

title: Excellent Location
review: I stay in Hilton hotels a lot. This place is probably justq above average in terms of the quality and overall experience. Like many hotels of this size it feels a little tired in terms of the decor and style.   I have stayed in the Marriott and Sheraton close by and both have a much better feel to them- indeed the bars in both are always full and have a really good feel- not the case in the Hilton.   Nice breakfast room, reliable Internet connection and friendly staff.

title: BED BUGS!!!!
review: Thank you for taking the time to review. We’re very sorry you experienced an undesirable stay and were disappointed with our guest rooms.  Guest feedback is incredibly important to us and we are taking your comments into consideration as we improve our on-property experience. We hope to have another opportunity to serve you, if your travels bring you back to our area.  Warm Regards,  Dominique Marty, General Manager Hilton Boston Back Bay

title: Great hotel, a bit out of the way
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Absolutely fine for what it is
review: The hotel is great. We had a room on the 24th floor, very quiet. We had planned to use our own computer and pay the daily internet charge, only to discover they have 5 computers for guests' use in the lobby. There was never a line to use them. A great convenience, and money saver.  The hotel is NOT near the main tourist sights. We had to take the T to get anywhere except the Prudential Center. That was a fun place, but our goal was to see all the sights.  Suggestions? There is a Trader Joe's right around the corner. The room has a refrigerator, so we bought enough at TJs to have breakfast every day. A real money & time saver! Another suggestion? Buy tickets to one of the hop-on, hop-off buses. They will take you everywhere you would want to see, and very convenient. There are…

title: Great location; nice hotel
review: Thanks for taking the time for the great review and hope to see you return to Hilton Boston Back Bay.  Warm Regards,  Dominique Marty, General Manager Hilton Boston Back Bay

title: Great location!  Hotel?...meh
review: A very good stay at this hotel, clean, convenient, great location. At $200 price was reasonable; I was holding out for a better deal via priceline or hotels.com, but must have been a busy weekend, couldn't get a rater any better for anything comparable.  My internet was free, but perhaps because I joined Hilton points?

title: Accom good, food expensive, wifi extortionate
review: I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay at Hilton Boston Back Bay. Hope to see you return in the near future. Safe travels.......  Dominique Marty, General Manager Hilton Boston Back Bay

title: Business oriented hotel located in the heart of the city!
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Great location, hotel showing her age...
review: We recently returned from a 1 week family vacation at the Hilton Back Bay.   The hotel is conveniently located in the Back Bay area adjacent to the Prudential Center and a short walk from Copley Place.  My son and I actually walked to Fenway Park (~15 mins) for a tour.  There is also a Shaw's grocery store in the Prudential Center where you can pick up breakfast/lunch items if you're so inclined.  The two closest T Stations (Subway/Underground) are Prudential and Hynes Convention Center depending upon which line you are taking.  Neither is more than a 5-10 min walk away making it very easy to navigate the city without a car.  Check in was fast and efficient and we were even offered a nicer room with a great view of the city.  Hotel staff always greeted us with a smile and were…

title: Worst Hilton experience I have ever had
review: Thanks for your kind comments about your recent stay with us. Hope to see you return again soon.  Warm Regards,  Dominique Marty, General Manager Hilton Boston Back Bay

title: Let down by this trusted brand
review: Stayed two nights at the Hilton in Back Bay for a combination business and family trip.  The location is great - walked to Fenway and walked to the Prudential Center (plenty of restaurant choices here).  The room was fine, I would say average.  It was clean but dated and the bathroom was very small (cramped).  Bed was good and comforatable as were the pillows - slept good for my 2 night stay.  There is a Starbucks in the lobby and the continental breakfast was fine.  Did not interact with the Staff much but when I did they were pleasant.  The rate is high for the quality of the hotel, she seems to be showing her age...

title: Excellent location sluggish service and small lobby
review: Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent stay at our hotel. We appreciate your feedback and we’re very sorry you were unhappy with the conditions of your guest room. Guest feedback is incredibly important to us and we are taking your comments into consideration as we improve our on-property experience. We hope to have another opportunity to serve you, if your travels bring you back to our area.  Warm Regards,  Dominique Marty, General Manager Hilton Boston Back Bay

title: Great Hotel - Loved the Location
review: Solid Hilton Hotel.  Our AC didn't work the first night (which was miserable), but they moved us the next day.  Loved its proximity to the subway station and Fenway.

title: Great location, clean, safe
review: Thank you for your review. My apologies that your AC did not during your first night with us.  However, I am pleased to hear that our staff was able to accommodate your with a different room.  I hope you will stay with us again next time you are in the Boston area.  Warm Regards, Dominique Marty, General Manager Hilton Boston Back Bay

title: poor service (food and bev)
review: We stayed two nights at the Hilton Boston Back Bay. We had a room on the 23rd floor with a nice view. This hotel is in a great location with a metro station just around the corner. It is a short walk to restaurants and the Mapparium. We were close to the 4th of July fireworks and were able to walk to the bridge to watch them. There was a Trolley stop across the street at the Sheraton which was convenient. The rooms was a nice size with a fridge and coffee maker. We would definitely stay again.

title: Won't be back
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Noisy elevators spoil great locale
review: Toliets flush very loudly and inefficiently. Our sink knob kept falling off and the bathroom was designed so that you can barely sit on the toilet and we are skinny people with a far toilet paper dispenser. The lobby is always very cold. At 330 on check in our room wasn't ready. We were told it would be ready soon and it never was. We returned at 6pm our room still wasn't ready and we were given a handicap room. This room has a leaking fridge so the carpet was all soggy also the room was small so that the bathroom could be big but the shower had was in the side wall making it hard to use. We changed rooms to get the room with the tiny bathroom and broken sink handle. The breakfast there is very expensive and should be included. Other hotels were better located. Next time we will…

title: Too crowded, not good service
review: We are sorry we were unable to provide you with the quality of amenities and service you expect from Hilton during your recent stay. We apologize for the issues in your room and will work with our maintenance team to ensure this does not happen again. If you return to our area, we hope you will consider staying with us again.  Warm Regards,  Dominique Marty, General Manager Hilton Boston Back Bay

title: Great Service!
review: The Hilton Boston Back Bay occupies a central location in Back Bay with shopping & restaurants within a few blocks walk. Clean, well-furnished rooms.  However, this particular Hilton occupies a small floor area overall (ie, it's easy to walk around the hotel perimeter), so basically all the rooms are close to the elevator banks.   At least on the lower floors, it seems very difficult to me to escape the constant noise from the elevators going up and down around the clock. After being unable to sleep due to elevator noise in my first room on about the 6th floor, I requested a change to a quieter room further away from the elevator banks. The second room was quite far away from the elevator banks on the floor above, but basically still had significant elevator noise that…

title: Great Location and Price
review: I’m sorry we were not able to provide you with a satisfactory experience during your recent stay.  Your satisfaction is very important to us and we appreciate your feedback about the noise coming from the elevators. Your comments have helped us to improve our Guest experience.  We hope you will consider staying with us again.  Warm Regards,  Dominique Marty, General Manager Hilton Boston Back Bay

title: Very nice hotel
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Back Bay Boston
review: Stayed here for a couple night in late June.  Used Hilton Honors points for the stay.  Got upgraded to a corner room with a view of Fenway Park.  The staff couldn't be nicer and the hotel is very nice inside.  Great location - it's withing wallking distance to many attractions including the Museum of Fine Arts and Fenway Park.  My only minor issue was some of the furniture could've been a little cleaner.  The bed was great, which is the most important part, but some of the other furniture could have used a once-over.  All in all though an excellent place to stay!

title: Great location-park offsite if can and walk everywhere
review: Thank you for choosing to stay with us at Hilton Boston Back Bay. I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay and that our staff was helpful. I will be sure to share your comments and hope you will return soon.  Warm Regards,  Dominique Marty, General Manager Hilton Boston Back Bay

title: Nice Hilton
review: Hotel was very nice.  Easy to get to using the "T" line (Silver to Red, or Blue to Green).  Located next to the Prudential Bldg (50 floors high).  As long as you could see the Prudential bldg. you were never lost.  Conviently located near Boylston Street, where all the action is located.  Nice rooms, inexpensive upgrade available too.  House cleaning was in and out quickly.  Elevators fast.  I would highly recommend this hotel for vacation or buisness.

title: Good Spot
review: I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay at Hilton Boston Back Bay. Hope to see you return in the near future.  Warm Regards,  Dominique Marty, General Manager Hilton Boston Back Bay

title: Nice business hotel
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: An Excellent 4th of July Visit
review: Stayed there for a conference. The room was nice, just one bed, nothing special. It was clean and close to the conference center. Rooms are really expensive as is almost every hotel in Boston.

title: Quick visit to Boston
review: Thanks for the comments and hope to see you return soon to Hilton Boston Back Bay.  Warm Regards,  Dominique Marty, General Manager Hilton Boston Back Bay

title: Family Vacation Stay
review: This was our second year in a row for the Fourth in Boston.  This year's stay was even better than the last.  We had an awesome room on the 20th floor overlooking the Charles River which was picturesque by day and very convenient for fireworks watching - no rain!  We enjoyed the personal attention of Claudia (front desk) and Claudia (breakfast nook) and being remembered by the lovely Jasoda (breakfast).  Staying here was like staying with family, only in much nicer surroundings!  With the convenient location to the MTBA train, the rental bikes at the Hubway, close to the MFA and all that Boylston and Newbury streets have to offer, we wouldnt stay anywhere else.

title: Great access to Fenway
review: Thank you for taking a moment to share your experience. I am happy to hear you had a great stay with us at Hilton Boston Back Bay for the July 4th holiday.  I am extremely pleased to hear that Claudia and Josoda helped make your stay more memorable by providing excellent customer service!  All of us at Hilton are passionate about hospitality and we look forward to welcoming you back next time you are in Boston.   Warm Regards,  Dominique Marty, General Manager Hilton Boston Back Bay

title: A great hotel!
review: room was clean  and comfortable , front desk staff was very accomidating ,  to not so nice   when we ran into travel problem however Omar  at the front desk solved our delema.Location was great walking distance to every area we wanted to see.

title: Very Nice and Clean
review: Thank you for your review. I am pleased to hear you enjoyed your stay and will let Omar know that they helped you have a great stay with us. All of us at Hilton are passionate about hospitality and we hope to see you again soon.  Warm Regards,  Dominique Marty, General Manager Hilton Boston Back Bay

title: Excellent hotel in the Back Bay
review: We stayed here while my husband was attending a conference in Boston.  It was very conveniently located close to the Hynes Convention Center and the Prudential Mall.  Boston was a very walkable city but we ended up getting a Charlie pass that was good for 7 days so that we could ride the subway and buses to a few locations that weren't nearby (Harvard, Quincy, Mount Auburn Cemetery).  We were very glad that we had this option most days.  You can buy these in the airport right by baggage claim.  We arrived at the hotel early in the morning on a Thursday and were told that they could hold our baggage until a room was ready.  I checked back around noon and we were able to check into our hotel room on the 22nd floor with a beautiful view of Boston!  The next morning when my husband…

title: great boston property
review: Thank you very much for taking the time to share your experience. I am very happy to hear that our Team Members took such good care of you and went above and beyond to make your stay comfortable and convenient.  I am also pleased that you found the amenities of our property to your liking. Hope to see you return soon next time you are in Boston.  Warm Regards,  Dominique Marty, General Manager Hilton Boston Back Bay

title: Great location... disappointed by front desk...
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Great location, spacious rooms, and excellent customer service
review: Nice hotel, centrally located so good location... everything we expect from a Hilton except the front desk issues we experienced...  The first time I phoned I got straight through, no problem, as I expected...  The second time I called it took about 3 minutes for someone to answer and they immediately asked if I could be put on hold and put me on hold before I could answer...  I waited on hold for 7 minutes before putting the phone down and redialing...  then no answer...  Not at all what you expect from a premium hotel...  That said, I like Hilton's and would stay again due to the great location... hopefully the phone issues will be sorted by the next trip!

title: Nice Stay for Business
review: Thank you for taking the time to review. We’re very sorry you experienced an undesirable level of customer service with us. The problems you mentioned with the front desk phones not being answered in a timely fashion have been addressed. We appreciate you alerting us to this issue and we hope you will give us a second chance if you return to the area.  Warm Regards,  Dominique Marty, General Manager Hilton Boston Back Bay

title: the little things make this better than most hotels
review: I wanted to start off by saying that the Back Bay Hilton treats Price Line customers the same as full paying customers.  Many hotels treat price line and hot-wire customers like second class citizens assigning the smallest rooms with the least amenities.    Not the Hilton.  Upon check in (They let us check in at 9:00am) we were treated like royalty.  The bellhop, front desk staff and concierge all provided excellent customer service.  We were assigned a high floor with a fabulous view.  The spacious  room was clean,  linens  were high quality, and the bathroom was spotless.   (also there were no bedbugs!!) The concierge was very gracious with her time spent with us planning our Boston itinerary and recommending restaurants in the area.  Housekeeping did an excellent job keeping…

title: Great location for seeing Boston!
review: Thanks for your kind comments about your recent stay with us. Hope to see you return again soon next time your are in the Boston area.  Warm Regards,  Dominique Marty, General Manager Hilton Boston Back Bay

title: Excellent Hotel.  Minimalist Rooms
review: Always treat me well when I visit. Great location, steps from the shopping of Newbury Street or the mall.  Try Trader Joes nearby for groceries, or Shaws if you are going cheaply.  Ask for a north-facing room to see the river, MIT, BU, Harvard, Fenway Park, etc.

title: Very pricey
review: Thank you very much for taking the time to share your experience. I am very happy to hear that our Team Members took such good care of you and you found the amenities of our property to your liking. Hope to see you return soon!   Warm Regards,  Dominique Marty, General Manager Hilton Boston Back Bay

title: Great location at a great price
review: We stayed in this nicely located hotel in Downtown Boston with our two young sons.  The hotel is clean and the staff is very friendly.   Parking is on site for a fee.  The rooms are nothing to write about.  Very simple furnishings and decor.  Modest spaces, but we weren't planning to spend much time there except to sleep anyway.  The hotel is walking distance to several Boston attractions including the Prudential Center, the Boston Common and Fenway Park.  The place is quite pricey, but most of the downtown hotels are.

title: Great location!!!!!!! Nice room!!!! But very weird check in by girl who hates America?
review: I am very happy to read your comments about your recent stay and glad that you found the location and service levels of our hotel to your satisfaction. Hope to see you return soon....  Warm Regards,  Dominique Marty, General Manager Hilton Boston Back Bay

title: Enjoyable Stay
review: We found this hotel most comfortable - wonderful bed. Restaurant attached to hotel was super - best lobster roll - reasonable prices - good breakfast buffet. Only negative was no free wifi in room. Since we were not on expense account, we found the $14.95 per day too high!

title: Good overall stay
review: We appreciate your feedback regarding the speed and cost of our wireless internet service. While we do charge an additional fee for wireless internet, we strive to be competitive with other hotels and offer quality services and amenities in our guest rooms. We hope you will consider staying with us again.  Warm Regards,  Dominique Marty, General Manager Hilton Boston Back Bay

title: Friendly hotel and some great views, good location
review: Just got back from a very nice 3-Day weekend at The Hilton Boston Back Bay.  Great location----easy walk to Fenway, The T, Restaurants.  Room was nice, service was very friendly.  I give it a strong recommendation if you are looking for convenience.

title: Great place to stay for shopping in Boston
review: Thank you very much for taking the time to share your experience. I am very happy to hear that our Team Members took such good care of you and you found the amenities of our property to your liking. Hope to see you return soon! Safe travels.  Warm Regards,  Dominique Marty, General Manager Hilton Boston Back Bay

title: Good, not great
review: I have nothing but great things to say about this hotel. The location is ideal, about a block from the prudential center (where there's a T stop and a 24 hour shaws) and there was always a line of cabs waiting just up the street at your beckon call. Everything was clean and the room was spacious with a mini fridge for our personal use and great coffee maker too! Everyone I encountered on the staff was super friendly and helpful, they have a complimentary storage room where you can keep your bags after checkout which was really convenient cause we weren't leaving the city til later that day. It was wonderful that the pool and gym were not in the main floor so we didn't have to go wondering around the lobby in swim trunks. The outdoor patio off the pool area was awesome as well! I…

title: Very clean with good location
review: I am very happy to read your comments about your recent stay and glad that you found the location and service levels of our hotel to your satisfaction. Hope to see you return soon....safe travels.  Warm Regards,  Dominique Marty, General Manager Hilton Boston Back Bay

title: great location
review: Good and friendly staff; rooms ok but not perfect (minibar disabled, lights poorly maintained), breakfast mediocre.

title: Good location and in walking distance to Fenway Park. Steep prices though.
review: Thank you very much for taking the time to write a review. I am very happy to hear that our Team Members took such good care of you and provided excellent service.However I am very sorry you experienced disabled amenities such as the minibar and lights in your room during you stay.  I can assure you this is not the norm.  We hope you will consider staying with us again so we can show you what our brand promise is all about.  Hope to see you return soon! Safe travels  Warm Regards,  Dominique Marty, General Manager Hilton Boston Back Bay

title: Great location
review: I stayed at the Back Bay Hilton in early May. Room was a little old and tired looking but very spacious. Staff were courteous. As Honors gold member I was able to use the lounge for breakfast. The selection was great and wold appeal to everyone. The fitness area and pool were also very good. Great location easily accessable to most things.

title: Pleasant stay!
review: Thank you for your review. I am pleased to hear you enjoyed your stay and will let our team know that they helped you have a great stay with us. All of us at Hilton are passionate about hospitality and we hope to see you again soon.   Warm Regards,  Dominique Marty, General Manager Hilton Boston Back Bay

title: Pricelined at $135 a night for May 4th
review: This hotel is located close to shopping and great restaurants...all within walking distance. Request a room on a higher floor and enjoy a fabulous view! The rooms were clean, large and well appointed with comfy beds, large flat screen TV and a huge desk. The staff at the reception desk were very friendly and helpful with directions and suggestions for travel times and good restaurants. WiFi was free for Diamond Honors members. Room service was quick, however the food was disgusting. I ordered clam chowder and it was really salty tasting and thick and gluey mess. Likewise, the Lobster Roll was inedible.

title: Above average location, below average room.
review: I am very happy to read your comments about your recent stay and glad that you found the location and service levels of our hotel to your satisfaction.  Although I am sorry to hear that you did not enjoy the clam chowder, I will be sure to let the culinary team know. Hope to see you return soon....safe travels.  Dominique Marty, General Manager Hilton Boston Back Bay

title: Good hotel
review: Excellent location for a one night stay for business and pleasure. Check in and out was quick and the staff were helpful and friendly. I recommend seeking a room in the higher floors as the hotel offers some decent views of Cambridge, south Boston, and Boston harbor islands.

title: Excellent hotel, well placed
review: Just wanted to thank you for your recent stay at Hilton Boston Back Bay! So glad you were able to experience our authentic Hilton hospitality. We look forward to seeing you soon.   Warm Regards,  Dominique Marty, General Manager Hilton Boston Back Bay

title: Excellent service
review: Stayed there in early May 2012. The hotel is nicely located, very close to the shopping centre. Starbucks is right across the Street, in the Sheraton Boston lobby (you can borrow a copy of WSJ there as well, if you feel like it - only USA Today at the Hilton). Nothing extraordinary about the hotel - rooms are clean and nice overall, frontdesk staff friendly and professional. Not getting the whole five stars as there was nothing 'over the top' - but no bad words to say about ir whatsoever.

title: Very good Hilton Hotel
review: I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay at Hilton Boston Back Bay. Hope to see you return in the near future.   Warm Regards,  Dominique Marty, General Manager Hilton Boston Back Bay

title: Internet: Pay PER DEVICE

title: It's OK, no complaints, but nothing to write home about either.
review: Nice hotel, convenient location. However, I think it's almost archaic to pay for Internet access in our room, much less having to pay PER DEVICE.  Ridiculous.  Got around it easily enough by making my laptop a hotspot with Connectify but the simple policy alone of charging per device is ludicrous.

title: not as good as expected
review: We appreciate your feedback regarding the and cost per device of our wireless internet service.  While we do charge an additional fee for wireless internet per device we strive to be competitive with other hotels and offer quality services and amenities in our guest rooms. We hope you will consider staying with us again.  Warm Regards,  Dominique Marty, General Manager Hilton Boston Back Bay

title: Good location but nothing more
review: Its your average hilton in the middle of a big city.  Much more of a business hotel than anything else.  Staff were decent.  Concierge didnt help me too much, so I wish that could be improved a little.  But rooms were fine, clean, no problems.

title: Perfect location!
review: I appreciate your review of your experience at our hotel last summer. I'm very sorry that had a disappointing experience with our concierge staff and I have addressed these issues with our staff. Exceptional Guest service is the foundation of our brand promise and your feedback will help us improve. Thank you once again for your comments.  Warm Regards,  Dominique Marty, General Manager Hilton Boston Back Bay

title: Quality hotel out of centre

title: Feeling Guilty
review: The Hilton Boston Back bay was booked for my trip to Boston with my boyfriend, quite simply as it was one of the best value hotels in Boston, everywhere in the centre was very expensive so took a chance and booked the Hilton.  Getting to the Hilton was ok, travel from Logan airport by way of a shuttle bus and subway and a ten minute walk through a set of shopping malls. On arrival the reception staff member was very helpful and there was a room ready for us, she even gave the choice of two doubles or a king size bed room. She also recommended the nearby street for plenty of bars, restaurants and places to eat which is where we spent most of evenings, we had booked for 5 nights.  The room itself was big and spacious, decent size bathroom, wardrobe space and an internal space, bed…

title: Great place to stay
review: Thank you very much for taking the time to share your experience. I am very happy to hear that you has a fantastic stay in Boston our Team Members took such good care of you.  I am also glad to hear that you found the amenities and location of our property to your liking. Hope to see you return on your next trip to London.  Warm Regards,  Dominique Marty, General Manager Hilton Boston Back Bay

title: Great location, great room, great view
review: My title is because all of the reviews seem so nice, and we have stayed here once before and had a wonderful experience....but this one was horrible. We used HH GOLD points (did I mention GOLD!!!!) and were still put in a room that was on the back side of the elevator so all we heared all night was the elevator going up and down.  After our first day I asked the man at the front desk to have someone go up to our room and clean the mold on the ceiling of the shower.....still not done by the second day so the front desk clerk comped our parking (thank you!!!)......still doesn't stop me from wondering if the mold will be cleaned for the next people.  :(  All under the bathroom sink was falling off.....honestly?  Without getting into it?  I work at a hotel and know that we were in a…

title: Great location, but pricey
review: Thank you for your feedback of your recent stay with us at Hilton Boston Back Bay. I understand that you were not satisfied with the cleanliness and noise levels of your guest room and am deeply disappointed by that. I sincerely apologize for this and assure you that this area is of great importance to us as we ensure the comfort and satisfaction for our guests. Thank you again, I appreciate your honest feedback.  Warm Regards,  Dominique Marty, General Manager Hilton Boston Back Bay

title: Good but thats all!

title: Rude front desk staff
review: Service is on par with most Hiltons but nothing really stands out. I dont remember any bad incident while I was there but nothing to make you smile about either.   They have a nice little cafe in the lobby with an internet lounge. The food is good in room service and breakfast is above average. We got a high level floor and the views of boston were nice.   The location is extraordinary. Its located right next to copley square and walking distance to fenway park, boston commons and alot of good places to eat! Its also very close to the "t" if you are of those who likes to act like a local (myself included). Parking is a fortune at the hotel but very convenient. It is something around $40 a day!   The rooms are nice and on average with sheratons and marriots. It has the giant flat…

title: Hilton Boston Back Bay
review: Thanks for the comments.  I am delighted to hear that you had a pleasant stay with us and hope to see you return soon next time you are in the Boston area.  Warm Regards,  Dominique Marty, General Manager Hilton Boston Back Bay

title: Good location, Good hotel
review: I was check in by a lady named Linda and she didn't have a clue what she was doing.  Just a hassle after a long day of travel.

title: Very Nice Stay
review: I appreciate your review of your recent experience at our hotel. I'm very sorry that had a disappointing experience with us and I have addressed these issues with our staff. Exceptional Guest service is the foundation of our brand promise and your feedback will help us improve. Thank you once again for your comments.  Warm Regards,  Dominique Marty, General Manager Hilton Boston Back Bay

title: Very nice hotel with a perfect location

title: Massachusetts has numerous Sports Champions, but Boston has the Hilton Back Bay
review: We have stayed at many hotels in the Hilton family, but the Hilton Back Bay hotel is one of the best. The staff was very friendly and professional. The room was nice and very clean.  Our room was on the 24th floor with an very nice view of Boston. The beds were excellent, some of the best we have tried in a hotel. The continental breakfast for Hhonors was very good, and above the average for such a breakfast.  No need to pay for the full buffet.  The internet was stable and fast.  The hotel has a perfect location, close to the Prudential center and the Back Bay area.  Also, conveniently located for the Beacon Hill and the Downtown areas, whether you walk or take the T from stations near-by.  The only negative point about this hotel is the 41$ for the overnight parking which is…

title: nice but nothing special
review: Thank you very much for taking the time to share your experience. I am very happy to hear that our Team Members took such good care of you and you found the amenities of our property to your liking.  We understand that parking can be a little pricey, but we try to remain as competitive as possible and in-line with parking prices at other hotels in the area.  Unfortunately this is the price we have to pay to be in the downtown Boston area.  Hope to see you return soon!   Warm Regards,  Dominique Marty, General Manager Hilton Boston Back Bay

title: Great place to stay in Boston
review: We travel to the city of Boston three to four times a year to visit family and just relax in one of our favourite cities. The Hilton Back Bay is a home away from home on so many levels.  The staff while being consummate professionals are also considered to be part of our family.  They are not just welcoming and friendly but are  efficient and attentive.  One can only attribute this to the Hotel Management.  From the General Manager to the Director of Front Desk Services to the Manager of Restaurant and Bar facilities to the Manager of housekeeping Services and Valet, they are the very best any Hotel can offer.  The staff are quick to greet us personally, or take a minute to chat socially, while always being ready to deliver world class service.  The rooms, at the Hilton Back…

title: It was alright
review: Thank you for your kind words. We appreciate the opportunity to welcome you and appreciate your business.  I will be sure to let our team know that they did an excellent job in providing world-class service.  If there is anything we can do to enhance our services please let us know. We are always listening to our Guests and appreciate your feedback. Thanks again for choosing Hilton Boston Back Bay as your hotel of choice in Boston.  Warm Regards,  Dominique Marty, General Manager Hilton Boston Back Bay

title: Average hotel convenient to the convention center
review: Good hotel and left with a sense that my money was well spent. The desk staff were pleasant and accomodating. The business center was PERFECT for what I needed to get accomplished. Every staff member was helpful and I had an excellent semicircle view of Boston. I've never had anyone ask if being on the twentieth floor would cause and problems ( another plus! ) but was just fine with the room.  The decor was warm and inviting in the small lobby area. I would stay again!

title: Terrific stay!
review: Thanks for your kind comments about your recent stay with us.  I am delighted to hear that you found the business center convenient and that our staff was helpful and attentive to your requests.  We look forward to welcoming you back next time you visit Boston.  Warm Regards,  Dominique Marty, General Manager Hilton Boston Back Bay

title: My Favorite Boston Hotel
review: We stayed here while attending a professional conference.  The rooms were more reasonable than the Sheraton. Tom size was fine.  There was a coffee machine and refrigerator.  The hotel was very clean.  Staff were very responsive to our requests.  I would recommend this hotel instead of the over priced Sheraton. There is a charge for wireless in the room, but I skipped it and used the free computers in the lounge across from registration. There was a printer, too, to print my boarding pass.

title: Fine hotel
review: I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your with us, we hope to see you return in the near future.   Warm Regards,  Dominique Marty, General Manager Hilton Boston Back Bay

title: Issues with room but great customer service
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. In nice weather, restaurant patio seating is packed with Bostonians and tourists alike soaking up the sunshine and enjoying the food. Commonwealth Ave offers a beautiful stroll down residential tree-lined streets. Keep walking towards the Charles River and enjoy a beautiful view by the water. In warmer months, people run and bike on paths running along the esplanade, and sail and kayak on the Charles River. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Perfect stay in a great location
review: I recently stayed here for two nights. I chose this location due to its proximity to the Hynes Convention Center were I was taking a very stressful licensing exam. I had many issues with my room including overly hot temperatures, dirty pillow cases, a mini-fridge whose temperature was set too high (all the contents became frozen causing a soda to explode all over my exam materials), AND a bathtub that was not properly set in its foundation. I honestly expected more from this hotel, and it added more stress to an already stressful two days of exams. However, despite all these issues, the front desk and engineering department were great. Mario in engineering should receive an award for his patience he had with me. Although I was offered another room for my last night, I decided…

title: UNBELIEVABLE 30TH!
review: I am sorry we were unable to provide you with the quality of amenities and service you expect from Hilton, I understand that this is not something you wanted to have to worry about during a stressful time. We apologize for the malfunctioning mini-fridge and issues with the bathtub, however I am happy to hear that our front desk and engineering staff responded quickly to the issues you reported. I hope you will consider giving us a second chance if you return to the area.

title: great hotel
review: Took my mother and my two teenage daughters into Boston for the night.  The Hilton is really a perfect location for shopping, great restaurants and really enjoying all the city has to offer.  The hotel is very clean and the staff is extremely friendly.  Will definitely stay here again next time I return to Boston.

title: Excellent location
review: Thank you for taking a moment to share your experience. I am happy to hear you had a great stay with us at Hilton Boston Back Bay and that you had an enjoyable weekend visiting Boston with your family.  I am pleased to hear that you were able to take advantage of our convenient location and experience the best of Boston.  We look forward to welcoming you back upon your next visit.

title: Comfortable

title: Good value, good area
review: My daughter let me out with the luggage and then disappeared into a maze of one way streets to get back to check in with me. Very unusual that there is not room for another car to pass. Check in very efficient,noted Hilton status,got free Wifi,water etc.41 dollars for parking does seem excessive,even for Downtown Boston. Comfy room even if the overriding color was "biscuit", "taupe", it just looked brown to me.Fridge didnt work ,bedside light didnt work,telly didnt work.Engineering fixed the televison. Bathroom o.k. no grab bars but I didnt request an accessable room,just thought of safety as opposed to accessability. Great to have Starbucks in the lobby.

title: Awesome Experience
review: Thank you for your review of your recent stay, I appreciate your honest feedback about your experience.  I understand that you found the price of parking to be an issue.  We look to be competitive in our pricing and comparable to other downtown Boston hotels in the area.  My apologies if this was not clearly communicated prior to booking.  I hope this did not affect your stay at our hotel.  If there is anything I can do in the future please feel free to contact me directly. We hope you will consider staying with us next time you are in the Boston area.  Warm Regards,  Dominique Marty, General Manager Hilton Boston Back Bay

title: Stunning View!
review: Ive stayed in a variety of hotels in Boston, and this is a good one I would return to. Its fairly generic, could use some updating in the common areas but its very comfortable and standard comfortable Hilton quality.  Its very near the convention center, backbay, the malls (prudential) and good and $$ dining on Newbury st.   The windows open a little as well, which is nice if you want some good fresh Beantown air.  I had a high room so noise was no issue.  Not sure what the lower floors would be like.  Good view! If you dont want to hit the ample fitness room, go for a run to Cambridge and backbay. You'll be happy. Enjoy Boston

title: Poor Hilton
review: I am very happy to read your comments about your recent stay and glad that you found the location and service levels of our hotel to your satisfaction. Hope to see you return soon....safe travels.  Warm Regards,  Dominique Marty, General Manager Hilton Boston Back Bay

title: Berkshire Concepts Does Have Great Proices

title: Great Hotel, Perfect location!
review: I will have to agree w/climax they do seem to have the best prices for the hotel hilton back bay ,,I did alot of home work and they did come up with the best price...........lucky for me

title: Friendly, Clean, but could be better!
review: Thank you for your review.  We try to stay competitive our surpass our competition in terms of price, service and amenities.  Glad to hear you enjoyed your stay, we hope to welcome you back upon your next trip to Boston.    Warm Regards,  Dominique Marty, General Manager Hilton Boston Back Bay

title: Awesome Weekend!
review: Have just returned from a long weekend in Boston at this hotel to celebrate my husband's birthday.  The hotel is in a perfect location to see all the sights of this wonderful city. We bought a 3 day pass with the Super Tours trolley bus company for 38 dollars. This was excellent value especially as there is a bus stop just across the street from the Hilton. This also included a Duck Splash in Boston harbour - great fun! We also walked to several places - there is a great bar called "Sevens" at Beacon Hill - and loads of nail parlours - so much cheaper than England!   We stayed on the 6th floor - ok so there was no view but we were not there for that. The beds were comfortable and the room clean with tea and coffe making facilities. We swam in the pool every morning before…

title: Conveniently located, sound hotel
review: Thank you very much for taking the time to share your experience. I am very happy to hear that our that you had a wonderful weekend celebrating your husband's birthday.  I am delighted that you found the amenities and location of our property to your liking. Hope to see you return soon! Safe travels  Warm Regards,  Dominique Marty, General Manager Hilton Boston Back Bay

title: Well-located, sensible hotel
review: I am a Diamond Level member in Hilton program, so I always stay at Hilton when I can.  This is a great property in a really great location.  Very close to many restaurants and shopping and highly recommend. Not quite the level of the Intercontinental, but really great. Quiet bar, but great service and great food.  The Club Sandwhich for lunch is awesome!

title: Perfect hotel, excellent as always...
review: Thanks for your kind comments about your recent stay with us. Hope to see you return again soon. Safe travels.  Dominique Marty, General Manager Hilton Boston Back Bay

title: Another Fantastic Stay at the Back Bay Hilton
review: I liked 1) the location which is near Newberry Street and a good sized mall 2) the hotel room is reasonably up to date, quite modern 3) reasonable gym equipment 4) staff - quite friendly and helpful  I didn't like 1) the pillows, which were very uncomfortable 2) the standard buffet was a bit disappointing  All in all - a sound hotel choice

title: No Complaints here!!
review: Just wanted to thank you for your recent stay here at the Hilton Boston Back Bay! So glad you were able to experience our authentic Hilton hospitality. We look forward to seeing you soon.   Warm Regards,  Dominique Marty, General Manager  Hilton Boston Back Bay

title: immaculate hotel, amazing staff
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Pool is Very dirty
review: Stayed at the Hilton Back bay for 2 days.  The room was immaculate.  You could tell that houskeeping took pride in their work.  Front desk staff and bartender were extremely friendly and helpful with tips about where to go for the day and where to get some great food.  Location is within walking distance of everything in downtown Boston.   Copley Square, the Prudential, and even the Commons if you dare take on the cold.  Unless you are in a group, the Go Boston Shuttle provides very efficient service for a good price.  Will definitely stay there again.

title: Very nice  Stay on a Very Cold Weekend
review: Thank you very much for taking the time to share your experience. I am very happy to hear that our Team Members took such good care of you and you found the amenities of our property to your liking. Hope to see you return soon! Safe travels.  Dominique Marty, General Manager  Hilton Boston Back Bay

title: Great hotel and value
review: Stayed on business and took my wife and step children.    All I heard from my wife was the cleanliness issue about the pool deck.   Initially thinking she was overreacting I took a look and I have to pass it on. The deck is absolutely filthy. FYI Slippers required!

title: Steady as she goes
review: Thank you for your feedback of your recent stay with us at Hilton Boston Back Bay. I understand that you were not satisfied with the cleanliness of our Pool Area and am deeply disappointed by that. I sincerely apologize for this and assure you that this area is of great importance to us as we ensure the comfort and satisfaction for our guests. Thank you again, I appreciate your honest feedback.  Dominique Marty, General Manager Hilton Boston Back Bay

title: Good accommodations, great view, central location
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle.
