title: Pleasant stay and good location
review: Found this hotel online after an extensive, value-based search.  Found a great deal less than a week before my trip for a king room for just a bit of $100 a night.  I am also a HHonors member so they automatically upgraded my pre-paid reservation to a room on the top floor with a pretty nice view.  The bed was very comfortable, maybe a bit soft for some but very adequate for my liking.  The room was modern and warm with an updated bathroom that was very functional.  Room service was efficient and undetected.  I actually never saw any service members, but the room was in top condition whenever I returned from breakfast with my girlfriend.  My stay here was great!  A block from the Prudential Center, the Christian Science Plaza and a convenient T-stop on the green line.  Cabs were…

title: Welcome home
review: Thank you for your review. I am pleased to hear you enjoyed your stay and will let our team know that they helped you have a great stay with us. All of us at Hilton are passionate about hospitality and we hope to see you again soon.  Warm Regards,  Dominique Marty, General Manager Hilton Boston Back Bay

title: Great Location, Average Everything Else
review: I was in town for a conference at the Hynes Convention center. So this Hilton was a "cheaper" option for that location because the other hotels in the area (such as the Sheraton across the street) were more expensive than the Hilton and you got the same or fewer amenities at the other hotels. I rated it a four, however, because the price only includes internet when you're in the lobby unless you're a Gold/Diamond Hilton Rewards member. Otherwise you can opt to pay something like $14 per day before taxes and fees for Internet in your room. That seems to be standard practice for the hotels in the area, but it seemed ridiculous to me.   Similarly, breakfast is only offered to the Gold/Diamond reward members. As a tip to travelers, especially if you'll be in town a few days-- we…

title: Great Hotel
review: Thank you for your review.  I am delighted to hear that you had a pleasant stay with us during your trip to Boston.  We appreciate your feedback regarding the cost of our in-room  wireless internet service. While we do charge an additional fee for wireless internet, we strive to be competitive with other hotels and offer quality services and amenities in our guest rooms.   Please contact me directly if there is anything I can provide upon your next visit to make your stay more comfortable.  Warm Regards,  Dominique Marty, General Manager Hilton Boston Back Bay

title: Nice stay.
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Standard Hilton hotel
review: The location is great and the rooms are a decent size for Boston. The staff was very friendly and helpful with recommending places in the area. My only word of cautiion - park somewhere else! $41 a night...ridiculous. There are a bunch of garages nearby at a cheaper rate - a much better option. There is a garage next door for $12 a night, but I think you might have to be out by 6am.

title: Perfect location for a New Year’s in Boston
review: We stayed her on personal travel in November. It was unseasonably cold for that time of year so any walk seemed farther than it really was. Convenient to Newbury, the Common, Back Bay and the shopping centers.  Hotel was clean, pool was on the small side and as with most Hiltons, slightly over chlorinated. We kept running in to the housekeeper no matter where in the hotel we were, and she was always polite and asking if we needed any amenities.  The only drawbacks to the property are the wait times at the elevator and lack of a close T stop if you have more than a wheeled suitcase it will be a haul.  I would recommend this hotel as clean and comfortable.

title: Great Hotel and location
review: Thanks for the comments, we hope to see you return soon to the Hilton Boston Back Bay in the near future.  Happy New Year!  Warm Regards,  Dominique Marty General Manager

title: nice hotel
review: I got the Hilton on Priceline name your price for $120/night ($140/night total with taxes), just as I was hoping for. Definitely a great deal for the quality and the location. It was basically what I’d expect from a Hilton. The beds were ridiculously comfortable, especially the pillows… heavenly. Room was standard, clean, well-kept, etc. Safe is big enough for a 15” laptop or two and a big purse.   Our TV didn’t work due to a problem with the remote. We also had some long, dark, gross hairs that were stuck in the toilet for like the first day. Couldn’t tell you about the customer service on those things though, since we were barely there and didn’t care enough to complain about them! Only other complaint is that the shower head was not that good, though it was sufficient.  …

title: Ideal location

title: Our view was amazing but not without a few complaints.
review: My wife and I stayed here for a week in September, it's location is ideal for accessing the main shopping area and Fenway park as well as having easy access to the subway.   The hotel itself was clean and the staff pleasant. Checkin and checkout was pleasant and quick. The staff in the complimentary breakfast lounge for those on executive floor rooms were very helpful and went the extra mile to ensure a good start to the day. The leisure facilities were small but perfectly usable and never busy when we were there.  Would be happy to stay here again but would pick my dates carefully to get the best value prices.

title: Location and Service
review: I just wanted to thank you for your recent stay here at Hilton Boston Back Bay]! I am delighted to hear you enjoyed your stay and experienced our authentic Hilton hospitality. We look forward to seeing you soon.   Warm Regards,  Dominique Marty, General Manager

title: typical hilton quality and great location
review: The only reason this hotel didn't get a '5' was the fact that the balcony was locked shut, the elevators seemed a bit old, the price was pretty high (I realize this is Boston but still...) and the restaurant's menu was pretty bare.  Overall, the hotel was in a decent location, the rooms were clean and the view from our floor was really breathtaking.  I would probably give it a 3.5 but I can't so a 4 will have to do (because I like to be positive).

title: Great location, Great location, Great location
review: Stayed here for a week and found the staff good, the breakfast buffet for Gold and above members ok, and repetitive (eggs and oatmeal were the two warm choices everyday), with a reasonable selection of fresh fruit, bagels, breads, pastries, yogurt etc to compliment. Never ate in the hotel restaurant since there were so many other choices in the area. The room was clean, but the details in the bathroom could have been better (the shower head had a pretty heavy layer of buildup on it for example). Location was excellent for anyone using the Hynes Convention Center...just a quick walk across the street and through the Sheraton to get there.

title: Excellent service and accommodations in a small footprint
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Great central hotel to see the sites
review: Staying in a downtown Boston hotel was an interesting first-time experience for us, seeing as we lived for 25 years less than a mile away from the Back Bay Hilton and still consider ourselves locals. This property is perfectly located in close proximity to many of Boston's cultural, dining, and shopping venues, and was for us a perfect home away from home.  Commercial property available for new hotel construction has been virtually non-existent in Boston's congested downtown and Back Bay areas for decades. This would explain why the Hilton, a relatively recent arrival to the Boston hotel scene, is appreciably smaller than, for example, the much larger and older Sheraton directly across the street, which has the advantages and disadvantages of being integrated into the Hynes…

title: Very thin walls
review: Thank you for your kind words. We appreciate the opportunity to welcome you we appreciate your business.  I am delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us.  If there is anything we can do to enhance our services please let us know. We are always listening to our Guests. Thanks again for choosing Hilton Boston Back Bay!  We hope you come back and visit us.  Warm Regards

title: Second stay here. Quite good.
review: We stayed for 3 nights on a room only basis and were very happy with our choice. Staying with a one year old the staff were helpful in providing a cot and a nice big room for us all. Staff very friendly, hotel overall was nice and clean. Great location for getting to look around Boston. Close to the fabulous Newbury street for great shopping and food. Would certainly stay again.

title: a stone's throw from the convention center...
review: Thank you for your recent stay here at Hilton Boston Back Bay! I am pleased you were able to experience our authentic Hilton hospitality and everything that Boston has to offer. We look forward to seeing you soon  Warm Regards,  Dominique Marty

title: Good location
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Nice location but didn't like it
review: As HH Gold member I was given an upgrade, but in reality, it was only a higher floor, not a better room. Room is ok, a little less than average. No executive lounge and the breakfast for HH is in a separate room with a very limited choice. Staff was pleasent. I beleive that for the same $$$, there are better choices in the area

title: Nice room,hotel needs updating.
review: Thank you for your comments about your recent stay, I am glad that you found the location and service levels of our hotel satisfactory.  We apologize that some amenities were not up to the standards and we appreciate your suggestions and will take them into consideration to provide our guests with more options. On your next visit to the area, we hope you consider staying with us again so we can demonstrate the excellent hospitality we are known for.  Hope to see you return soon. Safe travels!  Dominique Marty

title: Great hotel, great location, greatest staff ...
review: The hotel was right behind Sheraton which was connected to Prudential Center.  It's only across the road but it was raining so hard that I had to pay $15 for an umbrella which wasn't very good!  For this price, they could have gotten a nice one that is strong enough for Boston rain.  The room was ok with flat screen tv, though I feel it's more like 3* hotel.  Perhaps it's a small lobby or something.  The staffs were pretty cold and I didn't remember seeing them smile at all, except for the bellboy that helped me with my bags when I left.  I also got a rash on my face the next morning so I didnt' know whether I got it from the bedbug or from their towels.  Also water was running all night from the tub which was annoying.  For the price I paid, it's way toooooooo much.  I paid…

title: Beautiful View
review: Hello, I appreciate your review of your recent stay at the Hilton Boston Back Bay. I understand you felt the cost of the room was too high and am sharing your feedback with the appropriate members of our team. Thank you for your review.  Dominique Marty

title: Hilton Back Bay is a great place to stay!
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Good location rooms need updating
review: I have stayed in several hotels and a few in boston but this property is by far a family favorite. From the moment I walk into the spacious lobby till I tuck myself in to the super comfortable beds, I am reminded that you do get what you pay for. While some might find this property a bit on the pricy side, its location and convenience to all that Boston has to offer is far worth the money spent. The property has several different rooms depending on the budget your afforded. My family typically stays in the panoramic view rooms. Lots of space and huge windows to view what is arguably one of the finest skylines in the world. The Hilton has a restaurant as well as a small cafe type area where folks can sit and use the wireless internet to catch up on emails and the news. There are…

title: Good location but needs a lick of paint
review: Great location for sight seeing as well as shopping. As with most US hotels now the rooms feel dated and need updating. A/C wasnt great and quiet noisy. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. There is a car park attached to the hotel so you can park and use the lift for any luggage. Breakfast was ok, not a great range to choose from like other Hilton hotels which was slightly dissapointing.

title: Great location
review: We stayed at this hotel for three nights whilst on a Saga tour of New England so I am afraid that I cannot comment on value for money as we paid an all-in price.My initial impression was not very positive; Bolton Street (on which the hotel is situated) is not very attractive and, as we arrived I wondered about the neighbourhood. However, I was quite wrong. The hotel is ideally situated as it is just round the corner from Boylston Street which is full of restaurants, bars and many of the sights of Boston as well us the beginning of the Freedom Trail and just a block away from the very picturesque Newbury street which is has many upmarket restaurants and shops. It is also very close to the First Church of Christ Scientist whose amazing plaza, church and Mapparium are well worth a…

title: Nice hotel, but overpriced
review: I booked online in advance and took advantage of discount savings.  The room was as expected - both times we stayed there.  It is located within walking distance of Fenway Ballpark as well as the famous Newbury Street.  It is close to the Prudential building and shops as well as the subway.  One of the tour buses stops at the hotel - a great way to see Boston.  We will stay there again if we return to the area for any reason.

title: Great location
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. In nice weather, restaurant patio seating is packed with Bostonians and tourists alike soaking up the sunshine and enjoying the food. Commonwealth Ave offers a beautiful stroll down residential tree-lined streets. Keep walking towards the Charles River and enjoy a beautiful view by the water. In warmer months, people run and bike on paths running along the esplanade, and sail and kayak on the Charles River. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Good Hilton in general but poor breakfast/meal options
review: Stayed using Hilton Honors points while visiting student at nearby Northeastern University.  Convenient location within a short walk from Newbury Street, Mass Ave, and lots of other good dining spots.  Hilton is getting a little stale, small rooms typical of older inner city locations, but nice staff, and pretty good furnishings.  Limited dining / bar opportunities within the hotel, but enough nearby that that isn't a problem in nice weather.

title: Great stay! good location, comfy rooms with fantastic views
review: Stayed for 5 nights a few weeks ago.  Upgraded to high floor room (Diamond Member) - double double corner room - great choice if you want a bit more space.  Room smart and clean - but corridor a little shabby.  Front desk and housekeeping staff excellent - but always felt the Concierge was pushing his own interests/favorites.    The oddest thing was breakfast.  The free Continental breakfast was served in a windowless small room - more like a small conference room, and was VERY basic. The hot buffet was pretty poor too - although the spicy sausage links were lovely!   The oddest thing was that the only restaurant in the place was tiny - c.50 covers - but was still empty at breakfast and totally deserted for dinner.  When we went in on the first night at 9pm we were the only…

title: Wonderful place to relax after a day of touring
review: I came here for a conference (five nights) at the Hynes convention centre across the street. When I arrived, they actually reduced my rate from 560 dollars to 360 a night because I was staying with a group. They didn’t have to do that (since the group rate rooms had sold out) but I really appreciated it.  Everyone was helpful and friendly.  The staff constantly saw the big picture and did everything possible to make you happy.  My room was on the twenty first floor with a panoramic view. The room was perfectly clean, renovated and the bed was very comfortable. The bed faced three huge windows (floor to ceiling overlooking most of the city)The view  was great and the walls seemed sound proof.  There was a heavenly double shower in the room  (2 jets one on each side)  which would…

title: good city hotel
review: Boston is a wonderful place to visit.  The Hilton Boston Back Bay is set in the upscale section of Boston.  The desk staff was very accomodating. We arrived at 10:30 am, I not feeling well with check in time not until 3pm, and they found a room for us when we arrived.  The rooms were spacious, beds were comfortable, and very clean. Being a tourist location the concierge was most helpful with his knowledge of the area.  I was however, dissapointed with the choice of sweets offered as late night snacks, they all looked old, I asked for a cheese danish and got a lemon danish,  I have a feeling if I had asked for a lemon, I would have gotten a cheese..  The only other dissapointment was a hotel with this status charged for internet service in your room.  Most hotels I stay at, don't…

title: What Matters Most is What They Do When Something Goes Wrong
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. In nice weather, restaurant patio seating is packed with Bostonians and tourists alike soaking up the sunshine and enjoying the food. Commonwealth Ave offers a beautiful stroll down residential tree-lined streets. Keep walking towards the Charles River and enjoy a beautiful view by the water. In warmer months, people run and bike on paths running along the esplanade, and sail and kayak on the Charles River. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Boston Hotel
review: I booked at this Hilton for a very short (barely 24-hour) visit to make a presentation at a conference.  While I was surprised that this Hilton's lobby isn't as opulent as others I've seen, I realized once again that what matters most are the facilities in general, the room and its cleanliness, and how the staff members conduct themselves when things aren't right.  I checked in, the nice young woman found my reservation, and then she said, "My goodness.  I see that the room we have set aside for you hasn't been readied yet by housekeeping. Let me check."  She was embarrassed, as she should have been--it was 6pm!!  Before she went to check, she said, "Please go over to the Starbucks and get a cup of coffee and a snack as a gesture because of the inconvenience; they will charge…

title: Great start to a vacation in Boston
review: This was a nice, clean hotel.  Fitness room was ok.  The complimentary breakfast was not much to be desired! We stay at Hiltons and Hampton Inns all the time and the breakfast are MUCH better than this.  The concierge is NOT very helpful. I was asking questions and trying to figure out the best way to get to Maine (i.e., train, car, etc) and he acted like he didn't care because there were other people - so needless to say I had to get the front desk to rent my husband and I a car and had to use the GPS to get where we were going! The hotel is convenient to the shopping mall @ Prudential Center and other places.  This was our first trip to Boston and we loved Boston!

title: Very convenient - excellent hotel!
review: We spent 2 weeks in the States starting with four nights in the Hilton Boston Back Bay. It was my second trip to Boston and I was more than happy with the location of the hotel. Our room was spacious, well furnished and clean and we were more than happy with all the facilities. It was a great start to our vacation. Boston was great fun and I am sure we will return. If we do we will certainly stay here again.

title: Great location, lovely hotel
review: I have stayed at this hilton location periodically for two years as my daughter attends a nearby university.  My family has always found the staff to be pleasant and professional, the rooms to be clean and the parking provides in/out privileges.  Great location to nearby shopping and restaurants.  And it is pet friendly - so Sophie - the white miniature Schnauzer - is treated like a guest and there is a convenient dog friendly open space within a block of the hotel. Life is good at this location!

title: Good location, clean rooms
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Stay at another hotel instead
review: I had a good experience here for a conference. Good location, clean rooms. For dinner you have a multitude of good seafood restaurants within walking distance.  I am Hilton diamond member and had free continental breakfast in the lobby lounge. There is a guy working in there that is very helpful and has an extremely positive personality -- he was in a cheery and good mood each of the three mornings I went there for breakfast. That helps get your day off to a good start. Hotels can have excellent furnishings and cleanliness, but if the employees have an attitude and just don't care about the guests that ruins it all. I must say that the other employees were for the most part helpful too, but the friendly guy in the diamond lounge goes above and beyond.   I must note a couple…

title: Excellent location, nice panoramic room
review: My husband and I travel a lot.  We have stayed at many Hiltons and other hotel chains around the world.  We lived in Back Bay for a few years so we like the Hilton Back Bay location for the convenience.  Also, the Hilton Back Bay seemed like a safe choice of places to stay. Unfortunately for us, we are learning first hand that the Hilton Back Bay is not worth staying in.  You may have better luck if you try the Sheraton across the street or another hotel (Marriott, Collonade, Fairmont) in the neighborhood.    The Back Bay Hilton's exterior, entrance, and lobby are average.  Not a big deal, but we found ourselves hanging out at the Sheraton lobby many mornings.  Sheraton offers free wifi, free use of their computers in the lobby.  Also, the Sheraton lobby has a Starbucks and…

title: lovely experience in sunny hot Boston
review: We had a very hard time deciding where to stay in Boston for Columbus Day weekend.  A friend recommended the Hilton Back Bay, and it was perfect.  It is near the Green Line subway (known as the T in Boston), which makes it easily accessible from the airport and touring in general.  The Old Town Trolley has a stop right in front as well--very handy.  We chose a Panoramic View room and loved the view of the Christian Science Church headquarters--think basilica.  In the morning, we walked 1 1/2-2 blocks to a great restaurant called Thorton's.  Don't miss it.

title: Great location, standard Hilton quality
review: Spent 3 nights in this hotel in September 2011 as part of a Titan tour. The hotel was everything one has come to expect from a Hilton. Lovely clean big rooms, and all the usual extras, hairdryer, iron, coffee making etc. the bathroom was a little small  compared to the room size, and there could have been a few more toiletries, equally one could only make one cuppa per day for 2 people. Wide screen TV was great, and the air conditioning was managable, especially as we hit Boston in an unseasonable, but very welcome heatwave. The bed was fabulously comfortable. Also in the room was an unstocked, unplugged fridge which seems the norm now, the days of the mini bar seem to be over unless specifically requested!! Would also have liked a soft drinks machine on the floor somewhere near…

title: A Pleasant surprise!
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Very well located for holiday
review: I booked this via price line.  you never know what you will get, but with the costs of hotels for the town, I figured I would try.  I got a lovely room within a block of the T.  It is 2 blocks from Newbury St and right next to the capital grill.  The people were great, the process wonderful and the room was great.  I've had some nice nights at some lovely hotels, this was what a hilton should be, and more. thank you

title: Hilton Back Bay - First Class!
review: We spent 5 days at the hotel. The staff were very helpful and we had an excellent very large room with views over the city. Room was clean and room service did a good job. We got a good breakfast included with a good selection of food- no need to pay an additional $10 for the "full breakfast". Service at breakfast was excellent. Trolley bus stopped outside which was great for the two day ticket we purchased. Hotel close to Newbury Street and not far from the Copley & Prudential shopping Centres for great variety of shops. Plenty of good restaurants locally for variety.

title: good location, bit tired though
review: I visited Boston for my first time this weekend and I can't wait to go back!  The Hilton Back Bay is clean, friendly, and the amenities are excellent!  Peter Thomas Roth toiletries, a great shower, soft pillow-top beds, great views.... the staff were all extremely helpful and efficient. The location was great... easy to access the T, shopping, restaurants, tours, etc.  I would definitely stay there again!

title: Good, but not great....
review: We read they had spent a load of money on refurbs but can't see where. Was ignored by porters who preyed upon people who looked more wealthy than us, even though I was struggling (being disabled). Got an upgrade to an honours level room after stating it was our anniversary but got a room with 2 small beds, how romantic. Ok for price but not very luxurious

title: Great location if you are visiting Berklee College of Music.
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Great location!
review: It was very well priced and centrally located to visit Berklee.  Starbucks was in the lobby and a tour bus picked you up outside. Staff was also very good.

title: Fenway Close hotel
review: I’ve been there in September 2011 with a friend.  The hotel is in excellent location, in front of the Prudential Centre and close to Fenway Park, Newbury St. and Boston Common.  The hotel is clean and comfortable, rooms are spacious and quiet but wi-fi access should be free (a daily charge for wi-fi is applied). The staff was friendly and helpful and the view from our 17th floor’s room was great!!

title: Hilton, Back Bay
review: Stayed here Sept 2011 and enjoyed the stay.  Hotel is a typical city Hilton with slightly better than normal room.  Recommend requesting high floor corner room that overlooks the Charles River and Fenway Park.  We were on the 21st floor so had a quiet room.  Charge for internet access if you want to use it in your room, but there are approx 8 computers in the lobby next to Starbucks that you can use for free and we used them without trouble.  Front desk staff was fine but nothing special.  Valet was quite pleasant.  Ordered room service one night for dinner.  Food was fine, nothing exciting, and overly priced as expected.  Bar staff is helpful and typical hotel bar.  If you can leave the hotel for food/drinks, definitely do!  Exercise room is very nice!  Lots of equipment and…

title: Great hotel super location
review: A good hotel in an austere city. Not far from Logan airport, with excellent meeting accommodations and amenities but no real accommodations for late- night -arriving guests.   The only hotel restaurant includes a noisy, raucous bar with shrieking women and no respite for diners from drinking guests.  Still, the food was great, a late-night large Italian party was accommodated with a minimum of stress, only no service to clients, even if already in the restaurant and being served, after midnight. Not user-friendly in a cosmopolitan city.   And no room service after 11 pm  -- if you arrive late, you go hungry.  Not what one would want.

title: Great place to stay
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: A really good Hilton
review: We were there for a week and wished we had booked to stay longer before going to New York. The room was large and the facilities provided were great. The hotel was in the middle of things without being in a noisy area. The staff were friendly and helpful.

title: Great hotel as a base for a couple of tourist days in Boston
review: Glad you enjoyed your stay and appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback.

title: Good base for seeing the city or seeing the Red Sox
review: My wife and I stayed at the Back Bay Hilton for five days earlier in September.  We found the usual great Hilton service, and were delighted to be given a top floor room with great views of Fenway Park, the Charles River and the Back Bay area.  The heart of Back Bay (the "European" part of Boston) is a few minutes away on foot, and the nearest subway stations are close too.  Incidentally, the Boston subway is quick, clean and safe, and is a recommended way of getting around the city quickly and cheaply.  The hotel is equipped with all the facilities you'd want from a quality establishment, and we really must single out Matt, the barman, for special praise - he knew the best places to visit and to eat and was happy to share his extensive local knowledge (he comes from Boston). …

title: Comfortable and well placed.
review: Thank you for your note and so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay.  Your gracious comments regarding the attentive and personal service you received from Matt are particulalry appreciated.  Indeed, I am most fortunate to have such a service-oriented professional on the team.  I will be sure to use your note in our Team Member Appreciation Program.  Look forward to welcoming you back soon!

title: Good tourist base in Boston
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Great Hotel
review: Stayed 3 nights in Hilton Back Bay as part of a Titan UK Tour of Cape Cod/Boston.  Had room on 9th floor which was in excellent condition and very modern with all the necessary facilities.  The bathroom was lovely as were all other aspects of the room.  Front Desk staff friendly and very helpful with tourists.  Used Dalton Restaurant in the Hotel for breakfast.  Choice and staff were first class. The Hotel is well positioned for tourists, close to Prudential Centre Shopping and many restaurants in Boylston Street.  It is well positioned for public transport by underground to various parts of the City.  Would happily use this Hotel on any future visit to Boston.  One tip - we were there over a weekend and like to try local restaurants for meals at night.  In this area restaurants…

title: Great Service All Around
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your tip.  That is an excellent point.  The neighborhood is fortunate to have many great restaurants, but as you pointed out, they are popular and can be very busy particularly on weekends. Reservations are definitely recommended and our concierge can assist in suggestioins and setting it up for you either when at the hotel or in advance.  Thanks for pointing that out!

title: A home run....
review: I stayed one night with my girl friend. Located with in the short distance of the downtown Boston with a very clean fully furnished room. The room had also full supply of daily needs which include TV, cooking stuffs, and telephone including hot shower and clean towel. Food is a little bit expensive but breakfast was free which was very much enough for both my girl friend and me. Overall, it is highly recommended for visitors of Boston area.  It is easy to locate and walk around and come back.

title: Great Location
review: We stay at Hilton Hotels quite often and the difference here was we were treated with friendly helpful service at every opportunity.  It started at check in, continued at breakfast, and was appreciated at the bar with our server there.  The location was also very good.  We were fortunate to have beautiful weather and walked every where.  We would return should we return to Boston.

title: Good Location....Nothing More!!
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Great base in Boston
review: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights while in Boston on a fun trip.  The one and only benefit of this hotel is its location in Back Bay.  It was about 2 blocks over from Newbury Street and directly across the street from the Prudential Center.  Other than that, the staff was not friendly or very helpful. The concierge told us to go to this one club called District on a night that it was actually closed.  A friend of ours drove down from Maine to hang out with us for the weekend, and parking at the hotel was $41/day.  The refrigerator and ipod docking station were both broken, and we had to call the engineering guy a few times to finally resolve those issues.  I wouldn't recommend staying at this hotel unless you get a really good deal.

title: Good choice for Boston
review: Thank you for your constructive feedback.  I sincerely apologize for any misinformation you may have received.  The concierge team is usually quite knowledgeable but as you can imagine, it is very difficult to remain current on any changes given the magnitude of options in the city.  I also apologize for any maintenance issues and am pleased that they were addressed on a timely manner.  Parking, while expensive, is typical and competitive for the Back Bay.  While our location is ideal, I do hope you will give us another try to prove that there is more to us.

title: Convenient, clean, and not ridiculously priced
review: Well located hotel.Very nice rooms.Sensational,comfortable beds. Walls were thin but noise not too much of a problem. Wi-fi should be free

title: Boston favorite
review: Thank you for your note and hope we will welcome you back soon.

title: A Favorite
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Nice hotel, great location!
review: My partner and I have stayed at the Hilton Back Bay twice in the past year and we love it. Prime location, excellent service, and fabulous rooms. I highly recommend it!

title: Another Great Stay!
review: Thanks for the note and great to have you back!  Glad you enjoyed your stay.

title: Great Time
review: We stayed here for a conference in the city for 5 nights and had a great experience at this hotel! The location is perfect, walking distance to pretty much everything in Boston, or if you prefer, a short cheap taxi ride to any attraction. It is 2 blocks from beautiful Newbury St, 10 min walk from Boston Common and the Charles River, the South End, and Fenway Park in the other direction. We were pleasantly surprised with our corner room, spacious and amazing VIEW of the city from 5 windows!  Would definitely stay here again.

title: Great location
review: Thank you for taking the time to write.  I am glad you enjoyed your stay.  Those corner rooms are amazing, aren't they?!  Hope to welcome you back again soon.

title: Great stay in Boston at the Hilton Boston Back Bay
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Great location, hotel needs some upgrades!
review: We took a four day trip to Boston and stayed at the Hilton Boston Back Bay.  We really enjoyed our stay there.  We had two rooms on the same floor.  The rooms were very nice, clean,  and included a refrigerator in the room and Peter Thomas Roth toiletries in the bathroom.  The room had great air-conditioning and we had a good view from the 22nd floor.   We ate in the restaurant two times and it was very good.  We ate breakfast in the lounge for Hilton Honors Gold members every morning.  The gentleman in the lounge was extremely friendly and helpful.  The breakfast was good and they offered bottled water for you to take with you as you left the lounge.  We used the concierge to make reservations for the Duck Tour and he was very helpful.  We also used the business area for…

title: Great Spot
review: Thank you for sharing your feedback.  We particularly appreciate your gracious complements regarding the attentive service you received in the Diamond Lounge and at the Conceirge Desk.  I have taken the liberty of sharing your note with the team in each department.  I am most fortunate to work with such a group of service-oriented professionals.  Hope to welcome you back soon.

title: Great Hotel, great staff and great location
review: We stayed at the Hilton Back Bay for 6 nights at the end of July 2011. We got a King corner room with points so overall was a good deal. The hotel is in a great location - it takes less than 5 minutes to walk to all the restaurants on Newbury St or to the stores in the Prudential Center or Copley Place. The hotel is a bit old but clean and comfortable (as a Hilton should normally be). The carpets and the furniture are old and our carpet had a big stain on it. I am a Diamond member so we had free breakfast at the Diamond Lounge but we were disappointed by the choices we found there. It was nothing compared to other Hilton Executive Lounges - just some fruits, cereal, pastry and scrambled eggs. Even considering all the above, I would still recommend this hotel due to its proximity…

title: Not up to Hilton standards.
review: Thank you for taking the time to write.  Breakfast for our Gold and Diamond Hilton HHonors members is served in the Diamond Lounge which includes a continental breakfast and two hot items in keeping with the program.  We do not offer an Executive Floor/Lounge due to the smaller nature of our property but can understand the confusion.  Our Corner Kings are on a different renovation schedule than the rest of the hotel and are scheduled to be refurbished this winter.

title: Very dated, small rooms and not ideal location
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Overall a wonderful experience
review: When we saw the location it seemed very central, but this is a little misleading. It is down a back street off the more glamorous Boylston. The rooms are really rather small, and the decor very dated. My bill was incorrectly calculated, although the staff were pleasant and corrected it without fuss. The gym and swimming pool were the highlight of the stay. Also it is noisy - you can hear the person in the next bathroom very clearly for example.

title: Great location and great hotel
review: Thank you for your note.  It is true that the hotel is located on a side street off Boylston which also helps to mitigate noise and traffic while still providing an amazing location in the middle of everything Boston has to offer within walking distance or easy access to the T.  All rooms have been renovated within the last few years, but certainly it is an on-going process in a hotel.  I am glad the staff addressed the error quickly and professionally.  Hope to welcome you back soon.

title: Great Place, good rate but here's the catch...
review: Overall had a wonderful experience. The front desk staff was very attentive especially Emily. The Restaurant staff were great both for breakfast and dinner. The manager Bill was wonderful he really helped us the best way to explore Boston. John the concierge was also very helpful with things to see and do. We did have some complications with Housekeeping, We called down for 2 extra towels and it seemed forever to receive them. But overall a great trip and will return soon

title: Great location, friendly staff, dated rooms
review: Thank you for your note. I particularly appreciate the gracious comments regarding the attentive service you received from Emilie, Bill, John and the restaurant staff. I will be sure to recognize each in our Team Member appreciation program.

title: Great location for music schools
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. In nice weather, restaurant patio seating is packed with Bostonians and tourists alike soaking up the sunshine and enjoying the food. Commonwealth Ave offers a beautiful stroll down residential tree-lined streets. Keep walking towards the Charles River and enjoy a beautiful view by the water. In warmer months, people run and bike on paths running along the esplanade, and sail and kayak on the Charles River. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: A So-So Hilton for a Top Tier Rate
review: My husband, teenage son and I were in Boston looking at music schools (Berkelee, NEC) and I chose this hotel based on reviews and location.  Near the T, Commons, great dining and concerts.  We had a nice corner room with a view of Back Bay.  We were on a high floor, and the room was very quiet, clean and cool.  There's no compimentary breakfast in the hotel, so we wrangled up some Starbucks in the morning from the lobby.  Also, no free wifi in the room, but that was also available in the lobby.  Staff was helpful, our stay was just fine,  but we still felt the room was priced more in line with a luxury hotel (we'd just been spoiled at the Waldorf in NYC) not the lesser level of this Hilton hotel.

title: Great hotel in Back Bay
review: Thank you for taking the time to write and glad you generally enjoyed your stay.  Certainly, a perfect location for that college tour!  We do offer great packages and special deals throughout the year that provide great value though in the peak of summer season, these sell quickly.

title: Below expectations!
review: We stayed at this Hilton for 3 nights in August.   Positives:  --Great location close to trolley stops, T line, Fenway, Prudential Center, and tons of restaurants and pubs.   --Very courteous front desk staff and breakfast staff.   --Clean, quiet room.  Negatives:  --Room was very small, bathroom was tiny.  We were told this was an upgraded room, but I don't think they could have rooms that offer much less space.   --No minibar, no fridge.   --There is no lounge in this hotel.  Breakfast is offered for gold and diamond members in a room off the lobby, but there is no lounge in the evening.  This was a surprise for a hotel of this size and price range in Boston.

title: Great Hotel, and location.
review: Thank you for your feedback. I particularly appreciate that you found the team to be service-oriented professionals.    The Diamond Lounge offers complimentary breakfast for our Gold and Diamond Hilton HHonors members as part of that program.  It should not be confused with an Executive Lounge, which we do not offer given the smaller nature of our hotel.   We do offer a limited number of corner rooms which do offer more space than our 300 SF standard rooms which is a good size for a center-city location such as ours though the bathrooms are smaller in keeping with they style when the hotel was constructed.  While we no longer offer mini-bar service, the refrigerator remains within the credenza unit and is available at no charge for your convenience.

title: Efficient - as expected
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: St Patrick's Week
review: Having recently stayed at The Lenox we decided to try the Hilton for our last night after our tour of New England. The hotel is well positioned and exactly as a modern well run hotel should be so no complaints. You could have changed the name over the hotel to any of the other chain hotels in the area and not known the difference. Perfect for business a bit impersonal for family.

title: Great Location and Comfortable Stay
review: Thank you for your feedback.  We do recognize you have many choices when you travel with each offering a great room so we try to differentiate ourselves by our attentive service.  We will continue our efforts to personalize each touch point in order to better connet.

title: Comfortable, Great Location, Excellent Service
review: Stayed in Hilton Boston Back Bay back in March 2009, this is a very impressive hotel and the staff are very helpful!! Rooms are great and very spacious, there is free internet service in the lobby which is handy for checking things out.  You can also purchase trolley ride tickets in the hotel which is a good way of seeing and learning about the city of Boston!! Also near the hotel is lots shopping malls so anyone who stays here for shopping will not be dissappointed!!  Boston is a great city and enjoy it every time I go there and now I've found this gem of hotel I know where i'll be staying the next time I come back!!

title: Friendly and Helpful Staff, Day and Night
review: Thank you for your note.  I am glad you enjoyed your stay and particularly your complements of the attentive service you received from the team.  We are happy to accommodate upgrades when our occupancy allows which is tougher when we are sold out during peak season that runs April though mid-November.

title: Great Stay in Boston's Back Bay
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Solid Hotel in a Great Location
review: This hotel is a great option for an affordable hotel in the Back Bay area. It is very close to Newbury Street, the main thoroughfare of Back Bay. Furthermore, many of the trolley tour companies have stops in front of or across the street from the hotel. It is also a great option for Fenway Park; it was a 15 minute walk from our hotel to Fenway. You can also reach many historic sites with a 10-15 minute walk from the hotel. Another great plus to this property was the proximity to the Prudential Tower. You were able to cross the street to the Sheraton, take the escalators, and go through the shopping mall.   The rooms are an interesting shape; however, they are very spacious (larger than the average Hilton rooms) and are very clean. The decor is cookie-cutter Hilton, but it's not…

title: Convenient to Northeastern University
review: Thank you for your note.  I am glad you enjoyed your stay.  Interesting comment on the kids running amuck in the health club.  The combined space make for a really nice, bright, convenient area that allows parents to get in a quick work out while the kids are in the pool, but we will try to monitor that a bit more closely.

title: Delightfully convenient and easy for travelers
review: As part of a three city vacation to celebrate my birthday I stayed at this Hilton.  It was my first visit to Boston and the first stop on my mini tour.  The hotel was clean and a good size.  At check in I asked Brian, the manager, whether I was getting a corner room and was given one.  The room was huge and nicely decorated, but the view wasn't much (two parking lots were visible from my window).  Corner rooms are definitely nice, but I realized soon after check in that as a solo traveler the space wasn't necessary and I'd rather have had a beautify view of the water or city.  If you can get a corner room and a nice view too, go for it.  For the most part the staff was very friendly and helpful.  For example, I had an issue with trying to open an attachment on a computer in the…

title: Great location
review: Thank you for your note.  I particularly appreciate the gracious comments regarding the attentive service you received from Brian, Eriko and Eddie (Diamond Lounge.)  I am most fortunate to work with such a group of service-oriented professionals though I deeply regret that we missed the fact that this was your birthday trip.  My best wishes.

title: Close to fenway
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Great hotel!
review: stayed July25th and 26th,2011 Very quick check in, spacious,clean and comfortable. Walking distance to Fenway park,our main reason to be in Boston. Close to shopping,tour stops,restaurants.  Staff very friendly and helpful. If we go back to Boston,will definitely stay here again.

title: Very Nice
review: Thank you for taking the time to write of your recent stay.  Glad you enjoyed it and hope to welcome you back soon.  Playoffs perhaps!

title: Good location, Friendly staff
review: We spent 4 pleasant days at the Hilton. The room was very spacious - especially the bathroom! Very clean and in good shape.  Hotel staff was very helpful and welcoming. The hotel facilities were great and the location was very convenient. The city tour buses stops right outside the hotel. We walked to the inner city and back most days although taking a cab or public transportation might be easier. The Prudential shopping center is 2 minutes away and there are loads of good restaurants and bars in the neighborhood.  Would definitely return to this hotel, it was good value for your money!

title: Great Location
review: Thank you for your feedback.  We were honored to be your host during your visit to Boston and pleased you enjoyed your stay.

title: Nice hotel, nice location
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Clean & Convenient to Fenway Park with easy access to The Prudential Center
review: This is a very beautiful hotel.  It's very clean and the staff was both polite and helpful.  The rooms are spacious and there was a fantastic view.  The location is also super.  It's close to the T station and not far at all from Fenway or nearby shopping.  I would definitely stay here again.

title: Enjoyable Trip
review: Thank you very much for your thoughtful note.  I am glad you enjoyed your stay and sincerely appreicate your gracious comments on the attentive service you encountered from the team.

title: Great location with clean accommodations
review: Liked: easy & safe 10-15 min walk to Fenway Park, across the street from The Prudential Center with shops and restaurants, fitness center: clean & updated, Starbucks!, 6 computers with free internet useage in the lobby, clean (basic) rooms, and check in was a breeze. Service was friendly at check-in.  Disliked: only complaint that the only full-service restaurant in the hotel (for dinner) was upscaled, and the breakfast buffet was very bland.  This hotel isn't in the "middle" of Boston like the hotels around Copley Park (but close being a 5-10 minute walk) and Boston Common Park (20 min. walk). There is no doubt that Boston is a "walking" city. It may take you 45 minutes (give or take) to walk from The Hilton to The Harbor. If you walk around the outside of the hotel, there is a…

title: What a wonderful location
review: Thank you for your comments and glad to hear you enjoyed your stay.  We are in the midst of completely revamping our breakfast buffet so look forward to your comments after you next visit.

title: Great hotel in a perfect location!
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Disappointed for the money
review: I recently went to Boston to celebrate the fourth and stayed at the Hilton Boston Back Bay.  I was impressed with the hotel and even more happy with the location.  The rooms were big and spacious, the bed was extremely comfortable, and the bathroom was adequate.  More importantly, the hotel is located in the Back Bay section of the city, near many restaurants, bars, and shopping (the famed Newberry and Boylston streets are within two blocks).  There are two T stops within a few blocks, and the Prudential Center, a vast mall full of mainstream businesses, is almost directly across the street.  The hotel did not, however, provide free wi-fi, and the lobby restaurant was very expensive-these were the only aspects of the hotel that I did not like.  However, if you are looking for a…

title: Would stay here again!
review: Thank you for your note.  We were honored to be your host over the holiday weekend and glad you enjoyed your stay.  The convenience of  in-room wifi access does have a charge, but there is complimentary access in the business center on one of our terminals or your lap top.  There is even a terminal just for printing boarding passes at no charge.

title: Nice Hotel and Great Location
review: Paid full rate for 4th of July weekend. Rooms are small, bathroom even smaller. Shower curtain had very strong mildew smell.  Beds were comfortable and frig in room was nice.  Bellhop staff was outstanding no matter who was on shift--helpful and polite beyond the call of duty.  Staff in general was top notch.  Bartender on night of July 3rd gave great advice for 4th of July events.  Elevators were burdensome and slow.  I realize it was a holiday weekend, but waited up to 30 mins at checkout to get an elevator on the 12th floor that we could fit on with luggage.  Very inconvenient.  Business Center in lobby very convenient to print out boarding passes. Hilton Honors members.  Will shop around next time in Boston.

title: Needs renovating, but staff was great!
review: Thank you for your note.  I particularly appreciate your kind comments regarding the attentive service you received from the team, particularly the bell staff and bartender.  I am most fortunate to work with such a service-oriented team.  I wish I could do something about the elevators;  they can be overwhelmed during peak times during family-oriented periods.

title: Great hotel in a prime location with excellent staff!
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: An absolutely great hotel
review: We spent 2 nights in Boston after driving all the way from Canada to see a Dispatch concert, and I can say we were more than pleased with the service we received at the hotel. Arriving at the hotel and going up the parking, a strange smoke emerged from the hood of the auto. The second we noticed this, we stopped the car and opened the hood to notice the engine coolant was boiling and coming off the pressure valve. Immediately we went downstairs to check in and ask the front desk agent named Deshawn for help, he notified security about our situation, thus letting us park in a no parking zone and printed out maps of the nearest Mazda dealerships and other car garages in the area. The problem was solved pretty easily as no liquid leaked from the auto after filling it back up. But…

title: OK for Hilton, nothing special
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your note.  Your kind and gracious comments regarding the attentive service you received from DeShawn are greatly appreciated.  I am most fortunate to work with such a service-oriented professional.  I will be sure to use your note to recognize his efforts in our team member appreciation program.  Also glad the problem with your car wasn't more serious;  scary with such a long return trip in front of you.

title: Fenway and Shopping and Dining, Oh MY!
review: Just completed a weekend in Boston for Father's Day.  If you are looking for a phenomenal hotel with a great staff and convenient location, look here.  The staff did everthing possible to make the stay absolutely perfect!  Particularly the wait staff at the breakfast that hustled throughout the morning.  Great job!  And in addition, this location is pet friendly.

title: Fabulous experience!
review: Thank you for taking the time to write.  We were honored to be your host (and your pet's!) during your visit to Boston.  Indeed, we do welcome pets and Boston is very much a dog town, so bring them along!  Thank you for your kind comments regarding the breakfast crew;  I will be sure to share your comments with the team!

title: My home base in Boston

title: Very Nice in a Good Location
review: This time I was staying for business. Every night I stayed late for calls, meetings, so I really apprecaited the restaurant / bar opens until midnight. I love the gym with nice pool. 1F starbucks was a great place, especially as my work space, virtual office, too.

title: Fantastic staff and great location
review: Thank you for your gracious note.  We are always pleased to host Grand Circle during their New England tours.  Hope we will welcome you back again soon!

title: This was a great location to explore Boston
review: My husband and I stayed in this hotel with a Grand Circle Travel group tour and we were very happy with our stay.  Nice staff and rooms.  Only complaint would be the pay-for-wifi.  We felt very safe in the neighborhood and it was right next to The Prudential Building where you can go to the top and view all of Boston for free!

title: Great location & outstanding staff
review: Staff, always friendly and helpful and a location in Boston's Back Bay that cant be beat. Short walk to Fenway, shorter walk to the green line for the T with Boylston and Newbury streets right around the corner and you have both easy access to the rest of the city combined with more than enough to do right outside your door. Shaws supermarket is a 5 minute walk and Copley Plaza and square are within 10 minutes. Plenty of food choices all around.  $40 for parking per night

title: What a staff..
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Hiltons, always a pleasure
review: In Boston, you can't lose if you choose to stay at this Hilton.  When we arrived from the airport the doorman, the check in, the bellman were all so friendly.  We had a red-eye and early check in and were whizzed into our lovely room.  The room was quiet, great view, spacious and we got a great price for the amenities.   The staff was helpful in providing us with information about the local restaurants and sights to see.  I can't say enough about this staff.. they put this Hilton over the top.

title: Going the extra mile.......
review: Thank you for taking the time to share you comments.  While we appreciate all feedback, certainly we enjoy the complements all that much more!  Hope to welcome you back soon.

title: First stay in Boston
review: I am a frequent Hilton guest and nothing about this particular Hilton was any different. Service was great and the hotel was clean as always. The bell man who greeted me was especially nice and helpful. The back bay area is a great location. I really liked the Starbucks and business center located right in the lobby, it's super convenient.  I hate that they charge for the internet being that the room was almost $400 but again, that's to be expected. I do want to point out their restaurant 40 Dalton, mmm mmm good. I'm from Las Vegas so I wanted to taste something different and the room service lady suggested the Lobster grilled cheese sandwich and clam chowder, omg delicious! So much so that when I checked out, I made a special trip back to the restaurant to order that same dish.…

title: Great experience using Hilton Honors points.
review: Thank you for taking the time to write of your recent stay.  That sandwich is definitely killer!  I have taken the liberty of sharing your comments with the Food and Beverage team and appreicate your sharing it.

title: Great Location...hmmm but other than that??
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Great location but you should get more for the money.
review: Really any Hampton Inn is much better than this hotel. Room not all that! But I must say shopping and Redsox close by. Tour buses pick up outside of hotel that was nice. Starbucks in hotel....nice. But really PAY for parking and internet? Parking Crazy Fee!When you pay three times what you would pay to stay in a Hampton Inn really you have to pay for the internet? No shuttle to and from airport? For the money I would expect a nicer room, not all that great. Gym nice. Small Pool and hot tub. I just can not get over the cost of the hotel and then they still try to nickel and dime you for stuff....meaning parking, internet, ect........ Next time in Boston I will stay somewhere else for the money I spent.

title: Great Central Location
review: Thank you for your feedback.  I deeply regret that you did not find value in our rates.  Unfortunately, Boston is an extremely expensive city including the cost of real estate, labor, taxes, insurance and other expenses related to our city-center location.  Our rates are very  competitive, if not lower, than others in the neighborhood and are priced based on the costs associated with the room as well as demand, stay pattern and other attributes and this is the midst of peak season.  In order to keep our rates as low as possible, they are not "packaged" to include such additional amenities as parking, breakfast and wifi which are not utilized by all guests.  If these were included, our rates would need to be even more expensive and not fair to those that do not use these services.  We do offer complimentary internet access in the business center, parking rates are very typical for downtown Boston and there are packages that offer special rates for bundled services.  Hampton Inns and other limited service hotels located in suburban locations do have a different cost structure which allows for lower rates.  For instance, an open air parking lot is alot less expensive to build then a seven story center-city garage.  However, you need to balance this against the additional costs incurred during your stay for transportation, parking and lost time to get to where you want to be.  Certainly a personal decision.

title: Very good value hotel at a great location.
review: Great location but on arrival the room had items from previous guests. After paying over $300/night they wanted to charge an extra $15/day for WiFi access. Why can you get free access at Motel 6 and not at the Hilton?

title: Another great stay!
review: Thank you for the note.  Please accept my sincerest apologies for the lapse with Housekeeping.  Certainly, not the standard we are striving for.  I trust the staff responded quickly and appropriately.  While there is a charge for the convenience of in-room wifi service, please be aware that there is complimentary access on our five terminals or your own in the Starbucks Lobby Cafe where you will also find facilities to copy, scan, fax and print at no charge.

title: Quiet, comfortable, clean almost perfect--with one catch....
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Great Location
review: Went to Boston to run the marathon with my wife; check in was fast, they had the exact room I had requested, even mentioning right away that, as requested, I wanted a 'quiet' room, and that they had one ready for me.  They were right; it was very quiet, great little corner room.  Very good size TV, very clean bathrooms, close to amenities and convention center--very happy with almost all aspects of the stay, however: I travel a lot doing marathons around North America, and have occasionally left running gear, etc in my room, realizing it later.  The 3 or 4 times prior to this trip that I had left something and contacted staff, they quickly had it sent to me.  When I realized I left my cell phone at the Hilton Back Bay, I contacted them and they quickly found it and sent it out. …

title: love the bed and the room was large
review: Thank you for your note.  We were honored to be your host during Marathon Weekend and glad you found the hotel to be comfortable.  I am particularly pleased that we were able to locate your phone and expedite its return.  Actually, we did pay the shipping costs on this item as we always do.  According to UPS, the COD charges were taxes and fees imposed by Customs due to the international shipment of which we were unaware.  Trust you can appreciate that.  Please be aware that we reunite over a 1000 lost items with their owners in a typical year!  Some interesting stories there!

title: Excels in all 6 Tripadvisor categories
review: We stayed here for the Boston Marathon.  Rooms were large and clean.  The best thing about the hotel is the location.  Centrally located and within walking distance to all attractions.  A great supermarket within a couple of blocks for affordable take-out.  The Cheesecake Factory is within a block  Unfortunately, the service on the attached restaurant "40 Dalton" was not great.  One server to accommodate the three occupied tables in the place was slow.  We had to ask for a beer three times before she finally brought it to us and she didn't apologize.  I didn't appreciate having to pay an additional $15.00 a day for Wi-Fi.  I've stayed in Holiday Inn Expresses and Best Westerns for half the price with free Wi-Fi.

title: Basic Good Hotel
review: Thank you for your note.  We were pleased to be your host during Marathon Weekend.  Please accept my sincerest apologies for the slow and inattentive service you received in our restaurant.  Certainly, not the level of service we are striving to provide but appreicate you bringing it to our attention so that it can be addressed.  While there is a charge for the convenience of wifi access in guest rooms, complimentary access is available on our five terminals or your own device in the Starbucks lobby cafe which also includes printing, copying, scanning and faxing capabilities at no charge.  There is also a terminal exclusively for printing out boarding passes located at the front desk.

title: Great Location - close to colleges, shopping...
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. In nice weather, restaurant patio seating is packed with Bostonians and tourists alike soaking up the sunshine and enjoying the food. Commonwealth Ave offers a beautiful stroll down residential tree-lined streets. Keep walking towards the Charles River and enjoy a beautiful view by the water. In warmer months, people run and bike on paths running along the esplanade, and sail and kayak on the Charles River. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Very Nice
review: Stayed recently while touring colleges with my teenager.  Excellent location for touring colleges...easy walk to Northeastern.  Also very close to great shopping and many restaurants.

title: Nice location but expected a little more
review: Thank you for the note.  We were honored to be your host during your visit to Boston colleges and wish you all the best during the process.  Hope to welcome you back soon.

title: Great Location & Quality Hotel
review: I found the hotel to be very nice and clean. The plumbing is loud  and the cost to park is high.  I would tru another hotel before going back for another stay.

title: Nice Hotel in a Nice Area
review: Thank you for your feedback.  I am glad you found the hotel to be comfortable.  Unfortunately, it is true that parking is not inexpensive in Boston due to the limited space in a downtown locaton.  Our prices are very competitive for the neighborhood and includes early arrival and late departure so that one night's parking essentially includes two days for our guests which is a great value compared to public lots.  Also, Boston is very much a walking town, particularly our location, with easy access to public transportation, so a car is definitely not needed.  Hope to welcome you back soon.

title: Great if you like a SOFT bed.
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Great location and staff provides excellent customer service
review: Fabulous location. Staff nice. Beds made my back hurt (too soft)  and if you are used to a King for two people, a double wont cut it. Had to get a roll away. Asked for and got the roll away and Wi-Fi at no charge, a $40 per day savings. Right across the street from the Prudential and Sheraton, with great food court and shopping. Right next to Summer Shack restaurant. Walking distance (1 block) to the "T" subway. "River view" is to the Charles river but way way off in the distance. OK pool and hot tub. Good weight room. Rooms do get stuffy in winter, as the AC and fans don't run, and too noisy to open window. Pillows were awful. Trolleys pick up and drop off right at hotel entrance.

title: Overall good stay-but low water pressure
review: Thank you for your feedback.  I am sorry you did not enjoy our beds and pillows, usually one of the highlights.  However, we recognize everyone's preferences vary and thus we do have on hand a variety of pillows and back boards available upon request and regret we were not aware of your discomfort so it could be addressed immediately during your stay.  I am glad that the desk was able to address the lack of availability for a king size bed appropriately.  Your kinds comments in regards to the staff and health club are greatly appreciated.

title: Nice stay for a nice price
review: In today’s hotel industry, there are hotels which provide accommodations, and then there are hotels which provide superior customer service as the staff at the Hilton Boston Back Bay whom made my stay an enjoyable experience. When contacting the hotel, the front desk manager Segen was very helpful in arranging a quiet and comfortable room for me in advance of my arrival. At some hotels, the Diamond lounge or HHonors breakfast provides minimal or insufficient dining options. At the Hilton Boston Back Bay, Gold and Diamond members are provided with their own lounge with a nice breakfast buffet including fresh fruit, cereals, bread, hot oatmeal, and a warm egg dish. The Diamond lounge concierge Eddie oversees the lounge during the week and is great with providing guests…

title: Good facilities, but inattentive service
review: Thank you for taking the time to write.  Your gracious comments, particularly in regards to the attentive service you received from Segen, Eddie and Claudia, are sincerely appreicated.  I have shared your note and personally recognized each in our team member appreciation program.  Indeed, I am most fortunate to work with such a group of service-oriented professionals and appreciate your note.

title: Excellent stay -- Outstanding gym
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Great Stay for New England Conservatory Audition
review: The rooms were spacious, clean, and comfortable; I felt pampered.  I got a couple of great night’s sleep on comfortable beds and pillows.  The room was temperature controlled by an actual thermometer (what a refreshing change from those window unit heaters/air conditioners).  The hotel itself was beautiful; a high end experience.  I was able to use the free business center to complete some work while sipping on Starbucks coffee served right there in the hotel lobby.  To top it off, the Hilton Back Bay had THE BEST gym I’ve ever seen in a hotel.  Lots of running treadmills, weight machines, free weights, and floor space; I got a real workout in while traveling.  The pool and hot tub were clean and just wonderful.  On one evening, I visited the bar/restaurant, the FORTY DALTON. …

title: Great Stay!
review: Thank you for your feedback.  I appreciate your kind words and glad that you enjoyed your stay.  We did just complete a renovation of our health club last year and agree it came out very nice;  the skylights really make it a bright enjoyable space and the new equipment with individual TVs are wonderful.    Please allow me a note on the restaurant.  Indeed, there is a "Kobe Dog" for $14 on the lunch menu.  However, these are no ordinary hot dogs!  They are made with Kobe Beef and are served two to an order.  Dinner entree prices generally run $17 - $25 which is quite reasonable in Boston.  We also have a 'Bar Bites" menu with selections running at $7/each or 3 for $16, and includes a single Kobe Dog for $7 (and that is less than a steamed Fenway Frank at the ball park!)  We also offer daily specials and less expensive wines by the glass.  We do try to offer a great product using local ingredients served with flair at reasonable prices.  We will continue to watch our price points and appreicate your feedback.    Anyways, thanks again and hope we will welcome you back soon!

title: Enjoyable stay
review: We live about an hour north of Boston but decided to get a hotel room for my daughter's audtion at the New England Conservatory (NEC).  It was the best decision because it snowed the night before and instead of fighting the weather we were cozy in our room at the Hilton.  The location is within walking distance of NEC and convenient to restaurants and shopping.  The Prudential Center is just across the street and has 3 restaurants:  Legal Seafoods, PF Chang and the Cheesecake Factory.  My daughter used the Hilton business center to print out final copies of her sheet music from her computer.  We parked in the garage which was a bit expensive but worth it since we did not have to deal with the snow.  Luckily, I was able to get a great room rate using LastMinuteTravel.com.  We…

title: A 5 Star Experience!
review: Thank you for your gracious comments.  We were honored to be your host during your daughter's audition.  I hope we will be welcoming you back soon!

title: FANTASTIC HOTEL
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle.
