title: great
review: Stayed here back in may 2010 + found the hotel to be very good. Staff were very friendly  especially the bar + resteraunt staff. The room was very spacious + clean + the very large flat screen tv also helped..!!!   Was very accessible to the city + it also helped that the trolly tours of the city pulled up right outside. Would highly recommend the hotel to any of my family travelling to america + the boston area.

title: Nice Hotel
review: Thank you for taking the time to write.  I will be sure to share your comments with the team at Forty Dalton!  Hope to welcome you back soon.

title: Unclean rooms, poor service, would not recommend
review: me and my brother traveld to boston to watch a bruins game and chose this hotel for its location  good clean room great beds  ac was a bit lould  stayed on 12th floor no noise from other rooms if in boston again i would stay here again

title: College scouting and sightseeing - great location
review: Thank you for your note.  Hope we will be welcoming you back for the playoffs!  Go Bruins!

title: Fine hotel
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Excellent hotel, but pay attention to the bill!
review: Stayed during a recent snowstorm. As Hilton Gold, I was surprised to have to request a higher floor from the 5th floor room originally assigned, but did end up on the 24th floor. The room was clean and well laid out, with nice linens and a very comfortable bed. It was quiet, at least on this floor. This is a 3.5 star hotel that probably aspired to 4 star status at one point, but now seems to have found its niche. The pool was on the small side, but clean. I though the complimentary continental breakfast for Gold HHonors was quite fine, with good fresh coffee, a nice fruit assortment, and some freshly cooked (not dried) eggs. The staff member assigned to the Hhonors breakfast area offered very good service, despite what was probably a difficult morning for any staff member having…

title: Yes, with quibbles
review: Thank you for taking the time to write of your recent stay.  The recent storms have certainly made this winter a challenge but appreciate your complements that the team kept operations going smoothly.  I will be sure to share your note with all of them, particularly the Diamond Lounge attendant.

title: DO NOT STAY HERE... MUST READ!
review: We had an excellent stay at the Boston Hilton Back Bay while attending a professional conference recently, but make sure you check your bill before checking out.   On the positive stay, the staff were very friendly, professional, and accomodating.  The room was good and well-equipped but a bit dated. In particular, the small refrigerator was a bit dirty and the racks were broken.  The bathroom was clean, but small and seemed like it could use some updating.  The temperature control worked excellently and the room was very quiet.  The bed was comfortable, and overall we had good nights sleep.   But the challenges concerned the cost of the extras and the final bill.  The breakfast buffet with a discount coupon was $20 per person, and in-room wi-fi was $14 per day.  Thankfully…

title: Excellent hotel and location, excellent value
review: My sincerest apologies for the confusion on the bill and pleased that the staff corrected the matter quickly and professionally.  A note about the refrigerators:  rooms previously contained a mini-bar which was discontinued.  Rather than remove the refrigerators, we elected to leave them in rooms for complimentary guest access which is not advertised; it is just a little something extra.  Glad you enjoyed  your stay and hope to welcome you back soon.

title: Close to Fenway park but not close enough to Boston common
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: The Hilton Boston Back Bay is a winner.
review: Clean quiet hotel. You could get the old trolley sight seeing bus close by that showed all the sights in Boston. A group of restaurants close by. A bit far from the centre of town to walk.

title: Great location for conferences
review: Thank you for your comments.  Of course, the purpose of one's visit plays a big role in selection of location.  The Back Bay and Copley Square area is really the heart of the city with great shopping, restaurants, museums and, as you mentioned, Fenway Park all within easy walking distance.  The sight seeing trolley stops out front and the T is on the corner providing additional options.  Boston is also very much a walking town so the Boston Common/Garden are only about 10 minutes walk and the waterfront about 45 minutes with so much to see along the way.  Hope we will welcome you back soon!

title: Very good hotel
review: Our son had a college audition at nearby Berklee College of Music. This hotel provided a great location, a beautiful spacious room, and excellent customer service. The staff provided my son with a space to practice the night before his audition at no extra cost. Everyone was very friendly and trustworthy. I ended up leaving my checkbook in the room. Housekeeping handled this well and it was mailed to us the day after we checked out with nothing missing! The view from our corner room was gorgeous and the beds were heavenly. My son got a good night's sleep and nailed his audition (full scholarship!!!). If he ends up attending Berklee, we will be regular guests here.

title: Good value, good location, but unspectacular
review: Congratulations on Berklee!  As it is right next door to the hotel, I hope we will be seeing you often!  Thank you for the nice comments and so glad to hear the staff responded to the lost item so quickly.

title: Great location and comfortable room
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Hilton's Back Bay hotel was a great location to explore the city and had lovely view from the 24th floor.
review: We stayed here for one night before we took the ferry to Cape Cod, choosing it mainly for its location to the Back Bay so we could  see friends (payed $115 on a Thursday which seemed very reasonable). You can also walk to the Common pretty easily and there are tons of restaurants and stores nearby.  We were able to check in early and were given the option of a low floor or high floor, so obviously we chose the high floor which was so worth it. Our room overlooked the Charles and you could even see Fenway Park!  The king sized bed was so comfortable, and the room was a nicely decorated and a good size. Overall a great stay

title: Spacious, comfortable hotel in great location
review: Thank you for your note.  I am glad that you enjoyed your stay and hope to welcome you back soon.

title: The PERFECT Location
review: I organized a trip to Boston for 20+ docents from the Boise Art Museum to OD on art.  I chose the Hilton's Back Bay hotel because of it's location and price.  We were there for 5 nights.  Everyone was very satisfied wth the rooms.  We were close to shopping, many activites, good restaurants and public tranportation.  Would definitely stay again!

title: Very comfortable, great spot
review: Thank you for taking the time to write.  We were honored to host your group and so glad you enjoyed your stay.  Our location does provide easy walking access to the Museum of Fine Art (which just opened an entirely new wing for its Americas Art Collection which is spectacular!) as well as the Gardner Museum which will also be undergoing an addition in the next year or two.

title: Pleasant hotel with helpful staff
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Appears to be a competently-run business hotel
review: I'm not a lover of Hilton Hotels. I think they often live on their name.  But this one was pretty good.  The staff were friendly and helpful from first arrival and the room was pleasant and spacious with a lovely view over Boston.   The hotel is within easy reach of great restaurants, but quite a walk to Boston Common and tourist spots such as the Freedom Trail.    The hotel had two really good points:  a lovely little breakfast room where you could get coffee / muffins / fruit at a reasonable price, and good, free internet in the lobby where you could also print off boarding passes.

title: Great price, great location, great stay!
review: Thank you for your comments.  Glad you enjoyed your stay.  Back Bay provides easy access to great restaurants, shops, museums and of course Fenway Park.  The sight seeing tours stop in front of the hotel and the T is on the corner providing further options.  Of course, Boston is very much a walking city and the Common is only about a 10 minute walk and the Freedom Trail about 30.

title: A big disappointment
review: Stayed here in mid October for a work trip. This is a no fuss business hotel. The room was spacious and comfortably appointed. Perfect for a hectic work schedule, with everything within easy reach. Elevators are a tiny bit slow. There is a coffee shop in the lobby, and a light but cosy bar.

title: Great Location
review: We got a great price on Priceline (at least $200 cheaper per night for any hotel in the area) when coming to Boston for a vacation.  The front staff was very nice and helpful.  They moved our room to a higher floor so we could have a better view  when I mentioned my mom's 65th birthday.  The concierge was very helpful, although sometimes the line was very long!  The pool was small, but my daughter loved it.  The subway was a 5 minute walk away, which we didn't mind at all.  The coffee shop lady knew my name the second day and was very friendly. There is a huge mall in the Prudential building that you can get to through the hotel across the street.  Free Wi-Fi in the lobby, which was fine with me (they also had computers that you could use in the lobby and there was usually one…

title: Good Hotel, great location

title: Great Room, Great Stay
review: Hotel was a great standard as you would expect from the Hilton. Was in a great location for shopping and sightseeing.

title: Great Room Great Stay
review: Everything came up to expectation, with no complaints.  We arrived in the evening to an exceptionally warm and friendly welcome from reception. Our room was comfortable, clean and spacious.  We had booked in advance via the internet a package without breakfast. We had breakfast in the hotel, and it was great, but to us it seemed pricey.

title: Great Hotel, can't wait to go back.
review: I had the pleasure of staying in one of the superier panoramic room that are incredible. I stayed there for our anniversary and i wanted to make a reservation this year for the same room. One of the general managers responded to my request within minutes of my email and told me the process to help ensure i can stay in the same room this time around. The general manager was awesome and i 100% recommend this hotel because of the help from staff.

title: Great experience
review: Thank you for taking the time to write.  We were honored to be your host on such a special occassioin and glad we could secure the same room on your return visit.  Your kind and gracious complements are sincerely appreciated.

title: Great staff and location
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Small closets, very bad view, mold in the bathroom and a noisy ice machine.
review: We stayed 1 night to attend a Red Sox game.  I booked this hotel online w/ the advance no CX policy for $99/nite.  This was an great price for a Boston Hotel.  I opted to take a corner room upgrade for $9.00.  When we checked in, the front desk staff was very friendly and helpful.  The corner room was so big, very comfortable, so worth the extra $9.  This hotel is in a great location with Newbury street a block away, the Pru close.  I would definately stay at this Hilton property again when I return to Boston.

title: Mixed experience on a Rainy Weekend
review: Thank you for taking the time to write.  We appreicate your business and am glad that you enjoyed your stay.  Hope to welcome you back again next season.

title: It was a terrible experience, they have very poor room service.
review: We stayed at this hotel for the ACS conference and decided to make a week of vacation.  The hotel looked nothing like the photos on the internet.  We had a 12 inch closet which we could not hang our clothes.  We called platinum American Express and asked them to get aus a room with a real closet.  Well that didn't work.  The bathroom had mold in the tub and the ceiling had mold and falling down wall paper.  The ice machine around the corner was filled from our bathroom sink so you can imagine that noise!  Our view was terrible, just the air conditioning units from the buildings.  UGH!  On the positive side, the food in the hotel was very good.

title: Great stay...perfect location
review: Thank you for your feedback.  On behalf of the Hilton Boston Back Bay, please accept my sincerest apologies that the Hotel did not generally meet your expectations.   Certainly, this is not the type of guest experience we are trying to provide.   I am particularly sorry that you did not bring your concerns to our attention during your stay so that we could address the issues immediately.  If you would like to contact me directly, I like to make amends.

title: Nice Hotel, Great location
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Great fitness centre
review: I stayed at the Hilton Back Bay for 2 nights.  Hotel: The hotel is very nice overall. It has a modern feel and is well kept. They do not have a valet, but the parking garage is connected to the hotel ($35/night)  Room: I had a king room. The room had plenty of space, a comfortable bed and was very clean.  Room Service-I did have room service one night and the food was very good!  Location: Great location. You can walk out and walk any direction to find shopping, restaraunts, bars, walking paths, etc.   Business/Fitness Centers: the hotel offers both, while i didn't use either, they both looked very nice.  In summary, very nice hotel and location, I would definitally recommend.

title: good hotel and good location for shops and restaurants
review: Thank you for your taking the time to write.  Your kind and gracious comments are sincerely appreciated and I have taken the liberty of sharing them wtih the team.  Hope to welcome you back soon.

title: ok, big and impersonal
review: We booked this as a last minute treat when we decided to stay in Boston a day longer. The staff were friendly even though we must have looked scruffy with our backpacks!! The room was clean and comfortable. We were really impressed with the fitness centre which helped after a sneaky visit to the cheesecake factory nearby! I would definately stay here again.

title: great hotel a little pricey on parking
review: Thank you for your feedback.  I am glad that you enjoyed your visit, particularly the health club which we just completed a total renovation in July which enlarged the space and added all new equipment and a fresh look.

title: No Upgrade, A Miserly Breakfast Instead
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. In warmer months, people run and bike on paths running along the esplanade, and sail and kayak on the Charles River. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Convenient Location
review: We'd contacted this hotel well in advance before making a reservation for our first visit to Boston, our last port of call on a month-long tour of the USA. My partner holds a Hilton Honors "Gold VIP" card which entitles him to a room upgrade at Hiltons or, failing that, breakfast. When we Emailed the manager the implication was that we would be booking a pretty good room ("Superior Corner Room") but that an upgrade may be available to a "River View" room. This was not forthcoming so he was given vouchers for a "Continental" breakfast. We checked that this was correct as, at other Hilton-brand hotels we'd been given an excellent full breakfast in lieu of upgrade. But that was their policy so we suffered the meanest (ie most miserly) of breakfasts we'd encountered on our whole…

title: Excellent stay
review: Thank you for taking the time to write.  I deeply regret that you did not completely enjoy your stay particularly the breakfast.  Gold and Diamond members do receive a complimentary continental breakfast served daily in our members-only lounge.  While it is not a full breakfast buffet, it does include a wide selecton of items including fresh fruit, hot/cold cereals, danish, croissants, toast and one entree dish that rotates daily.  Regretfully, the size of the hotel does not allow for more lobby seating areas and there is only one suite which limits our upgrade opportunities and thus assign the corner rooms, which are our largest to our premium Hilton HHonors members.  I do agree that an additional chair would be a nice touch and am currently working to address that matter in our next renovation.  I hope we will be able to welcome you back soon and regain your confidence.

title: Clean and comfortable but a bit overpriced
review: The Hilton Boston Back Bay is a typical Hilton, located just steps away from Old Town and shopping. There is a trolley tour stop just outside (at the Sheraton, across the street).   The rooms are decent sized, clean, and comfortable. It's like staying at most other Hiltons around the world. The rooms seemed to be a bit larger than usual.  There was a mix up with our bill, as the reservation was in my name but my wife checked in before me and gave her credit card. For some reason, they charged her card for a higher rate than reserved, but corrected it without needing to contact them at all.

title: Perfect wedding reception venue
review: Thank you for the note.  I apologize for the accounting error and glad to hear that we caught it and corrected it with out causing you any further incovenience.

title: Ok hotel, good location
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Noting out of the oridinary - but too expensive internet and parking
review: The  hotel is a little worn, but ok. Nice view of the city from the higher floors.

title: Beautiful Amenities, Large Rooms, Great Staff!
review: Thank you for taking the time to write of your recent stay.  Your feedback is greatly appreciated.   Like most hotels, we are constantly updating and renovating to maintain the facilities.  All guest rooms and public areas were completely renovated in 2008 and we just finished a renovation of our health club this past weekend, which came out great!

title: That`s not a Boston accent
review: Stayed at the Hilton Boston Back bay for two nights. The hotel itself seems well maintained and the standard is OK; nothing out of the oridinary though. When you are using the elevator in this hotel, be sure not to be in a hurry! There are only three elevators, and often that seems inadequate. The elevators often get full, and people (especially on the lower floors) has to wait for quite some while until being able to cath a ride.   There is an excellent parking facility within the hotel. Unfortunately, this is charged at a high rate, as is also the wifi internet. At the prices that is payed to stay at this hotel, internet shoud be complimentary; and parking shoud be cheaper.   The hotel staff are generally friendly and helpful, and I had an enjoyable stay. If this hotel…

title: Great location, great staff
review: Thank you for your feedback.  We were honored to be your guest during your visit to Boston.    As most guests do not utilize parking, this charge is not included in the room in order to keep the rates as competitive as possible.  Given the center city location, a fee for parking is standard and on par with other lots and hotels in the area.  While there is a charge for wifi access in guest rooms, the Business Center located in our Starbucks Lobby Cafe provides free internet access along with printing/copying/faxing/scanning on our five terminals or your own laptop.  In addition, there is also a terminal just for printing boarding passes which is also complimentary.    Again, thank you for your note and hope we will welcom you back soon.

title: Pleasantly surprised!!
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Great!
review: We booked this hotel at the last minute because of the competitve rate we found on Travelocity. That said, we worried about what we would be getting for the price!  We were very pleasantly surprised regarding this Hilton. Understand, it is primarily a business hotel... There are not multiple restaurants and other amenities found in pricier hotels. However, we were traveling as a family and still found everything we needed. Our teenagers loved the internet access in the business center, and we loved having a Starbucks in the lobby. This hotel is in a great Back Bay location, with easy walking distance to the Prudential Mall, and several great restaurants. We had rooms on the 25th floor..(AMAZING VIEWS!) and we did not hear street noise at all...which made sleeping in easy!!!  I…

title: wow,amazing great staff and great food
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your comments following your recent trip to Boston.  We were honored to be your host.  We are pleased that the whole family generally enjoyed their stay and hope we will welcome you back soon.

title: Disappointed Hilton Diamond Member
review: Great breakfast! Very friendly breakfast staff. Unfortunately no free internet in the rooms! Though free internet is available in the lobby. Very clean and big room!

title: Great place to stay
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback.  We are glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay, particularly breakfast.  I have shared your gracious comments with the breakfast team.  As you pointed out, our business center located at the Starbucks Lobby Cafe does provide complimentary wifi access on one of our five terminals or your own lap top.

title: homely and welcoming
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Boston Fee Party
review: My wife and I stayed here in june this year and we were delighted by how well we were treated and looked after. the  room was of good size, air conditioned, with flat screen tv, coffee maker, iron and board, hairdryer. we had a decent city view. the staff in the hotel were very nice and helpful, the staff in the restaurant were brilliant, but best of all was the bartender, Matt. we arrived about 10pm in the hotel and after a brief look around the hotel we went to the bar to study guides and maps. Matt came over and pointed out a lot of places of interest and how to get there. he went way beyond the call of duty and is a credit to the hotel. as we never got to see him before we left, we can only thank him on here, thank you for your help Matt. to have a pint of samuel adams beer…

title: Very central, close to shops and restaurants
review: Thank you for your gracious complements regarding the attentive service and facilities.  I have taken the liberty of sharing your comments with Matt and have recognized his efforts in our Team Member Appreciation program.  Hope to welcome you back soon.

title: Meh.
review: I knew from experience that downtown Boston was a pricey lodging destination.  In town for a Red Sox game (already a costly proposition), I shrugged off the city’s typically astronomical hotel prices and opted for the Hilton Boston Back Bay for its proximity to Fenway.  The Hilton generally delivered on quality but the final tab, inflated by a laundry list of taxes and fees, was as frustrating as a line drive off the Green Monster by a visiting batter.  WHAT WAS GOOD:  The location is perfect for any activity or attraction in the Back Bay, including Fenway Park.  Boston is a horrible driving city so being able to walk or take the ‘T’ is a huge plus.  There’s an unlimited number of shops and restaurants within easy walking distance….There’s a small but adequate pool, spa and…

title: Enjoyed the Hilton Boston Back Bay
review: Thank you for taking the time to write of  your recent experience.  I am glad that you generally enjoyed the hotel and service, though recognize that Boston is not an inexpensive visit during peak season.  (By the way, there are great value rates during non-peak periods.)  As not everyone utilizes parking and wifi, these are charged on an a la carte basis to keep our overnight rates as competitive as possible.  You also may be interested to know that we are currently renovating and expanding our Health Club which will be completed shortly.  Unfortunately, the placement of the health club on top of the parking structure is what limits the elevator access from the top level.

title: Serendipity
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Overrated
review: What a find!  My first trip to Boston and this hotel turned out to be perfectly located for everything...shopping, the T, Restaurants, and Shaws Mkt.  for when you want to just grab a good bottle of wine and stay in.  Can't say enough about this place, rooms were nicely decorated, beds were comfortable, a bit pricey but good value for the money,  staff is friendly and professional, again, great location and you can walk to anything.  Booking our next trip to Boston here for sure.

title: Excellent stay
review: Thank you for your feedback.  I am pleased to learn that you enjoyed your stay.  We look forward to welcoming you back soon!

title: Got a good deal on a great hotel
review: The hotel was OK.  The staff was the big positive about the hotel, they were exceptional and provided excellent reccomendations.  Also excellent was the health club but the pool was closed while we were there.  The rooms (especially the bathroom!) was on the small side (but we did get basic rooms, so suites were likely bigger).  Rooms had sweet views of city.  Location was decent.  The biggest issue I had was the constant nickle and diming Hilton has resorted to.  We ate out for breakfest each morning to avoid paying exoburent fees.  Would try somewhere else next time

title: Comfortable and convenient
review: Thank you for sharing your feedback.  Your kind and gracious complements regarding the staff are sincerely appreciated and glad their efforts were recognized.  I apologize the pool was temporarily closed for servicing during your visit.  On an aside, we will be further improving upon our health club with a full renovation in July which will enlarge the space and bring all new equipment.  We hope you will come again and see it for yourself soon!

title: No complimentary wi-fi or breakfast; otherwise happy
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Met My Hilton Expectations Quite Well
review: I was reconciled to paying big bucks to be in Copley Square, Boston, which is convenient to Newberry St. shopping, Fenway Park, and art museums.  For the $300+/night price tag, though, I expected FREE wi-fi and a complimentary breakfast.  Had a king bed room and a comfy chaise longue.  The room was quiet (10th floor, facing a pedestrian way, so no vehicular traffic).  No shampoo -- probably an oversight that housekeeping would have gladly furnished.  But at these prices, it should not have been overlooked in the first place.  The heating/cooling thermostat was not intuitive and took a long time to figure out.  A 7-min. walk to Fenway, across the street from the Prudential Center and Legal Sea Food, and a few blocks walk to the art museums make the location ideal for touring the…

title: Amazing location
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your comments.  I apologize that shampoo was inadvertently missed and agree it should have been there regardless of the price.  I also appreciate your feedback on the thermostat and will put some thought into how to improve the directions.  We do provide free wifi in our business center located in the lobby including access to printer, copiers, fax and scanner though there is a charge for in-room access.    Hope we will welcome you back soon.

title: Great location and hotel
review: I was in Boston for a convention, and was lucky enough to get a great rate on a room at this Hilton with an AWESOME view of Cambridge and Fenway Park, so my Boston experience was a good one.  Everything else about the hotel is what you would expect from a downtown Hilton - the rooms were comfortable (their bedding is TOPS in my book), and the service was pretty good too.  One of the highlights I thought was kind of nice was somebody came up and knocked on my door in the morning when I missed repeated wake up calls due to being in the shower...nice touch, I thought.  Pretty good stay all things considered.  BTW - my review would have been lower if I didn't carry my own Internet access fob with me; this hotel's fee is through the roof!

title: Surprisingly Fine
review: Thank you for your feedback.  We were honored to be your host and glad you had an enjoyable stay.  Hope to welcome you back again soon.  (For future reference, there is free wifi access in the business center located in the Starbucks Lobby Cafe.)

title: Average hotel in Boston - good location
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Great hotel, incredible view from the...
review: This is the second time we have stayed at the Back Bay Hilton in Boston and each time there were issues at this hotel.  This time around was the day after a catastrophic water main break outside of Boston that affected 31 towns and cities.  Fortunately for us, we had been informed of the issue prior to our arrival.  Had we not, we would have used the water in the bathroom to brush our teeth, etc. since there was no signage in either the lobby or our room warning us not to do so.  I inquired at the desk upon check-in about the situation and received a vague response.  Directly across the street is the Sheraton Hotel and they had signs at every entrance warning guests about the water:  “The tap water / ice is not currently suitable for drinking but can be used for bathing,…

title: The Hilton chain should be proud
review: Again, thank you for your feedback.  As mentioned in our previous correspondence, the water situation which impacted the entire Boston metropolitan area was a first of its kind.  I personally reported to the hotel and stayed throughout the emergency overseeing the hotel's response.  We took a more personal approach by providing letters and complimentary bottled water to all rooms and guests throughout the entire emergency.  I greatly regret if this was missed in anyway and accept full responsibility for our response.  I am sorry that your email to the central office was not forwarded more expeditiously so that we could address your concerns immediately.  Your feedback would have been invaluable as we attempted to respond to this most unexpected emergency situation to the best of our ability.    Again, thank you for your continued feedback.

title: Not the Nicest Hilton in the Chain
review: Great hotel, incredible view from the 22nd floor. We were there during the boil water advisory and they had plenty of bottled water available. Would definitely stay again!

title: Nothing Special About Hilton Boston Back Bay
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Over night with friends in Boston
review: The hotel is in a great location. Belvedere St. entrance is a trolley stop - convenient. Across the street from the Sheraton and huge mall/convention center - excellent. Nearby walking streets, libraries, Lyric Stage Theater, and Fenway Park (10 min walk). The staff is friendly and efficient. Free internet in lobby area - very nice. The hotel itself is more budget than high class.   Rooms are very small, tiny little bathrooms (hard to turn around in). The lamp shades in two of our four rooms had been sliced and diced by some previous partygoers.  Pretty bad. . . . One of the two phones did not work. One lamp did not work. The room was freezing and could not be altered from the room (we tried and tried). Our requests for assistance was quick and effective. Overall, a decent place…

title: Night in Boston with my Son before flying to Utah.
review: Thank you for taking the time to write of your recent stay.    Please accept my sincerest apologies that you did not find your room in perfect working order.  Certainly, this is not the type of experience we are striving to provide.  While I am glad the issues were addressed promptly and professionally, I agree that they should not have occurred in the first place.    I sincerely appreciate your feedback so that we may improve upon our product and service.

title: They're so helpful.
review: Enjoyed dinner in the restaurant,  food and wine were wonderful.  The staff was great, service was terrific.  Our waiter was patient and professional as two guests joined out table late.

title: Average stay, uneventful.
review: Thank you for taking the time to write of your experience.  I am glad you enjoyed your dinner in Forty Dalton and hope to welcome you back soon.

title: Clean rooms, good location, but a few issues...
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Hotel has it all...clean, friendly, and convenient!
review: The location of this hotel is wonderful, as it is centrally located to many points of interest in the city.  The rooms are clean and spacious, however although the entire hotel is now non-smoking (by Boston law) our room REEKED of smoke.  It was really quite horrible.  All of our clothes smelled like smoke and my husband's asthma was acting up as a result.  We were told our room was always a non-smoking room and clearly this was untrue.  We booked on Orbitz, and my assumption is they give the rooms booked at a lower rate through third party sites the "previous smoking" rooms.    Softness/firmness of beds is a matter of personal preference, however my husband and I found the mattresses and the pillows to be extremely soft and unsupportive, resulting in two bad nights of sleep. …

title: Everything you could ask for EXCEPT...
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback.    Please accept my sincerest apologies for the smoky odor you encountered.  Certainly not the experience we are striving to provide.  While the entire hotel is non-smoking, obviously, not everyone complies.  However, housekeeping should have caught this problem so it could be corrected prior to your arrival.    I also apologize that the front desk clerk was not completely knowledgeable on some attributes of the hotel.  We will continue to work on our training.    I sincerely appreciate you bringing these issues to my attention so they can be addressed.  I hope we will welcome you back soon.

title: Overall nice stay.
review: The room was very clean.  The bed and sheets top quality.  I find it hard to get a good nights sleep in most hotels, but not this one.   The staff was very friendly and helpful. We had breakfast at the hotel and the food was delicious.  The waitstaff was prompt and courteous.   The hotel is very convenient to great shopping, restaurants and schools in the area.

title: Amazing Hotel!
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your comments.  We were honored to be your host during your visit to Boston and pleased that you enjoyed your stay.   The Hilton Serenity Bed featured in all our rooms includes the exclusive Suite Dreams mattress, Super Topper mattress pad, down-filled comforter, Touch of Down pillows and triple sheeted with 250 thread-count European style linens and decorative bed throw.    We hope to welcome you back soon!

title: Great Value. Nice Hotel
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Good hotel, but one big caveat
review: Stayed here for a weekend visit to Boston. Got a great rate online. A double room was comfortable enough for my wife and I to share with our teenage son.  We had a high room with a great view. The location was fine. Its a very short walk to the Prudential Center and the Back Bay subway station. Its also a block away from Mass Ave where you can find McDonalds, Starbucks, Dunkin Donuts and a slew of good inexpensive restaurants. The Back Bay Hilton is a fine middle of the road hotel. Clean, and comfortable. My son liked it and you know how picky teenagers are. If he gets accepted to a college in the Boston area this will be our go to hotel when we visit him.

title: Great Hotel ... Great room ... great service... great location... will be coming back.
review: Thank you for your feedback.  We were honored to be your host during your visit to area colleges.  I hope we will welcome you back soon.

title: Modern, Comfortable Hotel
review: My wife and I stayed here over Presidents Weekend for a Valentine's Day trip.   The hotel is clean and well maintained and the location is excellent: near the Prudential Center mall and a couple of blocks from old Back Bay and Newbury Street with its shops and restaurants.   Symphony Hall is a block and a half away, and we attended a superb BSO concert there. However, a warning is in order:  I reserved a King corner room at a discounted rate, paid in full for both nights, nonrefundable.  When we arrived, we were told there was no corner room available because the occupants of one room had asked to stay another night.   We were given a King standard room, but NO ADJUSTMENT for the rate because we had paid in advance!   The standard room was cramped for us and had an oblique view…

title: The Hilton is my favorite place to stay in Boston
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your recent experience.  We were honored to be your host during your visit to Boston.    I sincerely apologize that you did not receive the room type you expected.  Certainly, this is not the type of experience we are striving to provide and deeply regret that our attempt to accommodate another guest intruded on your stay.  I agree that you should receive what you paid for and am glad the desk did their best to make amends with the offer of breakfast.

title: A fabulous weekend celebrating our 50th birthdays
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Good hotel; lousy restaurant service
review: I spent the weekend with my girlfriends from college at the Back Bay Hilton, as we're all celebrating the fabulous 50 this year. Our stay at the Hilton couldn't have been better. The staff was incredibly accommodating, especially the general manager. The accommodations were spotless and lovely. The location is perfect, easy walking to great dining and shopping. The concierge and general manager went out of their way to secure a last minute dinner reservation for Saturday night at a very, trendy, upscale restaurant in high demand. We couldn't have asked for more. Kudos to the Back Bay Hilton!!! We will definitely be back.

title: Great staff
review: Thank you for taking the time to share your recent experience.  We were honored to be your host on such a special weekend and play a small role in making it memorable.  Your kind words are greatly appreciated.

title: Rooms, location, fitness ctr all top notch
review: I spent one night in the Hilton Back Bay in mid-January of 2010.  Great location, and the room was typically HIlton: very good bed, and a spacious-enough room with fairly utilitarian appointments.  The only functional problem was the heat: the thermostat would only go down to 65, which is too warm for sleeping as far as I'm concerned.  So I turned off the heating system and opened a window, and was then comfortable except for the traffic noise (which would have been even worse had I not been on the 21st floor).  Overall, a nice room at a reasonable price.  My breakfast at 40 Dalton (the hotel restaurant) the next morning was another matter, though.  I was seated promptly by a very pleasant hostess, and then handed off to a waiter who asked what I'd like to drink.  I told him…

title: Adequate but nothing special
review: Thank you for taking the time to write of your recent experience.  We were honored to be your host during your visit to Boston.  You are correct that our thermostats do not allow for a temperature setting below 65 degrees.  However, you can turn off the unit completely which would also allow the temperature to drop without having to open the window.  Our maintenance team is also available at any time if you ever have any challenges.    Please accept my sincerest apologies for the unacceptable attitude you encountered in the restaurant.  Certainly, this is not the type of service we are striving to provide and trust this was a most unfortunate exception.  We will be sure to share your experience with the team in order to improve upon our service.

title: Update on Hilton's amenities
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. In nice weather, restaurant patio seating is packed with Bostonians and tourists alike soaking up the sunshine and enjoying the food. Commonwealth Ave offers a beautiful stroll down residential tree-lined streets. Keep walking towards the Charles River and enjoy a beautiful view by the water. In warmer months, people run and bike on paths running along the esplanade, and sail and kayak on the Charles River. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: very happy with our stay
review: Stayed at the Boston Hilton in late December and was very pleased.  The location (nr to Prudential Center and easy access to Green Line and Orange Line T) is excellent.  The hotel is modest in size (about 25 floors but limited rooms on each floor), but they now have a Diamond Lounge for breakfast on the ground level - too bad it is not also open all day for use.   The rooms are pleasant, particularly if you snag a 'corner room' which is sized up. FYI - free internet is available in lobby, but very costly ($14.95) if used in one's room.  Rooms have flat screen TVs with a good selection of cable channels. Management has made the main lobby more hospitable and it is easy to use if working or visiting.  Will be nice when they finally drop the Internet fee for in-room use.  Recommend…

title: Nice Place
review: good value, very helpful staff, clean...no complaints we were traveling with our one year old...the crib that they provided was a pack 'n play, but it was fine

title: Great Hotel, Great Location!!
review: Nice hotel picked via priceline price $75 a night. Great food in the hotel restuarant "Forty Dalton". Room very nice with flat screen T.V. and lots of room. Staff was nice and very helpful. Location was central to everything. Five free internet computers in lobby with a printer... great.

title: Great location
review: We recently stayed at the Hilton, and enjoyed our stay thoroughly. Rooms were clean, staff was friendly and everything was new and updated.  From the 22'nd floor you had an amazing view of the bay. The pool had short hours and the parking was expensive, but isn't it always in large cities. Would definitely stay here again !

title: Best stay and service that I have had with a hotel
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. Commonwealth Ave offers a beautiful stroll down residential tree-lined streets. Keep walking towards the Charles River and enjoy a beautiful view by the water. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Very understaffed and eating there made us sick
review: We arrived at the hotel at check in time (3PM) and was greeted at the door by the bell man.  He was very polite and helped us with our bags to our room.   Our room was great.. We had 2 rooms side by side..  The beds were to die for, nothing but comfortable..   We had room service in the morning, which was great, nothing beats waking up to coffee, muffins, danishes, and crossiants by your bed..  I have stayed at many hotels, but The Hilton Back Bay is by far the best hotel.  Location is great close to many restaurants and shops..

title: Good hotel in ideal location
review: Very understaffed and eating there made us sick, sometimes the front desk was unattended for up to ten minutes....I thought a hotel was opne 24 hours. Also,,,we became ill after eating at the restaraunt. Then we had to wait 45 minutes for security(apparently only one security person works each shift we were told) to do a food poisoning report.

title: Location, clean, spacious,  will stay again.
review: We stayed here at the beginning of October and were pleased with our choice. It's close to subway stations, Prudential Centre, shops and restaurants and is well located to walk down Newbury & Boylston Street to the Public Gardens & Boston Common. You can also take a trolley tour which picks up outside the hotel. The hotel had everything we needed, coffee maker in the room, comfortable beds and well equipped (if a little small) bathroom. We had asked for a room higher up and that's what we got, complete with great views over Charles river at one side and part of the city at the other. There is also a very good coffee shop within the hotel. Staff were very professional, friendly and helpful and we would stay here again if we return to Boston.

title: Perfect place to stay for sightseeing in Boston
review: In an area where there is plento of  choice this hotel  kept coming up on my list and seemed a reasoanble balance of price and location.  I was happy with my choice, others  i considered  I found on my walks and were less better positioned i felt.   2 Night stay here in a room  near the elevavtor and Ice machine, yet no noise distractions. Room was spacious and comfortable, Clean and tidy.  Bathroom clean, amenities good qulaity. Hair Dryer.   Like most hotels averywhere,  bathrooms always need more room,   Easy access to everything, walked to Boston Common and Fenway Park. Prudential Centre  next door,   sneak  through via the Sheraton Foyer accross the street and your there.  Will Return..

title: Close to Fenway
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Well located, good amenities
review: We loved this Hotel.  The location was great, short walk to Fenway and parking garage attached to the hotel.  The staff was efficient and very nice.  The view from the room was well worth the money and the room itself was very clean and the bed was super comfortable. Go Red Sox!

title: Visiting BU
review: The Hilton Back Bay in Boston is well located for whatever you want to do in Boston. Within steps of the "T" station, one can reach the Harbor, Boston Commons, Universities and the Freedom Trail easily. The hotel is clean and well appointed. The elevator shaft tends to be noisy, so choose a room away from the elevator if possible Coffee maker, etc is available ( a must for me) but, much to my disappointment, there was no fridge. Also, there's a charge for the internet although it is free in the lobby.

title: great place, friendly staff
review: I booked my room online at a discounted rate and was so pleased! I had a corner room which was absolutely beautiful and well appointed. The staff was very friendly, and the location was great for shopping and visiting the BU medical campus. I walked everywhere. I'd love to stay here again.

title: loved our stay
review: My husband and I stayed here for three nights in September.  I booked a room on Priceline ($90) and had a great experience. I've stayed at other hotels where staff are outright hostile to Priceline bookers, but these guys were professional and customer service-focused all the way.  I didn't select this hotel intentionally, but likely would stay here again if I were returning to Boston.

title: 8/31-9/6/2009 North Eastern University - Daughter's College Trip
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Not Good Value at all
review: We just returned from a stay at the Hilton Boston Back Bay Hotel over the dates of August 31 through September 6, 2009 as our daughter was starting her freshman year of college at NEU. This hotel is centrally located to the "T" Green Line between the Prudential and Hynes stations, two blocks from the shopping and restaurant district on Newberry Street, three blocks from the NEU and BU campus' and about four or five blocks from Fenway Park. There is also a great wine store about a block away from the Hilton on Massachusetts Avenue!   I made our hotel reservation at priceline.com with a bid of $71.00 for a three and a half star hotel in the Back Bay area of Boston (we were in Boston in April 2009 and we got the Marriott Copley for $71.00 on priceline). I checked another site,…

title: Fabulous Hotel, Great Service, Great location
review: Thank you for your very through and constructive review.  I am sure the entire Trip Advisor community found the comments helpful.    On behalf of the Hotel, please accept my sincerest apologies for the problem you encountered with the carpet in your room.  Certainly this is not the type of service we are striving to provide and are pleased that the problem was addressed immediately.    Allow me to correct a few issues.  While we do have an energy management system that allows the engineers to access the HVAC system remotely, guests do have complete control of the system through the in-room thermostat and suspect their must simply have been an issue with the individual thermostat in your room and apologize it was not addressed more urgently.    Our lobby business center does offer complimentary wifi access on either your lap top or one of our five new terminals including printing capabilities.  The convenience of in-room wifi access does have a fee and the fluke you experienced has been addressed.    I am pleased that the front desk was able to provide you an upgrade during your visit.  Please understand that this was a relatively quiet week and not always available.    Again, thank you for your feedback.

title: A fine hotel, expect waits on the elevator
review: Through PriceLine we got a room at this hotel and even with the discounted rate through priceline this hotel did not provide good value.  We were treated like third rate customers when we arrived because the hotel agent knew we recieved this hotel at a discounted rate. She was snobby towards us and we got the worst room in the hotel. It was on the 4th floor, right next to the ice machine and the housekeeping closet and through our window we had a view of the dumpster outside. Not to mention that the toilet did not flush properly.  This hotel also nickels and dimes customers for everything.  They charge $36/night for parking, $1.25/minute to use the phones in the room even if you are calling a local # or using a calling card and to use wireless internet they charge $14.95 for 24…

title: great location
review: Thank you for your constructive feedback.    On behalf of the hotel, please accept my sincerest apologies for problems you encountered at the front desk.  Certainly, this is not the type of service we are striving to provide.  I am proud to be working with a team of service-oriented professionals and deeply regret that you did not have a positive experience.  We are proud to participate in Priceline.com.  We will continue to improve our efforts and look forward to your feedback in the future.    Due to the central-city location, there is a fee for parking as is standard at hotels in the area.  As not all guests utilize this service, it is not included in the rate.    Since your visit, our lobby business center has been upgraded with five new terminals and the latest in software that provides complimentary wifi access plus printing capabilities.  There is a charge for the convenience of in-room wifi access.  Payphones are also located in the lobby for a less expensive telephone option.    Again, thank you for your feedback.

title: Great location, bad view (this time)
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. In nice weather, restaurant patio seating is packed with Bostonians and tourists alike soaking up the sunshine and enjoying the food. In warmer months, people run and bike on paths running along the esplanade, and sail and kayak on the Charles River. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Disappointed lack of parking & room bad view
review: This is my second stay at the Hilton Boston Back Bay since I particularly like the location--very close to all the best sights in the city without being in the very dense civic quarters. I am pleased that the hotel has maintained its cleanliness and amenities and that the staff continue to be expedient and polite in a business-y (as opposed to familial) manner. I liked the pool and the jacuzzi, which were good to start the day or end one.  I got a poor room this time compared to my previous visit though. As with the other poster, mine faced the parking garage next door and the aircon ducts below. If you were to stay in this hotel, don't go for the rooms between -04 and -08, if my memory serves me right since they are oriented to these views.  Altogether still a commendable…

title: Best 4th of July Weekend!
review: Parked on the top level, level seven and to walk to fifth level to get elevator to the lobby. No signs of where to get elevator.  narrow spaces, dead end parking we  had to back out on each level and search for an empty space. Dangerous backing out.  Room had a terrible view of the a roof and the parking garage, I could almost see our car.  We were near the pool somewhere.

title: Great Location-Hospitality
review: Thank you for your constructive feedback.    On behalf of the hotel, please accept my sincerest apologies for any difficulties you encountered with parking.  Certainly, this is not the type of experience we are striving to provide.    We were resurfacing the garage during your visit which contributed to the tight spaces and a full garage.  This project is now completed and hopefully elevates the challenges.    Again, thank you for your feedback.

title: An average Hilton experience
review: I stayed at this hotel this past 4th of July and it was simply awesome! The room was extremely clean and spacious. There was a huge flat screen TV and a full size desk/work station. The view from our room overlooked the city. The bathroom was a decent size and the shower was really good, especially the water pressure. The Hotel staff were very nice and very helpful when we needed to rent a 10 passenger van to take us where we needed to go. The location is great for shopping, you can just walk up and down the streets and find a lot of good shops. There was one ice cream place that I can't remember the name of but it was probably some of the best ice cream I have ever had.

title: Very Nice Hotel and Unbeatable Location
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: excellent stay
review: Very impressive Hilton.  The location is great with easy access to all downtown landmarks as well as being right next door to the Sheraton and the Prudential shopping center.    The room was quite nice with updated furnishings and a comfortable bed.  The flatscreen TV complete with HD programming was very nice as well.  Carpeting, furnishings and hallways were updated and very nice.   Did not eat at the restaurant so cannot comment about that but there are literally hundreds of eateries and bars within a half mile of this location.   Staff was friendly and professional at all times.   This Hilton gets it done.

title: Loved it
review: Hotel is very nice and clean. Most friendly receptionist welcomed us and made our stay much better from the first minute. Rooms are very good size, bathroom is great. Location is also good, close to major attractions and not very crowded.

title: Decent hotel...
review: We stayed one night in order to be close to Fenway. The corner room offered a beautiful view of Boston & Cambridge & the Charles River. It was immaculate and the tv was huge :) We were able to walk to the Red Sox game. Please note that the parking rates are RIDICULOUS ($37), as they are in almost all Boston hotels, so if you have a car be prepared. However, we were able to find meter parking on the street for only a few dollars. Easy access to lots of restaurants, bars and shopping. Great location!!!

title: Excellent location
review: Stayed over memorial weekend and while the hotel was full with a convention in town we were upgraded to a larger room which was nice. The hotel has been recently updated and was clean. Short walk to the Prudential Center and not a bad walk to Fenway Park.  A little further walk to Boston Common, Quincy Market, etc. but easily done. Parking is expensive but is a similar price to other hotels in Boston.  Overall, if the price was right I would stay here again.

title: Good location, no complaints
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: It served it's purpose
review: We traveled on pleasure, not buisiness. I don't like being nickeled and dimed, however, this buisness hotel didn't do that. I'm a silver member and had two free night certificates, and was upgraded to a 25th floor corner room, with the hotel booked solid for a convention . . Only complaint came waiting for the elevevator, in the morning when biz folks were off to the show. But the view as worth the wait. However, this corner did not have the balcony. Slightly smaller than the other king beds, for more room get a double bed Nice pool, small out side deck. The whirpool , although small, packed a good power punch to work those muscle knotts out. The small gym was well equipment and 'sweat-smell free'.Great central location for getting around. we walked to everything. Boston common,…

title: Location, location, location
review: Stayed at the Hilton Back Bay for a long weekend in April. Nothing spectacular, nothing to complain about. Our room was clean and very spacious. There was about 7 feet in between the end of the bed and desk. The staff seemed very friendly and concierge was very helpful. Close to Prudential, the T and some pretty decent food options. Only thing that was not cool was the $35 a night parking fee. But i do believe that's the average fee for hotel parking in Boston.

title: Hilton Gold Membership
review: This nice hotel is so convenient to the convention center, shopping at Prudential Center, the subway trains, Fenway Park, Symphony Hall and many other attractions of Boston. The staff was pleasant and the rooms clean. We have nothing negative to say about this hotel and were very pleased with our stay.

title: Excellent place to stay!!
review: The Back Bay Hilton is in a nice area. We are Gold Members and where told that our up grade came with breakfast, we ended up paying $46.50 for the breakfast? Also we where told that we would get a up grade and we did not.  We have stayed at other hotels in the same area and would suggest those places. Parking was $37 a day!

title: PERFECT PLACE FOR FENWAY PARK
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Service not acceptable for a Hilton property
review: We stayed on Hilton Back Bay for the 2nd time and had another great experience.  Perfect place to stay if you are attending Red Sox games-  you can walk to the park in about 15 minutes.  It is also close to the T for everything else you want to do.  Will stay here again!

title: Perfect
review: I recently stayed at the Boston Back Bay Hilton for 1 night.  The room and location were great but my checkin was miserable.  The desk attendent couldn't find my reservation, and couldn't find my HHonors numbers to cross check the reservation.  This was graduation weekend in Boston so finding another hotel would have been extremely difficult.  I asked for a manager.  He finally came over, told me the desk attendent had it all taken care of (he still hadn't found my reservation), and went back across the counter to continue chatting with one of the bellmen.  I finally had to boot my computer and find the reservation email with the confirmation number.  Then magically they found my reservation.  This took approximately 30 minutes.  On the way up to my room the bellman asked how my…

title: A pleasant hotel, nothing terrible or wonderful
review: We recently stayed for one night at Hilton Back Bay.  The hotel was perfect for our needs; beds were very comfortable, rooms were clean & quiet (14th floor) and the in-room coffee maker with take away cups a life-saver.  Hilton accommodated our request for an early check-in, which we greatly appreciated.  We came by train to Boston Back Bay station and walked everywhere we needed to be - including to and from the station.  Extremely convenient.  My first trip to Boston, but a winner all the way around.  I'll be back....  : )

title: Hilton Boston Back Bay - wonderful room
review: We spent a week here as part of a two centre holiday with Washington. Our overall impression was that there isn't anything particularly wrong with the place, but nor was it outstanding. The lobby isn't impressive, there is a small lounge cafe serving Starbucks coffee, muffins, fresh fruit etc. The hotel's decor is in good condition but seemed a bit old fashioned and brown dominated to us. My partner found it strange that there was no bar, then later in the week we found the bar tucked away next to the restaurant. There was no suggestion that it was open generally. When we did eat in the restaurant the bar door was closed (private party?)  Atmosphere - pleasant, there were many different people staying for the marathon, some business people and tourists. Room - fine, clean,…

title: Moslty a positive
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings.
