Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Good «Value for Money»
review: I stayed at the Hilton Back Bay for four nights while attending a conference at the Haynes Convention Center.  The location was great (just had to cross the street).  The neighborhood has lots of restaurants and a mall across the street.  The views from my room were great.  Nice flat screen TV.  Comfortable bed. Clean, quiet room.  I did not need to interact with the staff very much, but they seemed efficient and polite.  The only strange thing about an otherwise nice room was the bathtub.  It seemed like they had put one of those plastic covers on top of it, and it was not well glued to the bottom, which gave the bathtub a motelish feel I did not expect.

title: Catered for the needs
review: Very nice hotel, with good staff.  Internet was free - very good. Good rooms.

title: Great location for exploring Boston at a good price.
review: Stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in February. Found very little to complain about.   Greeting at reception was friendly and efficient and not over the top. Room was very clean and comfortable and found that everything worked as it should in the room. Only slight complaint was that it was a small bit noisy as the lift was near our bedroom. Room was kept very neat and tidy everyday that we were there.  We didn't eat in the hotel or use the bar. We did use the Starbucks cafe that is in the lobby on occasions and service was good and friendly.   The free use of Internet in the lobby was very useful.   The hotel is well located being directly opposite from the Prudential Centre and very close to the "T" stop at Convention. Also is within walking distance of Boston Common, etc. There…

title: Well located, good sized room, average hotel
review: We got a great deal on this hotel through expedia, so weren't really expecting too much.  While this is a pretty basic no frills hotel, it appears to have been recently refurbished and offers pretty much everything a traveler would need.  The staff were helpful and polite, the rooms were clean and of a reasonable size, although the bathroom in our room was a little small.  The lobby has a coffee shop and there is a decent gym and small pool with a jacuzzi which was lovely after a days trekking around the streets of Boston.  There are lots of good nearby restaurants and the Prudential centre and Top of the hub are just a hop skip and a jump away.  We had a great time while we stayed here.  We walked everywhere, but a trolley leaves from outside the hotel, so everything the city…

title: Not at all what a Hilton should be.
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. In nice weather, restaurant patio seating is packed with Bostonians and tourists alike soaking up the sunshine and enjoying the food. Commonwealth Ave offers a beautiful stroll down residential tree-lined streets. Keep walking towards the Charles River and enjoy a beautiful view by the water. In warmer months, people run and bike on paths running along the esplanade, and sail and kayak on the Charles River. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Helpful Staff, Great Location for exploring Boston and its shopping district.
review: I was on crutches when we stayed at this hotel. There was no hadicapped parking and we had to park outside on the roof. We had to walk down two ramps in the rain to get to the elevator only to find that it wasn't working on that floor.  We were not allowed to drop off due to the $36.00 valet. When we complained to the front desk about the inconvenience they were very rude and unconcerned.  This was so not the service we expected from a Hilton. We will NEVER stay at a Hilton hotel again.  When we returned home I contacted the home offices and have yet to receive a response. Not even close to what customer service should be in a supposedly high end hotel.

title: BoCo auditions
review: Just stayed at the Hilton from the 12th-14th march and enjoyed my stay there. The hotel is in a great location for shopping and exploring the main tourist attractions. The rooms were comfortable and clean and the staff were very pleasant. There is a Trolly tour of the city which you can hop on outside the hotel. Walking to the main area of Boston takes approximatley 15 min. I booked the hotel at a great price, £100/night.

title: Very good location but expensive
review: Stayed for an audition at Boston Conservatory.   Very close for that purpose.  Location was excellent- near BoCo, Berklee and Newbury Street and there is a way to get to the Pru Center through the Sherton directly across the street (thus minimizing our time in the biting cold wind in Feb).  Staff was friendly and helpful.  Tried to 'beat the system' and not order the pig out al you can eat breakfast, but ended up paying more for my small breakfast all due to the $8 a la catre coffee.  Went with the $20 breakfast buffet the next day and just chalked the price up to traveling.  We were offered an upgrade at check in and we paid a little bit more for the higher floor, flat screen TV, etc.

title: Not all that great.
review: Parking is expensive--$36 per day--but might not be worse than others in the area. Plenty of parking, but the system is peculiar. There is no attendant at the exit, so you have to get your parking ticket validated at the front desk and use the *first* card reader at the exit to get out. (I assume the second car reader is for those who are not hotel guests.) However, 2 out of the 3 times I tried to get out of the parking lot, the reader did not work and I had to go into the hotel to get someone to help me to get out.  I had a problem checking in, as my travel agent booked me a room starting the night after I arrived. However the reception desk was able to get me a room for the night I arrived, kept it as two separate reservations, but kept me the same room for both nights.  It is…

title: good business class hotel
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. In nice weather, restaurant patio seating is packed with Bostonians and tourists alike soaking up the sunshine and enjoying the food. Commonwealth Ave offers a beautiful stroll down residential tree-lined streets. Keep walking towards the Charles River and enjoy a beautiful view by the water. In warmer months, people run and bike on paths running along the esplanade, and sail and kayak on the Charles River. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Enjoy  a clean hotel, with customer-savvy staff
review: The room we got on registering was not what we had reserved.  After going to the room and calling the front desk about the discrepency, we were told that it had found the correct room type we had reserved but it was being cleaned and we would be called in 40 minutes when the room would be ready.  We got no call for an hour which meant I had to go down to the front desk and ask for the room.  We were given new key cards and had to move our luggage ourselves to the new room.  NOT a good first impression.  The new room, however, was exactly as promoted on the hotel's website and was large with comfortable bedding and all the amenities.  Rest of our stay was uneventful and pleasant.  This is a solid business class hotel in an excellent location immediately across the street from the…

title: Hilton is just fine
review: We enjoyed staying here - the staff is excellent, from the pleasant greetings when we arrived, to the perfect dinner suggestions from the front desk, to the bartender who took the time to entertain us with some fancy drink suggestions - we couldn't have asked for more!  Hilton Hotels = Why stay some place else, when you can have it all!

title: Absolutely LOVED it!  PERFECT!
review: Great Location with easy to park in attached garage, Quick on and off to the Turnpike. Standard "nice" Hilton, good free interent access and computers in lobby, expensive wifi in rooms. Got a great rate through priceline and have booked previously through Hotwire. Very close to Fenway Park for Red Sox Games. Better than Sheraton across the street.

title: Enjoyed the Hilton Back Bay (after a room mixup)
review: Beautiful room, very friendly yet professional staff, great little gym, fabulous location, a gem. Oh, and the BEDS! Ah! Dreamland!

title: Nice Hotel, Great Location!
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. In nice weather, restaurant patio seating is packed with Bostonians and tourists alike soaking up the sunshine and enjoying the food. Commonwealth Ave offers a beautiful stroll down residential tree-lined streets. Keep walking towards the Charles River and enjoy a beautiful view by the water. In warmer months, people run and bike on paths running along the esplanade, and sail and kayak on the Charles River. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Quick stop in Boston
review: The hotel is in a great location (2 blocks from newbury) and pretty much attached to the prudential center and copley place.  There are definetly a lot of things to do around the area. The T is also very close and convienent. The rooms are nice and clean, but nothing fancy. I was unable to use the pool, as it was closed when I was there, but it looked nice. Parking was expensive, but I think it's expensive in every hotel downtown. If I was to return, I would definetly consider this hotel again if the price was right.

title: Hilton Boston Back Bay
review: A good but just standard Hilton hotel, but with a great location in the middle of the shopping area with connection to two malls and also close to the Metro. No executive lounge, but a small separate Honors breakfast lounge. Did not try the restaurants, nor the fitnesscenter with pool.  Location 8/10:  Right in the middle of the city with easy access to everything. Its located between two metro stations, which is more modern then to match the rest of the city. Walking distance to shopping, restaurants, museeums, etc..  Lobby/Check-in 6/10:  Nothing special, but not bad neither. The greated me as an Honors member and had upgraded me according to my request, which was excellent. Two free internet computers by the lobby, which was good (Business center costed approx $12).   Room…

title: Courteous Service & Beautiful Room
review: I have travled to Boston multiple times and this was by far one of the best stays I had there. The Hilton Back Bay is in a wonderful location, very close to almost anything you would want to get to. The hotel staff I encountered was friendly and helpful. I have worked in the hospitality industry for a few years now and I was very impressed with this hotel.

title: Diamond Members Beware
review: Celebrated our two year anniversary here, they upgraded our room for free upon check-in with friendly service. Not as close to the TD Banknorth Garden as we would have liked but the entire staff was more than helpful in directing us on how to get around. Clean facilities, with a very beautiful (albeit a little small for families) pool and hot tub. Right down the street from Newbury Street and the Prudential Center if you're interested in some nice shopping and Bean-town sightseeing. The view from our room was amazing, it looked like we were pretty close to Fenway too, if you're looking for a good hotel for a sox game. Got a great rate through Priceline, really top-notch. Nice, quiet room, super-cozy bed. Mini-fridge was out of service but they put our food in their front desk…

title: Sleek, fancy hotel with outstanding staff
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. In nice weather, restaurant patio seating is packed with Bostonians and tourists alike soaking up the sunshine and enjoying the food. Commonwealth Ave offers a beautiful stroll down residential tree-lined streets. Keep walking towards the Charles River and enjoy a beautiful view by the water. In warmer months, people run and bike on paths running along the esplanade, and sail and kayak on the Charles River. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Nice Business Hotel
review: My husband is in Boston often for business, and I come with him most of the time, which means we stay in alot of hotels.  When it comes to nicer business hotels, they are all pretty much the same with some differences here and there... but the Hilton Boston Back Bay stands out from the pack.  The building is new and the decour and materials are all very sharp and high end.  Everything looks shiny and new.  The staff is exceptional ... helpful ... warm ... opening doors, holding the elevator, fulfilling requests promptly and always going the extra distance, even when you don't tip them.  Everyone remember my name and my daughter's name and always went out of the way to make us feel welcome.  The lobby is very modern and spacious with so many comfortable arm charis, wide screen…

title: Poor Service
review: This was our second stay at Hilton Back Bay. We were on the Hilton Honors floor. Our room had an unreal view, you could see all of Boston. It was amazing.   The hotel is nice, its in close proximity to alot of attractions in Boston. The price of the rooms are very high though. We only stay there when we use spouses Hiltons Honors points. As was the case this past weekend, as it was son's college parents weekend, and the prices in Boston were through the roof.  Nice hotel, would definitely stay there again!

title: Not bad at all
review: My husband and I enjoyed the location of the hotel, but encountered poor service, which we have never encountered at other Hilton Hotels, where we have stayed at in the U.S.   Except for one young lady, who handled our check-in, the reception desk people were impolite and unfriendly.  But the worst service came from the hotel's own concierge:  She was condescending and downright rude to us, when we asked her information about the city tours. Naturally, we pledged never to return to this Hilton Hotel again.

title: good place to stay in boston but expensive
review: Big, fairly standard room though terrible soundproofing meant that I shared in a long phone conversation made from the room next door.   Excellent fitness centre & clearly popular. All machines in use at 7am!   Funny little Starbucks bar downstairs

title: nice hotel good position
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Spot on location.
review: we stayed for three nights in september ,friendly staff ,comfortable rooms good position , we had breakfast on one occasion although very good it was cheaper to pop over the road to the Prudential center where there is plenty of choice. Next door there is a superb fish resturaunt which serve the best oysters in boston.Its easy to walk to the sights and the shops.we would use it again.

title: great stay
review: This is a well positioned hotel. Whilst there we walked everywhere and if it was a little to far to walk, the hotel is handy to two subway  (theT) stations. Rooms are clean and comfortable and we had ample storage. Unlike many hotels, the in room safe was big enough for our laptop. Most of the staff are friendly and helpful and the girl in the bar was a real star whilst we were there. The exception being, while we were there, the staff in the breakfast room. The first couple of days they were first class, but then we seemed to get a different couple of girls serve us and they were uninterested and one time we had to ask for our coffee four times before it arrived. They were the exception though and we just stopped having breakfast in the hotel, so it didn't spoil our stay. We…

title: Excellent Hotel
review: Enjoyed this hotel. We were on the top floor (albeit not the room i had booked)  The room was huge though, with a flat screen tv  and comfy beds. The hotel lobby has 2 computers for guests to use for free.The hotel has a very good swimming pool/gym but there is a nice outdoor area (didnt find this til the last day!!)  from the gym area it hasnt got a view it looks out onto carparks etc but its got artificial grass with sun loungers and tables and chairs a nice little suntrap.  It is well placed for Newbury St and the Prudential shopping and the famous Duck Tours.  You can see Fenway Park from the hotel too. But Boston is an 'easy walking city' anyway so getting about from this hotel is easy.   Our teenage boys enjoyed this hotel too.

title: Mediocre breakfast, tiny bathrooms, better rooms decent
review: Simply another great Hilton, flawless and dependable! Awesome location, great staff, comfortable rooms.

title: Good stay in the Back Bay
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: god hotel but unfotunately we were on a smoking floor
review: We stayed at the Back Bay Hilton 8/3-8/5 and were happy with the hotel.  We stayed in a wheelchair accessible room which worked out well for us because the built in chair in the shower was perfect  for bathing our 2 month old.  I would stay there again  Likes:   1. Computers with free internet access in the lobby 2. Close proximity to the Prudential T stop 3. Clean rooms 4. Great view of the Charles River and Fenway Park 5. Comfortable beds 6. Price ($139/night)  Dislikes: 1. Smoke smell in room 2. Expensive parking $35/night (cheaper than the Sheraton across the street)

title: Beware of getting into the bathtub!
review: a very nice hotel with large attractive rooms and very comfortable beds but unfortunately the first night of our stay was marred by being in smoking rooms. I had booked non smoking but apparently these are not guaranteed. The hotel could not change our booking until the next day. Other than this the stay was excellent The eighth floor is definitely smoking - not sure how many more! 21st floor isn't - and has fabulous views

title: Fantastic!
review: Although the hotel was lovely the bathtub is dangerously slippery!  We had 3 rooms and everyone slipped getting into the tub.  I slipped and fell bruising my leg and hitting my head. Fortunately no bones were broken but my bruises are extensive.  There are no anti-slip pads, mats or handles in the tub.  There was no manager on duty but I did file a report with the head of security and sent an e-mail to the manager. I would be interested to see if the Hilton fixes this problem.

title: Unimpressed
review: We loved this hotel; we stayed for one Saturday night on points and were given the most awesome room.  Our room had about 24 feet of clean windows with an incredible wrap-around view on the 24th floor.  The room was fantastic; we did not even want to leave it!   The décor was great, the colors nice and soothing.   The bed was super comfortable with soft high quality sheets.   We had a double headed shower in the bathroom with the nicest plush towels.  There was a coffee maker, iron and ironing board, safe, and internet access. The staff was wonderful, with many suggestions, and information on restaurants, the T and other sights that we shouldn’t miss.   We were one block from Newbury St. and had a great time shopping and eating our way towards Quincy market.  Try Croma on…

title: Great Staff
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Spacious, clean, excellent location.
review: Stayed at the Back Bay Hilton for 2 nights as we had tickets to Fenway. Loved the hotel and especially the staff. From Mark at the valet parking to the lovely lady at reception with the great looking nails. Every one seems to love their jobs and their city. The location is wonderful for a first time visitor and finding PF Changs & Cheesecake Factory around the corner was a treat. Our room was spacious but did have to get an extra bed as the beds are narrow. Breakfast was confusing to me, get the bacon, sausage from the buffet station & order two eggs. Food was good.

title: Awesome hotel!
review: We arrived here early in the day but were warmly greated by the front desk staff and allowed to check in several hours early.  Our room was very spacious with a nice flat screen, HD TV, well-stocked mini-bar and robes.  The bed was dreamy, the linens were luxurious.  We ordered room service one day and the service was impeccable, delivered on time and the food was exceptional.  The pool area and workout room is very nice.  Workout facility was nicer than in most hotels.  Great location.  Would definitely stay here again.

title: Good Hotel, Good Location
review: We booked this hotel through Hotwire.com and were thrilled with the selection.  The room was totally renovated, very spacious and clean.  Although our arrival was early and our room wasn't ready, the Hilton took our luggage and called us when the room was available.  The location was great with two T stops close by and the Prudential Center right across the street.  We could easily walk to Newbury Street for a variety of restaurant selections.  We would definitely stay there again and recommend it to our family and friends.

title: Great stay at the Hilton
review: If you are looking for a hotel close to Fenway Park, the subway, and the downtown sites, this is a good choice. Front desk staff if courious and helpful. Rooms are clean, comfortable and quiet.

title: Nice hotel..
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Nice Hotel in a Good Location
review: My family and I stayed there this past Saturday night. The hotel is renovated so it is very clean! The rooms were nice, but my only complaint was that the walls do seem to be thin. The people in the room next door came in at 2:30 am and I could hear them in the bathroom, toilet flush etc. Also, I could constantly hear the elevator going up and down all night which was very annoying. Not sure if I am super sensitive to noise as I do not see any other complaints about this. We got a gret price, so it was hard to complain. The staff was very nice at check in. We had breakfast at the hotel (just ok), nothing fancy at the buffet. But once again, staff was extremely nice. Also, great location close to shopping, restaurants and the T.

title: Marathon weekend
review: Our family enjoyed our stay at this hotel in April....they are finishing up a renovation and only the lobby lounge was not complete during our stay...the pool and fitness center and outdoor sun deck are great. The location is convenient for tourism with the Prudential Center right next door with many dining options, plus trolley and duck tours are available right outside the door and around the corner. The hotel has funny angles and request one of the corner rooms that opens up with more space than a standard room.  We drove everywhere we wanted to visit and generally found parking easy except in the North End by the Old North Church. Tourist tip - there is a parking deck right under the Boston Common and real ease of use to get to the swan boats and public gardens.  Would…

title: Very pleased with this hotel
review: My husband and I stayed here for the Boston Marathon.  Even though the hotel was overflowing with guests, the staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful.  Our room, while small, was very nicely renovated.  I'm not a huge fan of Hiltons, but this one has won me over.  The location was great for sightseeing, although not so convenient to the marathon finish line.  Still, we would definitely stay here again.

title: Great deal, fine hotel!
review: We arrived in Boston on the Amtrak train from New York city.  The hotel is a short walk from the train station, and even closer to an underground station.  It is next door to the Sheraton, and a few minutes away from a Westin.  The location is very good for tourists - walking distance to Copley Square and the Prudential tower / shopping area.  There is a Cheesecake Factory 5 minutes away, and a great bar for breakfast just round the corner (ask reception staff for directions).  The room was clean, tidy and a good size.  As others have mentioned, the walls are very thin and you may be disturbed if the guests in the room next to you are noisy.  The bathroom was also clean and in good condition.  As with most hotels, internet is available in the room for a charge.  However, there…

title: Excellent location
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Great Area
review: Situated 2 minute walk from Pudential " T " station, by a $15 weekly travel pass and take public transport its cheaper and surprisingly easy ( as opposed to $30 taxi)  hotel is under renovation a the moment, but that doesn't get  in the way of the experience, the only real issue id the paper thin walls, but the room does have flat screen TV's , ans a great view over Back Bay.  The Prudential Centre/ CopleyPlaza and Newbury & Boylston street, are literally on the doorstep, so great food, cheap shopping and a brilliant talking tour around Boston

title: Decent room but loud!
review: Stayed here for 5 nights. The hotel restuarant and lobby area are under rennovation so it wasnt looking its best.  We had just stayed at the Plamer House Hilton in chicago which this hotel is not in the same class as. However the rooms were spacious and very clean. The location is what i was really pleased with about the hotel - within a short walk there are lots and lots of very nice bars, shops and excellant restuarants. I would def stay here again as i think downsatirs will be looking a lot better soon and the brilliant location was excellant.

title: Minor Disappointment
review: Pros: Room was nicely furnished-better than expected. Decent size, modern and updated. Decent location-any further from downtown would be too far. Near T-stop, prudential center/mall etc. Friendly staff. Cons: Noisy! Loud! Very, very thin walls. Can hear toilets flushing on other floors! Phones ringing, t.v.'s, vacuuming in other rooms! Half of the hotel was under construction- began very early every morning. The thermostat in our room didn't work. Ice machine broken or empty on at least 3 different floors. No fridge. No fan.

title: More than adequate, polite staff
review: Stayed in Hilton Back Bay for three nights in March’08  Since my reserved room wasn’t ready when I checked in (at 12:30 AM) I spent one night in a room that looked like a standard room in floor 4, that was just about adequate for spending one night there, though very thin walls meant that I could (unfortunately) hear just about everything that went on next door. Luckily didn’t have to spend more time there. Then I was transferred to my “original requested room” which was Deluxe Corner room in 18th floor. That was relatively good size and seemed to have thicker walls (or just that nobody was staying in the room next to mine).   Have to say that I felt a bit short-changed when stepping into the room, due to comparison with the image from Hilton website. I mean surely everybody is…

title: Pleasant stay
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Great buy, right near the Prudential Building!
review: Stayed at the Hilton Back Bay with my husband and two children for a 3 night trip to Boston during the February school vacation.  I got a great deal of $106 per night on Hotwire and for this price it was a steal.  The room was pleasant with a nice open view.  Small bathroom, but clean.  Comfortable beds.  The pool and hot tub were great amenities with the kids and the fitness center was nice.  We were given breakfast vouchers for one morning when we had issues with the room temperature.  Overall, staff was friendly and helpful and the location was convenient to the T and to shops/restaurants.  I would stay here again--especially for the price!

title: Good Experience -- No Complaints
review: As always, this hotel is great for it's price.  It is clean, has nice toiletries, a nice gym with pool, and if you are lucky, a great view of the Charles!  The decor is a bit boring, but it's clean and the staff are also friendly.  It has a good location right across from the Prudential Building.  It is also quiet.  Nothing outstanding, but very nice overall.

title: Staff and location are best assets
review: My wife and I were in Boston (from Kansas City) because  I was slated to be in Boston for a conference and because her birthday was the same weekend we decided to fly out a few days early.  We booked this hotel on Hotwire for around $135/night for two nights.  The hotel itself was in a nice area.  The Sheraton just across the street is connected to two large malls via walkways and there is plenty of dining.  The hotel is also right beside The Church of Christ Science's headquarters and Berklee College of Music.  The lobby and restaurant seemed to be a little old-school, yet still elegant and welcoming.  Upon arrival the staff was very kind.  The doorman asked us if we had eaten and when we told him we hadn't, he offered his advice on good eateries within walking distance.  The…

title: So So Stay
review: The wife and I decided to visit Boston as a weekend getaway. I found a great rate of $119 for a deluxe room at the Back Bay location preferable to the Financial District location at weekends.  We arrived in the city at 7.30am and decided to go to the hotel to drop our bags off. The hotel is a short walk from the Prudential T stop and at first glance things didn't look great, something of a 60s/70s concrete monstrosity! However inside things were on the up. The lobby area didn't look dated at all and there were signs in the lobby indicating that as of December '07 the hotel was under renovation. We asked at the front desk about leaving the bags and were told our room was actually ready and that we were going to be the first guests staying in the room with a view of the city…

title: Average Hilton, Above Average Restaurant
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. title: Hilton Boston Back Bay very nice
review: I stayed at the Bay Back Hilton while attending a conference in 2005. I've stayed at other Hilton's around the country and this one easily met their standards. Those standards being good service, good clean rooms, and a nice building with good facilities. That's how most Hilton's are: Good. This one was no exception.  I stayed on one of the upper floors in a room with two double beds. It was average sized and very comfortable with a nice desk and desk chair and comfortable sitting chairs. My view was nothing special, but I think it's unfair to cut a hotel to pieces in a review over their view (unless you personally requested a room with a view), as it is often something that they don't have much control over.   As for the location, it's very central to to the city. The Heinz…

title: Great location, average accomodations
review: Recently stayed at the Hilton Boston Back Bay.  We have stayed at the Westin Copley Place several times but decided to make a change.  The room was smaller in size but very clean with comfortable beds and pillows.  Bedding was new and clean also.  Very nice and helpful staff.  Location very good if going to the Prudential Center Mall and shops - just cross the street. A little farther to walk to Newbury St. and Copley area than the Westin.  Would definitely stay again.

title: Nice, centrally located hotel
review: I booked a room for a stay in Boston to do some shopping and to get into the Christmas Spirit. The locale is great, a block off Boylston St. and not too far from Newbury St. shops. Also the Prudential mall is across the street, a great feature for winter shopping, though it does close early on weekdays.  The staff at check in was very pleasant. The beds were just ok. No special down comforter as is found in most hotels today. The temperature control for the room was not very reliable.  The tv was old school, but had a good variety of channels including HBO.  Parking overnight will cost you at least $36 in the nearby garage, a bit more for valet.  There is free access to one of two pc's in the lobby for checking email etc.  We ran away from the restaurant on site - way too many…

title: Could be improved
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. In nice weather, restaurant patio seating is packed with Bostonians and tourists alike soaking up the sunshine and enjoying the food. Commonwealth Ave offers a beautiful stroll down residential tree-lined streets. Keep walking towards the Charles River and enjoy a beautiful view by the water. In warmer months, people run and bike on paths running along the esplanade, and sail and kayak on the Charles River. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Loved the Back Bay Hilton
review: My spouse and I stayed one night so we could see the Boston Pops Christmas concert.  We arrived early and a room was ready, but not the one we specially asked for. We had asked for a corner room with floor to ceiling windows of the city. We got a room with a view of the rooftop of the neighboring Sheraton. No nice windows, no nice view. We decided not to talk to the desk about it and move on, now I wish we had. This Hilton has no members lounge for carded members, so there is no complimentary breakfast or cocktails.  The two business stations in the lobby are free to use, but Internet in the rooms, and any additional channels (even music) are charged.   When we checked out the next day, the bill for room charges was 20 extra than what we had on our reservation. I brought down…

title: Beautiful rooms, great location
review: We stayed at the Back Bay Hilton the 3rd week of November for 5 days. The room size was large, the beds ultra-comfy, and the bathroom was spotless. I had friends staying at the Sheraton and had experienced the chaos and noise over there, so it was a pleasure coming back to my quiet hotel lobby. The location was great. Two blocks over to Newbury and Boylston for shopping, across the street from Prudential Center Mall and Copley mall, trolley stop in front of the hotel and a quick cab ride to the beginning of the Freedom Trail.( If it weren't so cold outside we would've walked there.) I saw many of the hotels, (for curiousity's sake), and will choose the Back Bay Hilton again when I come to Boston. Walls are a bit thin, but the beds are comfy enough to make you forget that. There…

title: In the midst of all the action!
review: Recently stayed here during a trip to meet with some colleagues in Boston and found the location was superb (lots of great shopping, restaurants, sights in the area) and that the room was a cut above most others (and certainly above most others in the Hilton chain).  The bed was extremely comfortable; the room was stylish and spacious; the staff were friendly and helpful - I would definitely recommend this hotel to others - stay here, you won't be disappointed.

title: Adequate for Sleeping
review: A friend and I recently spent the last night of a week long trip to the US at the Hilton Back Bay and to be honest we wished we'd stayed at this hotel for longer.  Located in the Back Bay area the hotel is great for getting to the many bars and restaurants in the Back Bay.  It's also not bad for getting to other parts of Boston owing to the proximity of the T (metro) lines.  We were put into a Twin Delux Corner Room which had excellent views of the city and a balcony.  The room was large, well appointed and very clean.  Overall the hotel gave a very good impression - it wasn't overly ornate, more like a business hotel and functional.  It was also very well maintained and very clean throughout.  To relax before our flights back home we made use of the pool and fitness suite.  The…

title: Good choice if need to be by the Hynes Convention Center
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Awesome
review: The hotel is located in the “back bay” area of Boston … towards the south side.  It is not in the immediate downtown area but is right across the street from the Hynes convention center and a large mall.  There are plenty of restaurants in the area, as well as other major hotels like Sheraton, Marriott, Westin and others.  The Hotel – the interior of the hotel is nice but nothing fancy.  No extravagant lobby or sitting area.  The elevators appear to be designed to have at least one unused elevator at the lobby.  Check-in was quick and staff was courteous.  There is a bellman at the entrance most of the time. The hotel is kept in good shape and the hallways are clean.  Did not use the pool or workout facility.   The Rooms – nice, and fairly large for a big-city hotel.  As usual,…

title: Terrific location and river views
review: Got a great rate through Hotwire. Room was smoking and we got two double beds instead of a king, but more than worth the money, and the faint cigarette odor wasn't very bad at all.  Right in the middle of everything in Boston. Great access to restaurants and historical sites.  My girlfriend left her necklace there, and they were nice enough to overnight it to us for free.  Thanks Hilton!

title: Great Boston Hotel !
review: We were lucky enough to use Hilton HHonors points for a free room at the Hilton Back Bay.  Upon check-in with a courteous front desk attendant we were upgraded to a corner room on the 18th floor with balcony and view of the Charles River.  This room was spacious, quiet, and clean, and I definitely enjoyed the view.  (Note that the upgrade was based on the fact that I am a Hilton HHonors Gold Card member.  I have found that Hilton is very good about rewarding loyalty with both airline miles, Hilton HHonors points for free stays, and with free upgrades/breakfasts/access to concierge lounges, etc.)   The breakfast buffet the next morning featured a reasonable variety: tomato quiche and smoked salmon were present in addition to the usual scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon, pancakes,…

title: Excellent hotel & Location
review: I recently stayed at the Hilton Boston Back Bay for business over four nights.  The hotel was excellent in a great location.  The rooms were extremely comfortable and had larger rooms then you will find at most hotels in Boston.  The room had a fantastic walk in shower with two shower heads and fantastic pressure.  The beds are very comfortable and the climate control works very well.  This hotel also had the best housekeeping I have had at a hotel in very long time, they replaced everything, left bottled water everyday and were very efficient, I wish every hotel had housekeeping like this hotel.  The hotel had a great pool and hot tub on the 7th floor and a good sized gym with modern equipment.  There is a starbucks right across the street at the Sheraton and even though I…

title: Felt More Holiday Inn Than Hilton!!!!
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: nice stay but  but 2 flaws
review: There are 2 Hiltons in the central Boston area. Last year, we stayed at the Hilton in the Financial District. It was great and only walking distance to Quincy Market etc. No pool though. This year we thought that we would try Back Bay and again opted for a Hilton primarily to experience another area of Boston and to benefit from the indoor pool. Although the staff were very friendly, the hotel was rundown and jaded. Certainly not what we would have expected from Hilton. The cleaning staff also did not have that much attention to detail! As for the pool, it was okay but nothing special. No Hilton Executive Room either which was something that we missed. We did like the Back Bay area though and there were lot's of attractions in that area. We particularly enjoyed walking all the…

title: Good Stay at the Hilton
review: Location is close to ideal: Across the street to the Prudential Center entrance (via Sheraton) and a short walk to Hynes Convention Center Subway station as well as an even shorter walk to Newbury Street with all its Restaurants and Specialty stores. Lobby is somewhat small but all common areas were clean and updated. Service was friendly and professional. Two free computer terminals are available in the lobby for brief internet access and boarding pass printing. Rooms were clean, updated and our kingsize bedroom size was acceptable. Bathrooms are a bit small but updated and clean. No complaints about the Roomservice.  Wireless internet access is available for $13/24hrs. Pod-style coffee machines and ceramic mugs were very welcomed. Now for two somewhat serious detractors which…

title: Three and a half stars:)
review: We stopped at the Hilton for four nights at the end of July. We paid for the upgraded corner room but couldnt see a difference from the standard room apart from a bit more space. The room was clean and comfortable, with a small balcony that you could manouvre a chair out onto at a push. The swimming pool and gym were fine nice to have a quick dip after a long day sight seeing. Used the bar but not the breakfast room which seemed to be overpriced. Overall it was a good experience and we would stop again if in Boston.

title: Ok, but felt a little deceived
review: We stayed at the Hilton August 5-10 while my husband was in town for a business trip. It was a nice hotel, but having stayed at the Westin just two months prior, I cannot give it the same four star rating as I gave the Westin.  Both are high-rise Back Bay hotels, but the Westin has a better location - Copley Square vs. the bottom end of Boylston - and better views.   Location - at the "bottom end" (as I call it) of Boylston. By all means nice, especially if you are attending an event at Hynes Convention, visiting a student at Berklee, or want a short walk to Fenway.  However, it was a good 30 minute walk to South Station when I took a commuter rail out to visit family, and just as long to Faneuil Hall/Quincy Market/etc... Of course, you can just hop on the nearby green line T at…

title: Nice hotel, convenient location
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Great Hotel
review: We stayed here for a 2 night getaway.  After being quoted a room rate over $400 for a hotel downtown, I was ecstatic to get a room here for $168!  The hotel and room were immaculate--all appeared to be recently renovated.  There was a large, flat panel TV in the room!  The bed was SO comfortable with a plush comforter and down pillows.  Only distraction was the stained room carpet.  Nice indoor pool and exercise room.  Staff was mostly friendly and efficient except for the young, blond lady (her name begins with an "M") at the front desk.  Hotel is only about 2 blocks from 2 "T" (subway) stops--very easy to get around Boston.  But the trains are short and crowded at all times. A lot of reasonable little restaurants in area due to a local music college.

title: Don't do it if you have to pay full price
review: The Hilton Back Bay is a great hotel.  We went for a short weekend trip and it is centrally located to Newbury Street and Boylston.   Easy to get to shops and restaurants and also not far from the airport.    The hotel room was very nice.  The pool and exercise room were in above average condition.   I would definitely stay there again.

title: Clean and quiet hotel in a good location
review: The Hilton Back Bay is an average hotel with high prices.   We booked a Corner King Deluxe Room for 258/night. I booked through the hotel b/c I wanted to make sure we received a corner room b/c the view was important. For $258/night the view was the only thing we got. The King bed was not very comfortable and the room was musty. The bathroom was very very small. The view was great but was not worth it. We could have stayed at the Sheraton and gotten the same view and a much better room.  We didn't have any problems with the staff, in fact they were very helpful.  The bathroom towels were very rough, sounds picky, but when it actually hurts to dry yourself off there is a problem.   I had breakfast at the buffet one morning, an average buffet, and it cost $50 for two people.  …

title: Good choice hotel
review: This is a good-quality hotel in a convenient location. It was a bit pricey, but no  more so than other hotels of a similar standard in Boston, which is an expensive city.  The hotel is in the Back Bay area, a short walk from both the Hynes and Prudential stations (Green Line). Copley Square is also within walking distance, but for the main tourist areas (including the Freedom Trail), you’ll need to use transportation.  Our room on the 12th floor was clean, well-equipped and surprisingly quiet. Despite being at the front of the building, we heard no traffic noise. The staff were efficient and friendly, and there were no delays in either check-in or check-out. Our only complaint was that the lady on the concierge desk seemed remarkably ignorant of the neighborhood. She couldn’t…

title: Excellent Hotel!
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Horrible Service at the Hotel
review: The Back Bay Hilton was a lovely surprise.  Modern - granite in the bathrooms, very clean, very spacious rooms.  We had a 2 double room for my husband and I and our two small kids and there was plenty of room to operate.  The rooms have a mini-bar refrig, and great in room coffee with pods, real cups and take-out cups if you are dashing out the door.  The view was excellent - we were on the 18th floor and had a city view.  From the hallway we could see that a river view room would be terrific, too.  The room had amazing temperature control - quiet quiet quiet, yet could control temp very well - even told you the outside temp at the push of a button!  The staff was very helpful.  The bell captain knew our names the first day and was cheerful and seemed like he was checking in on…

title: Okay except for staff
review: My husband and I stayed there last night, and it was a horrible customer service experience.  They have Kiosks to check in in the lobby but they didn't work, one half-worked but you still need a plastic card that you have to wait on line for, so the kiosks are essentially useless. (We guessed that the desk workers do this on purpose to save their jobs instead of the kiosks taking over their jobs).  We asked the first reception worker  for a quiet room away from the elevators and ice machine. We go to our room, and it is directly across from the elevators.  We go downstairs and ask another clerk for the same.  We go to our room, and it is directly across from the ice machine.  Then they lied to us and tell us that all rooms are near the elevators the way the building is…

title: Great Stay at Hilton Back Bay
review: As a former reviewer pointed out, the hotel is great but the staff has a LOT to be desired.  I booked my room at the Hilton on Priceline for $65 (~$80 with taxes/fees).  The hotel is not what I would call easy to get to driving wise, but certainly very easy to get to with public transportation by getting off at the Prudential stop (as a footnote, if you are flying into logan or taking the train into Boston, I do NOT recommend taking the subway directly to the hotel if you have big luggage... the green line of the T is VERY hard to accomodate luggage on as the cars are pretty small... I would suggest a cab).  A LOT of things are within walking distance of this hotel, including Fenway Park, Newbury Street (a lot of high-end stores and nice cafes and restaurants), Copley Square,…

title: Good, but not great.  Am I getting too fussy?
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Hilton - NOT recommended
review: I travel on business a lot, and I usually try to stay at the Hilton because they're good.  This time, I'm on a vacation with my wife and two teenage kids.  We got a room with two double, plus a roll-away bed (extra $20 per night, which is pretty excessive!).  We ordered an extra large room, but to be honest, we didn't notice.  We were on the HHonours floor, right over the main entrance.  So first the good.  The location is fantastic.  A quick walk across to the Prudenial centre, and close to public transport.  The room was clean, with a small balcony (maybe 1x1 meters).  There's two free to use computers in the lobby with internet capabilities and printer.  Staff were helpful.  The bar was nice too, but I didn't eat there.  The pool was small, but OK.  The Jacuzzi was good and…

title: Great Location.
review: It's a shame how a great chain of hotels can make such a great mistake in hiring employees and managers.  The Hilton Back Bay is, by far, the worst hotel I've ever stayed at.  We were not able to obtain a fridge so we basically had to dine out 24/7.  The nearest laundrymat is a few "BLOCKS" away and they pretended to not have a clue where it is when asked.  We gave in and had to "dry clean" some underwear and a swim suit, we never saw the swim suit again and we were acused of not filling out the itemized content list.  They basically didn't believe we sent the swim suit to get cleaned.  They knocked on the door at 7:00am the morning of checkout and yelled out "CHECKOUT" since it seems they didn't believe the copy of the checkout bill being slid under the door was sufficient.

title: Not worth $179
review: Beautiful View, and very clean. Couple minutes from the mall, tours and Downtown boston. Everything you need is in the area.  I will book them again.

title: Excellent hotel for business travellers to Boston
review: Seems we should have shopped the $179 rate for this hotel. It was a convenient location to restaurants, and the subway "T" is a short 2 blocks away (Pru Center stop). Bath was very cramped. Bed was usual Hilton comfortable. Easy and safe-feeling walk to Fenway Park.  Ask for view to the north, the view to the south is boring.

title: Hilton: Great quality and location
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Great Location, Nice Room, Courteous Staff
review: This Hilton was in a great location - the next street over had shopping, food, bars.  But the hotel itself was very quiet, as we had a room on the 18th floor with an awesome view.  Our rate was only $70/night due to being purchased on Pricelin.  We didn't have a rental car since parking is so expensive, but the day pass on the T worked great.  You can definitely get wherever you need to go anywhere in Boston without walking too far due to the many T stops.

title: A very pleasant 4-day stay
review: My husband and I stayed Thursday through Sunday of last week.  Our room was clean, comfortable, and had a small balcony with a good view of the city and a peek view of the Charles.  The hotel was quiet, with street noise audible only when we had the balcony door open.  There is complimentary coffee and bottled water replenished daily, a mini bar, iron/board, hair dryer, Crabtree & Evelyn amenities, clock/radio with MP3, lighted closet, ice machines on each floor, and a small store in lobby behind front desk for incidental items.  The hotel is in an excellent location -- within walking distance to much of what Boston has to offer.  We used no public transportation during our stay (except to and from the airport), but had easy access to the T, and readily available taxis if we…

title: Great but hard to find at night
review: Stayed four nights for a convention.   The room was nicer than I expected for a room at a conference rate - king bed, sofa, side chair, desk/chair and enough lighting to keep the room bright if desired.  Also had a minibar although I didn't touch it, and on top of that was a coffee maker, ice bucket and glasses and two half-pint bottles of Poland Spring water which were replenished daily. Small padded bench at the foot of the bed which faced the TV.   Coffee guzzlers will want to hit up the front desk for additional coffee, as the packets provided make but a single cup each, and they leave you 2 regular and 2 decaf packets in the room.   Some little niceties: the alarm clock had a wire for plugging into an MP3 player's headphone jack if desired, a soap dish on the sink,…

title: Excellent staff
review: I stayed here in the fall of 2006 as a layover between business trips.  I thought it was great.  My only complaint was that I had to find it at night and found it almost impossible.  The good news is that the hotel put someone on the phone who talked me to the hotel while I drove.  I thought this was way beyond the call of duty.  I gave that woman a hug when I finally got there because I had been lost for over 2 hours.   (If you have never been to Boston, it is a huge challenge to navigate around.)  My room was great.  The food was great.  I had a great stay and thought the staff was wonderful!

title: Nice Hotel with great location
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Needs a lift
review: The hotel is nicely located in the Back Bay Area of Boston. It's very close to the Prudental Center with shops, restaurants and the magnificent view from the top of the Prudential Tower.  Nearby is also Boylston Street and Newbury Street with more shopping and restaurants. The area felt very safe and friendly. Boston is compact so we walked into the city center and the New England Aquarium, it took about 30 minutes. The Hotel may need some remodeling in the next years but the room was comfortable and we also enjoyed the very good breakfast buffet.  There´s also a small but nice pool and a jacuzzi.  Overall I would say this is a good hotel in a very friendly area an I would probably stay here again when visiting Boston.

title: Acceptable, but only because of corporate reimbursement
review: The HIlton Back Bay has elevator problems.  Not just broken elevators and there were two of those during our stay that significantly lenghthened lobby wait times, but noisy elevators.  Our room was located behind the elevator bank and across the hall from the elevator and at night and in the morning we could hear the elevators going up and down.  This is a real impediment a to good night's sleep.  There isn't much soundproofing between rooms either, as it sounded as if our neighbor was showering in our room.  On the plus side, the rooms are pleasantly decorated and the hotel is conveniently located to the Prudential Center mall.  Although there is no concierge, the Front Desk did make us a restaurant reservation and the bell staff was helpful.

title: OK but a bit disappointed
review: I stayed here for a conference, for which the rates were knocked down to $160 a night. Reasons for the selection: the proximity and distance (Sheraton was a bit close for comfort-- the event spanned the Hynes center and parts of the Sheraton) for a first-timer in Boston. Since I'm more of a Best Western fan, the amenities were all right, but nothing really better. Sure, the polished marble, fancy chairs, and internet access were nice (glad that the company was paying for the internet access as it wasn't free).  There was an issue with the toilet not flushing properly and the fact that the maid who serviced the rooms cleaned out the trashcans by dumping the contents and wiping the inner surface before rearranging the linens (no she didn't not wash her hands between handling the…

title: convenient, friendly, and spotless
review: My wife and I stayed at the Hilmton for two nights during a business trip. Overall the hotel was good but still below my usual experience with the Hilton. There is a general feeling of decadence in the service, in the outdated rooms and in the overall decoration. I recommend it to business travellers but would shy away from it for long stays.

title: Central modern Hilton Boston Back Bay
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: Good place to stay in the back bay area
review: The Hilton made for good central location for a weekend hop to Boston.  Our delux King corner room on the 26th flloor had a comfortable/heavenly bed, 37 inch hdtv, small sofa and balcony,  internet access for a fee, and great views.  Free internet and apples are available in the lobby. The room was spacious, very quiet, clean, and modern, hotel corridors were well lit, and staff was very accomodating.  Unlike the adjacent Sheraton, Marriott, and Westin, the Hilton is not connected to the Prudential Center mall so if you want to shop until you drop you have to exit the hotel, cross the street, and enter the Sheraton for an access walkway-no big deal.  The plus for all of this is that the Hitlon is tranquil and not frenetic like the Sheraton and other connected hotels-the downside…

title: Great Location
review: This hotel has been around for a while but still comfortable and the location is excellent.  missing some things like a VIP lounge but the restaurant is very good.  Good views from the windows all around.  right in the heart of the back bay area.  close walk to mall, train, and Mass avenue.

title: Back Bay Charm
review: My husband and I stayed here for New Years for one week and had a great time.  Husband is a Hilton Honors gold member so we were upgraded to one of the hexagonal rooms on the 22nd floor and got breakfast vouchers for our entire stay. The room was fabulous with floor to ceiling windows offering amazing views of Boston.  We found all the hotel staff to be very helpful and friendly (in fact, we found practically EVERYONE in Boston to be helpful and friendly!!).  We ate breakfast every day at the hotel and whilst it is of a very high standard I was getting fed up of it by the end of the week - there's too much much choice :-) We only ate in the hotel once in  the evening (New Years Eve). It was a special meal they had laid on and was fabulous.  The hotel location is great for…

title: Great Weekend Break
review: My wife and l spent one week at this Hotel.  From the moment we arrived at midnight without any luggage, which had been misplaced ex Australia, the staff could not of been more helpful. They provided us with the necesities of life and a late night upgrade. Breakfast was first class, as was the room. Whilst the views are tainted by the location, the location from a tourist point of view was awesome.  Will gladly return next year.

title: Nice stay!
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. In nice weather, restaurant patio seating is packed with Bostonians and tourists alike soaking up the sunshine and enjoying the food. Commonwealth Ave offers a beautiful stroll down residential tree-lined streets. Keep walking towards the Charles River and enjoy a beautiful view by the water. In warmer months, people run and bike on paths running along the esplanade, and sail and kayak on the Charles River. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Great hotel.
review: I generally do not like to stay at chain hotels, so my fingers were crossed tightly till check out time. I stayed here for a weekend with friends. It was pricey but split between three people it turned out to be quite reasonable.  Wacky location, but if you know your way around the Back Bay area (and it won't take long) you'll be fine.  Shopping directly across the street in the Prudential Center was quite convenient.   Beds were comfortable, but small. They call it a double I call it an oversized twin. Room was clean and cozy. Beatuiful bedding and a really nice bed side radio. Concierge was helpful. Hotel held our bags at check out so we can grab brunch before catching our train back to NY.   Not bad stay; I was nicely surprised. I would recommend to others.

title: Very nice business-class hotel
review: Have stayed here several times and always enjoy it. As a Hilton Honors Diamond member we are always upgraded to a beautiful room and get free breakfast, which is excellent. The rooms I have stayed in have amazing views of the city with panoramic windows. It is in a great location and easy to find if you're not that familiar with the city. I highly recommend it.

title: awesome!
review: I would normally only stay at this type of large hotel if it was a business trip.  But I didn't plan far enough in advance, it was Columbus Day weekend and most hotels in the Copley area had already sold out.  The room on the 20th floor was very spacious with a sweeping view of the city and no street noise.  Every amenity that one might expect at $200/night was available.  The bed was extremely comfortable with down bedding and turn-down service.  Bathroom was clean and there was plenty of hot water and pressure.  Front desk staff and doormen were friendly and helpful.

title: Good Hotel in Good Neighborhood
review: we stayed one night at the Hilton Boston Back Bay last week end. it is a pretty great hotel. we had a double room at the 11th floor. check in and check out where pretty fast. our room was an ok size double but very very clean and the furniture looked almost brand new. the bed was huge! loved the mini bar- lots of food, soda, liquor, wine and snacks (of course overpriced!). the bathroom was quite big- we did not have a large bath tub, but it was alright. the only thing that i am complaining about was that in the bathroom there was not tooth paste, there was one near the mini bar, but you had to pay for it. there is also a coffee machine which worked pretty good. the location is awesome. it is steps from copley, newbury and northeastern university and it is basically 200feet from…

title: Some Problems at the Hilton Boston Back Bay
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. title: overall okay
review: Although we had a pleasant stay at the Hilton (except for 1 MAJOR problem), I felt that I needed to write this review to inform others who might consider staying at this hotel.  The lobby was pleasant enough -- a bit on the small side compared to other Hiltons that I have stayed at before.  Check-in proceeded quite quickly.  The reception staff were excellent and efficient.  The room was pretty, but rather small.  However, I was surprised that they wanted to charge a fee for internet access.  At 2:30 AM, we were awakened by a very loud alarm, eminating from the room radio.  A fire alarm had gone off and we were instructed to proceed to the stairwells to begin our descent.  This was OK, except we were staying on the 26th floor.  The other guests (quite elderly) and I (mid-50's)…

title: very satisfied
review: We stayed for 4 days during college parents day.  Hotels were full and we were booked at $285.00 rate which is way steep for this hotel.  My biggest concern on booking was staying somewhere central, and assuring a courtesy shuttle as I had 3 extra large suitcases in tow.  Our first encounter was there was no courtesy shuttle.  When I didn't see their name on the airport shuttle phones, I called the hotel and was told to just get a cab.  I was a bit miffed.    Aside from the pictures of a high rise, and comparable to adjacent hotels, this is a small property.  On check in I informed them on the mis-comm on the shuttle to no avail, no apology.  I wasn't sure the clerk even understood me.  The porters stood and watched us get our luggage on a cart and get it to the room - I think…

title: Solid Nice Hotel
review: I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel after having a less than stellar experience at another Hilton.  I checked in late and the woman at the front desk was very friendly, got me checked in quickly and gave me toothpaste free of charge (darn FAA restrictions!).  The room (on the 24th Hilton HHonors floor, despite my not being a member) was spacious, spotless, and had a great view.  The bathroom was large and included a bathrobe and free bottled water.  I had no complaints whatsoever.  When I checked out (at 4am!) the young man at the front desk was polite and courteous, and made sure I got a cab to the airport. The staff was always friendly and even directed me to a computer where I could check my email free of charge.  I ate in the hotel restaurant once for breakfast, and…

title: excellent hotel
review: Stayed here for one night on a quick business trip to Boston.  When I arrived a room was not available (got in around noon), so I went to the restaurant for lunch.  No one was there but I had a very good meal---food is above average.  The front desk called me on my mobile to tell me my room was ready.  Was upgraded to a room that had a panoramic view of the area--very nice.  Went to the restaurant for breakfast in the am and the buffet was very good.  A quick walk thru the Sheraton to Copley plaza and cab service is quick.  Would recommend a stay for business

title: Excellent!
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: We were satisified.
review: We stayed here for one night but i wish it was longer! As a hilton honors member i managed to get floor 22 which was a hilton honours floor - the view over the city was amazing! The room itself was very spacious and had loads of goodies in the bathroom :-)  Hotel has a nice indoor pool and i beleive recently rennovated gym. Also has a nice sun deck!  Only a stones throw away from the prudential centre and the green line T station. Very handy for staying right the centre of everything!  Also would recommend eating at the top of the huib restaurant - if you go here just before sun down the views are great - they have a bar menu which is a lot cheaper than their main menu - you can get burger an pizzas etc! If you are on a budget like we were :-)

title: Nice hotel, great location
review: We booked through Hotwire at a rate of $119/night.  When we checked in we were told that we could have a room with one king or a room with 2 double beds.  As Hotwire had guaranteed me a room that would sleep 4, I opted for the 2 bed option.  The room was OK, but the beds were tiny!!!  The hotel was more than happy to offer me a rollaway for $20/night!!  I eventually received the rollaway at no charge.  Unfortunately, my son had to sleep on the floor.  Each bed held one adult, the rollaway 1 child and the other child had to sleep on the floor.  If there are more than 2 in your party, I would not recommend this establishment.  The indoor pool was OK but very small and there was not enough poolside seating.   The rooms were very quiet and the beds comfortable.  I would consider…

title: Hilton Back Bay recommended
review: The Hilton Back Bay is in a great location, close to Newbury St with great restaurants and shopping. There is a small gourmet market (Delucas) just a few blocks away. The hotel is very close to the OLD convention center, but don't confuse it with the NEW convention center, which is not at all close.  The hotel itself has a small lobby, with a small on-site restaurant and no gift shop or executive/concierge floor. They do have a small rack of convenience-store type stuff behind the front desk for sale. As a Hilton Gold, I received an upgraded room (w couch) and free water each day.  My room (417) was great, wonderful furnishings and bed, couch, and small, strangely shaped balcony. This room faced the Sheraton, and the street between is where many of the large tour buses idle…

title: Great Location
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Loved this hotel, loved Boston
review: We stayed at this hotel the night of a Red Sox game.  It is absolutely the best place if you are going to a game.  Definitely within walking distance of Fenway.  The hotel lobby was nice and service was very friendly.  The rooms were average.  Nothing fancy and the beds weren't the best that I have had at a Hilton.  However, we had everything we needed and had no complaints other than the high priced parking.  However, that's just the price you pay for staying in this area.  The best thing overall about this hotel is the location.  You can't go wrong.

title: Great hotel, shame about the reception staff
review: I spent a week in Boston last September and stayed at the Hilton. Loved the hotel, room was spacious and very clean. The buffet breakfast is great - only complaint was we were there 2 days before the waitress took the time to tell us about the buffet and we had been ordering breakfast from the more expensive menu until then. Buffet was great value. The hotel location is super, 5 minutes to Newbury street on foot and about 3 minutes to the Prudential centre where u can hop on the train to downtown Boston and be there in about 10 minutes. For shoppers heading to Boston I'd recommend Filenes and to be there at 9am before it gets busy, early morning shopping there is an enjoyable experience. A trip to Wrentham Village for the outlet shopping experience is also a must, super…

title: Great All Round Hotel
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle.
