title: Nice surprise
review: Stayed at the Hilton Back Bay for a week in early September and glad we did. The hotel has a good location in the Back Bay area close to Copley Square and with easy access to the rest of this compact city. The hotel rooms were generous in size, well equipped and immaculately clean. There is a great gym/pool/sundeack area which is little used but very good. The restaurant is pricy and although the food is good, there are better and cheaper alternatives right on the doorstep with many good retaurants and cafe bars close by. Have breakfast in the nearby shopping mall which has several fast food/breakfast options.  Would highly recommend and certainly stay here again.

title: Great location
review: In my mind, Hiltons are normally pretty safe bets.  Nothing terribly exciting and nothing normally too bad.   This Hilton exceeded my expecations by a mile.  First, the location is terrific if you want to be close to the Back Bay train station, Newbury Street, the Pru Center, good restaurants, shopping, and places to walk around.   The rooms must have been renovated recently because my room was spotless and all of the furniture was new, the bathroom fixtures were new and the countertops were granite.  The bed and the linens stack up with any Ritz I have stayed in.  What pleased me the most was the service I received the next morning from room service.  It arrived exactly on time and the server was friendly and refused my additional gratuity because she said it was already…

title: Happy at the Hilton
review: We stayed here for 3 nights and had a very enjoyable stay. We had a room on the 22nd floor which gave us brilliant views of Boston. Our room was very comfy and clean and our only complaint was the cost of the car park - 30 dollars a night!!  We ate breakfast every day in a lovely garden, with a fountain, which we reached through the Sheraton hotel opposite. It was a peaceful start to each day.  A great location made it possible to walk to all the main attractions easily.

title: good value
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Needs improvement.
review: good location, price, large room

title: Good price, good service, good location
review: Hotel had no AC. It was in the 80's on Saturday. Front desk staff informed us to open our windows that the hotel had no AC. Also bed linens were stained and the toilet ran all night. Front desk staff very unhelpful. This hotel does not represent the Hilton chain very well. The Sheraton across the street is a much better hotel.

title: Had A Great Room At The Hilton
review: Spent Memorial Day weekend at the Hilton Back Back with my wife and two young children.  Rate was $154/night, which included two buffet breakfasts per night at Boodles.  Hotel is in a great location - close to T, major attractions, shopping and major highways.  Hotel is clean and modern.  Room was of decent size.  Two double beds - both real comfortable.  Bathroom looks like it was upgraded recently.  Climate control worked well.  They have a pool - once was empty and another time (at night) was hopping with kids.  Service was unfailingly polite.  Vern and Jeff at the door were very pleasant and helpful.  Buffet at Boodles was fine - $15/pp (1/2 price for kids - although they let my 3 year-old eat for free).  It included french toast, pancakes, bacon/sausages, pastries,…

title: Good location, but you pay for it
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Hilton was great for our anniversary celebration
review: I'll start by saying that I'm more of a "Holiday Inn" person than a Sheraton/Hilton type.  So I get frustrated when I pay double the room rate and get half the amenities that I'd get at a Hampton Inn or Holiday Inn.    The location was definitely the main asset of this place.  It was only a few blocks from the Hynes Center subway stop and it was easy to walk to some good restaurants in the Back Bay area.  Boylston isn't far off at all.  So I had no trouble with foregoing a rental car and taking the subway from the airport to the hotel and using the subway for any other travel.  Otherwise, they make you pay for anything and everything.  And when you've already dropped $215/night on the room, that gets frustrating.  The room itself was decent, about what I would expect.  Staff was…

title: Fabulous girlie week away ....
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. title: Beware the hidden extras
review: 4 of us travelled to Boston and stayed in adjoining double double rooms (with accessible door between) at the Hilton Back Bay .... it was all we could do to peel ourselves from the beds, they were so comfortable!  All service at the hotel was courteous and staff were prepared to go the extra mile - with the exception of one person who was standing in for the Concierge one day.  We'd travelled over 3000 miles but knew more than he did BUT this may have been a once off and the real concierge was knowledgable and helpful.  The location of this hotel is first class - walking distance to so many places and very easy to use the T to get to other parts of town, including to North station where we managed to get a train to Salem and back with no hitches.  We breakfasted at the Hilton -…

title: Miserable!
review: Stayed here in October 04 for 3 nights.  The room was spacious and spotlessly clean.  The Hilton had the most comfortable bed against 3 Canadian cities. Large bathroom but with an odd shower set-up, that understanadably invites criticism about water pressure (management take note, invest in some decent power showers!)  The Breakfast Buffet was good value and offered plenty of choice although my wife felt that the quality was average.  Location was good... a two minute walk from the nearest subway stop and the hotel is well served by an airport shuttle bus(twelve dollars) although this is poorly advertised when you land at Logan and we were forced to trek across town via the subway with cases (look out for the brown mini vans when you land, although I have no idea which stand…
